Text

Away beyond [the village]423-the village stands [a white cottage]424-a white cottage with [the sea lapping at low cliffs beneath]425-the sea lapping at low cliffs beneath [it]424-a white cottage . [Plum and apple orchards]426-plum and apple orchards slope upward behind [this building]427-this building , and already , upon the former trees , there trembles a snowy gauze where blossom buds are breaking . Higher yet , [dark plowed fields , with hedges whereon grow straight elms]428-dark plowed fields , with hedges whereon grow straight elms , cover the undulations of [a great hill even to [its]429-a great hill even to its windy crest windy crest]429-a great hill even to its windy crest , and below , at the water line , lies [Newlyn]1-newlyn — [a village of gray stone and blue , with [slate roofs now shining silver - bright under morning sunlight and easterly wind]431-slate roofs now shining silver - bright under morning sunlight and easterly wind]430-a village of gray stone and blue , with slate roofs now shining silver - bright under morning sunlight and easterly wind . Smoke softens every outline ; red - brick walls and tanned sails bring warmth and color through the blue vapor of many chimneys ; a sun - flash glitters at this point and that , denoting [here]432-here [a conservatory]433-a conservatory , there [a studio]434-a studio . Enter [this hive]435-this hive and [you]436-you shall find a network of [narrow stone streets]437-narrow stone streets ; a flutter of flannel underwear , or blue stockings , and tawny garments drying upon lines ; little windows , some with rows of oranges and ginger - beer bottles in them ; [little shops]438-little shops ; little doors , at which cluster [little children]439-little children and many cats , the latter mostly tortoise - shell and white . [Infants]440-infants watch [[their]440-infants elders]441-their elders playing marbles in [the roadway]442-the roadway , and the cats stretch lazy bodies on the mats , made of old fishing - net , which lie at [every cottage]443-every cottage door . [Newlyn]1-newlyn stands on slight elevations above [the sea level]444-the sea level , and at one point [the road]445-the road bends downward , breaks and fringes the tide , leading among broken iron , rusty anchors , and [dismantled fishing - boats]446-dismantled fishing - boats , past an ancient buoy whose sides now serve the purposes of advertisement and tell of prayer - meetings , cheap tea , and so forth . Hard by , the mighty blocks of the old breakwater stand , [their]447-their fabric dating from the reign of [James I.]173-james i. , and taking the place of one still older . But [the old breakwater]448-the old breakwater is no more than a rialto for ancient gossips now ; and far beyond [it]448-the old breakwater new piers stretch encircling arms of granite round [a new harbor]449-a new harbor , southward of which [the lighthouse stands]450-the lighthouse stands and winks [his]173-james i. sleepless golden eye from dusk to dawn . Within [this harbor]451-this harbor , when [the fishing fleet]452-the fishing fleet is at [home]453-home , lie jungles of stout masts , row upon row , with here and there a sail , carrying on the color of [the plowed fields above [the village]423-the village]454-the plowed fields above the village , and elsewhere , scraps of flaming bunting flashing like flowers in a reed bed . Behind the masts , along [the barbican]456-the barbican , [the cottages]457-the cottages stand close and thick , then clamber and straggle up the acclivities behind , decreasing in [their]457-the cottages numbers as [they]457-the cottages ascend . Smoke trails inland on the wind — black as a thin crepe veil , from the funnel of a coal " tramp " about to leave [the harbor]458-the harbor , blue from the dry wood burning on [a hundred cottage hearths]459-a hundred cottage hearths . A smell of fish — where great split pollocks hang drying in the sun — of tar and tan and twine — where nets and cordage lie spread upon low walls and open spaces — gives to Newlyn an odor all its own ; but aloft , above the village air , spring is dancing , sweet - scented , light - footed in the hedgerows , through [the woods]460-the woods and on [the wild moors]461-the wild moors which stretch inland away . There the gold of the gorse flames in many a sudden sheet and splash over [the wastes]462-the wastes whereon last year 's ling - bloom , all sere and gray , makes a sad - colored world . But the season 's change is coming fast . [Celandines]2-celandines twinkle everywhere , and primroses , more tardy and more coy , already open wondering eyes . [The sea]463-the sea lies smooth with a surface just wind - kissed and strewed with a glory of sun - stars . Away to the east , at a point from which [brown hills]464-brown hills , dotted with [white dwellings]465-white dwellings , tend in long undulations to [the cliffs of [the Lizard]3-the lizard]466-the cliffs of the lizard , under fair clouds all banked and sunny white against the blue , rises [St. Michael 's Mount]4-st. michael 's mount , with [[a man]467-a man 's little castle capping Nature 's gaunt escarpments and rugged walls]468-a man 's little castle capping nature 's gaunt escarpments and rugged walls . Between [Marazion]5-marazion and [Newlyn]1-newlyn stretches [Mount 's Bay]6-mount 's bay ; while a mile or two of flat [sea - front]469-sea - front , over which , like a string of pearls , roll steam clouds , from [a train]470-a train , bring [us]471-us to [Penzance]7-penzance . Then — [noting centers of industry where freezing works rise and smelting of ore]472-noting centers of industry where freezing works rise and smelting of ore occupies [many men]473-many men ( for [Newlyn]1-newlyn labors at [the two extremes of fire and ice)—we]474-the two extremes of fire and ice)—we are back in [the fishing village]475-the fishing village again and upon [the winding road which leads therefrom]476-the winding road which leads therefrom , first to [Penlee Point]8-penlee point and [the blue - stone quarry]477-the blue - stone quarry , anon to [the little hamlet of [Mousehole]9-mousehole]478-the little hamlet of mousehole beyond . Beside [this road]479-this road lay [[our]471-us white cottage]480-our white cottage , with the sunshine lighting up a piece of new golden thatch let into the old gray , and the plum - trees behind it bursting into new - born foam of flowers . Just outside [it]480-our white cottage , above [the low cliff]481-the low cliff , stood [two men]482-two men looking down into the water , seen dark green below through a tangle of brier and blackthorn and emerald foliage of budding elder . [The sea]463-the sea served base uses here , for the dust and dirt of many [a cottage]484-a cottage was daily cast into the lap of the great scavenger who carried all away . [The low cliffs]485-the low cliffs were indeed spattered with filth , and the coltsfoot , already opening yellow blossoms below , found itself rudely saluted with cinders and potato - peelings , fishes ' entrails , and suchlike unlovely matter . [The men]3467-the men were watching [a white fleet of bird boats]3468-a white fleet of bird boats paddling on [the sea]463-the sea , hurrying this way and that , struggling — with many a plunge and flutter and plaintive cry — for the food a retreating tide was bearing from [the shore]3470-the shore . " '[486-i] White spirits and gray , ' [I]486-i call [them]3467-the men , " said [the younger of [the two spectators]3472-the two spectators]3471-the younger of the two spectators . " The gulls fascinate [me]486-i always . [They]3467-the men are beautiful to see and hear and paint . Swimming there , and wheeling between the seas in rough weather , or hanging almost motionless in midair with [their]3467-the men heads turning first this way , then that , and [their]3467-the men breasts pressed against the wind — why , [they]3467-the men are perfect always , [the little winged gods of [the sea]463-the sea]3473-the little winged gods of the sea . " " Gods kissing carrion , " sneered [the other]3475-the other . " Beautiful enough , no doubt , but [their]3467-the men music holds no charm for [me]486-i . Nothing is quite beautiful which has for its cause something ugly . Those echoing cries down there are the expression of a greedy struggle , no more . [I]486-i hate [[your]3476-your Newlyn gulls]3477-your newlyn gulls . [They]3467-the men are ruined , like a thousand other wild things , by civilization . [I]486-i see [them]3467-the men scouring [the fields]3478-the fields and hopping after [the plowman]3479-the plowman like upland crows . A Cornish seabird should fight its battle with [the sea]463-the sea and find its home in [the heart of [the dizzy cliffs]3482-the dizzy cliffs]3481-the heart of the dizzy cliffs , sharing them with [the samphire]3483-the samphire . But [your]3476-your '[486-i] white spirits and gray ' behave like gutter - fed ducks . " [The first speaker]3484-the first speaker laughed and [both]3485-both strolled upon [their]3485-both way . [They]3485-both were [artists]3486-artists , but while [Edmund Murdoch]175-murdoch dwelt at [Newlyn]1-newlyn and lived by [his]175-murdoch profession , [the older man]3487-the older man , [John Barron]176-barron , was merely on a visit to [the place]3488-the place . [He]3487-the older man had come down for change and with no particular intention to work . [Barron]176-barron was wealthy and wasted rare talents . [He]176-barron did not paint much , and [the few who knew [his]176-barron pictures]3489-the few who knew his pictures deplored the fact that no temporal inducement called upon [him]176-barron to handle [his]176-barron brush oftener . [A few]3490-a few excused [him]176-barron on the plea of [his]176-barron health , which was at all times indifferent , but [he]176-barron never excused [himself]176-barron . It needed something far from the beaten track to inspire [him]176-barron , and inspiration was rare . But let a subject once grip [him]176-barron and [the artist]3491-the artist 's life centered and fastened upon it until [his]176-barron work was done . [He]176-barron sacrificed everything at such a time ; [he]176-barron slaved ; labor was to [him]176-barron as [a debauch]3492-a debauch to [the drunkard]3493-the drunkard , and [he]176-barron wearied body and mind and counted [his]176-barron health nothing while the frenzy held [him]176-barron . Then , [his]176-barron picture finished , at the cost of [the man]3494-the man 's whole store of nervous energy and skill , [he]176-barron would probably paint no more for many months . [His]176-barron subject was always some transcript from nature , wrought out with almost brutal vigor and disregard of everything but truth . [His]176-barron looks belied [his]176-barron work curiously . [A small , slight man]3495-a small , slight man [he]176-barron was , with sloping shoulders and the consumptive build . But the breadth of [his]176-barron head above the ears showed brain , and [his]176-barron gray eyes spoke a strength of purpose upon which a hard , finely - modeled mouth set the seal . Once [he]176-barron had painted in [the West Indies]10-the west indies : a picture of [two negresses]3496-two negresses bathing at [Tobago]11-tobago . Behind [them]3496-two negresses hung low tangles of cactus , melo - cactus and white - blossomed orchid ; while on the tawny rocks glimmered snowy cotton splashed with a crimson turban ; but the marvel of the work lay in the figures and the refraction of [their]3496-two negresses brown limbs seen through crystal - clear water . The picture brought reputation to [a man who cared nothing for it]3497-a man who cared nothing for it ; and [Barron]176-barron 's " Bathing Negresses " are only quoted here because they illustrate [his]176-barron method of work . [He]176-barron had painted from [the sea]463-the sea in [a boat moored fore and aft]3499-a boat moored fore and aft ; [he]176-barron had kept [the two women]3500-the two women shivering and whining in [the water]3501-the water for two hours at a time . [They]3500-the two women could not indeed refuse the gold [he]176-barron offered for [their]3500-the two women services , but [one]3502-one never lived to enjoy the money , for [her]3502-one prolonged ablutions in the cause of art killed [her]3502-one a week after [her]3502-one work was done . [John Barren]177-barren was a lonely sybarite with a real love for Nature and absolutely primitive instincts with regard to [his]177-barren fellow - creatures . [The Land 's End]12-the land 's end had disappointed [him]177-barren ; [he]177-barren had found [Nature]178-nature neither grand nor terrific there , but sleepy and tame as a cat after a full meal . Nor did [he]177-barren derive any pleasure from the society of [his]177-barren craft at [Newlyn]1-newlyn . [He]177-barren hated the clatter of art jargon , [he]177-barren flouted all schools , and pointed out what [nobody]3503-nobody doubts now : that [the artists of [the Cornish village]3505-the cornish village]3504-the artists of the cornish village in reality represented nothing but [a community of [fellow - workers]3507-fellow - workers]3506-a community of fellow - workers , all actuated indeed by love of art , but each developing [his]177-barren own bent without thought for [[his]177-barren neighbor]3508-his neighbor 's theory . [Barron]176-barron indeed made [some enemies]3509-some enemies before [he]176-barron had been in [the place]3488-the place a week , and the greater lights liked [him]176-barron none the better for vehemently disclaiming the honor when [they]3511-they told [him]176-barron [he]176-barron was one of [themselves]3511-they . " The shape of a brush does not make [men]3512-men paint alike , " [he]176-barron said , " else [we]3513-we were [all equal]3514-all equal and should only differ in color . Some of [you]3515-you can no more paint with a square brush than [you]3515-you can with a knife . Some of [you]3515-you could not paint though [your]3515-you palettes were set with [Nature]178-nature 's own sunset colors . And others of [you]3515-you , if [you]3515-you had a rabbit 's scut at the end of a hop - pole and the gray mud from a rain puddle , would produce work worth considering . [You]3515-you are [a community of painters]3516-a community of painters — [some clever , some hopeless]3517-some clever , some hopeless — but [you]3515-you are not [a school]3518-a school , and [you]3515-you may thank [God]179-god for it . " [John Barron]176-barron was rough tonic , but [the fearless little man]3519-the fearless little man generally found an audience at the end of the day in [this studio]3520-this studio or that . The truth of much that [he]176-barron said appealed to [the lofty - minded and serious]3521-the lofty - minded and serious ; [his]176-barron dry cynicism , savage dislike of civilization , and frank affection for Nature , attracted [others]3522-others . [He]176-barron hit hard , but [he]176-barron never resented rough knocks in return , and [no man]3523-no man had seen [him]176-barron out of temper with anything but mysticism and the art bred therefrom . Upon the whole , however , [his]176-barron materialism annoyed more than [his]176-barron wit amused . Upon the evening which followed [his]176-barron insult to [the Newlyn gulls]1-newlyn , [Barron]176-barron , with [Edmund Murdoch]175-murdoch and [some other men]3524-some other men , was talking in the studio of one [Brady]180-brady , known to fame as [the " Wrecker]3525-the " wrecker , " from [his]180-brady love for the artistic representation of maritime disaster . [Barron]176-barron liked [this man]3526-this man , for [he]180-brady was outspoken and held vigorous views , but [the two]3527-the two quarreled freely . " [Fate]181-fate was [a fool]3528-a fool when [she]181-fate chucked [her]181-fate presents into the lap of [a lazy beggar like [you]176-barron]3529-a lazy beggar like you , " said [Brady]180-brady , addressing [the visitor]3530-the visitor . " And thrice [a fool]3528-a fool , " [he]180-brady added , " to assort [her]181-fate gifts so ill . " " [Fate]181-fate is [a knave]3532-a knave , a mad thing playing at cat 's cradle with the threads of [our]3533-our wretched little lives , " answered [John Barron]176-barron , " [she]181-fate is [a coward]3534-a coward — [a bully]3535-a bully . [She]181-fate hits the hungry below the belt ; [she]181-fate heaps gold into the lap of [the old man]3536-the old man , but not till [he]3536-the old man has already dug [his]3536-the old man own grave to come at it ; [she]181-fate gives health to [those who must needs waste all [their]3537-those who must needs waste all their splendid strength on work splendid strength on work]3537-those who must needs waste all their splendid strength on work ; and wealth to [worthless beings like [myself]486-i who are always ailing and who never spend a pound with wisdom]3538-worthless beings like myself who are always ailing and who never spend a pound with wisdom . Make no dark cryptic mystery of [Fate]181-fate when [you]3539-you paint [her]181-fate . [She]181-fate looks to [me]486-i like [a mischievous monkey poking sticks into an ant - hill]3540-a mischievous monkey poking sticks into an ant - hill . " " [She]181-fate 's [a woman]3541-a woman , " said [Murdoch]175-murdoch . " [She]181-fate 's three , " corrected [Brady]180-brady ; " what can [you]3539-you expect from [three women rolled into one]3542-three women rolled into one ? " " Away with [her]181-fate ! Waste no incense at [[her]181-fate shrine]3543-her shrine . [She]181-fate 'll cut the thread no sooner because [you]3539-you turn [your]3539-you back on [her]181-fate . Fling overboard [your]3539-you mythologies , dead and alive , and kneel to Nature . A budding spike of wild hyacinth is worth [all the gods]3544-all the gods put together . Go hand in hand with [Nature]178-nature , [I]486-i say . Ask nothing from [her]181-fate ; walk humbly ; be well content if [she]181-fate lets [you]3539-you but turn the corner of one page [none else]3545-none else have read . That 's how [I]486-i live . [My]486-i life is not a prayer exactly — " " [I]486-i should say not , " interrupted [Brady]180-brady . " But a hymn of praise — a purely impersonal existence , lived all alone , like [a man at a prison window]3546-a man at a prison window . This carcass , with its shaky machinery and defective breathing apparatus , is [the prison]3547-the prison . [I]486-i look out of the window till the walls crumble away — " " And then ? " asked one [Paul Tarrant]182-tarrant , [a painter who prided [himself]182-tarrant on being [a Christian]3549-a christian as well]3548-a painter who prided himself on being a christian as well . " Then , the spark which [I]486-i call [myself]486-i , goes back to Nature , as the cloud gives the raindrop back to [the sea]463-the sea from whence the sun drew it . " " A lie , [man]3551-man ! " answered [the other]3475-the other hotly . " Perhaps . It matters nothing . [God]179-god — if there be [a God]3553-a god — will not blame [me]486-i for making a mistake . Meantime [I]486-i live like [the rook and the thrush]3554-the rook and the thrush . [They]3554-the rook and the thrush never pray , [they]3554-the rook and the thrush praise , [they]3554-the rook and the thrush sing '[486-i] grace before meat ' and after it , as [Nature]178-nature taught [them]3554-the rook and the thrush . " " [A simple child of Nature]3555-a simple child of nature — beautiful spectacle , " said [Brady]180-brady . " But [I]486-i 'm[486-i] sorry all the same , " [he]486-i continued , " that [you]487-you 've found nothing in [Cornwall]13-cornwall to keep [you]487-you [here]432-here and make [you]487-you do some work . [You]487-you talk an awful deal of rot , but [we]489-we want to see [you]487-you paint . Is n't there anything or anybody worthy of [you]487-you [here]432-here ? " " As a matter of face , [I]0-i 've found [a girl]491-a girl , " said [Barron]176-barron . There was a clamor of excitement at this news , above which [Brady]180-brady 's bull voice roared approval . " [Proud girl]492-proud girl , [proud parents]493-proud parents , [proud Newlyn]1-newlyn ! " [he]486-i bellowed . " The mood ripens too , " continued [Barren]177-barren quietly . " ' Sacrifice [all the world]3556-all the world to mood '[177-barren] is [my]0-i motto . So [I]0-i shall stop and paint . " A moment later derisive laughter greeted [Barron]176-barron 's decision , for [Murdoch]175-murdoch , in answer to a hail of questions , announced the subject of [[his]175-murdoch friend]494-his friend 's inspiration . " [We]489-we strolled round this morning and saw [Joan Tregenza]183-joan in an iron hoop with a pail of water slung at either hand . " " So [your]487-you picture begins and ends where it is , [Barron]176-barron , [[my]0-i friend]495-my friend ; in [your]487-you imagination . Did it strike [you]487-you when [you]487-you first saw that vision of loveliness in dirty drab that [she]183-joan was hardly [the girl to have gone unpainted till now]496-the girl to have gone unpainted till now ? " asked [Brady]180-brady . " The possibility of previous pictures is hardly likely to weigh with [me]0-i . Why , [I]0-i would paint [a drowned sailor]497-a drowned sailor if the subject attracted [me]0-i , and that though [you]487-you have done it , " answered [the other]3475-the other , nodding toward a big canvas in the corner , where [Brady]180-brady 's picture for the year approached completion . " [[My]0-i dear chap]499-my dear chap , [we]500-we all worship [Joan]183-joan — at a distance . [She]183-joan is not to be painted . Tears and prayers are useless . [She]183-joan has [a flinty father]501-a flinty father — [a fisherman , who looks upon painting as a snare of the devil]502-a fisherman , who looks upon painting as a snare of the devil and sees every artist already wriggling on the trident in [his]501-a flinty father mind 's eye . [Joan]183-joan has also [a lover]503-a lover , who would rather behold [her]183-joan dead than on canvas . " " In fact [these Methodist folk]504-these methodist folk take [us]500-we to be what [you]487-you really are , " said [Brady]180-brady bluntly . " [Old Tregenza]183-joan tars [us]500-we every one with the same brush . [We]500-we are lost [sinners all]505-sinners all . " " Well , why trouble [him]501-a flinty father ? [A fisherman]506-a fisherman would have [his]506-a fisherman business on [the sea]463-the sea . Candidly , [I]0-i must paint [her]183-joan . The wish grows upon [me]0-i . " " Even money [you]487-you do n't get as much as a sketch , " said [Murdoch]175-murdoch . " Have any of [you]487-you tried approaching [her]183-joan directly , instead of [[her]183-joan relations]508-her relations ? " " [She]183-joan 's as shy as a hawk , [man]3551-man . " " That makes [me]0-i the more hopeful . [[You]487-you fellows]510-you fellows , with [your]487-you Tam o ' Shanters and aggressive neckties and knickerbockers and calves , would frighten [the devil]3557-the devil . [I]487-you 'm[487-you] shy [myself]0-i . If [she]183-joan 's natural , then [we]511-we shall possibly understand [each other]512-each other . " " [I]0-i 'll bet [you]487-you ten to one in pounds [you]487-you wo n't have [your]487-you wish , " said [Brady]180-brady . " No , sha n't bet . [You]487-you 're all so certain . Probably [I]487-you shall find [myself]487-you beaten like the rest of [you]487-you . But it 's worth trying . [She]183-joan 's a pretty thing . " " How will [you]180-brady paint [her]183-joan if [you]180-brady get the chance ? " " Do n't know yet . [I]487-you should like to paint [her]183-joan in a wolf - skin with a thread of wolf 's teeth round [her]183-joan neck and a celt - headed spear in [her]183-joan hand . " " [Art]184-art will be [a loser by the pending repulse]3558-a loser by the pending repulse , " declared [Brady]180-brady . " And now , as [my]487-you whisky - bottle 's empty and [my]487-you lamp going out , [[you]487-you [chaps]3560-chaps]3559-you chaps can follow its example whenever [you]487-you please . " So [the men]3467-the men scattered into a starry night , and went , each [his]487-you way , through [the streets of [the sleeping village]3563-the sleeping village]3562-the streets of the sleeping village . [[Edmund Murdoch]175-murdoch 's studio]3564-edmund murdoch 's studio stood high on [Newlyn hill]3565-newlyn hill , and [Barron]176-barron had taken [comfortable rooms in [a little lodging - house close beside]3567-a little lodging - house close beside [it]3564-edmund murdoch 's studio]3566-comfortable rooms in a little lodging - house close beside it . [The men]3467-the men often enjoyed breakfast in [each other]512-each other 's company , but on the following morning , when [Murdoch]175-murdoch strolled over to see [[his]175-murdoch friend]494-his friend , [he]175-murdoch found that [[his]175-murdoch rooms]3571-his rooms were empty . [Barron]176-barron , in fact , was already nearly a mile from [Newlyn]1-newlyn , and , at the moment when [the younger artist]3572-the younger artist sought [him]176-barron , [he]176-barron stood upon [a footpath which ran through [plowed fields]3574-plowed fields to [the village of Paul]3575-the village of paul]3573-a footpath which ran through plowed fields to the village of paul . In the bottom of [his]176-barron mind ran a current of thought occupied with the problem of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan , but , superficially , [he]176-barron was concerned with the spring world in which [he]176-barron walked . [He]176-barron stood where [Nature]178-nature , like [Artemis]185-artemis , appeared as [a mother of many breasts]3576-a mother of many breasts . Brown and solemn in their undulations , [they]3577-they rose about and around [him]176-barron to the sky - line , where [the land]3578-the land cut sharply against a pale blue heaven from which tinkled the music of larks . [He]176-barron watched a bird wind upward in a spiral to its song throne ; [he]176-barron noted the young wheat brushing the earth with a veil of green ; [he]176-barron dawdled where elms stood , their high tops thick with blossom ; and [he]176-barron delayed for full fifteen minutes to see the felling of one giant tree . A wedge - shaped cut had been made upon the side where the great elm was to fall , and , upon the other side , [two men were sawing through the trunk]3579-two men were sawing through the trunk . There was no sound but the steady hiss of steel teeth gnawing inch by inch to the wine - red heart of the tree . [Sunshine]186-sunshine glimmered on its leafy crown , and as yet distant branch and bough knew nothing of [the midgets]3580-the midgets and Death below . [Barron]176-barron took pleasure in seeing [the great god Change at work]3581-the great god change at work , but [he]176-barron mourned in that a masterpiece , on which Nature had bestowed half a century and more of love , must now vanish . " A pity , " [he]176-barron said , while [the executioners]3582-the executioners rested a few moments from [their]3582-the executioners labors , " a pity to cut down such a noble tree . " [One woodman]3583-one woodman laughed , and [the other]3475-the other — [an old rustic , brown and bent]3585-an old rustic , brown and bent — made answer : " [I]487-you sez '[487-you] dang the tree ! ' [Us]3586-us doan't take no joy in thrawin '[487-you] en , [mister]513-mister . [I]0-i be bedoled wi ' pain , an '[515-the second laborer] this ' ere sawin 's just food for rheumatiz . [My]515-the second laborer back 's that bad . But [Squire]187-squire must '[515-the second laborer] ave money , an ' theer 's five hundred pounds '[515-the second laborer] value o ' ellum comin '[515-the second laborer] down ' fore [us]3586-us done wi '[515-the second laborer] it . " The saw won its way ; and between each spell of labor , [the ancient man]514-the ancient man held [his]514-the ancient man back and grumbled . " Er 's [Billy Jago]188-billy jago , " confided [the second laborer]515-the second laborer to [Barron]176-barron , when [[his]515-the second laborer companion]516-his companion had turned aside to get some steel wedges and a sledge - hammer . " Er 's well - knawn in [these paarts]517-these paarts — a reg'lar cure . Er used tu work up [Drift]15-drift wi ' [Mister Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin . " [Billy]188-billy jago added two wedges to those already hammered into the saw - cut , then , with the sledge , [he]188-billy jago drove them [home]453-home and finished [his]188-billy jago task . The sorrowful strokes rang hollow and mournful over [the land]3578-the land , sadder to [Barron]176-barron 's ear than fall of earth - clod on coffin - lid . And , upon the sound , a responsive shiver and uneasy tremor ran through trunk and bough to topmost twig of the elm — a sudden sense , as it seemed , of awful evil and ruin undreamed of , but now imminent . Then [the monster]3589-the monster staggered and [the midget]3590-the midget struck [his]3590-the midget last blow and removed [himself]3590-the midget and [his]3590-the midget rheumatism . [Whereupon]190-whereupon began that magnificent descent . Slowly , with infinitely solemn sweep , the elm 's vast height swung away from its place , described a wide aerial arc , and so , with the jolting crash and rattle of close thunder , roared headlong to [the earth]3591-the earth , casting up a cloud of dust , plowing the grass with splintered limbs , then lying very still . From glorious tree to battered log it sank . [No man]3523-no man ever saw more instant wreck and ruin fall lightning - like on a fair thing . The mass was crushed flat and shapeless by its own vast weight , and the larger boughs , which did not touch the earth , were snapped short off by the concussion of their fall . [Billy Jago]188-billy jago held [his]188-billy jago back and whined while [Barron]176-barron spoke , as much to [himself]176-barron as [the woodman]3593-the woodman . " [Dear God]179-god ! " [he]176-barron said , " to think that this glory of the hedge - row — this kingdom of song birds — should come to the making of pauper coffins and [lodging - house furniture]3594-lodging - house furniture ! " " [Squire]187-squire must have money ; an '[188-billy jago] [folks]518-folks must have coffins , " said [Billy]188-billy jago . " [You]519-you can sleep [your]519-you last sleep so sound in ellum as [you]519-you can in oak , for that matter . " Feeling the truth of the assertion , [Barron]176-barron admitted it , then turned [his]176-barron back on [the fallen king]520-the fallen king and pursued [his]176-barron way with thoughts reverting to the proposed picture . There was nothing to alarm [Joan Tregenza]183-joan about [him]176-barron ; which seemed well , as [he]176-barron meant to approach [the girl]521-the girl [herself]521-the girl at the first opportunity , and not [[her]521-the girl parents]522-her parents . [Barron]176-barron did not carry " artist " stamped upon [him]176-barron . [He]176-barron was plainly attired in a thick tweed suit and wore a cap of the same material . [The man]3494-the man appeared insignificantly small . [He]176-barron was clean - shaved and looked younger than [his]176-barron five - and - thirty years seen a short distance off , but older when [you]524-you stood beside [him]176-barron . [He]176-barron strolled now onward toward [the sea]463-the sea , and [his]176-barron cheeks took some color from the fine air . [He]176-barron walked with a stick and carried a pair of field - glasses in a case slung over [his]176-barron shoulder . The field - glasses had become a habit with [him]176-barron , but [he]176-barron rarely used them , for [his]176-barron small slate - colored eyes were keen . Once and again [John Barron]176-barron turned to look at [[St. Michael]191-michael 's Mount]4-st. michael 's mount , seen afar across [the bay]526-the bay . The magic of morning made [it]4-st. michael 's mount beautiful and the great pile towered grandly through a sunny haze . No detail disturbed the eye under this effect of light , and [the mount]527-the mount stood vast , dim , golden , magnified and glorified into a fairy palace of romance built by immortal things in a night . Seen thus , it even challenged [the beholder]528-the beholder 's admiration , of which [he]176-barron was at all times sparing . Until that hour , [he]176-barron had found nothing but laughter for [this same mount]529-this same mount , likening the spectacle of [it]529-this same mount , with [[its]529-this same mount castle]530-its castle and [cottages]531-cottages , now to [a senile monarch with moth - eaten ermine about [his]176-barron toes and a lop - sided crown on [his]176-barron head]532-a senile monarch with moth - eaten ermine about his toes and a lop - sided crown on his head , now to a monstrous sea - snail creeping shoreward . [Barron]176-barron , having walked down [the hill]533-the hill to [Mouse - hole]534-mouse - hole , breasted slowly the steep acclivity which leads therefrom toward the west . Presently [he]176-barron turned , where [a plateau of grass]535-a plateau of grass sloped above [the cliffs]536-the cliffs into a little theater of [banks ablaze with gorse]537-banks ablaze with gorse . And here [his]176-barron thoughts and the image [they]538-they were concerned with perished before reality . Framed in a halo of golden furze , [her]539-her hands making a little penthouse above [her]539-her brow , and in [her]539-her blue eyes the mingled hue of [sea]540-sea and sky , stood [a girl looking out at the horizon]541-a girl looking out at the horizon . The bud of [a wondrous fair woman]542-a wondrous fair woman [she]539-her was , and [Barron]176-barron saw [her]539-her slim yet vigorous figure accentuated under its drab - brown draperies by a kindly breeze . [He]176-barron noted the sweet , childish freshness of [her]539-her face , [her]539-her plump arms filling the sleeves of rusty black , and [her]539-her feet in shoes too big for them . [Her]539-her hair was hidden under a linen sun - bonnet , but one lock had escaped , and [he]176-barron noted that it was the color of wheat ripe for the reaping . [He]176-barron regretted it had not been darker , but observed that it chimed well enough with the flaming flowers behind it . And then [he]176-barron frankly praised [Nature]178-nature in [his]176-barron heart for sending [[her]178-nature servant]543-her servant such a splendid harmony in gold and brown . There stood [his]176-barron picture in front of [him]176-barron . [He]176-barron gazed a brief second only , and then [his]176-barron quick mind worked to find what human interest had brought [Joan Tregenza]183-joan to [this place]544-this place and turned [her]539-her eyes to [the sea]463-the sea . It might be that herein existed the possibility of the introduction [he]176-barron desired . [He]176-barron felt that victory probably depended on the events of the next two or three minutes . [He]176-barron owed a supreme effort of skill and tact to [Fate]181-fate , which had thus befriended [him]176-barron , and [he]176-barron rose to the occasion . [The girl]521-the girl looked up as [he]176-barron came suddenly upon [her]521-the girl , but [his]176-barron eyes were already away and fixed upon the horizon before [she]521-the girl turned . Observing that [he]176-barron was not regarding [her]521-the girl , [she]521-the girl put up [her]521-the girl hands again and continued to scan [the remote sea - line]547-the remote sea - line where a thin trail of dark smoke told of [a steamer]548-a steamer , itself apparently invisible . [Barron]176-barron took [his]176-barron glasses from [their]549-their case , and seeing that [the girl]521-the girl made no movement of departure , acted deliberately , and presently began to watch a fleet of brown sails and black hulls putting forth from [the little harbor below]551-the little harbor below . Then , without looking at [her]521-the girl or taking [his]176-barron eyes from the glasses , [he]176-barron spoke . " Would [you]521-the girl kindly tell [me]0-i what [those small vessels]552-those small vessels are below there just setting out to [sea]540-sea ? " [he]176-barron asked . [The girl]521-the girl started , looked round , and , realizing that [he]176-barron had addressed [her]521-the girl , made answer : " They'm Mouzle [ Footnote : [Mouzle]16-mouzle — Mousehole . ] [luggers]555-luggers , [sir]556-sir . " " Luggers , are [they]555-luggers ? Thank [you]176-barron . And where are [they]555-luggers sailing to ? Do [you]176-barron know ? " " Away down - long , south'ard o ' [the Scillies]17-the scillies mostly , [arter mackerl]3595-arter mackerl . [Theer]3596-theer 's a power o '[521-the girl] mackerl bein ' catched just now — [thousands an '[555-luggers] thousands]3597-thousands an ' thousands — but some o ' [they]555-luggers booats be laskin'—that 's just fishin '[176-barron] off [shore]557-shore . " " Ah , a busy time for [the fishermen]558-the fishermen . " " [Iss]559-iss , ' tis . " " Thank [you]176-barron . Good - morning . " " Good - marnin '[556-sir] , [sir]556-sir . " [He]176-barron started as though to continue [his]176-barron walk along [the cliffs]536-the cliffs beyond [the plateau]562-the plateau and [the gorse]563-the gorse ; then [he]176-barron stopped suddenly , actuated , as it seemed , by a chance thought , and turned back to [the girl]521-the girl . [She]521-the girl was looking out to [sea]540-sea again . " By the way , " [he]176-barron said , unconcernedly , and with no suggestion that anything in particular was responsible for [his]176-barron politeness . " [I]0-i see [you]521-the girl are on the lookout there for something . [You]521-the girl may have [my]0-i glass a moment , if [you]521-the girl like , before [I]0-i go on . [They]566-they bring [the ships]567-the ships very close . " [The girl]521-the girl flushed with shy pleasure and seemed a little uncertain what to answer . [Barron]176-barron , meanwhile , showed no trace of a smile , but looked bored if anything , and , with a serious face , handed [her]521-the girl the glass , then walked a little way off . [He]176-barron was grave and courteous , but made no attempt at friendship . [He]176-barron had noticed when [Joan]183-joan smiled that [her]183-joan teeth were fine , and that [her]183-joan full face , though sweet enough , was a shade too plump . " Thank ' [e]176-barron kindly , [sir]556-sir , " [she]521-the girl said , taking the glass . " [You]556-sir see [theer]556-sir 's [a gert ship passin '[183-joan] down Channel]3599-a gert ship passin ' down channel , an'—an ' [[my]183-joan Joe]3600-my joe 's aboard '[183-joan] er , an ' they'm bound for [furrin '[183-joan] paarts]3601-furrin ' paarts , an ' [I]183-joan promised as [I]183-joan 'd come to this [here horny - winky]3602-here horny - winky [ Footnote : Horny - winky — Lonely . Fit place for [horny - winks]3603-horny - winks . ] plaace to get a last sight o '[183-joan] [the vessel]569-the vessel if [I]0-i could . " [He]176-barron made no answer , and , after a pause , [she]183-joan spoke again . " [I]0-i caan't see naught , but that 's [my]0-i fault , [p'raps]570-p'raps , not bein ' used to sich things . " " Let [me]193-anna try and find [the ship]3604-the ship , " [he]176-barron said , taking the glass , which [he]176-barron had put out of focus purposely . Then , while scanning the horizon where [he]176-barron had noted [the smoke - trail]3605-the smoke - trail , [he]176-barron spoke , [his]176-barron head turned from [her]183-joan . " Who 's [Joe]192-joe , if [I]193-anna may ask ? [[Your]192-joe brother]3606-your brother , [I]193-anna daresay ? " " No , [sir]556-sir ; Joe'm [[my]193-anna sweetheart]3608-my sweetheart . " " There 's [a big three - masted ship]3609-a big three - masted ship being taken down [the Channel]18-the channel by [a small steamer]3610-a small steamer . " " Ah ! then [I]193-anna reckon that 's the '[193-anna] [Anna]193-anna , ' 'cause[192-joe] [Joe]192-joe said ' twas tolerable certain [they]3611-they 'd be in tow of [a tug]3612-a tug . " " [You]183-joan can see the smoke on [the edge of [the sea]463-the sea]3613-the edge of the sea . Look below it . " [He]556-sir handed the glasses to [her]183-joan again and heard a little laugh of delight break from [her]183-joan lips . The surprise of the suddenly - magnified spectacle , visible only as a shadow to the naked eye , brought laughter ; and [Barron]176-barron , now that [the girl]521-the girl 's attention was occupied , had leisure to look at [her]183-joan . [She]183-joan was more than [a pretty cottage maid]3616-a pretty cottage maid , and possessed some distinction and charm . There was a delicacy about [her]183-joan too — a sweet turn of lip , a purity of skin , a set of limb — which gave the lie to [her]183-joan rough speech . [She]183-joan was all Saxon to look at , with nothing of the Celt about [her]183-joan excepting [her]183-joan name and the old Cornish words upon [her]183-joan lips . Those [he]556-sir rejoiced in , for [they]3611-they showed that [she]183-joan still remained a free thing , primitive , innocent of [School Boards]19-school boards , or like frost - biting influences . [Barron]176-barron took mental notes . [Joan Tregenza]183-joan was [a careless young woman]3617-a careless young woman , it seemed . [Her]183-joan dress had a button or two missing in front , and a safety - pin had taken their place . [Her]183-joan drab skirt was frayed a little and patched in one corner with a square of another material . But the colors were well enough , from [the artist]3491-the artist 's point of view . [He]556-sir noted also that [the girl]521-the girl 's stockings were darned and badly needed further attention , for above [her]183-joan right shoe - heel a white scrap of [Joan]183-joan was visible . [Her]183-joan hands were a little large , but well shaped ; [her]183-joan pose was free and fine , though the field - glasses spoiled the picture and the sun - bonnet hid the contour of [her]183-joan head . " So [you]556-sir walked out from [Mouzle]16-mouzle to see the last of [[Joe]192-joe 's ship]3620-joe 's ship ? " [he]556-sir asked , quite seriously and with no light note in [his]556-sir voice . " From [Newlyn]1-newlyn . [I]193-anna ed'n [a Mouzle maid]3621-a mouzle maid , " [she]193-anna answered . " Is the '[193-anna] [Anna]193-anna ' coming [home]453-home again soon ? " " No , [sir]556-sir . [Her]193-anna 's bound for [the Gulf of]20-the gulf of [Californy]21-californy , round t'other side [the world]3624-the world , [Joe]192-joe sez . [He]192-joe reckons to be back agin '[192-joe] come winter . " " That 's a long time . " " [Iss]194-iss , ' tis . " But there was no sentiment about the answer . [Joan]183-joan gazed without a shadow of emotion at [the vanishing ship]3625-the vanishing ship , and alluded to the duration of [[her]183-joan sweetheart]3626-her sweetheart 's absence in a voice that never trembled . Then [she]193-anna gave the glass back to [Barron]176-barron with many thanks , and evidently wanted to be gone , but stopped awkwardly , not quite knowing how to depart . Meanwhile , showing no further cognizance of [her]193-anna , [Barron]176-barron took the glasses [himself]176-barron and looked at [the distant ship]3627-the distant ship . " [A splendid vessel]3628-a splendid vessel , " [he]176-barron said . " [I]194-iss expect [you]193-anna have a picture of [her]193-anna , have n't [you]193-anna ? " " No , " [she]193-anna answered , " but [I]194-iss 've got [a lil ship [Joe]192-joe cut out o '[194-iss] wood]3629-a lil ship joe cut out o ' wood an ' painted butivul . [I]193-anna 'll make a tiny picture of the '[193-anna] [Anna]193-anna ' and paint it and give it to [you]193-anna . " But [the girl]521-the girl took fright instantly . " [You'm]0-i [a artist]3633-a artist , then ? " [she]521-the girl said , with alarm in [her]521-the girl face and voice . [He]176-barron shook [his]176-barron head . " No , no . " [Joan Tregenza]183-joan lived in [a white cottage already mentioned]3644-a white cottage already mentioned : that standing just beyond [Newlyn]1-newlyn upon [a road above [the sea]463-the sea]3645-a road above the sea . [The cot]3647-the cot was larger than [it]3647-the cot appeared from [the road]445-the road and extended backward into [an orchard of plum and apple - trees]3649-an orchard of plum and apple - trees . [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza heard [the girl]521-the girl arrive , and spoke without lifting [her]198-mrs. tregenza little gray eyes from the clothes . [Her]198-mrs. tregenza voice was hard and high and discontented , like that of one who has long bawled into [a deaf man]3659-a deaf man 's ear and is weary of it . " Drabbit [you]588-you ! " [Joan]183-joan accepted [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza 's comfort philosophically , though [[her]183-joan sweetheart]3626-her sweetheart 's departure had not really caused [her]183-joan any emotion . [She]183-joan visited [the larder]598-the larder , drank a cup of milk , and then , fetching an iron hoop and buckets , went to a sunken barrel outside [the cottage]599-the cottage door , into which , from a pipe through [the road - bank]600-the road - bank , tumbled a silver thread of spring water . Of [the Tregenza household]601-the tregenza household a word must needs be spoken . [[Joan]183-joan 's own mother]602-joan 's own mother had died twelve years ago , and [the anxious - natured woman who took [her]198-mrs. tregenza place]603-the anxious - natured woman who took her place proved [herself]603-the anxious - natured woman who took her place [a good step - parent]604-a good step - parent enough . Despite a disposition prone to worry and to dwell upon the small tribulations of life , [Thomasin Tregenza]201-thomasin was not unhappy , for [[her]201-thomasin husband]605-her husband enjoyed prosperity and a reputation for godliness unequaled in [Newlyn]1-newlyn . [A great , weather - worn , gray , hairy man]606-a great , weather - worn , gray , hairy man was [he]606-a great , weather - worn , gray , hairy man , with a big head and a furrowed cliff of a forehead that looked as though it had been carved by its Creator from Cornish granite . [Tregenza]201-thomasin indeed might have stood for [a typical Cornish fisher]607-a typical cornish fisher — or [a Breton]608-a breton . Like enough , indeed , [he]606-a great , weather - worn , gray , hairy man had old Armorican blood in [his]606-a great , weather - worn , gray , hairy man veins , for [many hundreds of [Britons]610-britons]609-many hundreds of britons betook [themselves]609-many hundreds of britons to [ancient Brittany]94-brittany when the Saxon invasion swept [the West]26-the west , and [many afterward]611-many afterward returned , with [foreign wives]612-foreign wives , to [the homes of [[their]609-many hundreds of britons fathers]614-their fathers]613-the homes of their fathers . [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza had found religion , of a sort fiery and unlovely enough , but [his]203-michael tregenza convictions were definite , with iron - hard limitations , and [he]203-michael tregenza looked coldly and without pity on [a damned world]615-a damned world , [himself]203-michael tregenza saved . [Gray Michael]204-gray michael had no sympathy with sin and less with [sinners]616-sinners . [He]204-gray michael found [the devil]3557-the devil in [most unexpected quarters]618-most unexpected quarters and was always dragging [him]3557-the devil out of surprising hiding - places and exhibiting [him]3557-the devil triumphantly , as [a boy]619-a boy might show a bird 's egg or butterfly . [His]204-gray michael devil dwelt at penny readings , at fairs and festivals , in the brushes of [the artists]620-the artists , in a walk on a Sunday afternoon undertaken without a definite object , sometimes in a primrose given by [a boy]619-a boy to [a girl]491-a girl . Of [all these bitter , self - righteous , censorious little sects which raise each its own ladder to the Throne of Grace at [Newlyn]1-newlyn]623-all these bitter , self - righteous , censorious little sects which raise each its own ladder to the throne of grace at newlyn , [the Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers was the most bitter , most self - righteous , most censorious . And of all those burning lights which reflected the primitive savagery of [the Pentateuch from that fold]624-the pentateuch from that fold , [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's beacon flamed the fiercest and most bloody red . There was not [a Gospeler]625-a gospeler , including [the pastor of the flock]626-the pastor of the flock , but feared [the austere fisherman]627-the austere fisherman while admiring [him]204-gray michael . Concerning [his]204-gray michael creed , at the risk of wearying [you]628-you , it must be permitted to speak here ; for only by grasping its leading features and its vast unlikeness to the parent tree can a just estimate of [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza be arrived at . [Luke Gospeldom]242-luke gospeldom had mighty little to do with the Gospel of [Luke]205-the luke gospelers . [The sect]629-the sect numbered [one hundred and thirty - four just persons , at war with principalities and powers]630-one hundred and thirty - four just persons , at war with principalities and powers . [They]629-the sect were saturated with the spirit of [Israel]206-israel in [the Wilderness]28-the wilderness , of [Esau]207-esau , when [every man]631-every man 's hand was against [him]631-every man . At [[their]629-the sect chapel]632-their chapel one heard much of [Jehovah]208-jehovah , [the jealous God]633-the jealous god , of [the burning lakes]634-the burning lakes and the damnation reserved for [mankind]635-mankind , as a whole . Every [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler was [a Jehovah]636-a jehovah in [his]636-a jehovah own right . [They]629-the sect walked hand in hand with [God]179-god ; [they]629-the sect realized the dismay and indignation [Newlyn]1-newlyn must occasion in [His]1-newlyn breast ; [they]629-the sect sympathized heartily with the Everlasting and would have called down fire from [Heaven]637-heaven [themselves]629-the sect if [they]629-the sect could . [Many]638-many openly wondered that [He]1-newlyn delayed so long , for , from a [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler 's point of view , [the place with [[its]639-the place with its dozen other chapels dozen other chapels]640-its dozen other chapels]639-the place with its dozen other chapels — each held in error by [the rest]641-the rest , and all at deadly war among [themselves]629-the sect — [[its]639-the place with its dozen other chapels most vile ritualistic church of [St. Peter]39-st. peter]642-its most vile ritualistic church of st. peter , [[its]639-the place with its dozen other chapels public - houses]643-its public - houses , [scandals]644-scandals , and strifes , was riper for destruction than [Sodom]30-sodom . However , [the hundred and thirty - four]645-the hundred and thirty - four served to stave off celestial brimstone , as it seemed . It is pitiable , in the face of the majestic work of [John Wesley]210-john wesley in [Cornwall]13-cornwall , to see the shattered ruins of [it]646-it which remain . When [the Wesleys]211-the wesleys achieved [their]211-the wesleys notable revival and swept off the dust of a dead Anglicanism which covered [religious [Cornwall]13-cornwall like a pall in the days of [the Georges]212-the georges]647-religious cornwall like a pall in the days of the georges , the old Celtic spirit , though [these heroes]648-these heroes found it hard enough to rekindle , burst from its banked - up furnaces at last and blazed abroad once more . That spirit had been bred by [the saint bishops of [Brito - Celtic]31-brito - celtic days]649-the saint bishops of brito - celtic days , and [Wesley]210-john wesley 's ultimate success was a grand repetition of history , as extant records of the ancient use of [the Church in [Cornwall]13-cornwall]32-the church in cornwall prove . [Its]650-its principle was that [he]210-john wesley who filled [[a bishop]651-a bishop 's office]652-a bishop 's office should , before all things , conduct and develop missionary enterprise ; and the moral and physical courage of [the Brito - Celtic bishops]653-the brito - celtic bishops , having long slumbered , awoke again in [John Wesley]210-john wesley . [He]210-john wesley built on the old foundations , [he]210-john wesley gave to [the laymen]654-the laymen a power at that time blindly denied [them]654-the laymen by [the Church]33-the church — the power which Irish and Welsh and [Breton missionary saints of old]655-breton missionary saints of old had vested in [them]654-the laymen . [Wesley]210-john wesley — [himself]210-john wesley [a giant]656-a giant — made wise use of the strong where [he]210-john wesley found [them]654-the laymen , and if [a man]467-a man — [tinker or tinner]658-tinker or tinner , [fisher or jowster]659-fisher or jowster — could preach and grip [an audience]660-an audience , [that man]661-that man might do so . Thus had [the founders of the new creed]662-the founders of the new creed developed it ; thus does [the Church]33-the church to - day ; but when [John Wesley]210-john wesley filled [his]210-john wesley empty belly with blackberries at [St. Hilary]35-st. hilary , in 1743 ; when [he]210-john wesley thundered what [he]210-john wesley deemed eternal truth through [Cornwall]13-cornwall , year after year for half a century ; when [he]210-john wesley faced a thousand perils by [sea]540-sea and [land]664-land and spent [his]210-john wesley arduous days " in watchings often , in hunger and thirst , in fasting often , in cold and nakedness " ; when , in fine , [this stupendous man]665-this stupendous man achieved the foundations of Methodism , the harvest was overripe , at any rate , in [Cornwall]13-cornwall . [No Nonconformist]666-no nonconformist was [he]665-this stupendous man , though [few enough of [[his]665-this stupendous man followers]668-his followers]667-few enough of his followers to - day remember that , if [they]667-few enough of his followers ever knew it . [He]665-this stupendous man worked for [[his]665-this stupendous man church]669-his church ; [he]665-this stupendous man was a link between it and [[his]665-this stupendous man party]670-his party ; [his]665-this stupendous man last prayer was for church and [king]671-king — a fact which might have greatly shocked the [Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers had such come to [their]667-few enough of his followers ears . For [John Wesley]210-john wesley was [[their]667-few enough of his followers only saint]672-their only saint , and [they]667-few enough of his followers honestly believed that [they]667-few enough of his followers alone of all [Methodist communities]673-methodist communities were following in [his]210-john wesley footsteps . [Poor souls]674-poor souls ! [they]667-few enough of his followers lived as far from what [Wesley]210-john wesley taught as it is easily possible to conceive . As for [Gray Michael]204-gray michael , [he]204-gray michael was under the impression that [he]204-gray michael and [[his]204-gray michael sect]675-his sect worthily held aloft the true light which [Wesley]210-john wesley brought in person to [Newlyn]1-newlyn , and [he]204-gray michael talked with authority upon the subject of [[his]204-gray michael master]676-his master and [[his]204-gray michael master]676-his master 's doings . But [he]204-gray michael knew little about [the founder of Methodism]678-the founder of methodism in reality , and still less about the history of [the Methodist movement]679-the methodist movement . Had [he]204-gray michael learned that [John Wesley]210-john wesley [himself]210-john wesley was once accused of Popish practices ; had [he]204-gray michael known that not until some years after [the great preacher]680-the great preacher 's death did [[his]204-gray michael party]670-his party , in conference assembled , separate [itself]670-his party from [the Church of [England]37-england]36-the church of england , [he]204-gray michael had doubtless been much amazed . Though saturated with religious feeling , [the man]3494-the man was wholly ignorant of religious history in so far as it affected [[his]3494-the man own country]683-his own country . To [him]3494-the man [all saints not mentioned in Scripture]684-all saints not mentioned in scripture were an abomination and invention of [Rome]38-rome . Had [he]3494-the man been informed that [the venerable missionary saints of [[his]3494-the man mother land]686-his mother land]685-the venerable missionary saints of his mother land were in no case [Romish]213-romish , another vast surprise must have awaited [him]3494-the man . Let it not for an instant be supposed that [the Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers represented right Methodism . But [they]685-the venerable missionary saints of his mother land fairly exemplified a sorry side of it ; those little offshoots of which dozens have separated from the parent tree ; and [they]685-the venerable missionary saints of his mother land exhibited most abundantly in [themselves]685-the venerable missionary saints of his mother land that canker - worm of Pharisaism which gnaws at the root of all Nonconformity . This offense , combined with such intolerance and profound ignorance as was to be found amid [the Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers , produced [a community merely sad or comic to consider according to the point of view]687-a community merely sad or comic to consider according to the point of view . An instance of [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza 's attitude to [the Church]688-the church will illustrate better than analysis the lines of thought on which [he]203-michael tregenza served [[his]203-michael tregenza Creator]689-his creator . Once , when [she]690-she was thirteen , [Joan]183-joan had gone to an evening service at [St. Peter 's]39-st. peter , because [a friend]691-a friend had dared [her]183-joan to do so . [[Her]183-joan father]3642-her father was at [sea]540-sea and [she]183-joan believed the delinquency could by no possibility reach [his]3642-her father ears . But [a Luke Gospeler]694-a luke gospeler heard the dread tidings and [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza was quickly informed of [[his]203-michael tregenza daughter]695-his daughter 's lapse . [He]203-michael tregenza accused [Joan]183-joan quietly enough , and [she]183-joan confessed . " Then you'm [a damned maiden]696-a damned maiden , " [he]203-michael tregenza said , " 'cause [you]183-joan sinned open - eyed . " [He]203-michael tregenza thought the matter over for a week , and finally an idea occurred to [him]203-michael tregenza . " '[203-michael tregenza] Tis wi'in the power o ' [God]179-god to reach even [you]183-joan back , " [he]203-michael tregenza declared to [Joan]183-joan , " an '[203-michael tregenza] [He]203-michael tregenza 's put in [my]0-i mind that chastenin ' might do it . A sore body 's saved many sowls '[203-michael tregenza] fore now . " Whereupon [he]203-michael tregenza took [[his]203-michael tregenza daughter]695-his daughter into [the little parlor]698-the little parlor , shut the door , and then flogged [her]183-joan as [he]203-michael tregenza would have flogged [a boy]619-a boy — only using [his]203-michael tregenza hard hand instead of a stick . " Get [thee]183-joan behind [her]183-joan , [Satan]214-satan ! Get [thee]183-joan behind [her]183-joan , [Satan]214-satan ! Get [thee]183-joan behind [her]183-joan , [Satan]214-satan ! " [he]203-michael tregenza groaned with every blow , while [Joan]183-joan grit [her]183-joan teeth and bore it as long as [she]183-joan could , then screamed and fainted . That was how the truth about heaven and [hell]700-hell came to [her]183-joan . [She]183-joan had never felt physical pain before , and eternal torment was merely an idea . From that day , however , [she]183-joan was frightened and listened to [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father gladly and wept tears of thankfulness when , a month after [her]183-joan flogging , [he]3642-her father explained that [he]3642-her father had wrestled with [the Lord]702-the lord for [her]183-joan soul and how it had been borne in upon [him]3642-her father that [she]183-joan was saved alive . [She]183-joan had reached the age of seventeen now , and felt quite confident upon the subject of eternity as became a right [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler . Unlike [other women of the sect]703-other women of the sect , however , and despite extreme ignorance on all subjects , [the girl]521-the girl had a seed of humor in [her]183-joan nature only waiting circumstances to ripen . [She]183-joan felt pity , too , for [the great damned world]705-the great damned world , and though religion turned life sad - colored , [her]183-joan own simple , healthy , animal nature and high spirits brought ample share of sunshine and delight . [She]521-the girl was , in fact , [[[her]183-joan mother]706-her mother 's child rather than [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father 's]707-her mother 's child rather than her father 's . [[His]3642-her father ancestors before [him]3642-her father]709-his ancestors before him had fought [the devil]3557-the devil and lived honest lives under a cloud of fear ; [[Michael]203-michael tregenza 's own brother]711-michael 's own brother had gone religious mad , when still [a young man]712-a young man , and died in [a lunatic asylum]713-a lunatic asylum ; indeed the awful difficulty of saving [his]711-michael 's own brother soul had been in the blood of [every true Tregenza]714-every true tregenza for generations . But [[Joan]183-joan 's mother]715-joan 's mother came of different stock . [The Chirgwins]215-the chirgwins were [upland people]716-upland people . [They]716-upland people dwelt at [Drift]15-drift and elsewhere , went to [the nearest church]717-the nearest church , held simple views , and were content with orthodox religion . [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza said of [them]716-upland people that [they]716-upland people always wanted and expected [God]179-god to do more than [His]216-mr. tregenza share . But [he]216-mr. tregenza married [Joan Chirgwin]183-joan , nevertheless ; and now [he]216-mr. tregenza saw [her]183-joan again , fair , trustful , light - hearted , in [[his]216-mr. tregenza daughter]695-his daughter . [The girl]521-the girl indeed had more of [[her]521-the girl mother]706-her mother in [her]521-the girl than [Gray Michael]204-gray michael liked . [She]521-the girl was superstitious , not after the manner of [the Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas , but in a direction that must have brought [[her]521-the girl father]3642-her father 's loudest thunders upon [her]521-the girl head if the matter had come to [his]216-mr. tregenza ears . [She]521-the girl loved the old stories of [the saints]722-the saints and spirits , [she]521-the girl gloried secretly in the splendid wealth of folklore and tradition [[[her]521-the girl mother]706-her mother 's people]724-her mother 's people and those like [them]724-her mother 's people possessed at command . [[Her]521-the girl dead parent]725-her dead parent had whispered and sung these matters into [Joan]183-joan 's baby ears until [[her]521-the girl father]3642-her father stopped it . [She]521-the girl remembered how black [he]216-mr. tregenza looked when [she]521-the girl lisped about [the piskeys]727-the piskeys ; and though to - day [she]521-the girl half believed in demon and fairy , goblin and giant , and quite believed in [the saints]722-the saints and [their]722-the saints miracles , [she]521-the girl kept this side of [her]521-the girl intelligence close locked when at [home]453-home , and only nodded very gravely when [[her]521-the girl father]3642-her father roared against the blighting credulity of [men]3512-men 's minds and the follies for which [fishers]732-fishers and [miners]733-miners , and indeed [the bulk of [the human family]735-the human family in [Cornwall]13-cornwall]734-the bulk of the human family in cornwall , must some day burn . [People outside the fold]736-people outside the fold said that [the Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers killed [[Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza 's first wife]737-tregenza 's first wife . [She]521-the girl , of course , accepted [[her]521-the girl husband]605-her husband 's convictions , but it had never been in [her]521-the girl tender heart to catch [the true Luke Gospel spirit]739-the true luke gospel spirit . [She]521-the girl was too full of the milk of human kindness , too prone to forgive and forget , too tolerant and ready to see good in [all men]740-all men . The fiery sustenance of the new tenets withered [her]521-the girl away like a scorched flower , and [she]521-the girl died five years after [[her]521-the girl child]741-her child was born . For a space of two years [the widower]742-the widower remained [one]3502-one ; then [he]605-her husband married again , being at that time [a hale man of forty]744-a hale man of forty , [the owner of [[his]605-her husband own fishing - boat]746-his own fishing - boat , and at once [the strongest personality and handsomest person in [Newlyn]1-newlyn]747-the strongest personality and handsomest person in newlyn]745-the owner of his own fishing - boat , and at once the strongest personality and handsomest person in newlyn . [Thomasin Strick]219-thomasin strick , [[his]605-her husband second wife]748-his second wife , was already a [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler and needed no conversion . [People]749-people laughed in secret at [their]749-people wooing , and likened it to the rubbing of granite rocks or [a miner]750-a miner 's pick striking fire from tin ore . [A boy]619-a boy presently came to [them]749-people ; and now [he]619-a boy was ten and [[his]619-a boy mother]752-his mother forty . [She]752-his mother passed rightly for [a careful , money - loving soul]753-a careful , money - loving soul , and [a good wife]754-a good wife , with the wit to be also a good [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler . But [her]752-his mother tongue was harder than [her]752-his mother heart . [Father]755-father and [mother]756-mother alike thought the wide world of [[their]749-people boy]757-their boy , though [the child]758-the child was brought up under an iron rod . [Joan]183-joan , too , loved [[her]183-joan half - brother]759-her half - brother , [Tom]199-tom , very dearly , and took a pride only second to [[her]183-joan stepmother]760-her stepmother 's in [the lad]761-the lad 's progress and achievements . More than once , though only [Joan]183-joan and [he]761-the lad knew it , [she]183-joan had saved [his]761-the lad skin from punishment , and [she]183-joan worshiped [him]761-the lad with a frank admiration which was bound to win [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza 's regard . [Joan]183-joan quite understood [the careful and troubled matron]762-the careful and troubled matron , never attached undue importance to [her]183-joan sharp words , and was usually at [her]183-joan elbow with an ear for all grievances and even a sympathetic word if the same seemed called for . [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza had to grumble to live , and [Joan]183-joan was [the safety - valve]763-the safety - valve , for when [[her]183-joan husband]605-her husband came off [the sea]463-the sea [he]761-the lad would have none of it . Life moved uniformly for [these people]766-these people , being varied only by the seasons of the year and the different harvests from [the sea]463-the sea which each brought with it . [Pollock]220-pollock , mackerel , pilchards , herrings — all had [their]766-these people appointed time , and the years rolled on , marked by events connected with the secular business of life on one hand and that greater matter of eternity upon the other . Thus mighty catches of fish held the memory with mighty catches of [men]3512-men . One year the take of mackerel had been beyond all previous recollection ; on another occasion [three entire families]769-three entire families had joined [the Luke Gospelers]770-the luke gospelers , and so promised to increase the scanty numbers of [the chosen]771-the chosen . There were black memories , too , and black years , casting gloomy shadows . [Widows]772-widows and [orphans]773-orphans knew what it was to watch for brown sails that came into [the harbor]458-the harbor 's sheltering arms no more ; and spiritual death had overtaken more than one [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler . [Such]775-such turned [their]775-such backs upon the light and exchanged Truth for the benighted parody of religion displayed by [Bible Christians]776-bible christians , by [Plymouth Brethren]221-plymouth brethren or by [the Church of [England]37-england]36-the church of england . Six months before the day on which [she]777-she saw [[his]761-the lad ship]778-his ship through [Barron]176-barron 's glasses , [Joan]183-joan had been formally affianced to [Joe Noy]192-joe , with [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father 's permission and approval . The circumstances of the event demand a word , for [Joe]192-joe had already been engaged once before : to [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary , [a young woman who was [first cousin to [Joan]183-joan and a good deal older]781-first cousin to joan and a good deal older . [She]222-mary was [an orphan]782-an orphan and dwelt at [Drift]15-drift with [Thomas Chirgwin]223-tom , [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle]780-a young woman who was first cousin to joan and a good deal older . she was an orphan and dwelt at drift with thomas chirgwin , her uncle . [The sailor]784-the sailor had thereby brightened an unutterably lonely life and brought earthly joy to one who had never known it . Then [Gray Michael]204-gray michael got hold of [the lad , who was naturally of a solid and religious temperament , and up to that time of the order of the Rechabites]785-the lad , who was naturally of a solid and religious temperament , and up to that time of the order of the rechabites . As a result , [Joe Noy]192-joe joined [the Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers and called upon [[his]192-joe sweetheart]786-his sweetheart to do likewise . But [she]786-his sweetheart recollected [[her]786-his sweetheart aunt]787-her aunt , [[Joan]183-joan 's mother]715-joan 's mother , and being made of stern stuff , stuck to [the Church of [England]37-england]36-the church of england as [she]786-his sweetheart knew it , counting salvation a greater thing than even [a home of [her]786-his sweetheart own]789-a home of her own . The struggle was sharp between [them]790-them ; neither would give way ; [their]790-them engagement was therefore broken , and [the girl]521-the girl 's solitary golden glimpse of happiness in [this world]792-this world shattered . [She]786-his sweetheart found it hard to forgive [the Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas , and when , six months afterward , [the sleepy farm life at [Drift]15-drift]793-the sleepy farm life at drift was startled by news of [Joan]183-joan 's love affair , [Mary]222-mary , in the first flush of [her]222-mary reawakened agony , spoke bitterly enough ; and even [that most mild - mannered of [men]3512-men]794-that most mild - mannered of men , [[her]222-mary uncle]783-her uncle , said that [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza had done an ugly act . But [the fisherman]797-the fisherman was at no time concerned with [Mary]222-mary or with [Joan]183-joan . The opportunity to get a soul into the fold had offered and been accepted . Any matter of earthly love - making counted little beside this . When [Joe]192-joe broke with [Mary]222-mary , [[his]192-joe mentor]798-his mentor declared the action inevitable , as [the girl]521-the girl would not alter [her]521-the girl opinions , and when , presently , [young Noy]192-joe fell in love with [Joan]183-joan , [[her]521-the girl father]3642-her father saw no objection , for [the sailor]784-the sailor was honest , already a stanch [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler and [a clean liver]802-a clean liver . Perhaps at that moment there was hardly [another eligible youth in Newlyn from [Tregenza]203-michael tregenza 's point of view]803-another eligible youth in newlyn from tregenza 's point of view . [He]3642-her father held [Joan]183-joan [a girl to be put under stern marital rule]804-a girl to be put under stern marital rule as soon as possible , and [Joe]192-joe promised to make [a godly husband with a strong will]805-a godly husband with a strong will , while [his]3642-her father convictions and view of life were altogether satisfactory , being modeled on [Michael]203-michael tregenza 's own . The arrangement suited [Joan]183-joan . [She]183-joan believed [she]183-joan loved [Joe]192-joe very dearly , and [she]183-joan looked forward with satisfaction to marrying [him]3642-her father in about a year 's time , when [he]3642-her father should have won a [ship - master]806-ship - master 's certificate . But [she]183-joan viewed [his]3642-her father departure without suffering and would not have willingly foregone [her]183-joan remaining year of freedom . [She]183-joan respected [Joe]192-joe very much and knew [he]192-joe would make [a good partner]807-a good partner and give [her]183-joan a position above [the everyday wives of [Newlyn]1-newlyn]808-the everyday wives of newlyn ; moreover , [he]192-joe was [a fine figure of a man]809-a fine figure of a man . But [he]192-joe lacked mental breadth , and that fact sometimes tickled [her]183-joan dormant sense of humor . [He]192-joe copied [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father so exactly , and [she]183-joan , who lived with [the real thunder]811-the real thunder , never could show sufficient gravity or conviction in the presence of [the youthful and narrow - minded Noy]812-the youthful and narrow - minded noy 's second - hand echoes . [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary was naturally a thousand times more religious - minded than [Joan]183-joan , and sometimes [Joe]192-joe wished the sober mind of [his]192-joe first love could be transported to the beautiful body of [his]192-joe second ; but [he]192-joe kept this notion to [himself]192-joe , studied to please [[his]192-joe future father - in - law]813-his future father - in - law , which [he]192-joe succeeded in doing handsomely , and contented [himself]192-joe , in so far as [[his]192-joe lady]814-his lady was concerned , by reflecting that the necessary control over [her]814-his lady somewhat light mind would be [his]192-joe in due season . To return from this tedious but necessary glimpse at the position and belief of [these people]766-these people to [Joan]183-joan and the washing , it is to be noted that [she]183-joan quickly made up for lost time , and , without further mentioning the incidents of [her]183-joan morning 's excursion , began to work . [She]183-joan pulled up [her]183-joan sleeves , dragged [her]183-joan dress about [her]183-joan waist , then started to cleanse the thick flannels [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father wore at [sea]540-sea , [his]3642-her father long - tailed shirts and woolen stockings . [The Tregenzas]818-the tregenzas were [well - to - do folk]819-well - to - do folk , and did not need to use [the open spaces of [the village]423-the village]820-the open spaces of the village for drying of clothes . [Joan]183-joan presently set up a line among [the plum - trees]822-the plum - trees , and dawdled over the hanging out of wet garments , for it was now noon , sunny , mild , and fresh , with a cool salt breeze off [the sea]463-the sea . The winter repose of the bee - butts had been broken at last , and the insects were busy with the plum - blossom and among the little green flowerets on the gooseberry bushes . Beyond , sun - streaked and bright , extended apple - trees with whitewashed stems and a twinkle of crimson on their boughs , where buds grew ripe for the blowing . [Joan]183-joan yawned and blinked up at the sun to see if it was dinner time . Then [she]183-joan watched a kitten hunting the bees in the gooseberry bushes . Presently the little creature knocked one to the ground and began to pat it and pounce upon it . Then the bee , using [Nature]178-nature 's weapon to preserve precious life , stung the kitten ; and the kitten hopped into the air much amazed . [It]824-it shook its paw , licked it , shook it again . [Joan]183-joan laughed , and [two pigs at the bottom of]825-two pigs at the bottom of [the garden]3656-the garden heard [her]183-joan and grunted and squealed as [they]825-two pigs at the bottom of thrust expectant noses through the palings of [their]825-two pigs at the bottom of sty . [They]825-two pigs at the bottom of connected the laugh with [their]825-two pigs at the bottom of dinner , but [Joan]183-joan 's thoughts were all upon [her]183-joan own . A few minutes later [Thomasin Tregenza]201-thomasin called [her]183-joan , and , as [they]825-two pigs at the bottom of sat down , [Tom]223-tom arrived from [school]827-school . [He]223-tom was [a brown - faced , dark - eyed , black - haired youngster]828-a brown - faced , dark - eyed , black - haired youngster , good - looking enough , but not at that moment . " Aw ! [Jimmery]224-jimmery ! fightin ' agin , " said [[his]223-tom mother]752-his mother , viewing two swollen lips , a bulged ear , and an eye half closed . " [I]223-tom 've downed [Matthew Bent]225-matthew bent , [Joan]183-joan ! Ten fair rounds , then [he]223-tom gived up . " " Fight , fight , fight—'tis all [you]183-joan think of , " said [[his]223-tom parent]3663-his parent , while [Joan]183-joan poured congratulations on [the conqueror]3664-the conqueror . " '[223-tom] Tweer bound to come arter the football , when [he]223-tom played foul , an ' [I]829-i tawld en so . Now , [we'm friends]3665-we'm friends . " [Tom]223-tom , with [his]223-tom mouth full of fish and potato pie , told the story of [his]223-tom victory , and [the women]3669-the women made a big , hearty meal and listened . " [He]223-tom cockled up to [me]183-joan , an '[183-joan] [us]833-us beginned fightin ' right away , an '[227-faither'll] in the third round [I]0-i scat en on the mouth an ' knocked wan '[0-i] is teeth out . " " [Us]833-us doan't want to knaw no more 'bout it , " declared [[his]223-tom mother]752-his mother after dinner was over . " [You]834-you 've laced en an '[227-faither'll] that 's enough .
