" " Why , that 's good , sweet news , [Joan]183-joan ; and [Nature]178-nature told [me]0-i the truth after all ! [We]1544-we 're bound to love [one another]4213-one another . [She]178-nature made [us]1544-we for that very reason ! " [He]241-mister jan knew that [her]183-joan mind was full of the tangles of life and that [she]183-joan wanted [him]241-mister jan to solve some of the riddles just then uppermost in [her]183-joan own existence . [He]241-mister jan felt that [Joe]192-joe was in [her]183-joan thoughts , and [he]241-mister jan easily divined [her]183-joan unuttered question as to why [Nature]178-nature had sent [Joe]192-joe before [she]178-nature had sent [him]192-joe . But , though answers and explanations of [her]183-joan troubles were not likely to be difficult , [he]241-mister jan had no wish to make them or to pursue the subject just then . Indeed , [he]241-mister jan bid [Joan]183-joan depart an hour before [she]183-joan need have done so . [Her]183-joan face was spoiled for that sitting , and matters had progressed up to the threshold of the barrier . Before that could be broken down , [she]183-joan must be made to feel that [she]183-joan was necessary to the happiness of [his]241-mister jan life ; as [he]241-mister jan already felt that [she]183-joan was necessary to the completion of [his]241-mister jan picture . [She]183-joan loved [him]241-mister jan very dearly , and [he]241-mister jan , though love was not possible to [his]241-mister jan nature , could feel the substitute . [He]241-mister jan had fairly stepped out of [his]241-mister jan impersonal shell into reality . Presently [he]241-mister jan would return to [his]241-mister jan shell again . For a moment [a model]4214-a model had grown more to [him]241-mister jan than a picture ; and [he]241-mister jan told [himself]241-mister jan that [he]241-mister jan must obey [Nature]178-nature in order adequately to serve [Art]184-art . [He]241-mister jan picked up the handkerchief [he]241-mister jan had lent [Joan]183-joan , looked at the dampness of the tear - stains , and then spread it in the sun to dry . While [John Barren]177-barren determined that a space of time extending over some days should now separate [him]241-mister jan from [Joan]183-joan , [she]183-joan , for [her]183-joan part , had scarce left [Gorse Point]42-gorse point after the conversation just chronicled when there came a great longing in [her]183-joan heart to return [thither]4215-thither . As [she]183-joan walked [home]453-home [she]183-joan viewed wearily the hours which lay between [her]183-joan and the following morning when [she]183-joan might go back to [him]241-mister jan and see [his]241-mister jan face again . Time promised to drag for the next day and night . Already [she]183-joan framed in [her]183-joan mind the things [her]183-joan mouth should say to - morrow ; and that almost before [she]183-joan was beyond sight of [the man]3494-the man 's easel . [Her]183-joan fears had vanished with [her]183-joan tears . The future was entirely in [his]241-mister jan hand now , for [she]183-joan had accepted [his]241-mister jan teaching , endeavored to look at life with [his]241-mister jan eyes , made [[his]241-mister jan God]4218-his god [her]183-joan own , so far as [she]183-joan had wit to gather what [[his]241-mister jan God]4218-his god was . [She]183-joan accepted the situation with trust , and felt responsibility shifted on to " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's " shoulders with infinite relief . [He]241-mister jan was very wise and knew everything and loved the truth . It is desirable to harp and harp upon this ever - recurring thought : [the artist]3491-the artist 's grand love for truth ; because all channels of [Joan]183-joan 's mind flowed into [this lake]4221-this lake . [His]241-mister jan sincerity begat absolute trust . And , as [John Barren]177-barren and [his]241-mister jan words and thoughts filled the foreground of life for [her]183-joan , so , correspondingly , did the affairs of [[her]183-joan home]1297-her home , with all the circumstances of existence in the old environment , peak and dwindle toward shadowy insignificance . [[Her]183-joan father]3642-her father lost [his]3642-her father majestic proportions ; [the Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers became mere objects for compassion ; the petty , temporal interests and concerns of the passing hour appeared mere worthless affairs for the occupation and waste of time . " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " loved [her]183-joan , and [she]183-joan loved [him]241-mister jan , and what else mattered ? Past hours of unrest and wakefulness were forgotten ; [her]183-joan tears washed the dead anxieties clean away ; and the kiss which had caused them , though it scorched [her]183-joan lip when it fell there , was now set as a seal and a crowning glory to [her]183-joan life . [He]241-mister jan never kissed [any other woman]1490-any other woman . That pledge of [this rare man]4225-this rare man 's affection had been won by the magic of love , and [Joan]183-joan welcomed [Nature]178-nature gladly and called it [God]179-god with a warm heart and thankful soul ; for [Nature]178-nature had brought about this miracle . [Her]183-joan former religion worked no wonders ; it had only conveyed terror to [her]183-joan and a comprehensive knowledge of hell . " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " smiled at hell and [she]183-joan could laugh at [her]183-joan old fears . How was it possible to hesitate between two such creeds ? [She]183-joan did not do so , and , with final acceptation of the new , and secret rejection of the old , came a great peace to [Joan]183-joan 's heart with the whisper of many voices telling [her]183-joan that [she]183-joan had done rightly . So the storm gave place to periods of delicious calm and content only clouded by a longing to be back with [the artist]3491-the artist again . [He]241-mister jan loved [her]183-joan ; the voice of [his]241-mister jan love was the song of the spring weather , and the thrush echoed it and the early flowers wrote it on the hedgerows . [God]179-god was everywhere to [her]183-joan open eyes . Everything that was beautiful , everything that was good , seemed to have been created for [her]183-joan delight during that homeward walk . [She]183-joan was mightily lifted up . Nature seemed so strong , so kind , such [a guardian angel for [a maiden]3858-a maiden]4227-a guardian angel for a maiden . And the birds sang out that " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " was [[Nature]178-nature 's priest]4229-nature 's priest and could do no wrong ; and that to obey [Nature]178-nature was the highest good . From which reflection rose a hazy happiness — dim , beautiful and indefinable as the twinkling gold upon [the sea under the throne of the sun]4230-the sea under the throne of the sun . [Joan]183-joan dwelt on the memory of the day which was now over for [her]183-joan , and on the thought of morning hours which to - morrow would bring . But [she]183-joan looked no further ; and backward [she]183-joan did not gaze at all . No thought of [Joe Noy]192-joe dimmed [her]183-joan mental delight ; no shadowy cloud darkened the horizon then . All was bright , all perfect . [Her]183-joan mind seemed to be breaking its little case , as the butterfly bursts the chrysalis . [Her]183-joan life till then had been mere grub existence ; now [she]183-joan could fly and had seen the sun drawing the scent from flowers . Great ideas filled [her]183-joan soul ; new emotions awoke ; [she]183-joan was like [a baby]4231-a baby trying to utter the thing [he]4231-a baby has no word for ; [her]183-joan vocabulary broke down under the strain , and as [she]183-joan walked [she]183-joan gave thanks to [Nature]178-nature in a mere wordless song , like the lark , because [she]183-joan could not put [her]183-joan acknowledgment into language . But [the great Mother]4232-the great mother , to whom Life is all in all , [the living individual nothing]4233-the living individual nothing , looked on at a world wakening from sleep and viewed the loves of the flowers and the loves of the birds and beasts and fishes with concern as keen as the love in the blue eyes of [Joan]183-joan upon [[her]183-joan homeward way]4234-her homeward way . Busy indeed at this vernal season was the mysterious Nurse of [[God]179-god 's little world]4235-god 's little world . [Her]183-joan hands rested not from [her]183-joan labors . [She]183-joan worked strange wonders on the waste , by magic of a million breaking buds , by burying of the dead , by wafting of subtle pollen - life from blossom to blossom . And in cliffs above [the green waters]4236-the green waters the nests of [her]183-joan wild - fowl were already lined with wool and feather ; neither were [her]183-joan samphires forgotten in [their dizzy habitations]4237-their dizzy habitations ; and salt spray sprinkled [her]183-joan uncurling sea ferns in caves and crannies where they grew . [She]183-joan laughed at the porpoises rolling [their]4238-their fat sides into sunshine ; [she]183-joan brought the sea - otter where it should find fish for its young ; [she]183-joan led [giant congers]4239-giant congers to [drowned men]4240-drowned men ; [she]183-joan patted the sleek head of the sad - eyed seal . Elsewhere [she]183-joan showed [the father - hawk]4241-the father - hawk a leveret crouching in [his]4241-the father - hawk form ; [she]183-joan took young rabbits to the new spring grass ; the fox to the fowl , the fly to the spider , the blight to the bud . [Her]183-joan weakly nestlings fell from tree and cliff to die , but [she]183-joan beheld unmoved ; [her]183-joan weasel sucked the gray - bird 's egg , yet no hand was raised against [the thief]4242-the thief , no voice comforted the screaming agony of [the mother]4243-the mother . With the van of [her]183-joan legions [she]183-joan moved , and [the suffering stragglers]4244-the suffering stragglers cried in vain , for [her]183-joan concerns were not with [them]4244-the suffering stragglers . [She]183-joan did no right , [she]183-joan worked no evil ; [she]183-joan was not cruel , neither shall [we]4245-we call [her]183-joan kind . [The servant of [God]179-god]4246-the servant of god was [she]183-joan , then as always , heedful of [His]179-god utterances , obedient to [His]179-god laws . Which laws , when [man better divines]4247-man better divines , [he]179-god shall learn [thy]179-god secret too , Nurse of [the world]3624-the world , but not sooner . Having already learned from experience that hard work quickens the flight of time , [Joan]183-joan , returning in happy mood to [[her]183-joan home]1297-her home and with no trace of the past tears upon [her]183-joan cheeks , surprised [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza by a display of most unusual energy and activity . [She]183-joan helped [the butcher]4250-the butcher to get the pig into a low cart built expressly for the conveyance of such unwieldy animals ; [she]183-joan looked mournfully at [[her]183-joan departing companion]4251-her departing companion , knowing that the morrow had nothing for [him]4251-her departing companion but a knife , that [he]4251-her departing companion had eaten [his]4251-her departing companion last meal . And while [Joan]183-joan listened to the farewell grunts of the fattest pig which had ever adorned [[[her]183-joan father]3642-her father 's sty]4253-her father 's sty , [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza counted the money and bit a piece here and there , and wondered if [she]183-joan could get [the next young pig]4254-the next young pig from [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin for even a lower figure than the last . The day which had wrought such wonders for [Joan]183-joan 's inner life , and brought to [her]183-joan eyes a sort of tears unshed till then , ended at last , and for [her]183-joan a sleepless night followed upon it . Not until long past one o'clock in the morning did [she]183-joan lose consciousness , and then the thoughts of the day broke loose again in visions , taking upon themselves fantastic shapes and moving amid dream scenery of strange splendor . Now it was [her]183-joan turn to conjure brain pictures out of fevered thoughts , and [she]183-joan woke at last with a start in the dawn , to see a faint light painting the square of [her]183-joan bedroom window . Looking out , [she]183-joan found [the world]3624-the world dimly visible , a darker shadow through the gloom where [the fishing - boats]3631-the fishing - boats were gathering in [the bay]526-the bay , the lighthouse lamp still shining , stars twinkling overhead , absolute silence everywhere , and a cold bite about the air . [The girl]521-the girl went back to bed again , but slept no more and anon arose , dressed , set about morning duties , and , much to [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza 's astonishment , had the fire burning and breakfast ready by the time [[her]183-joan stepmother]760-her stepmother appeared . " Aw jimmery ! " [Thomasin]201-thomasin exclaimed , as [Joan]183-joan came in from [the outhouse]4260-the outhouse to find [her]183-joan warming cold hands at the fire , " [I]1545-the piskey men could n't b'lieve [my]1545-the piskey men eyes at first an '[1545-the piskey men] thot [the piskey men]1545-the piskey men had come to do [us]1546-us a turn spite o ' what faither sez . " " [He]1548-he 's pork now , or nearly . [You]183-joan heard [butcher]283-butcher promise [me]1548-he some nattlins , dedn '[1548-he] ' [e]4261-e ? [You]183-joan 'd best walk up to [Paul bimebye]267-paul an '[1548-he] fetch , 'em . '[1548-he] Tis easier to call to mind [other folk]1547-other folk 's promises than [our]1546-us awn . [He]1548-he said the same last pig - killin ' an '[1548-he] it comed to nort . " [Joan]183-joan escaped soon after breakfast and set off eagerly enough . [She]183-joan took a basket with [her]183-joan and designed to call at [Paul]267-paul on the way [home]453-home again . Moreover , [she]183-joan chose [a longer route to [Gorse Point]42-gorse point]1550-a longer route to gorse point than that through [Mousehole]9-mousehole , for [her]183-joan very regular habits of late had caused some comment in [that village]1551-that village , and [more than one acquaintance]1552-more than one acquaintance had asked [her]183-joan , half in jest , half in earnest , who it was [she]183-joan went to see up [Mousehole hill]1553-mousehole hill . This had frightened [Joan]183-joan twice already , and to - day , for the first time , [she]183-joan took [the longer route above [Paul Church -]70-paul church - [town]1223-town]1554-the longer route above paul church - town . It brought [her]183-joan over fields near [the cow - byre]71-the cow - byre where [Barren]177-barren spent much of [his]177-barren time and kept [his]177-barren picture ; and when [she]183-joan saw [her]183-joan footpath must pass the door of [the little house]1556-the little house , a flutter quickened [her]183-joan pulses and [she]183-joan branched away over [the field]1557-the field and proceeded to [the cliffs]536-the cliffs through a gap in the hedge some distance from [the byre]3755-the byre . But as [Joan]183-joan came out upon [the sward through the furzes]1560-the sward through the furzes [her]183-joan heart sank in sight of loneliness . [She]183-joan was not early to - day , but [she]183-joan had come earlier than " [Mister Jan.]196-mister jan. " [The gray figure]1561-the gray figure was invisible . There were the marks on the turf where [his]177-barren easel and camp - stool stood ; there was the spot [his]177-barren feet were wo nt to press , and [her]183-joan own standing - point against the glimmering gorse ; but that was all . [She]183-joan knew of no reason for [his]177-barren delay . The weather was splendid , the day was warm , and [he]177-barren had never been so late before within [her]183-joan recollection . [Joan]183-joan , much wondering , sat down to wait with [her]183-joan eyes upon [the sea]463-the sea , [her]183-joan ears alert for the first footstep , and [her]183-joan mind listening also . Time passed , and indefinite uneasiness grew into a fear ; then that expanded and multiplied as [her]183-joan mind approached the problem of " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's " non - appearance from a dozen different standpoints . [Hope]284-hope declared some private concern had kept [him]177-barren and [he]177-barren would not be long in coming ; fear inquired what unforeseen incident was likely to have risen since yesterday — asked the question and answered it a dozen ways . [The girl]521-the girl waited , walked here and there , scanned [the footpath]1564-the footpath and [the road]445-the road , returned , sat down in patience , ate a cake [she]521-the girl had brought , and so whiled the long minutes away . The fears grew as hour and half - hour passed — fears for [him]177-barren , not [herself]183-joan . The crowning despair did not touch [her]183-joan mind till later , and [her]183-joan first sorrow was a simple terror that harm had fallen upon [the man]3494-the man . [He]3494-the man had told [her]183-joan that [he]3494-the man valued life but little , that at best no great length of days awaited [him]3494-the man ; and now [she]183-joan thought that wandering about [the cliffs]536-the cliffs by night [he]3494-the man might have met the death [he]3494-the man did not fear . Then [she]183-joan remembered [he]3494-the man was but [a sick man always , with frail breathing parts]1568-a sick man always , with frail breathing parts ; and [her]183-joan thoughts turned to [the shed]3720-the shed , and [she]183-joan pictured [him]3494-the man lying ill there , unable to communicate with [friends]1078-friends , perhaps waiting and praying long hours for [her]183-joan footfall as [she]183-joan had been waiting and praying for [his]3494-the man . Upon this most plausible possibility striking [Joan]183-joan , [her]183-joan heart beat at [her]183-joan breast and [her]183-joan cheeks grew white . [She]183-joan rose from [her]183-joan seat upon [the cliff]4179-the cliff , turned [her]183-joan face to [the cow - byre]1280-the cow - byre and made a few quick steps in that direction . Then a vague flutter of sense , as of warning where no danger is visible , slowed [her]183-joan speed for a moment ; but [her]183-joan heart was strung to action , and the strange new voice did not sound like [Nature]178-nature 's , so [she]183-joan put it aside and let it drown into silence before the clamor of fear for " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's " well - being . Indeed , that dim premonitory whisper excited a moment 's anger in [the girl]521-the girl that any distrust could shadow [her]183-joan love for [such a one]1574-such a one at such a time . [She]183-joan hated [herself]183-joan , held the thought a sin of [her]183-joan own commission , and sped onward until [she]183-joan stood upon [the northern side of [the byre]3755-the byre]1575-the northern side of the byre in a shadow cast from it by the sun . [The place]3488-the place was padlocked , and at that sight [Joan]183-joan 's spirits , though [they]1578-they rose in one direction , yet fell in another . One fear vanished , a second loomed the larger ; for the padlock , while it indicated that [the artist]3491-the artist had left [his]3491-the artist lonely habitation for the time , did not explain [his]3491-the artist absence now or dispel the possibilities of an accident or disaster . The tar - pitched double door of [the shed]3720-the shed was fast and offered no peep - hole ; but [Joan]183-joan went round to [the south side]1581-the south side , where an aperture appeared and where a little glass window had taken the place of the wooden shutters . Sunshine lighted [the shed inside]1582-the shed inside ; [she]183-joan could see every detail of [the chamber]1583-the chamber , and [she]183-joan photographed [it]1583-the chamber on [her]183-joan mind with a quick glance . A big easel with the life - size picture of [herself]183-joan upon it stood in the middle of [the shed]3720-the shed , and a smaller easel appeared hard by . [The artist]3491-the artist 's palettes , brushes and colors littered a bench , and bottles and tumblers were scattered among them . Two pipes which [she]183-joan had seen in [his]3491-the artist mouth lay together upon a box on the floor , and beside them stood a tin of tobacco wrapped in yellow paper . A white umbrella and some sticks stood in one corner , and another [she]183-joan saw was filled by some railway rugs spread over dried bracken . Two coats hung on nails in the wall , and above one was suspended a Panama hat which [Barren]177-barren often wore when painting . Something moved suddenly , and , looking upon the stone floor , [she]183-joan saw a rat - trap with a live rat in it . The beast was running as far as it could this way and that , poking its nose up and trying the roof of [its prison]1586-its prison . [She]183-joan noticed its snout was raw from thrusting between the wire , and [she]183-joan wished [she]183-joan could get in to kill it . [She]183-joan did not know that it was [a mother rat with [young ones]1588-young ones outside squeaking faintly in the stack of mangel - wurzels]1587-a mother rat with young ones outside squeaking faintly in the stack of mangel - wurzels ; [she]183-joan did not know , as it hopped round and round , that its beady eyes were glittering with a great agony , and that [the Mother of all]1589-the mother of all was powerless to break down a mere wire or two and save [it]1587-a mother rat with young ones outside squeaking faintly in the stack of mangel - wurzels . Presently , worn and weary , [Joan]183-joan trudged [home]453-home again , with no very happy mind . [She]183-joan found food for comfort in one reflection alone : [the artist]3491-the artist had made no special appointment for that day , and it might be that business or an engagement at [Newlyn]1-newlyn , [Penzance]7-penzance or elsewhere was occupying [his]3491-the artist time . [She]183-joan felt it must be so , and tried hard to convince [herself]183-joan that [he]3491-the artist would surely be at the usual spot upon the morrow . So [she]183-joan walked [home]453-home unhappy ; and time , which had dragged yesterday , to - day stood still . Before night [she]183-joan had lived an age ; the hours of darkness were endless , but [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father 's return furnished excuse for another morning of early rising ; and when [Gray Michael]204-gray michael and [Tom]199-tom had eaten , donned clean raiment and returned to [the sea]463-the sea , [Joan]183-joan , having seen [them]1595-them to [the pierhead]4120-the pierhead , did not go [home]453-home , but hastened straight away for [Gorse Point]42-gorse point , and arrived [there]3728-there earlier than ever [she]183-joan had done before . There was something soothing to [her]183-joan troubled mind in being upon [the spot sacred to [him]3491-the artist]1599-the spot sacred to him . Though [he]3491-the artist was not present , [she]183-joan seemed closer far to [him]3491-the artist on [Gorse Point]42-gorse point than anywhere else . [His]3491-the artist foot had marked the turf there ; [his]3491-the artist eye had mirrored the furzes a hundred times ; [she]183-joan knew just where [his]3491-the artist shadow had fallen as [he]3491-the artist stood painting , and the spot upon which [he]3491-the artist was wo nt to sit by [the cliff - edge]1600-the cliff - edge when came the time for rest . Beside [this holy place]1601-this holy place [she]183-joan now seated [herself]183-joan and waited with hope higher in the splendor of morning ; for sorrows , fears and ills are always blackest when the sun has set , and [every man]631-every man or [woman]1347-woman can better face trouble on opening [their]631-every man eyes in a sunny dawn than after midnight has struck , a sad day left [them]631-every man weakened , and nothing wakes in [the world]3624-the world but Care and [themselves]631-every man . The morning wore away , and the old fears returned with greater force to chill [her]183-joan soul . The sun was burnishing [the sea]463-the sea , and [she]183-joan watched Mousehole luggers putting out and dancing away through the gold . Under the cliffs the gulls wheeled with sad cries and the long - necked cormorants hastened backward and forward , now flying fast and low over [the water]3501-the water , now fishing here and there in couples . [She]183-joan saw [them]1607-them rear in the water as [they]1607-them dived , then go down head first , leaving a rippling circle which widened out and vanished long before [the fishers bobbed up again twenty yards further on]1608-the fishers bobbed up again twenty yards further on . Time after time [she]183-joan watched [them]1607-them , speculating vaguely after each disappearance as to how long the bird would remain out of sight . Then [she]183-joan turned [her]183-joan face to [the land]3578-the land , weary of waiting , weary of [the bright sea]1610-the bright sea and sky , and the music of [the gulls]1611-the gulls , and of life . [She]183-joan sat down again presently , and put [her]183-joan hand over [her]183-joan face and struggled with [her]183-joan thoughts . Manifold fears compassed [her]183-joan mind about , but one , not felt till then , rose now , a giant above the rest . Yesterday [she]183-joan had been all alarm for " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " ; to - day there came terror for [herself]183-joan . Something said " [He]241-mister jan has gone , [he]241-mister jan has left [you]183-joan . " [Her]183-joan brain , without any warning , framed the words and spoke them to [her]183-joan . It was as though [a stranger]571-a stranger had brought the news , and [she]183-joan rose up white and stricken at this fatal explanation of [the artist]3491-the artist 's continued absence . [She]183-joan put the thought from [her]183-joan as [she]183-joan had put another , but it returned with pertinacity , and each time larger than before , until the fear filled all [her]183-joan mind and made [her]183-joan wild and desperate , under the conviction of a sudden , awful life - quake launched against [her]183-joan existence to shatter all [her]183-joan new joy and dash the brimming cup of love from [her]183-joan lips . Hours passed , and [she]183-joan grew somewhat faint and hollow every way — in head and heart and stomach . [Her]183-joan eyes ached , [her]183-joan brains were worn out with thinking ; [she]183-joan felt old , and [her]183-joan body was heavy and energy dead . [The world]3624-the world changed , too . [The gorse]563-the gorse looked strange as the sun went round , the lark sang no more , the wind blew coldly , and [the sea]463-the sea 's gold was darkened by a rack of flying clouds whose shadows fell purple and gray upon [the waters]1617-the waters . [He]3491-the artist had gone ; [he]3491-the artist had left [her]183-joan ; perhaps [she]183-joan would never see [him]3491-the artist or hear of [him]3491-the artist again . Then [the place]3488-the place grew hateful to [her]183-joan and terrible as a grave . [She]183-joan dragged [herself]183-joan away , dizzy , weary , wretched ; and not until half way [home]453-home again did [she]183-joan find power to steady [her]183-joan mind and control thought . Then the old alarm returned — that first fear which had pictured [him]3491-the artist dead , perhaps even now rolling over and over under the precipices , or hid forever in the cranny of [some dark cavern at the root of [the cliffs]536-the cliffs , where high tides spouted and thundered and battered the flesh off [his]3491-the artist bones against granite]1620-some dark cavern at the root of the cliffs , where high tides spouted and thundered and battered the flesh off his bones against granite . [She]183-joan suffered terribly in mind upon that homeward journey . [Her]183-joan own light and darkness mattered nothing now , and [her]183-joan personal and selfish fears had vanished before [she]183-joan reached [Newlyn]1-newlyn . [She]183-joan was thinking how [she]183-joan should raise an alarm , how [she]183-joan should tell [[his]3491-the artist friends]1622-his friends , who possibly imagined " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " safe and comfortable in [his]3491-the artist cow - byre . But who were [[his]3491-the artist friends]1622-his friends and how should [she]183-joan approach [them]1622-his friends without such a step becoming known and getting talked about ? [Her]183-joan misery was stamped on [her]183-joan face when [she]183-joan at last returned to [the white cottage]841-the white cottage at three o'clock in the afternoon of that day , and [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza saw it there . " [God]179-god save [us]1625-us ! wheer [you]1626-you bin to , an ' what [you]1626-you bin 'bout[1626-you] ? [You'm]1626-you so pasty an ' round - eyed as if [you]1626-you 'd bin piskey - led somewheers . An '[0-i] [me]0-i worn to death wi ' work . An '[0-i] wheer'm the nattlins an ' the basket ? " [Joan]183-joan had quite forgotten [her]183-joan commission and left the basket on [Gorse Point]42-gorse point . " [I]1626-you 'll gaw back bimebye , " [she]1626-you said . " [I]1626-you bin walkin '[1626-you] ' long [the cliffs]536-the cliffs in the sun an '[1626-you] forgot the time . Gimme somethin' t'ate , [mother]756-mother ; [I]0-i be hungry an ' fainty like wi '[1626-you] gwaine tu far . [I]0-i could hardly fetch [home]453-home . " " [You'm]1629-his [a queer twoad]1630-a queer twoad , " said [Thomasin]201-thomasin , " an ' [I]1630-a queer twoad doan't knaw what 's come over '[1630-a queer twoad] e of late days . ' Pears to [me]1630-a queer twoad [you'm]1629-his hidin '[1630-a queer twoad] summat ; an ' if [I]201-thomasin thot that , [I]201-thomasin 'd mighty quick get faither to find out what '[201-thomasin] twas , [I]0-i can tell ' e. " Then [she]1626-you went off , and brought some cold potatoes and dripping , with bread and salt , and a cup of milk . The lesson which [he]1629-his had set for [Joan Tregenza]183-joan 's learning taught [John Barron]176-barron something also . Eight - and - forty hours [he]1629-his stayed in [Newlyn]1-newlyn , and was astounded to find during that period what grip [this girl]4263-this girl had got upon [his]1629-his mind , how [she]4263-this girl had dragged [him]1629-his out of [himself]1629-his . [His]1629-his first thought was to escape all physical excitement and emotion by abandoning [his]1629-his picture almost upon the moment of its completion and abandoning [his]1629-his model too ; but various considerations cried out against such a course . To go was to escape no difficulty , but to fly from the spoils of victory . The fruit only wanted plucking , and , through pleasure , [he]1629-his believed that [he]1629-his would proceed to speedy , easy and triumphant completion of [his]1629-his picture . No lasting compunction colored the tenor of [his]1629-his thoughts . Once , indeed , upon the day when [he]1629-his returned to [Gorse Point]42-gorse point and saw [Joan]183-joan again , some shadow of regret for [her]183-joan swept through [his]1629-his brain ; but that and the issue of it will be detailed in [their]4264-their place . Time went heavily for [him]1629-his away from [Joan]183-joan . [He]1629-his roamed listlessly here and there and watched the weather - glass uneasily ; for this abstention from work was a deliberate challenge to [Providence]285-providence to change sunshine for rain and high temperature for low . Upon the third day therefore [he]1629-his returned at early morning to [his]1629-his picture in [the shed]3720-the shed . The greater part was finished , and [the masses of gorse]4266-the masses of gorse stood out strong , solid and complete with the slender brown figure before [them]4266-the masses of gorse . The face of it was very sweet , but to [Barron]176-barron it seemed as the face of a ghost , with no hot blood in its veins , no live interests in its eyes . " '[1632-he] Tis the countenance of [a nun]1631-a nun , " [he]1632-he said sneeringly to [himself]1632-he . " No fire , no love , no story — a sweet virgin page of life , innocent of history or of interest as a new - blown lily . " The problem was difficult , and [he]1632-he had now quite convinced [himself]1632-he that solution depended on one course alone . " And why not ? " [he]1632-he asked [himself]1632-he . " Why , when pleasures are offered , shall [I]0-i refuse them ? [God]179-god knows [Nature]178-nature is chary enough with [her]178-nature delights . [She]178-nature has sowed death in [me]0-i , here in [my]0-i lungs . [I]0-i shall bleed away [my]0-i life some day or die strangled , unless [I]0-i anticipate the climax and choose another exit . Why not take what [she]178-nature throws to [me]0-i in the meantime ? " [He]1632-he walked down to [the Point]1633-the point , set up [his]1632-he easel and waited , feeling that [Joan]183-joan had certainly made two pilgrimages since [his]1632-he last visit and little doubting that [she]183-joan would come a third time . Presently indeed [she]183-joan did , scarcely daring to raise [her]183-joan eyes , but flushing with great waves of joy when [she]183-joan saw [him]1632-he , and crying " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan ! " in a triumphant ripple of music from a full heart . Then [the artist]3491-the artist rose very boldly and put [his]3491-the artist arms round [her]183-joan and looked into [her]183-joan face , while [she]183-joan nestled close to [him]3491-the artist and shut [her]183-joan eyes with a sigh of sheer content and thankfulness . [She]183-joan had learned [her]183-joan lesson thoroughly enough ; [she]183-joan felt [she]183-joan could not live without [him]3491-the artist now , and when [he]3491-the artist kissed [her]183-joan [she]183-joan did not start from the caress , but opened [her]183-joan eyes and looked into [his]3491-the artist face with great yearning love . " [He]0-i did not answer , and began to paint . [Joan]183-joan 's face was far short of looking its best ; there were dark shadows under [her]183-joan eyes and less color than usual brightened [her]183-joan cheeks . [He]0-i tried to work , but circumstances and [his]0-i own feelings were alike against [him]0-i . [He]0-i was restless and lacked patience , nor could [his]0-i eye see color aright . In half an hour [he]0-i had spoiled not a little of what was already done . Then [he]0-i took a palette - knife , made a clean sweep of much previous labor and began again . But the music of [her]183-joan happy voice was in [his]0-i blood . [The child]758-the child had come out of [the valley of sorrow]1647-the valley of sorrow and [she]183-joan was boisterously happy and [her]183-joan laughter made [him]0-i wild . Mists gathered in [his]0-i eyes and [his]0-i breath caught now and again . Passion fairly gripped [him]0-i by the throat till even the sound of [his]0-i own voice was strange to [him]0-i and [he]0-i felt [his]0-i knees shake . [He]0-i put down [his]0-i brushes , turned from the picture , and went to [the cliff - edge]1600-the cliff - edge , there flinging [himself]0-i down upon the grass . " [I]0-i can not paint to - day , [Joan]183-joan ; [I]0-i 'm too over - joyed at getting [you]183-joan back to [me]0-i . " " [Iss fay]194-iss , but [I]0-i can , [Mister Jan]241-mister jan , if [you]183-joan felt same as what [I]0-i done . '[0-i] Tweer cruel , cruel . " " [I]183-joan expect [Joe]192-joe often thinks about [you]183-joan . " " [I]183-joan dunnaw . '[183-joan] Tis awful wicked , but [Joe]192-joe [he]192-joe gone clean out [my]0-i mind now . [Nature]178-nature has brought [you]183-joan to [me]1649-her , [Joan]183-joan , [[my]1649-her little jewel]4276-my little jewel ; and [she]183-joan has brought [Jan]241-mister jan to [you]183-joan . " " [I]1649-her 'd be well content to belong to '[1649-her] [e]1649-her , [Mister Jan.]196-mister jan. You'm [[my]0-i good fairy]1650-my good fairy , [I]0-i reckon . If [I]0-i could work for ' [e]1649-her allus an '[0-i] see ' [e]1649-her an '[1649-her] ' ear '[1649-her] [e]1649-her every day , [I]0-i shouldn ' want nothin' better'n that . " Then it was that the shade of a compunction and the shadow of a regret touched [John Barron]176-barron ; and it cooled [his]176-barron hot blood for a brief moment , and [he]176-barron swore to [himself]176-barron [he]176-barron would try to paint [her]1649-her again as [she]1649-her was . [He]176-barron would fight [Nature]178-nature for once and try if pure intellect was strong enough to get the face [he]176-barron wanted on to the canvas without the gratification of [his]176-barron flesh and blood . In which determination glimmered something almost approaching to self - sacrifice in [such a man]4280-such a man . [He]176-barron did not answer [Joan]183-joan 's last remark , but rose and went to [his]176-barron picture , and [she]1649-her , thinking [herself]1649-her snubbed by [his]176-barron silence after [her]1649-her avowal , grew hot and uncomfortable . " The weather is going to change , [sweetheart]4281-sweetheart , " [he]176-barron said , allowing [himself]176-barron the luxury of affectionate words in the moment of [his]176-barron half - hearted struggle ; " the weather - glass creeps back slowly . [We]4282-we must not waste time . Come , [Joan]183-joan ; [we]4282-we are [the children of Nature]4283-the children of nature , but [the slaves of Art]4284-the slaves of art . Let [me]196-mister jan. try again . " But [she]1649-her , who had spoken in all innocence and with [a child]4285-a child 's love , was pained that [he]176-barron should have taken no note of [her]1649-her speech . [She]1649-her was almost angry that [he]176-barron had power to conjure such words to [her]1649-her lips ; and yet the anger vanished from [her]1649-her mind quickly enough and [her]1649-her thoughts were all happy as [she]1649-her resumed [her]1649-her pose for [him]176-barron . The past few days had vastly deepened and widened [her]1649-her mental horizon ; and now [Barron]176-barron for the first time saw something of what [he]176-barron wanted in [her]1649-her eyes as [she]1649-her gazed away over [the sea]463-the sea and did not look at [him]176-barron as usual . There , sure enough , was the soul that [he]176-barron knew slept somewhere , but had never seen until then . And the sight of it came as a shock and swept away [his]176-barron sophistries and ugly - woven ideas . [Inclination]286-inclination had told [him]176-barron that Nature , through one channel only , would bring the mystery of hidden thought to [Joan]183-joan 's blue eyes , and [he]176-barron had felt well satisfied to believe it was so ; but now even the plea of Art could not excuse the thing which had grown within [him]176-barron of late , for experiences other than those [he]176-barron dreamed of had glorified the frank blue eyes and brought mind into them . Now it only remained for [him]176-barron to paint them if [he]176-barron could . Not wholly untroubled , but never much more beautiful than that morning , [Joan]183-joan gazed out upon [the remote sea]4287-the remote sea . Then the thoughtful mood passed , and [she]183-joan laughed and babbled again , and [the new - born beauty]4288-the new - born beauty departed from [her]183-joan eyes for a season , and the warm blood raced through [her]183-joan veins , and [she]183-joan was all happiness . Meanwhile nothing came of [his]176-barron painting and [he]176-barron was not sorry when [she]183-joan ended the ordeal . " [The bwoats]4289-the bwoats be comin '[196-mister jan.] back [home]453-home along , [Mister Jan.]196-mister jan. [I]0-i doan't [mark faither]287-mark faither 's yet , but when ' tis wance in sight [he]176-barron 'll be to [Newlyn]1-newlyn sooner'n [me]0-i . So [I]0-i 'd best be gwaine , though it edn '[0-i] more than noon , [I]0-i s'pose . An ' [my]0-i heart 's a tidy sight lighter now than '[0-i] tweer issterday indeed . " " [I]0-i 'm almost afraid to let [you]0-i go , [Joan]183-joan . " [She]183-joan looked at [him]0-i curiously , waiting for [his]0-i bidding , but [he]0-i seemed moody , and said no more . " When be [you]0-i comin '[0-i] next ? " " To - morrow and to - morrow and to - morrow , [my]0-i pearl above price . It is so hard , so very hard , " [he]0-i answered . " Fine or wet [I]0-i shall be here to - morrow , for [I]0-i am not going back to [Newlyn]1-newlyn again till [my]0-i work is done . Three more sittings , [Joan]183-joan , if [you]0-i have enough patience — " " In coorse , [Mister Jan.]196-mister jan. " [She]183-joan did not explain to [him]0-i what difficulties daily grew in the way of [her]183-joan coming , how rumor was alive , and how [[her]183-joan stepmother]760-her stepmother had threatened more than once to tell [Gray Michael]204-gray michael that [[his]204-gray michael wayward daughter]1653-his wayward daughter was growing a gadabout . [Joan]183-joan had explained away [her]183-joan roaming with a variety of more or less ingenious lies , and [she]183-joan always found [her]183-joan brain startlingly fertile where [the artist]3491-the artist and [his]3491-the artist picture were concerned . [She]183-joan felt little doubt that three more visits to [Gorse Point]42-gorse point might be achieved — ay , and thirty more if necessary . But afterward ? What would follow the painting of the picture ? [She]183-joan asked [herself]183-joan the question as [he]0-i kissed [her]183-joan , with a kiss that was almost rough , while [he]0-i bid [her]183-joan go quickly ; and the former reply to every doubt made answer . [Her]183-joan fears fled as usual before the invigorating spectacle of [this sterling , truth - loving man]1655-this sterling , truth - loving man . With [him]0-i all the future remained and with [him]0-i only . [Hers]1656-hers was the pleasant , passive task of obedience to [one utterly trusted and passionately loved]1657-one utterly trusted and passionately loved . [Her]183-joan fate lay hidden in [his]0-i heart , as the fate of the clay lies hid in the brain of [the potter]1658-the potter . And so [home]453-home [she]183-joan went , walking in a sunshine of [her]183-joan own thoughts . The clouds were gone ; they massed gloomily on the horizon of the past ; but looking forward , [she]183-joan saw no more of [them]1660-them . All time to come was at the disposition of [the wisest man [she]183-joan had ever met]1661-the wisest man she had ever met . [She]183-joan did not know or guess at the battle which [this same wise man]1662-this same wise man had fought and lost under [her]183-joan eyes ; [she]183-joan gathered nothing of the truth from [his]1662-this same wise man gloom , [his]1662-this same wise man silence , [his]1662-this same wise man changed voice , [his]1662-this same wise man sudden farewell . [She]183-joan did not know passion when [she]183-joan saw it ; and the ugly visible signs thereof told no tale to [her]183-joan . That night the change came and the wind veered first to the south , then to the southwest . By morning , gray clouds hid the sky and hourly grew darker and lower . As yet no rain fell , but [the world]3624-the world had altered , and every light - value , from [an artist]3634-an artist 's standpoint , was modified . [John Barren]177-barren sat by [his]177-barren stove in [the byre]3755-the byre , made [himself]177-barren a cup of black coffee , and presently , wrapped in a big mackintosh , walked out to [Gorse Point]42-gorse point . [His]177-barren picture [he]177-barren left , of course , at [the shed]3720-the shed , for painting was out of the question . [Nature]178-nature , who had been smiling so pleasantly in sunshine these many days , now awoke in a grim gray mood . [The sea]463-the sea ran high , its white foam - caps and ridges fretting the rolling volume of it ; [the luggers]890-the luggers fought [their]890-the luggers way out with buried noses and laboring hulls ; rain still held off , but it was coming quickly , and the furze and the young grasses panted for it on [Gorse Point]42-gorse point . Below the cliffs a wild spirit inhabited [the sea]463-the sea fowl , and [they]1670-their screamed and wheeled in many an aerial circle , now sliding with motionless outstretched wing upon the gathering gale , now beating back against it , now dancing in a fleet and making music far away in the foam . Upon [the beach]1496-the beach the dry sand whipped round in little whirls and eddies where wind - gusts caught it ; the naked rocks poked shining weed - covered heads out of a low tide , and the wet white light of them glimmered raw through the gray tones of the atmosphere . Now and then a little cloud of dust would puff out from the cliff - face where the wind dislodged a dry particle of stone or mould ; elsewhere [Barren]177-barren saw the sure - rooted samphire and tufts of sea - pink , innocent of flowers as yet ; and sometimes little squeaking dabs of down might also be observed below where infant gulls huddled together in the ledges outside [their]1670-their nests and gazed upon a condition of things as yet beyond [their]1670-their experience . [Joan]183-joan came presently to find [the artist]3491-the artist looking out at [the sea]463-the sea . " [You]3491-the artist ban't gwaine to paint , [I]0-i s'pose , 'cause o '[183-joan] this ugly fashion weather ? " [she]183-joan said . " No , [sweetheart]4281-sweetheart ! All the gold has gone out of [the world]3624-the world , and there is nothing left but lead and dross . See how sharp the green is under the gray , and note the clearness of the air . Everything is keen and hard upon the eye to - day ; the sky is full of rain and [the sea]463-the sea is a wild harmony in gray and silver . " " [Iss]194-iss , [the cleeves]1677-the cleeves be callin ' this marnin '[194-iss] . ' Tis a sort o '[194-iss] whisper as comes to a body 's ear , an ' it means that the high hills knaws the rain is nigh . An '[194-iss] [they]1677-the cleeves tell it wan to t'other , and moans it mournful over [the valleys]1678-the valleys ' pon the wind . '[1677-the cleeves] The storm be comin ' , the storm be comin '[194-iss] , ' [they]1677-the cleeves sez . " [The south and west regions of distance]4290-the south and west regions of distance blackened as [they]1677-the cleeves sat there on [the cliff]4179-the cliff , and upon [the sea]463-the sea separate heavy gusts of wind roughened up the hollows of the waves . Which effect seen from afar flickered weirdly like a sort of submarine lightning shivering white through dark water . Presently a cloud broke , showing a bank of paler gray behind , and misty silver arrows fell in broad bands of light upon [the sea]463-the sea . [They]1677-the cleeves sped round , each upon the last , like the spokes of a gigantic wheel trundling over [the world]3624-the world ; then the clouds huddled together again and the gleam of brightness died . " [You'm]196-mister jan. wisht this marnin '[194-iss] , [Mister Jan.]196-mister jan. [You]196-mister jan. abbun so much as two words for [me]0-i . ' Tis 'cause[196-mister jan.] [you]196-mister jan. caan't paint [your]196-mister jan. picksher , [I]0-i reckon . " [He]0-i sighed and took [her]1679-her hand in [his]0-i . " Do n't think that , [[my]0-i [Joan]183-joan]1680-my joan . Once [I]0-i cared nothing for [you]183-joan , everything for [my]0-i picture ; now [I]0-i care nothing for [my]0-i picture , everything for [you]183-joan . And the better [I]0-i love [you]183-joan , the worse [I]0-i paint [you]183-joan . That 's funny , is n't it ? " " [Iss]1681-iss , ' tis coorious . But [I]1681-iss 'm[1681-iss] sure [you]0-i do draw [me]0-i a mighty sight finer than [I]0-i be . ' [Tis]4295-tis wonnerful clever , an '[0-i] [theer]1682-theer edn ' no call to be sad , for [no man else]4296-no man else could a done better , [I]0-i lay . " [He]0-i did not answer , and still held [her]183-joan hand . Then there came a harder breath of wind with a sob of sound in it , while already over [the distant sea]4297-the distant sea swept separate gray curtains of rain . " It 's coming , [Joan]183-joan ; the storm . It 's everywhere , in earth and air and water ; and in [my]0-i blood . [I]0-i am savage to - day , [Joan]183-joan , savage and thirsty . What will be the end of it ? " [He]0-i spoke wildly , like the weather . [She]183-joan did not understand , but [she]183-joan felt [his]0-i hand clinch tightly over [hers]183-joan , and , looking at the white thin fingers crooked round [her]183-joan wrist , they brought to [her]183-joan mind the twisted claws of a dead sea - gull [she]183-joan remembered to have found upon [the beach]1496-the beach . " What will be the end of it , [Joan]183-joan ? Ca n't [you]0-i answer [me]0-i ? " " Doan't '[0-i] [e]1683-e , [Mister Jan]241-mister jan ; [you'm]241-mister jan hurtin ' [my]241-mister jan hand . [I]241-mister jan s'pose as a sou'westerly gale be comin '[241-mister jan] . [Us]1684-i knaws 'em well enough in [these paarts]517-these paarts . [Faither]196-mister jan. reckoned [theer]196-mister jan. was dirty weather blawin '[1685-you] up ' fore [he]196-mister jan. sailed . [He]196-mister jan. was away by daylight . The gales do bring trouble to [somebody]4300-somebody most times . " " What will be the end of [us]1684-i , [I]1684-i mean , not of the weather ? The rain will come and the clouds will melt , and [we]1684-i know , as sure as [God]179-god 's in [heaven]637-heaven , that [we]1684-i shall see sunshine and blue sky again . But what about [our]1684-i storm , [Joan]183-joan ; the storm of love that 's burst in [my]1684-i heart for [you]183-joan — what follows that ? " [His]1684-i question frightened [her]183-joan . [She]183-joan had asked [herself]183-joan the same and been well content to leave an answer to [him]1684-i . Here [he]1684-i was faced with a like problem and now invited [her]183-joan to solve it . " [I]1684-i dunnaw . [I]1684-i thot such love never comed to no end , [Mister Jan.]196-mister jan. [I]1684-i thot '[1684-i] tweer good to wear ; but — but how do [I]0-i knaw if [you]1685-you doan't ? " " [You]1685-you trust [me]0-i , [Joan]183-joan ? " " Why , who should [I]0-i trust , if ' tweern't [you]1685-you ? [I]1685-you never knawed [any person else as set such store]4302-any person else as set such store '[1685-you] pon the truth . [I]0-i doan't s'pose [the cherrybims in heaven]1686-the cherrybims in heaven loves it more'n what [you]1685-you do . " " Here 's the rain on the back of the wind , " [he]1685-you said . A few heavy drops fell , cold as ice upon [his]1685-you burning face , and [Joan]183-joan laughed as [she]183-joan held out [her]183-joan hand , on which a great splash as big as a shilling had spread . " That be wan of [Tregagle]288-tregagle 's tears , " [she]183-joan said , " an ' '[183-joan] tis the voice of en as [you]1685-you can hear howlin ' in the wind . [He]288-tregagle 's allus a bawlin '[183-joan] an ' squealin '[183-joan] , [poor sawl]1687-poor sawl , but [you]1685-you can awnly hear en now an ' again '[183-joan] fore a storm when the gale blaws [his]288-tregagle hollerin ' this way . " " Who was [Tregagle]288-tregagle ? " " [He]288-tregagle was [a lawyer man wance]4303-a lawyer man wance , an '[183-joan] killed [a many wives]1688-a many wives , an ' did a many shameful deeds '[183-joan] fore [he]288-tregagle went dead . Then , to [Bodmin Court]74-bodmin court , [theer]1689-theer comes a law case , an ' [they]4304-they wanted [Tregagle]288-tregagle , an '[467-a man] [a man]467-a man said [Tregagle]288-tregagle was [the awnly witness]1691-the awnly witness , and another said [he]288-tregagle wadden . [The second man]1692-the second man up an ' swore '[1692-the second man] If [Tregagle]288-tregagle saw it done , then [I]0-i wish to [God]179-god [he]288-tregagle may rise from 's graave and come this minute . ' Then , sure enough , the ghost of [Tregagle]288-tregagle '[1692-the second man] peared in [the court - house]1693-the court - house an ' shawed [the man]3494-the man was [a liar]4306-a liar . But [they]4307-they couldn '[1692-the second man] lay the ghost no more arter ; an ' it was a devil - ghost , which is the worstest kind ; an '[1692-the second man] it stuck close to [thicky lyin ' man]4308-thicky lyin ' man an '[1692-the second man] wouldn ' leave en nohow . But at last [a white witch]4309-a white witch bound the spirit an '[1692-the second man] condemned [it]1694-it to empty out [Dosmery Pool]75-dosmery pool wi ' [a crogan]4310-a crogan wi '[1692-the second man] a hole in it . [A crogan]4310-a crogan 's a limpet shell , which [you]1696-you might n't knaw , [Mister Jan. Tregagle]288-tregagle , [he]288-tregagle done that party quick , an ' then [he]288-tregagle was at [the man]3494-the man again ; but [a passon]4312-a passon got the bettermost of en an '[288-tregagle] tamed en wi ' [Scripture]289-scripture till [Tregagle]288-tregagle was as gentle as a cheel . Then [they]4307-they set en to work agin an '[288-tregagle] bid [en]1697-en make a truss o ' sand down in [Gwenvor Cove]76-gwenvor cove , an '[288-tregagle] carry it ' pon [his]288-tregagle shoulder up to [Carn Olva]77-carn olva . [Tregagle]288-tregagle weer a braave time doin' that , [I]288-tregagle can '[288-tregagle] sure ' [e]1697-en , but [theer]1697-en comed a gert frost wan winter , an '[288-tregagle] [he]288-tregagle got water from [the brook]1099-the brook an ' poured it '[288-tregagle] pon the truss o ' sand , so it froze hard . Then [he]288-tregagle carried it up [Carn Olva]77-carn olva ; an '[288-tregagle] then , bein ' [a free spirit agin]4313-a free spirit agin , [he]288-tregagle flew off quicker'n lightning to [that lyin '[288-tregagle] man]4314-that lyin ' man to tear en to pieces this time . But by good chance , when [Tregagle]288-tregagle comed to en , [the man]3494-the man weer carryin ' a lil baaby in 's arms — a lil cheel as had never done a single wicked act , bein '[288-tregagle] tu young ; so [Tregagle]288-tregagle couldn ' do no hurt . An '[1700-they] [they]1700-they caught [en]1697-en again , an ' passon set en '[1700-they] pon another job : to make a truss o ' sand in [Whitsand Bay]79-whitsand bay wi'out usin '[1700-they] any fresh water . But [Tregagle]288-tregagle caan't never do that ; so [he]288-tregagle cries bitter sometimes , an ' howls ; an '[288-tregagle] when ' [e]1697-en howls [you]1697-en knaw the storm 's a comin '[288-tregagle] to scatter the truss o ' sand [he]288-tregagle 's builded up . " [Barron]176-barron followed the legend with interest . [Tregagle]288-tregagle and [[his]288-tregagle victim]4315-his victim and the charm of [the pure child that saved one from the other]4316-the pure child that saved one from the other filled [his]176-barron thought and the event to which Fate was now relentlessly dragging [him]176-barron . [He]176-barron argued with [himself]176-barron a little ; then the rain came down and the wind leaped like a lion over [the edge of [the land]3578-the land]4317-the edge of the land , and [the man]3494-the man 's blood boiled as [he]176-barron breathed ocean air . " [Us'll]4320-us'll be wetted proper . [I]288-tregagle 'll run for it , [Mister Jan]241-mister jan , an '[288-tregagle] [you]1701-you 'd best to go up - long to [[your]1701-you lil lew house]1702-your lil lew house . Wet 's bad for ' [e]1701-you , [I]0-i reckon . " " No , " [he]176-barron said , " [I]0-i ca n't let [you]1701-you go , [Joan]183-joan . Look over there . Another flood is going to burst , [I]0-i think . Follow [me]0-i quickly , quickly . " The rain came slanting over the gorse in earnest , but [Joan]183-joan hesitated and hung back . Louder than the wind , louder than the cry of the birds , than the howling of [Tregagle]288-tregagle , than the calling of [the cleeves]1677-the cleeves , spoke something . And it said " Turn , on the wing of the storm ; fly before it , alone . Let [this man]3526-this man walk in the teeth of the gale if [he]3526-this man will ; but [you]1701-you , [Joan Tregenza]183-joan , follow the wind and set [your]1701-you face to the east , where the sole brightness now left in the sky is shining . " Sheets of gray swept over [them]4323-them ; [the world]3624-the world was wet in an instant ; a little mist of water splashed up two inches high off the ground ; the gorse tossed and swayed its tough arms ; [the sea]463-the sea and the struggling craft upon [it]4326-it vanished like a dream ; from the heart of the storm cried gulls , [themselves]4327-themselves invisible . " Come , [Joan]183-joan , [we]4323-them shall be drowned . " [He]0-i had wrapped [her]183-joan in a part of the mackintosh , and laughed as [he]0-i fastened [them]4323-them both into it and hugged [her]183-joan close to [himself]0-i . But [she]183-joan broke away , greatly fearing , yet knowing not what [she]183-joan feared . " [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i 'd best run down fast . Indeed an '[0-i] [I]0-i want to go . " " Go ? Where ? Where should [you]0-i go ? Come to [me]0-i , [Joan]183-joan ; [you]183-joan shall ; [you]183-joan must . [We]1703-we two , [sweetheart]4281-sweetheart — [we]1703-we two against the rain and the wind and [the world]3624-the world . Come ! It will kill [me]0-i to stand here , and [you]183-joan do n't want that . " " But — " " Come , [I]0-i say . Quicker and quicker ! [We]1703-we two — only [we]1703-we two . Do n't make [me]0-i command [you]183-joan , [my]0-i priceless treasure of a [Joan]183-joan . Come with [me]0-i . [You]183-joan are [mine]0-i now and always . Quicker and quicker , [I]0-i say . God ! what rain ! " Still [she]183-joan hesitated and [he]0-i grew angry . " This is folly , madness . Where is [your]183-joan trust and belief ? [You]183-joan do n't trust , nor love , nor — " " Doan't ' [e]4328-e say that ! Never say that ! It edn '[1706-you'm] true . [You'm]1706-you'm all to [me]0-i , an ' [you]1706-you'm knaws it right well , an '[1706-you'm] [I]0-i 'll gaw to [the world]3624-the world 's end with ' [e]4328-e , [I]1706-you'm will — ay , an '[1706-you'm] trust ' [e]4328-e wi '[0-i] [my]0-i life ! " [He]0-i moved away and [she]183-joan followed , hastening as [he]0-i hastened . Unutterable desolation marked [the spot]3752-the spot . Life had vanished save only where sheep clustered under a bank with [their]1709-their tails to the weather , and long - legged lambs blinked [their]1709-their yellow eyes and bleated as [the couple]1710-the couple passed . Despite [their]1710-the couple haste [the man]3494-the man and [the girl]521-the girl were very wet before reaching the shelter of [the byre]3755-the byre . Rain - water dribbled off [his]0-i cap on to [his]0-i hot face and [his]0-i feet were soaking . [Joan]183-joan was breathless with haste ; [her]183-joan draggled skirts clung to [her]183-joan ; and the struggle against the storm made [her]183-joan giddy . So [they]1710-the couple reached [the place of shelter]1714-the place of shelter ; and the gale burst over [it]1714-the place of shelter with a great , crowning yell of wind and hurtle of rain . Then [John Barren]177-barren opened the byre door and [Joan Tregenza]183-joan passed in before [him]177-barren ; whereupon [he]177-barren followed and shut the door . A loose slate clattered upon the roof , and from inside [the byre]3755-the byre it sounded like a hand tapping high above [the artist]3491-the artist 's bed of brown fern — tapping some message which neither [the man]3494-the man nor [the girl]521-the girl could read — tapping , tapping , tapping tirelessly upon ears wholly deaf to it . For a week the rain came down and it blew hard from the west . Then the weather moderated , and there were intervals of brightness and mild , damp warmth that brought a green veil trembling over [the world]3624-the world like magic . The elms broke into a million buds , the pear trees in sunny corners put forth snowy flowers ; the crimson knobs of the apple - blossom prepared to unfold . In [the market gardens]1720-the market gardens around and about Newlyn the plums were already setting , the wallflowers , which make a carpet of golden - brown beneath the fruit - trees in [many orchards]1721-many orchards , were velvety with bloom ; the raspberry canes , bent hoop - like in long rows , beautifully brightened the dark earth with young green ; and verdure likewise twinkled even to the heart of [the forests]1722-the forests , to the stony nipples of [the moor 's vast , lonely bosom]1723-the moor 's vast , lonely bosom . So spring came , heralded by the thrush ; borne upon the wings of the western wind . And then followed a brief change with more heavy rains and lower temperature . The furzes on [Gorse Point]42-gorse point were a scented glory now — a nimbus of gold for the skull of [the lofty cliff]1724-the lofty cliff . Here [John Barren]177-barren and [Joan Tregenza]183-joan had met but twice since the beginning of the unsettled weather . For [her]183-joan this period was in a measure mysterious and strange . Centuries of experience seemed to separate [her]183-joan from the past , and , looking backward , infinite spaces of time already stretched between what had been and what was . Now overmuch sorrow mingled with [her]183-joan reflections , though a leaven of it ran through all — a sense of loss , of sacrifice , of change , which flits , like the shadow of a summer cloud , even through the soul of [the most deeply loving woman who ever opened [her]183-joan eyes to smile upon the first day - dawn of married life]1725-the most deeply loving woman who ever opened her eyes to smile upon the first day - dawn of married life . But [Joan]183-joan 's sorrow was no greater than that , and little unquiet or uneasiness went with it . [She]183-joan had [his]3494-the man promises ; from [him]3494-the man they could but be absolute ; and not a hundred attested ceremonies had left [her]183-joan heart more at ease . In fact [she]183-joan believed that [John Barren]177-barren was presently going to marry [her]183-joan , and that when [he]177-barren vanished from [Newlyn]1-newlyn , [she]183-joan , as [the better - loved part of [himself]177-barren]1726-the better - loved part of himself , would vanish too . It was the old , stale falsehood which [men]3512-men have told a hundred thousand times ; which [men]3512-men will go on telling and [women]1371-women believing , because it is the only lie which meets all requirements of the case and answers its exact purpose effectively . Age can not wither it , for experience is no part of the armor of [the deceived]1730-the deceived , and Love and Trust have never stopped to think since [the world]3624-the world began . As for [the artist]3491-the artist , each day now saw [him]3491-the artist slipping more deeply , more comfortably back into the convolutions of [his]3491-the artist old impersonal shell . [He]3491-the artist had been dragged out , not unwilling , by a giant passion , and [he]3491-the artist had sacrificed to it , sent [it]1733-it to sleep again , and so returned . [He]3491-the artist felt infinitely kind to [Joan]183-joan . A week after [her]183-joan visit to [the linhay]1734-the linhay [he]3491-the artist , while sitting alone there , had turned [her]183-joan picture about on the easel , withdrawn its face from the wall and studied [his]3491-the artist work . And looking , with restored critical faculty and cold blood , [he]3491-the artist loved the paint for itself and deemed it very good . The storm was over , the transitory lightnings drowned lesser lights no more , and that steady beacon - flame of [his]3491-the artist life , which had been merged , not lost , in the fleeting blaze , now shone out again , steadfast and clear . Such a revulsion of feeling argued well for the completion of [his]3491-the artist picture , ill for the model of it . [They]1735-us sat one day , as the weather grew more settled , beside a granite bowlder , which studded [the short turf at the extremity of [Gorse Point]42-gorse point , where [it]1736-the short turf at the extremity of gorse point , where it jutted above the sea jutted above [the sea]463-the sea]1736-the short turf at the extremity of gorse point , where it jutted above the sea . [Joan]183-joan , with [her]183-joan chin upon [her]183-joan hands , looked out upon [the water]3501-the water ; [Barron]176-barron , lying on a railway - rug , leaned back and smoked [his]176-barron pipe and studied [her]183-joan face with the old , keen , passionless eagerness of [their]1735-us earliest meetings . " When 'll ' [e]1739-e tell [me]1739-e , [Jan]241-mister jan love ? When 'll '[1739-e] [e]1739-e tell [me]0-i what ' [e]1739-e be gwaine to do ? [Us]1735-us be wan now — [you]183-joan an '[1739-e] [me]0-i — but the lines be [all the lovin'est wife]1740-all the lovin'est wife can p'int to in proof [she]183-joan be [a wife]1741-a wife . Could n't [us]1735-us be axed out in [church purty]1742-church purty soon ? " [He]176-barron did not make immediate answer , but only longed for [his]176-barron easel . There , in [her]183-joan face , was the wistful , far - away expression [he]176-barron had sighed for ; a measure of thought had come to the little animal — [her]183-joan brains were awake and [her]183-joan blue eyes had never looked liked this before . [Joan]183-joan asked the question again , and [Barren]177-barren answered . " The same matter was in [my]0-i own mind , [sweetheart]4281-sweetheart . [I]0-i am in a mighty hurry too , believe it . " [He]0-i listened to [her]1755-you delicious voice , and shut out the crude words as much as might be while [he]0-i marked the music . [He]0-i was thinking that if [Joan]183-joan had possessed a reasonable measure of intellect , a foundation for an education , [he]0-i would have been satisfied to keep [her]183-joan about [him]0-i during that probably limited number of years which must span [his]0-i existence . But the gulf between [them]4333-them was too wide ; and , as for the present position , [he]0-i considered that no harm had been done which time would not remedy . [Joan]183-joan was not sufficiently intelligent to suffer long or much . [She]183-joan would forget quickly . [She]183-joan was very young . [[Her]183-joan sailor]4334-her sailor must return before the end of the year . Then [he]0-i began to think of money , and then sneered at [himself]0-i . But , after all , it was natural that [he]0-i should follow step by step upon the beaten track of similar events . " Better not attempt originality , " [he]0-i thought , " for the thing [I]1760-i have done is scarce capable of original treatment . [I]1760-i suppose the curtain always rings down on a check — either taken or spurned . " " So [you]183-joan think [you]183-joan can give [them]4335-them all up for poor [me]1760-i , [Joan]183-joan ? " [Barron]176-barron listened with considerable interest to these remarks . There was passion in [Joan]183-joan 's voice as [she]183-joan concluded , and [her]183-joan emotion presently found relief in tears . [She]183-joan only uttered thoughts long in [her]183-joan mind , without for an instant guessing the grim truth or suspecting what [his]176-barron work was to [the man]3494-the man ; yet , things being as they were , [she]183-joan felt some real passing pain to find [him]176-barron devote so much thought to it . Before the storm [his]176-barron painting had sunk to insignificance , since then it began to grow into a great matter again ; and [Joan]183-joan was honestly jealous of the attention [the artist]3491-the artist bestowed upon [it]1779-it now . If [she]183-joan had dared , [she]183-joan would have asked [him]176-barron to destroy it ; but something told [her]183-joan [he]176-barron would refuse . No fear for the future was mingled with this emotion . Only [his]176-barron mighty interest in the work annoyed [her]183-joan . It was a natural petty jealousy ; and when [John Barron]176-barron laughed at [her]183-joan and kissed [her]183-joan tears away , [she]183-joan laughed too and felt a little ashamed , though none the less glad that [she]183-joan had spoken . But while [he]176-barron flung jests at [her]183-joan anger , [Barron]176-barron felt secretly surprised to note the strides [his]176-barron [Awdrey]293-awdrey 's mind was making . Much worth consideration appeared in [her]183-joan sudden attack upon the picture . [She]183-joan had evidently been really reflecting , with coherence and lucidity . That astonished [him]176-barron . But still [he]176-barron answered with a laugh . " Jealous , [Joan]183-joan ! Will [you]183-joan always amuse [me]0-i , [I]0-i wonder ? [I]0-i hope [you]183-joan will . [Nobody else]4279-nobody else can . If [I]0-i find pleasure in the picture , how much the more must [I]0-i love the soul of it ? [You]183-joan see , [I]0-i 'm ambitious . [You]183-joan are quite the hardest thing [I]183-joan ever found to paint , and so [I]183-joan go on trying and trying . Hard to win and hard to paint , [Joan]183-joan . " To - day , coming fresh to [his]0-i ear after a week 's interval , after several days spent with [cultured friends]1784-cultured friends and acquaintances in [Newlyn]1-newlyn , [Joan]183-joan 's rustic speech grated more painfully than usual . Once [he]0-i had found pleasure in it ; but [he]0-i was not [a Cornishman]1785-a cornishman to love the sound of those venerable words which sprinkled [Joan]183-joan 's utterances and which have long since vanished from all vocabularies save those of [the common people]1786-the common people ; and now [her]183-joan language began to get upon [his]0-i nerves and jar them . [He]0-i was tired of it . Often , while [he]0-i painted , [she]183-joan had prattled and [he]0-i , occupied with [his]0-i work , had heard nothing ; but to - day [he]0-i recognized the debt [he]0-i owed and listened patiently for a considerable time . [Her]183-joan deep expectancy irritated [him]0-i too . [He]0-i had anticipated that , however , and was aware that [her]183-joan trust and confidence in [him]0-i were alike profound . Perhaps a shadow of fear , distrust or uneasiness had pleased [him]0-i better . [He]0-i was snugly back in [his]0-i tub of impersonality from which [he]0-i liked to view [the fools]1787-the fools ' show drift pass . [His]0-i last experiment in the actively objective had ruined [a girl and promised to produce a fine picture]4345-a girl and promised to produce a fine picture . And that was the end of it . And when [the girl]521-the girl left [him]0-i , with a promise to come at all costs upon the next sunny morning , [Barron]176-barron began to think about money again . [He]176-barron found that the larger the imaginary figures , the smaller shadow of discomfort clouded [his]176-barron thoughts . So [he]176-barron decided upon an act of princely generosity , as the result of which resolve peace returned and an unruffled mind . For the musty conventionality of [his]176-barron conclusion , it merely served as a peg upon which to hang thoughts not necessary to set down here . [Joan]183-joan had only told [[her]183-joan lover]1084-her lover a part of what happened in [[her]183-joan home]1297-her home when [Thomasin]201-thomasin broke [her]183-joan suspicions to [Gray Michael]204-gray michael . " '[183-joan] The gad - about is a vain thing and a mighty cause for stumblin ' . " [She]183-joan lied as to particulars . [She]183-joan had no fear of [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father now as [a man]467-a man , but hard words always hurt [her]183-joan , and superstition , though [she]183-joan was fast breaking from many forms of it under [Barron]176-barron 's tuition , still chained [her]183-joan soul in some directions . Did [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father know even a shadow of the truth , some dire and blasting prediction would probably result from it , and though personally [he]3642-her father was little to [her]183-joan now , as [a mouthpiece of supernatural powers]4361-a mouthpiece of supernatural powers [he]3642-her father might bring blighting words upon [her]183-joan ; for [he]3642-her father walked with [God]179-god . But [Michael]204-gray michael 's God was [Joan]183-joan 's no more . [She]183-joan had fled from that awful divinity to [the more beautiful Creator of [John Barron]176-barron]4362-the more beautiful creator of john barron . [He]3642-her father was kind and gentle , and [she]183-joan loved to hear [His]3642-her father voice in the hum of the bees upon the gorse and see [His]3642-her father face everywhere in the fair on - coming of spring . [Nature]178-nature , as [she]183-joan understood it now , chimed with the things [[her]183-joan mother]706-her mother had taught [Joan]183-joan . [She]183-joan found room for all the old , pretty stories in this new creed . [The dear saints]4364-the dear saints fitted in with it , and [their]4364-the dear saints wonders and mysteries , and the comprehensive if vague knowledge that " [God]179-god is Love . " [She]183-joan believed [she]183-joan understood the truth about religion at last ; and [Nature]178-nature smiled very sweetly at [her]183-joan and shared in the delight of the time . So [she]183-joan walked dreaming on toward the invisible door of [[[her]183-joan fool]4365-her fool 's paradise]4366-her fool 's paradise , and never guessed how near it was or what [Nature]178-nature would look like from [the other side]4367-the other side . [She]183-joan still dwelt at [the little home on [the cliff]4179-the cliff]4368-the little home on the cliff , so unreal and shadowy now ; [she]183-joan built [cloud castles]4370-cloud castles ablaze with happiness ; [she]183-joan found falsehood not difficult , for [her]183-joan former absolute truthfulness deadened [[her]183-joan stepmother]760-her stepmother 's suspicion . Certain lies told at [home]453-home enabled [her]183-joan to keep faith with [the artist]3491-the artist ; and the weather also befriending [him]3491-the artist , three more sittings in speedy succession brought [John Barron]176-barron to the end of [his]3491-the artist labors . After [Joan]183-joan 's exhibition of jealousy [he]3491-the artist was careful to say little about [his]3491-the artist work and affect no further interest in it . [He]3491-the artist let [her]183-joan chatter concerning the future , told [her]183-joan of [[his]3491-the artist big house in [London]45-london]4374-his big house in london , and presently took care to drop hints from time to time that [the habitation]4375-the habitation was by no means as yet ready to receive [[his]3491-the artist bride]4376-his bride . [She]183-joan always spoke on the assumption that when the picture was done [he]3491-the artist would leave for [London]45-london and take [her]183-joan with [him]3491-the artist . [She]183-joan already imagined [herself]183-joan creeping off to join [him]3491-the artist at [the station]4377-the station , sitting beside [him]3491-the artist in [the train]4378-the train , and then rolling away , past [Marazion]5-marazion , into [the great unfamiliar world which lay beyond]4379-the great unfamiliar world which lay beyond . And [he]3491-the artist knew that no such thing would happen . [He]3491-the artist intended that [Joan]183-joan should become a pleasant memory , with the veil of distance and time over it to beautify what was already beautiful . [He]3491-the artist wanted to remember the music of [her]183-joan throbbing voice , and forget the words [it]4380-it used to utter . [The living girl]4381-the living girl 's part was played and ended . [Their]4382-their lives had crossed at right angles and would never meet again . " Nature makes a glorious present to [Art]184-art , and [I]1788-i am privileged to execute the deed of gift , " thought [Barron]176-barron ; " that is the position in an epigram . " [He]3491-the artist felt very grateful to [Joan]183-joan . [He]3491-the artist knew [her]183-joan arm must have ached often enough , but whether [her]183-joan heart would presently do so [he]3491-the artist hardly felt qualified to judge . The incidents of that stormy day might have been buried in time ten years , so faint was [his]3491-the artist recollection of them now . [He]3491-the artist remembered the matter with no greater concern than the image of the shivering negresses in [the blue water at [Tobago]11-tobago]4383-the blue water at tobago . And so the picture , called " [[Joe]192-joe 's Ship]3620-joe 's ship , " was finished , and while it fell far short of what [Barron]176-barron had hoped , yet [he]3491-the artist knew [his]3491-the artist work was great and the best thing [he]3491-the artist had done . A packing case for the canvas was already ordered and [he]3491-the artist expected it upon the identical day that saw [his]3491-the artist farewell to [Joan]183-joan . Bit by bit [he]3491-the artist had broken to [her]183-joan that it was not [his]3491-the artist intention to take [her]183-joan with [him]3491-the artist , but that [he]3491-the artist must go to [[his]3491-the artist house]4385-his house alone and order things in readiness . Then [he]3491-the artist would come back and fetch [her]183-joan . And [she]183-joan had accepted the position and felt wondrous sad at the first meeting with [Barren]177-barren after the completion of the picture . It seemed as though a great link was broken between [them]4386-them , and [she]183-joan realized now what folly [her]183-joan dislike of [his]3491-the artist work had been . " [I]1788-i wish [I]1788-i could take [you]183-joan right away with [me]1788-i , [Joan]183-joan , [[my]1788-i little love]4387-my little love ; but [[a bachelor]4388-a bachelor 's house]4389-a bachelor 's house is a comfortless concern from [a woman]3541-a woman 's point of view . [You]183-joan will hear from [me]1788-i in a day or two .
