" " [You]0-i 'll print out what [you]0-i writes big , so 's [I]1788-i doan't [miss nort]4393-miss nort , wo n't '[1788-i] [e]1789-e ? " " [I]0-i 'll make the meaning as clear as possible , [Joan]183-joan . " " ' Tis wisht to think as [theer'll]4394-theer'll be hunderds o '[0-i] miles ' twixt [us]4395-us . [I]0-i doan't know how [I]0-i be gwaine to live the days out . " " Only a fortnight , remember . " " Fourteen whole days an '[0-i] nights . " " Yes , indeed . It seems a terribly long time . [You]183-joan must comfort [me]0-i , [sweetheart]4281-sweetheart , and tell [me]0-i that [they]1791-they will be very quickly done with . " [Joan]183-joan laughed at this turning of the tables . " [I]0-i reckon [a man]467-a man 's allus got a plenty things to make time pass for en . But ' tis different wi '[4107-a gal] [a gal]4107-a gal . " [She]183-joan trusted [him]0-i as [she]183-joan trusted [God]179-god to lift the sun out of [the eastern sea]1794-the eastern sea next morning and swing it in its solemn course over [heaven]637-heaven . And as there was no fear of danger and no shadow of distrust upon [her]183-joan , [Joan]183-joan made a braver parting than [[her]183-joan lover]1084-her lover expected . " [Some men]1797-some men are coming to see [my]0-i picture presently , " [he]0-i said , very gently . " [I]0-i expect [my]0-i sweet [Joan]183-joan would like to be gone before [they]1797-some men arrive . " [She]183-joan took the hint , braced [her]183-joan heart for the ordeal , and rose from where [they]1797-some men had been sitting on [Gorse Point]42-gorse point . [She]183-joan looked dreamily a moment at the furzes and the place whereon [she]183-joan had stood so often , then turned to [the man]3494-the man and came close and held up four little spring lilies which [she]183-joan had brought with [her]183-joan . [Her]183-joan voice grew unsteady , but [she]183-joan mastered it again and smiled at [him]3494-the man . " [I]0-i brot these for ' [e]1799-e , [dear Jan.]4396-dear jan. [Us]4397-us calls 'em[183-joan] butter - an'-eggs , 'cause o '[0-i] the colors , [I]0-i s'pose . They'm awnly four lil flowers . Will ' [e]1799-e keep 'em[183-joan] ? An'—an ' give [me]183-joan summat as [I]183-joan can knaw 's just bin in [your]1799-e hand , will [']1799-e[183-joan] [e]1799-e ? ' Tis fulishness , dear heart , but [I]3494-the man 'm[3494-the man] thinkin ' '[3494-the man] twould make the days a dinky bit shorter . " [He]3494-the man took the gift , thought a moment , and gave [her]183-joan a little silver ring off [his]3494-the man finger . Then [he]3494-the man kissed [her]183-joan , pressed [her]183-joan close to [him]3494-the man and said " good - by , " asking [God]179-god to bless [her]183-joan , and so forth . With but a few tears rebelling against [her]183-joan determination , [Joan]183-joan prayed good upon [his]3494-the man head , repaid the caress , begged [him]3494-the man for [his]3494-the man love to come quickly back again , then tore [herself]183-joan away , turned and hastened off with [her]183-joan head held bravely up . But [the green fields]1800-the green fields swam and [the sea]463-the sea danced for [her]183-joan a moment later . [The world]3624-the world was all splashed and blotched and misty . " [I]0-i 'll be braave like [him]3494-the man , " [she]183-joan thought , smothering the great sobs and rubbing [her]183-joan knuckles into [her]183-joan eyes till [she]183-joan hurt them . But [she]183-joan could not stem the sorrow in a moment , and , climbing through a gap in the hedge , [she]183-joan sat down , where only ewes and [lambs]1803-lambs might see , and cried bitterly a while . And so weeping , a sensation , strange , vague , tremendous , came into [her]183-joan being ; and [she]183-joan knew not what it meant ; but the mystery of it filled [her]183-joan with great awe . " ' Tis [God]179-god , " [she]183-joan said to [herself]183-joan , " '[179-god] tis [God]179-god 's hand upon [me]0-i . [He've]179-god touched [me]0-i , [He've]179-god sealed [me]0-i to dear , dear Jan. ' Tis a feelin '[179-god] to bring happiness along with it , nor sorrer . " [She]183-joan battled with [herself]183-joan to read the wonder aright , and yet at the bottom of [her]183-joan heart was fear . Then physical sensations distracted [her]183-joan ; [she]183-joan found [her]183-joan head was aching and [her]183-joan body feeling sick . Truly [the girl]521-the girl had been through an ordeal that day , and so [she]183-joan explained [her]183-joan discomfort . " [I]0-i be wivvery an ' wisht along o '[183-joan] leavin ' en , " [she]183-joan said ; " oh ! kind , good [God]179-god A'mighty , as hears all , send en back to [me]183-joan , send en back to [me]183-joan very soon , for [I]183-joan caan't live wi'out en no more . " As for [the man]3494-the man , [he]3494-the man sighed when [Joan]183-joan disappeared ; and the expiration of breath was short and sharp as the sound of a key in a lock . [He]3494-the man had in truth turned the key upon a diary to be opened no more ; for the sweetness of the closed chapter was embalmed in memory , blazoned on canvas . Yet there was bitterness , too , of a sort in [his]3494-the man sigh , and the result of this sunken twinge at [his]3494-the man heart appeared when [Brady]180-brady , [Tarrant]182-tarrant and [one or two other artists]4399-one or two other artists presently joined [him]3494-the man . [They]4399-one or two other artists saw [[their]4399-one or two other artists companion]4400-their companion was perturbed , and found [him]3494-the man plunged into a black , cynic fit more deeply than usual . [He]3494-the man spared [no subject]4401-no subject , [no individual]4402-no individual , least of all [himself]3494-the man . [Paul Tarrant]182-tarrant — [a Christian painter , already mentioned]4403-a christian painter , already mentioned — was the first to find fault with [Barron]176-barron 's picture . [The rest]641-the rest had little but praise for it , and [Brady]180-brady , who grew madly enthusiastic , swore that " [Joe]192-joe 's Ship " was the finest bit of work that ever went out of [Cornwall]13-cornwall . But [Tarrant]182-tarrant cherished a private grievance , and , as [his]182-tarrant view of art and ethics made it possible for [him]182-tarrant , from [his]182-tarrant standpoint , to criticise the picture unfavorably in some respects , [he]182-tarrant did so . It happened that [he]182-tarrant had recently finished a curious work for [the Academy]4405-the academy : a painting called " [The Good Shepherd]4406-the good shepherd . " [It]4406-the good shepherd represented [a young laboring man with a face of rare beauty but little power]4407-a young laboring man with a face of rare beauty but little power , plodding homeward under setting sunlight . Upon [his]182-tarrant arm [he]182-tarrant bore a lamb , and behind [his]182-tarrant head the sinking sun made a glorious nimbus . [Barron]176-barron had seen this work , admired some of the painting , but bluntly sneered at the false sentiment and vulgar parade of religious conviction which , as [he]176-barron conceived , animated the whole . And now , [the other man , in whose heart those contemptuous words still rankled]4408-the other man , in whose heart those contemptuous words still rankled , found [his]4408-the other man , in whose heart those contemptuous words still rankled turn had come . [He]182-tarrant had bitterly resented [Barron]176-barron 's sarcastic reference to those holy things which guided [his]182-tarrant life ; there was something of feminine nature in [him]182-tarrant too ; so [he]182-tarrant did not much regret the present opportunity . " And [you]182-tarrant , [Tarrant]182-tarrant ? This gives [you]182-tarrant scant pleasure — eh ? " asked [Barron]176-barron . " It is very wonderful painting , but there 's nothing under the paint that [I]183-joan can see . " " Nothing but the canvas — in so far at least as [the spectator]4409-the spectator is concerned . Every work of art must have a secret history only known to its creator . " " What the divil d'you mean , [Paul]182-tarrant ? " asked [Brady]180-brady . " [You]182-tarrant know what [I]183-joan mean well enough , " answered [the first speaker]3484-the first speaker coldly . " [My]183-joan views are not unfamiliar to any of [you]182-tarrant . Here is a thing without a soul — to [me]183-joan . " " [God]179-god ! [you]182-tarrant say that ! [You]182-tarrant can look at those eyes and say that ? " " [I]183-joan admire the painting , but cui bono ? Who is the better , the wiser ? There is nothing under the paint . " " [You]182-tarrant are [one of those who turn shadows into crosses]4411-one of those who turn shadows into crosses , [clouds into angels]4412-clouds into angels . Is it not so ? " asked [Barron]176-barron smiling ; and the other fired at this allusion to [his]176-barron best known picture . " [I]183-joan am [one of those who know that [Art]184-art is [the handmaid of [God]179-god]4414-the handmaid of god]4413-one of those who know that art is the handmaid of god , " [he]176-barron answered hotly . " [I]183-joan happen to believe in [Jesus Christ]4415-jesus christ , and [I]183-joan conceive that no picture is worthy to be called great or worthy of [any Christian]4416-any christian 's painting unless it possess some qualities calculated to ennoble the mind of [those who see]4417-those who see . [Art]184-art is the noblest labor [man]3551-man can employ time upon . The thing comes from [God]179-god ; it is a talent only to be employed in the highest sense when devoted to [His]179-god glory . " " Then what of heathen art ? [You]182-tarrant let [your]182-tarrant religion distort [your]182-tarrant view of Nature . [You]182-tarrant sacrifice truth to a dogma . Nature has no ethics . [You]182-tarrant profess to paint facts and paint them wrong . [You]182-tarrant are not [a mystic]4419-a mystic ; that [we]4420-we could understand and criticise accordingly . [You]182-tarrant try to run with the hare and hunt with the hounds . [You]182-tarrant talk about truth and paint things not true . " " From [your]182-tarrant standpoint possibly . [Yours]182-tarrant is the truth of naturalism ; mine is the truth of Faith . " " If [you]182-tarrant are going to entrench [yourself]182-tarrant behind Faith , [I]183-joan have done , of course . Only , do n't go about saying , as [you]182-tarrant did just now , that [Art]184-art is [the noblest labor man]4421-the noblest labor man can employ time upon . That 's bosh , pure and simple . There are some occupations not so noble , that is all . [Art]184-art is [a heathen and always will be]4422-a heathen and always will be , and [[you]182-tarrant missionary - men]4423-you missionary - men , with a paint - brush in one hand and a Bible in the other , are even worse than [certain objectionable literary celebrities , whose novels reek of the '[183-joan] new journalism ' and the Sermon on the Mount — the ridiculous and sublime in tasteless combination]4424-certain objectionable literary celebrities , whose novels reek of the ' new journalism ' and the sermon on the mount — the ridiculous and sublime in tasteless combination . [[You]182-tarrant missionaries]4425-you missionaries , [I]182-tarrant say , sap the primitive strength of [Art]184-art ; [you]182-tarrant demoralize [her]4426-her . To dare to make [Art]184-art pander to a passing creed is vile — worse than the spectacle of [the Salvation Army]80-the salvation army trying to convert [Buddhists]294-buddhists . That [I]182-tarrant saw in [India]81-india , and laughed . But [we]4427-we wo n't quarrel . [You]182-tarrant paint Faith 's jewelry ; [I]182-tarrant 'll amuse [myself]182-tarrant with Truth 's drabs and duns . The point of view is all . [I]182-tarrant depict pretty [Joan Tregenza]183-joan looking over [the sea]463-the sea to catch a glimpse of [[her]183-joan sweetheart]3626-her sweetheart 's outward - bound ship . [I]182-tarrant paint [her]183-joan just as [I]182-tarrant saw [her]183-joan . There was no occasion to leave out or put in . [I]182-tarrant reveled in a mere brutal transcript of Nature . [You]182-tarrant would have set [her]183-joan down by one of the old Cornish crosses praying to [Christ]4430-christ to guard [[her]183-joan man]4431-her man . " [You]1806-you build on the foundations of Art a series of temples to [your]1806-you religious convictions . [You]1806-you blaze Christianity on every canvas . [They]1811-they did once , but [the world]3624-the world has passed beyond that point . " " Never , " answered [Tarrant]182-tarrant . " [We]1813-we have proof of it . [Souls]295-souls have been saved by pictures . That is as certain as that [God]179-god made [the earth]3591-the earth and everything on it . " " There again ! Every word [you]1806-you speak only shows how difficult it is for [us]1813-we to exchange ideas . Why is it so positively certain that [God]179-god made [the earth]3591-the earth and everything on it ? To attribute [man]3551-man 's origin direct to [God]179-god is always , in [my]0-i mind , the supreme proposition of [human conceit]1817-human conceit . Then [you]0-i enjoy the spectacle of that seraph about as busy over [this notable world]4444-this notable world as [a child]4285-a child with a mud pie . [The winged one]4446-the winged one sets to work with a will . Picture [that well - meaning but muddle - headed archangel]4447-that well - meaning but muddle - headed archangel 's dismay at such a conclusion ! All [his]179-god theories and conceits — [his]179-god splendid scheme of evolution and the rest — end in [a mean but obstinate creature with conscious intelligence and an absolute contempt and disregard for Nature]4448-a mean but obstinate creature with conscious intelligence and an absolute contempt and disregard for nature . [This poor Frankenstein of a cherub watches the worm [he]179-god has produced]4449-this poor frankenstein of a cherub watches the worm he has produced defy [him]179-god and refuse absolutely to obey [his]179-god most fundamental postulates or accept [his]179-god axioms . [The fittest]4450-the fittest survive no more ; these gregarious , new - born things presently form [themselves]4450-the fittest into [a pestilential society]4451-a pestilential society , [they]4450-the fittest breed rubbish , [they]4450-the fittest — " " By [God]179-god ! stop it , [John]176-barron , " said [Murdoch]175-murdoch . " Now [you]1824-you 're[180-brady] going too far . Look at [Tarrant]182-tarrant . [He]182-tarrant 'd burn [you]1824-you over a slow fire for this if [he]182-tarrant could . [I]0-i know what [a poor , rotten cur]1827-a poor , rotten cur [I]0-i am physically and mentally — not worth the bread [I]0-i eat to keep [me]0-i alive . And shall [I]0-i dare say that [God]179-god made [me]0-i ? " " But what 's the end of this philosophy of despair , [old chap]1828-old chap ? " asked [Brady]180-brady ; " what becomes of [[your]1828-old chap worst of [all possible planets]1830-all possible planets]1829-your worst of all possible planets ? " " The end ? Dust and ashes . [[My]0-i unfortunate workman]1831-my unfortunate workman , having blundered on for certain millions of years tinkering and patching and improving [[his]1831-my unfortunate workman dismal colony]1832-his dismal colony , will give the thing up ; and [God]179-god will laugh and show [him]1831-my unfortunate workman the mistakes and then blot the essay out , as [a master]1833-a master runs [his]1833-a master pen through the errors in [a pupil]1834-a pupil 's exercise . [The earth]3591-the earth grows cold at last , and the herds of [humanity]1836-humanity die , and the countless ages of agony and misery are over . Yes , the poor vermin perish to the last one ; then [[their]1837-their black tomb]1838-their black tomb goes whirling on until it shall be allowed to meet another like itself , when a new sun shines in heaven and space is the richer by one more star . " " May [God]179-god forgive [you]1828-old chap for [your]1828-old chap profanity , [John Barren]177-barren , " said [Tarrant]182-tarrant . " That [He]179-god places in [your]1828-old chap hand such power and suffers [your]1828-old chap brain to breed the devil 's dung that fills it , is to [me]0-i a mystery . May [you]1828-old chap live to learn [your]1828-old chap errors and regret them . " [He]179-god turned away and [two men]482-two men followed [him]179-god . Conversation among [those who remained]1840-those who remained reverted to the picture ; and presently [all]1841-all were gone , excepting only [Barren]177-barren , who had to wait and see [his]177-barren work packed . [Remorse]297-remorse will take strange shapes . [His]179-god bitter tirade against [his]179-god environment and [himself]179-god was the direct result of [this man]3526-this man 's recent experiences . [He]179-god knew [himself]179-god for [a mean knave]1843-a mean knave in [his]179-god dealings with [an innocent girl]1844-an innocent girl and the thought turned the aspect of all things into gall . Solitude brought back a measure of peace . The picture was packed and started to [[Penzance]7-penzance railway - station]1845-penzance railway - station , while [Barron]176-barron 's tools also went , by [pony - cart]1846-pony - cart , back to [[his]179-god rooms in [Newlyn]1-newlyn]1847-his rooms in newlyn . [He]179-god was to leave upon the following morning with [Murdoch]175-murdoch and [others who were taking [their]1848-others who were taking their work to the exhibitions work to [the Exhibitions]1849-the exhibitions]1848-others who were taking their work to the exhibitions . Now [he]179-god looked round [the cow - byre]1280-the cow - byre before locking it for the last time and returning the key to [[Farmer Ford]233-farmer ford 's boy]1851-farmer ford 's boy , who waited outside to receive it . " The chapter is ended , " [he]179-god said to [himself]179-god . " The chapter which contains the best thing that ever [I]0-i did , and , [I]0-i suppose , the worst , as morals have it . Yet Art happily rises above those misty abstractions which [we]1852-we call right and wrong . [She]1853-she resembles Nature [herself]1853-she there . [Both]3485-both demand [their]3485-both sacrifices . ' The white martyrdom of self - denial , the red martyrdom of blood — each is a thousand times recorded in the history of painting and will be a thousand times again . " So [John Barren]177-barren set forth , well content to believe that [he]177-barren would never again visit [Cornwall]13-cornwall , and [Joan]183-joan called at [the Penzance post - office]4452-the penzance post - office on the morning which followed [his]177-barren departure . [Her]183-joan geographical knowledge was scanty . [Truro]69-truro and [Plymouth]82-plymouth , in [her]183-joan belief , lay somewhere upon the edge of [the world]3624-the world ; and [she]183-joan scarcely imagined that [London]45-london could be much more remote . But no letter awaited [her]183-joan , and life grew to be terribly empty . For a week [she]183-joan struggled with [herself]183-joan to keep from [the post - office]4454-the post - office , and then , nothing doubting that [her]183-joan patience would now be well rewarded , [Joan]183-joan marched off with confidence for the treasure . But only a greater disappointment than the last resulted ; and [she]183-joan went [home]453-home very sorrowful , building up explanations of the silence , finding excuses for " [Mister Jan.]288-tregagle " The prefix to [his]288-tregagle name , which had dropped during [their]4456-their latter intimacy , returned to [her]183-joan mind now [the man]3494-the man was gone : as " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " it was that [she]183-joan thought about [him]288-tregagle and prayed for [him]288-tregagle . The days passed quickly , and when a fortnight stood between [herself]183-joan and the last glimpse of [[her]183-joan lover]1084-her lover , [Joan]183-joan began to grow very anxious . [She]183-joan wept through long nights now , and [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father , finding [the girl]521-the girl changed , guessed [she]183-joan had a secret and told [[his]3642-her father wife]843-his wife to find it out . But it was some time before [Thomasin]201-thomasin made any discovery , for [Joan]183-joan lied stoutly by day and prayed to [God]179-god to pardon by night . [She]183-joan strove hard to follow the teaching of [the artist]3491-the artist , to find joy in flowers and leaves , in the spring music of birds , in the color of [the sea]463-the sea . But now [she]183-joan dimly guessed that it was love of [him]288-tregagle which went so far to make all things beautiful , that it was the magic and wisdom of [his]288-tregagle words which had gilded [the world]3624-the world with gold and thrown new light upon the old familiar objects of life . [Nature]178-nature 's organ was dumb now that the hands which played upon it so skillfully had passed far away . But [she]183-joan was loyal to [[her]183-joan teacher]4465-her teacher ; [she]183-joan remembered many things which [he]4465-her teacher had said and tried hard to feel as [he]4465-her teacher felt , to put [her]183-joan hand in beautiful [Mother Nature]178-nature 's and walk with [her]178-nature and be at peace . [Mister Jan]241-mister jan would soon return ; the fortnight was already past ; each day as [she]183-joan rose [she]183-joan felt [he]241-mister jan might come to claim [her]183-joan before the evening . And , meanwhile , other concerns occupied [her]183-joan thoughts . The voice which spoke to [her]183-joan after [she]183-joan bid [John Barren]177-barren " good - by , " had since then similarly sounded on the ear of [her]183-joan heart . Alike at high noon and in the silence of the night watches it addressed [her]183-joan ; and the mystery of it , taken with [her]183-joan other sorrows , began to affect [her]183-joan physically . For the first time in [her]183-joan life [the girl]521-the girl felt ill in body . [Her]183-joan appetite failed , dawn found [her]183-joan sick and weary ; [her]183-joan glass told [her]183-joan of [a white , unhappy face , of eyes that were lighted from within and shone with strange thoughts]4467-a white , unhappy face , of eyes that were lighted from within and shone with strange thoughts . [She]183-joan was always listening now — listening for the new voice , that [she]183-joan might hear the word it uttered . [Her]183-joan physical illness [she]183-joan hid with some cunning and put a bright face upon life as far as [she]183-joan could do so before those of [[her]183-joan home]1297-her home ; but the task grew daily more difficult . Then , with a period of greatly increased discomfort , [Joan]183-joan grew alarmed and turned to [the kind God of " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan]4469-the kind god of " mister jan , " and made great , tearful praying for a return of strength . [Her]183-joan petition was apparently granted , for [the girl]521-the girl enjoyed some improvement of health and spirit . Whereupon [she]183-joan became fired with a notable thought , and determined to seek [[her]183-joan patron saint]4471-her patron saint where still [she]183-joan suspected [his]4471-her patron saint power held sway : at the little brook which tinkles along beside [the ruins of [St. Madron]249-st. madron 's chapel]4472-the ruins of st. madron 's chapel in [a fair coomb below [the Cornish moorlands]4474-the cornish moorlands]4473-a fair coomb below the cornish moorlands . The precious water , as [Joan]183-joan remembered , had brought strength and health to [her]183-joan when [a baby]4231-a baby ; and now [the girl]521-the girl longed to try its virtues again , and a great conviction grew upon [her]521-the girl that [the ancient saint]4477-the ancient saint never forgot [his]4477-the ancient saint own little ones . Opportunity presently offered , and through the first misty gray of a morning in early April , [she]183-joan set out upon [her]183-joan long tramp from [Newlyn]1-newlyn through [Madron]249-st. madron to [the ruined baptistery]4478-the ruined baptistery . [St. Madron]249-st. madron , or [Padern]298-padern , lived in the sixth century , somewhat earlier than [Augustine]299-augustine . [A Breton]300-a breton by birth , [he]249-st. madron labored chiefly in [Wales]85-wales , established [a monastery on Brito - Celtic lines in [Cardiganshire]86-cardiganshire]4479-a monastery on brito - celtic lines in cardiganshire , and became [[its]4479-a monastery on brito - celtic lines in cardiganshire bishop]4480-its bishop when a see was established in [that district]4481-that district . [He]249-st. madron traveled far , visited [Mount 's Bay]6-mount 's bay and established [the church of [Madron]249-st. madron , still sacred to [his]249-st. madron name]4482-the church of madron , still sacred to his name , while doubtless [the brook]1099-the brook and [chapel hard by]4484-chapel hard by were associated with [him]249-st. madron from the same period . In [Scawen]301-scawen 's time [folk]4485-folk were wo nt to take [their]4485-folk hurts thither on [Corpus Christi]87-corpus christi evening , drink of the water , deposit an offering , and repose upon [the chapel]1120-the chapel floor till dawn . Then , drinking again , [they]4485-folk departed whole , if faith sufficiently mighty had supported [them]4485-folk . [Norden]302-norden remarks of the water that " [its]1099-the brook fame was great for the supposed vertue of healinge , which [St. Maderne]303-st. maderne had thereunto infused ; and maine votaries made anuale pilgrimages unto it … . " In connection with the custom of immersion here indicated , [we]4487-we find there obtained the equally venerable practice of hanging votive rags upon the thorn bushes round about [the chapel]1120-the chapel . This conceit is ancient as [Japan]88-japan , and one not only in usage to this day among [the Shintoists of [that land]4490-that land]4489-the shintoists of that land , but likewise common throughout [Northern Asia]89-northern asia and , nearer [home]453-home , in [the Orkneys]90-the orkneys , in [Scotland]91-scotland , in [Ireland]92-ireland . Older far than Christianity are these customs ; [the megalithic monuments of [the pagan]4493-the pagan]4492-the megalithic monuments of the pagan witness similar practices in [remote corners of [the earth]3591-the earth]4494-remote corners of the earth ; rag - trees , burdened with the tattered offerings of [the devout]4496-the devout , yet stud [the desert of [Suez]93-suez]4497-the desert of suez , and [those who seek shall surely find some holy well or grave hard at hand in every case]4498-those who seek shall surely find some holy well or grave hard at hand in every case . To mark and examine the junction of these venerable fancies with Christian superstition is no part of [our]4487-we present purpose , but that ideas , pagan in [their]4493-the pagan birth , have lent [themselves]4493-the pagan with sufficient readiness to successive creeds and been knit into the dogmas of each in turn , is certain enough . Thus , through [Cornwall]13-cornwall , the imaginings of [wizard]4499-wizard and [wonder - worker]4500-wonder - worker in hoary time come , centuries later , to be the glory and special power of [a saint]1124-a saint . Such fantastic lore was definitely interdicted in [King Edgar]304-king edgar 's reign , when " stone worshipings , divinations , well worshipings and necromances " were proclaimed things heathen , and unhallowed ; but with the advent of [the Saint - Bishops from [Wales]85-wales]4502-the saint - bishops from wales , from [Ireland]92-ireland , from [Brittany]94-brittany , primitive superstitions were patched upon the new creed , and , to suit private purposes , [the old giants of the Christian faith]4503-the old giants of the christian faith sanctified holy well and holy stone , posing by right divine as sure dispensers of the hidden virtue in [stream and granite]4504-stream and granite . But the roots of these fables burrow back to paganism . [Hundreds of [weakly infants]4506-weakly infants]4505-hundreds of weakly infants were passed through [Mên - an]95-mên - an - tol — the stone with a hole or the " crick - stone"—in the names of [saints]4507-saints ; and [hundreds]4508-hundreds had already been handed through it centuries before under like appeal to [pagan deities]4509-pagan deities . Of [Madron baptistery]4510-madron baptistery , now [a picturesque ruin]4511-a picturesque ruin , it seems clear that until the Reformation regular worship and the service of baptism were therein celebrated . [The place]3488-the place has mercifully escaped all restoration or renovation and stands at this moment open to the sky in the slow hand of Time . [A brook]4513-a brook runs babbling outside , but the holy well or colymbethra is now dry , though [it]3488-the place might easily be filled again . [This interesting portion of [the chapel]1120-the chapel]4514-this interesting portion of the chapel remains intact , and the entrance to [it]1120-the chapel lies upon the level of the floor according to ancient custom , being so ordered that [the adult to undergo baptism]4516-the adult to undergo baptism might step down into the water , and that not without dignity . Hither came [Joan]183-joan . [Her]183-joan patchwork of faith and Nature - worship was a live thing to [her]183-joan now , and [she]183-joan found no difficulty in reconciling the sweet saint - stories heard in childhood from [[her]183-joan dead mother]1231-her dead mother 's lips , with the beautiful and fair exposition of truth which " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " found written large upon [the world]3624-the world by Nature in spring - time . It was half - past four o'clock when [she]183-joan trudged through [Madron]249-st. madron to see [the gray church]4519-the gray church and [the little gray houses]4520-the little gray houses all sleeping under the gray sky . [She]183-joan plodded on up [the hill]533-the hill past [the gaunt workhouse which stands at the top of]4522-the gaunt workhouse which stands at the top of [it]533-the hill ; and what had seemed soft , sweet repose among [the cottage homes]4523-the cottage homes , felt like cold death beneath these ashy walls . To [Joan]183-joan , [the workhouse]4524-the workhouse was a word of shame unutterable . [Those among whom [she]183-joan lived]4525-those among whom she lived would hurl the word against [enemies]4526-enemies as a prophecy of the utmost degradation . [She]183-joan shivered as [she]183-joan passed , and was sad , knowing that a whole world of poverty , failure , sorrow , regret , was hidden away in [that cold , still pile]4527-that cold , still pile . But the hand of sleep lay softly there ; only [a sick soul or two]4528-a sick soul or two stirred , [the paupers]4529-the paupers were the equal of [princes]4530-princes till a hoarse bell brought [them]4529-the paupers back out of blessed unconsciousness . Bars of light streaked the east , and [Joan]183-joan , only stopping at [the hill crest]4531-the hill crest to see dawn open silver eyes on [the sea]463-the sea , hastened inland through [silent , dewy fields]4533-silent , dewy fields . Presently a fence and wall cut civilization from [the wild land of the coomb]4534-the wild land of the coomb , and [the girl]521-the girl proceeded where grass - grown cart - ruts wound among furze and heather and the silver coils of new - born bracken just beginning to peep up above the dead fern of last year . [This hollow]4536-this hollow ran between undulations of fallow and meadow ; no harrow clinked as yet ; only the cows stood here and there above the dry patches on the dewy fields where [their]4529-the paupers bodies had lain in sleep . [She]183-joan saw [their]4529-the paupers soft eyes and smelled the savor of them . Presently the cart - ruts disappeared in fine grass all bediamonded , knobbed with heather , sprouting rusty - red , and sprinkled with tussocks of coarser grass , whereon green blades sprang up above [the dead ones]4537-the dead ones , where [they]4537-the dead ones struggled , matted and bleached and sere . Rabbits flashed here and there , the white under - side of [their]4537-the dead ones little scuts twinkling through the gorse ; and then the birds woke up ; a thrush sang low , sleepy notes from the heart of a whitethorn ; yellowhammers piped [their]4538-their mournful calls from the furze . On [Joan]183-joan 's left hand there now rose a clump of wind - worn beech - trees , their brown spikes breaking to green , even where dead red leaves still clung to the parent branches . Beneath [them]4539-them ran a hedge of earth above [a deep pool]4540-a deep pool or two , very clear and fringed with young rushes , upright and triumphant above [the old dead ones]4541-the old dead ones . Everywhere [Joan]183-joan saw Life trampling and leaping , growing and laughing over the ruins of things that had lived and died . It saddened [her]183-joan a little . Did [Nature]178-nature forget so soon ? Then [she]183-joan told [herself]183-joan that kind [Nature]178-nature had loved [them]4529-the paupers and gloried in [them]4529-the paupers too ; and now [she]183-joan would presently bury all [[her]183-joan dead children]4542-her dead children in [beautiful graves of new green]4543-beautiful graves of new green . The mosses and [marsh]4544-marsh were lovely and the clear pools full of living creatures . But these things were not saint - blessed and eternal . No spring fed [these silent wells]4545-these silent wells , [no holy man of old]4546-no holy man of old had ever smiled upon [them]4545-these silent wells . A stepping - stone by a wall lay before [her]183-joan now ; this [she]183-joan crossed , heard the stream murmuring peace , and hastened , and presently stood beside [it]4547-it . Here were holy ground and water ; [here]432-here were peace and a place to pray in . [Blue]305-blue forget - me - nots looked wondering up , seeing eyes as blue as [their]4529-the paupers own , and [she]183-joan smiled at [them]4529-the paupers and drank of the ripples that ran at [their]4529-the paupers roots . Gray through the growing haze of green , a ruined wall showed close to [the girl]521-the girl . The blackthorns '[1853-she] blooms were faded around [her]1855-her , the hawthorn was not yet powdered with white . [She]1855-her cast one look to right and left before entering [the chapel]1120-the chapel . A distant view of [the moorland]1857-the moorland rose to the sky , and [the ragged edge of [the hills]1859-the hills]1858-the ragged edge of the hills was marked by a gaunt engine - stack noting past enterprise , triumphs long gone by , ruined hopes but recently dead . Snug fox - covers of rhododendron swept up toward the head of the coomb ; and below , distant half a mile or more , [cottages]531-cottages already showed a glimmer of gold on their thatches where the increasing splendor of day brightened them , and morning mists were raising jeweled arms . Then [Joan]183-joan passed into [the ruin]1861-the ruin through that narrow opening which marks the door of [it]1861-the ruin . The granite walls now stand about the height of [a man]467-a man 's shoulder and [the chamber]1583-the chamber itself is small . Stone seats still run round two sides of [it]1583-the chamber ; ivy and stone - worts and grasses have picked the mortar from the walls and clothed them , even as emerald moss and gray lichens and black and gold glorify each piece of granite ; a may - bush , tangled about a great shiny ivy - tod , surmounts the western walls above [the dried well]1864-the dried well ; furzes and heather and tall grasses soften the jagged outlines of [the ruin]1861-the ruin , and above a stone altar , at the east end of [it]1583-the chamber , rises another white - thorn . At this season of the year the subsequent floral glories of [the little chapel]1866-the little chapel were only indicated : [young briers]1867-young briers already thrust [their]1867-young briers soft points over the stone of the altar and the first leaves of foxgloves were unfolding , with dandelions and docks , biting - stone - crop and ferns , ragged - robins and wild geraniums . These infant things softened no outline yet . The flat paving of the floor , where [it]1868-it yet remained , was bedded in grass ; a little square incision upon the stone of the altar glimmered full of water and reflected the light from fleecy clouds which now climbed into heaven , bearing sunrise fires upward over a pale blue sky . Here , under the circumambient , sparkling clearness , coolness and silence , [Joan]183-joan stood with strange medley of thoughts upon [her]183-joan soul . [The saints]722-the saints and the fairies mingled there with visions of Nature , always smiling , with a vague shadow of [one great God above the blue]1870-one great god above the blue , but dim and very far away ; and a nearer picture which quickened [her]183-joan heart - beat : the picture of " [Mister Jan. "]288-tregagle Here [she]183-joan felt [herself]183-joan at one with [the world]3624-the world spread round [her]183-joan . The mother eyes of a blackbird , sitting upon [her]1872-her eggs in the ivy - tod , kept their bright gold on [Joan]183-joan , but showed no fear ; the young rabbits frisked at hand ; a mole poked [his]1873-his snout and little paddle - paws out of the grass ; all was peace and happiness , it seemed , with the voice of [good St. Madron]249-st. madron murmuring love in [his]249-st. madron brooklet at hand . [Joan]183-joan knelt down by the old altar and bowed [her]183-joan head there and prayed to [Nature]178-nature and to [God]179-god . At first merely wordless prayers full of passionate entreaty rose to the Throne ; then utterance came in a wild simple throng of petitions ; and all [her]183-joan various knowledge , won from [[her]183-joan mother]706-her mother and [John Barren]177-barren , found a place . [Pan]306-pan and [Christ]1875-christ might each have heard and listened , for [she]183-joan called on [the gods of [earth]1877-earth]1876-the gods of earth and [heaven]637-heaven from a heart that was full . " Kind Mother o ' the flowers , doan't '[1879-e] [e]1879-e forget [a poor maiden]1880-a poor maiden what loves ' [e]1879-e so dear . [I]1879-e be sad an '[1879-e] sore - hearted 'cause things is bad wi '[183-joan] [me]0-i now [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's gone ; an ' [I]183-joan knaws as [I]183-joan 've lied an '[183-joan] bin wicked 'bout [Joe]192-joe , but , [kind Mother]178-nature , [I]183-joan awnly done what [Mister Jan]241-mister jan , as was wise an '[183-joan] loved [me]0-i , bid . Oh , [God A'mighty]179-god , doan't ' [E]1879-e let [en]1879-e forget [me]0-i , 'cause[0-i] [I]0-i 've gived up all — all the lil [I]0-i had for en , an ' [Nature]178-nature made [me]179-god as [I]179-god be . Oh , kind [God]179-god , make [me]179-god happy an '[179-god] light - hearted an ' strong agin , same as the lil birds an '[179-god] sich like is happy an ' strong ; an '[178-nature] forgive [me]0-i for all [my]0-i sins an ' make [me]178-nature well for [Mister Jan]241-mister jan , an '[178-nature] clever for [Mister Jan]241-mister jan , so 's [I]0-i 'll be a fine an ' [good wife to en]4550-good wife to en . An '[178-nature] forgive [me]0-i for lyin ' , 'cause[178-nature] what [I]0-i done was [Nature]178-nature , ' cordin '[178-nature] to [Mister Jan]241-mister jan ; an ' Nature 's kind to young things , '[178-nature] cordin ' to [Mister Jan]241-mister jan ; an '[178-nature] [I]0-i be young yet . An ' make [me]178-nature [a better lass]4551-a better lass , for [I]178-nature caan't abear to feel as [I]178-nature do ; an '[178-nature] make [me]0-i think o ' [the next world]4552-the next world arter this wan . But , oh , [dear God]4553-dear god , make [me]178-nature well an '[178-nature] braave agin , for ' tis awful wisht for [me]178-nature wi'out [Mister Jan]241-mister jan ; an '[178-nature] make [Mister Jan]241-mister jan strong too . [I]0-i be all in a miz - maze and doan't knaw wheer to turn ' cept to [Nature]178-nature , [dear Lard]200-the lard . Oh , kind [God A'mighty]179-god , lemme have [[my]178-nature angel]4554-my angel watchin '[178-nature] over [me]0-i close , same as what [mother]756-mother used to say [he]241-mister jan did allus . An ' bring [Mister Jan]241-mister jan back long very quick , 'cause[0-i] [I]0-i 'm nothin' but sadness wi'out en . An '[0-i] , [dear St. Madern]1882-dear st. madern , [I]0-i ax ' [e]4555-e to bless [me]0-i same as [you]1882-dear st. madern done when — when [I]0-i was [a lil baaby]4556-a lil baaby , 'cause[0-i] [I]0-i be gwaine to bathe in [[your]1882-dear st. madern brook]1883-your brook , bein ' [a St. Madern cheel]4557-a st. madern cheel . Oh , dear , good [God]179-god o '[0-i] all things , please to help [me]0-i an ' look to [me]0-i , 'cause[0-i] [I]0-i be very sad , an ' [I]0-i never done no harm to none , for [Jesus Christ]4558-jesus christ 's sake . Amen . " Then [she]1882-dear st. madern said [the Lord]702-the lord 's Prayer , because [[her]1882-dear st. madern mother]706-her mother had taught [her]1882-dear st. madern that [no human petition]4561-no human petition was ever heard unless accompanied by it . And it seemed as though the lark , winding upward with wide spiral to [his]4558-jesus christ song - throne in the sky and tinkling thin music on the morning wind , was [[her]1882-dear st. madern messenger]4562-her messenger : which thought was beautiful to [Joan]183-joan and made [her]183-joan heart glad . Never had [she]183-joan looked fairer . [Her]183-joan blue eyes were misty , but the magic of prayer , the glory of speaking straight to [the Father of all]1400-the father of all , call [Him]1400-the father of all what [she]183-joan might , had nobly fortified [her]183-joan sinking spirit . Peace brooded in [her]183-joan soul then , and faith warmed [her]183-joan blood . [She]183-joan was sure [her]183-joan prayer would be answered ; [she]183-joan was certain that [her]183-joan health and [[her]183-joan loved one]4564-her loved one would both come back to [her]183-joan . And [she]183-joan stood by the altar and smiled at the golden morning , [herself]183-joan the fairest thing the sun shone upon . Having peeped shyly about [her]183-joan , [Joan]183-joan took off [her]183-joan clothes , placed them on the altar - stones , shook down [her]183-joan hair , and glided softly to [the stream]4565-the stream . At one point [its]4565-the stream waters caught the sunshine and babbled over white sand between many budding spikes of wild parsley and young fronds of fern . Naked and beautiful [the girl]521-the girl stood , [her]521-the girl bright hair glinting to [her]521-the girl waist , all rippled with the first red gold of the morning , [her]521-the girl body very white save where the sun and western wind had browned both arms and neck ; [her]521-the girl form innocent as yet of the mystery hid for [her]521-the girl in Time . [Joan]183-joan 's fair limbs spoke of blood not [Cornish]307-cornish , of days far past when a race of [giants]4567-giants swept up from behind [the North Sea]96-the north sea to tread [a new earth]4568-a new earth and take wives of [the little dark women of [the land]3578-the land]4569-the little dark women of the land , abating the still prevalent nigrescence of the Celt with Saxon eyes and hair , adding [their]4569-the little dark women of the land stature and [their]4569-the little dark women of the land strength to [races unborn]4571-races unborn . A sweet embodiment of all that was lovely and pure and fresh , [she]183-joan looked — [a human incarnation of youth]4572-a human incarnation of youth and springtime . There was a pool deeper than the general shallowness of [the stream]4565-the stream which served for [Joan]183-joan 's bath , and [she]183-joan entered [there]3728-there , where soft white sand made pleasant footing for [her]183-joan toes , where more forget - me - nots twinkled [their]4569-the little dark women of the land turquoise about the margin , where shining gorse towered like a sentinel above . [She]183-joan suffered the holy water to flow over every inch of [her]183-joan body , and then , rubbing [her]183-joan white self red and glowing with the dead brake fern of last year and squeezing the water out of [her]183-joan hair , [Joan]183-joan quickly dressed again and prepared to depart . [She]183-joan was about to leave a fragment torn from [her]183-joan skirt hanging by [the chapel]1120-the chapel , but changed [her]183-joan mind , and getting a splinter of granite , rough - edged , [she]183-joan began to chip away a tress of [her]183-joan own bright hair , sawing it off upon the stone table as best [she]183-joan could . Like a fallen star it presently glimmered in the thorn bush above [[St. Madron]249-st. madron 's altar]4576-st. madron 's altar where [she]183-joan wound the little lock , presently to bring gold to the nests and joy to the heart of [small feathered folk]4577-small feathered folk . [Joan]183-joan walked [home]453-home with the warm blood racing in [her]183-joan veins , roses on [her]183-joan cheeks and the glory of hope in [her]183-joan eyes . Already [she]183-joan felt [her]183-joan prayers were being heard ; already [she]183-joan was thanking [God]179-god for heeding [her]183-joan cry , and [St Madron]308-st madron for the life - giving waters of [[his]249-st. madron holy stream]4579-his holy stream . [Thee]4580-thee , where finches chattered and fluttered forward , breakfasting together in pleasant company , a shadow and a swift , strong wing flashed across [Joan]183-joan 's sight — and a hawk struck . [The little people]4581-the little people shrieked , a few gray feathers puffed here and there , and one spark of life was blown out that other sparks might shine the brighter . For presently [Joan]183-joan 's kind " Mother o '[0-i] the flowers " watched the beaks of fledgeling hawks grow red , and the parent bird of prey 's cold eyes brightened with satisfaction ; as will [every parent eye]1884-every parent eye brighten at the spectacle of baby things eating wholesome food with hearty appetite . The death of the small fowl clouded [the pilgrim]1885-the pilgrim 's thoughts , but only for a moment . Sentiment and emotion had passed ; now [she]1885-the pilgrim was eager with delicious physical hunger and longing for [her]1885-the pilgrim breakfast . [The girl]521-the girl had not felt so well or so happy for a considerable time . Half [her]1885-the pilgrim prayer , [she]1885-the pilgrim told [herself]1885-the pilgrim , was answered already ; and the other half , relating to " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan , " would doubtless meet with similar merciful response ere many hours had flown . So joyfully homeward out of [dreamland]1887-dreamland into a world of facts [Joan]183-joan hastened . A glad heart shortens [the longest road]1888-the longest road , and [Joan]183-joan , whose return journey from [the holy well]1889-the holy well was for the most part downhill , soon found [herself]183-joan back again in [Penzance]7-penzance . The fire of devotion still actuated [her]183-joan movements , and [she]183-joan walked fearlessly , doubting nothing , to [the post - office]4454-the post - office . There would be a letter to - day ; [she]183-joan knew it ; [she]183-joan felt it in [her]183-joan consciousness , as a certainty . And when [she]183-joan asked for it and mentioned [her]1885-the pilgrim name , [she]183-joan put [her]183-joan hand out and waited until [the sleepy - eyed clerk]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk rummaged through a little pile of letters standing together and tied with a separate string . [She]183-joan watched [him]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk slowly untie them and scan the addresses , grumbling as [he]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk did so . Then [he]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk came to the last of all and read out : " ' [Miss Joan Tregenza]183-joan , [Post - Office]4582-post - office , [Penzance]7-penzance . To be left until called for . '[1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk] " " [Mine]1892-mine , [mine]1892-mine , [sir]556-sir ! [I]0-i knawed ' e'd have it ! [I]0-i knawed as the kind , good — " Then [she]183-joan stopped and grew red , while [the clerk]4583-the clerk looked at [her]183-joan curiously and then yawned . " What 's a draggle - tailed chit like [her]183-joan got to do with such a thing ? " [he]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk wondered , and then spoke to [Joan]183-joan : " Here [you]183-joan are ; and [you]183-joan must sign this paper — it 's a registered letter . " [Joan]183-joan , [her]183-joan hand shaking with excitement , printed [her]183-joan name where [he]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk directed , thanked [the man]3494-the man with a smile that softened [him]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk , and then hastened away . [The girl]521-the girl was faint with hunger and happiness before [she]521-the girl reached [home]453-home . [She]183-joan did not dare to open the letter just then , but took it from [her]183-joan pocket a dozen times before [she]183-joan reached [Newlyn]1-newlyn and feasted [her]183-joan eyes on [her]183-joan own name , very beautifully and legibly printed . [He]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk had written it ! [His]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk precious hand had held the pen and formed each letter . Deep , wordless thanks welled up in [Joan]183-joan 's heart , for [God]179-god was not very far away , after all . [He]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk had heard [her]183-joan prayer already , and answered it within an hour . No doubt it was easy for [Him]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk to grant such a little prayer . It could be nothing much to [God]179-god that [one small creature]4587-one small creature should enjoy such happiness ; but what seemed wonderful was that [He]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk should have any time to listen at all , that [He]1891-the sleepy - eyed clerk should have been able to turn from the mighty business of [the great awakening world]4588-the great awakening world and give a thought to [her]183-joan . " Sure '[0-i] twas the lil lark as [the good Lard]1894-the good lard heard , an ' [my]1894-the good lard asking as went up - long wi '[1894-the good lard] en , " said [Joan]183-joan to [herself]183-joan . [She]183-joan found [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father at [home]453-home and [the family]1897-the family just about to take breakfast . [Gray Michael]204-gray michael had returned somewhat unexpectedly , with a fine catch , and did not intend sailing again before the evening tide . A somewhat ominous silence greeted [the girl]521-the girl , a silence which [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father was the first to break . " Ayte [your]521-the girl food , [[my]0-i lass]1900-my lass , an ' then come in [the garden]3656-the garden '[0-i] long with [me]0-i , " [he]0-i said . " [I]0-i do want a word with ' [e]521-the girl , an '[0-i] things must be said which [I]0-i 've put off the sayin ' of tu long . So be quick 's [you]521-the girl can . " But this sauce did not spoil [the girl]521-the girl 's enjoyment of [her]521-the girl porridge and treacle . [She]521-the girl ate heartily , and [her]521-the girl happy humor seemed catching , at least so far as [Tom]199-tom was concerned . A bright color warmed [Joan]183-joan 's cheek ; the cloud that had dimmed [her]183-joan eyes was there no longer ; and more than once [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza looked at [[his]216-mr. tregenza wife]843-his wife inquiringly , for the tale [she]843-his wife had been telling of [Joan]183-joan 's recent moods and disorder was at variance with [her]183-joan present spirits and appetite . After breakfast [she]183-joan went to [[her]183-joan room]4592-her room while [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father waited ; and then it was that [Joan]183-joan snatched a moment to open [John Barron]176-barron 's letter . There would be no time to read it then , [she]183-joan knew : that delicious task must take many hours of loving labor ; but [she]183-joan wanted to count the pages and see " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's " name at the end . [She]183-joan knew that crosses meant kisses , too . There might be crosses somewhere . So [she]183-joan opened the envelope in a fever of joyous excitement , being careful , however , not to tear a letter of the superscription . And from it there came a fat , folded pile of tissue paper . [Joan]183-joan knew it was money , and flung it on [her]183-joan bed and fumbled with sinking heart for something better . But there was nothing else — only ten pieces of tissue - paper . [She]183-joan remembered seeing [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father with similar pieces ; and [[her]183-joan mother]706-her mother saying there was nothing like Bank of [England]37-england notes . But they had been crumpled and dirty , these were snowy white . Each had a hundred pounds marked upon it ; and [Joan]183-joan was aware that ten times a hundred is a thousand . But a thousand pounds possessed no more real meaning for [her]183-joan than a million of money does for [the average man]4596-the average man . [She]183-joan could not estimate its significance in the least or gauge its possibilities . Only [she]183-joan knew that [she]183-joan would far rather have had a few words from " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " than all the money in [the world]3624-the world . [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza 's voice below broke in upon [the girl]521-the girl 's disappointment , and , hastily hiding the money under some linen in a little chest of drawers , where the picture of [Joe]192-joe 's ship was also concealed , [she]183-joan hurried to join [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father . But the empty envelope , with [her]183-joan name printed on it , [she]183-joan put into [her]183-joan pocket that it might be near [her]183-joan . [Joan]183-joan did not for an instant gather what meaning lay under this great gift of money , and to [her]183-joan the absence of a letter was no more than a passing sorrow . [She]183-joan read nothing between the lines of this silence ; [she]183-joan only saw that [he]3642-her father had not forgotten , and only thought that [he]3642-her father perhaps imagined such vast sums of money would give [her]183-joan pleasure and make the waiting easier . What were banknotes to [Joan]183-joan ? What was life to [her]183-joan away from [him]3642-her father ? [She]183-joan sighed , and fell back upon the thought of [his]3642-her father wisdom and knowledge . [He]3642-her father must be in the right to delay , because [he]3642-her father was always in the right . A letter would presently come to explain why [he]3642-her father had sent the money and to treat of [his]3642-her father return . [The girl]521-the girl felt that [she]521-the girl had much to thank [God]179-god for , after all . [He]3642-her father had sent [her]521-the girl the letter ; [He]3642-her father had answered [her]521-the girl prayer in [His]3642-her father own way . It ill became [her]521-the girl , [she]183-joan thought , to question more deeply . [She]183-joan must wait and be patient , however hard the waiting . So thinking , [she]183-joan joined [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father . [Tom]199-tom was away up [the village]423-the village , [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza found plenty to occupy [her]198-mrs. tregenza mind and body indoors ; [Joan]183-joan and [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza had [the garden]3656-the garden to [themselves]4604-themselves . [He]3642-her father was silent until [they]4604-themselves reached [the wicket]4605-the wicket , then , going through [it]4605-the wicket , [he]3642-her father led the way slowly up [a hill which wound above [the neighboring stone quarry]4607-the neighboring stone quarry]4606-a hill which wound above the neighboring stone quarry ; and as [he]3642-her father walked [he]3642-her father addressed [Joan]183-joan . [She]183-joan , weary enough already , prayed that [[her]183-joan parent]4608-her parent intended going no further than [the summit of [the hill]533-the hill]4609-the summit of the hill ; but when [he]3642-her father spoke [she]183-joan forgot physical fatigue , for [his]3642-her father manner was short and stern . " Here [Gray Michael]204-gray michael paused and turned homeward , while [Joan]183-joan congratulated [herself]183-joan upon the fact that a conversation which promised to be difficult had ended so speedily and without misfortune . Faith 's the awnly medicine worth [usin]1928-usin ' . " [Joan]183-joan remembered [her]183-joan morning bath and felt comforted by this last reflection . Had [she]183-joan not already found the magic result ? For a moment [she]183-joan thought of telling [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father what [she]183-joan had done , but [she]183-joan changed [her]183-joan mind . Such faith as that would have brought nothing but wrath upon [her]183-joan . While [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza improved the hour and uttered various precepts for [[his]216-mr. tregenza daughter]695-his daughter 's help and guidance , [Thomasin]201-thomasin was occupied at [home]453-home with grave thoughts respecting [Joan]183-joan . [She]201-thomasin more than suspected the truth from signs of indisposition full of meaning to [a mother]4639-a mother ; but while duly mentioning [the girl]521-the girl 's illness , [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza did not dare to breathe the color of [her]198-mrs. tregenza own explanation . [She]198-mrs. tregenza prayed to [God]179-god in all honesty to prove [her]201-thomasin wrong , but [her]198-mrs. tregenza lynx eyes waited to read the truth [she]198-mrs. tregenza feared . If things were really so with [Joan]183-joan , then they could not be hid from [her]198-mrs. tregenza eyes much longer ; and in the event of [her]198-mrs. tregenza suspicions proving correct , [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza told [herself]198-mrs. tregenza , as a right [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler , [she]198-mrs. tregenza must proclaim [her]198-mrs. tregenza horrid discovery and let the perdition of [[[her]198-mrs. tregenza husband]605-her husband 's daughter]4642-her husband 's daughter be generally made manifest . [She]198-mrs. tregenza knew so many were called , [so few chosen]4643-so few chosen . [No girl]4644-no girl had ever been more surely called than [Joan]183-joan : [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father 's trumpet tongue had thundered the ways of righteousness into [her]183-joan ears from [her]183-joan birth ; but , after all , it began to look as though [she]183-joan was not chosen . The circumstance , of course , if proved , would rob [her]198-mrs. tregenza of every [Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler 's regard . No weak pandering with sentiment and sin was permitted in that fold . And [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza had little pity [herself]198-mrs. tregenza for [unfortunate or mistaken women]4646-unfortunate or mistaken women . Let [a girl]491-a girl lose [her]491-a girl character and [Thomasin]201-thomasin usually refused to hear any plea of mercy from any source . Only once did [she]198-mrs. tregenza find extenuating circumstances : in a case where [[a ruined farmer]4648-a ruined farmer 's daughter]4649-a ruined farmer 's daughter brought an action for breach of promise and won it , with heavy damages . But money acted in a peculiar way with [this woman]4650-this woman . It put [her]198-mrs. tregenza conscience and [her]198-mrs. tregenza judgment out of focus , softened the outlines of events , furnished excuses for unusual practices , gilded with a bright lining even the blackest cloud of wrongdoing . Where [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza could see money [she]198-mrs. tregenza could see light . Money made [her]198-mrs. tregenza charitable , broad - minded , even tolerant . [She]198-mrs. tregenza knew [she]198-mrs. tregenza loved it , and was careful to keep the fact out of [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's sight as far as possible . [She]198-mrs. tregenza held the purse , and [he]204-gray michael felt that it was in good hands , but cautioned [her]198-mrs. tregenza from time to time against the awful danger of letting a lust for [this world]792-this world 's wealth come between the soul and [God]179-god . And now a course long indicated in [Thomasin]201-thomasin 's mind was being by [her]198-mrs. tregenza pursued . Having convinced [herself]198-mrs. tregenza that under the present circumstances any step to found or dispel [her]198-mrs. tregenza fears concerning [Joan]183-joan would be just and proper , [she]198-mrs. tregenza took the exceptional one of searching [[the girl]521-the girl 's little room]4653-the girl 's little room while [[her]198-mrs. tregenza stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter was out with [Michael]204-gray michael . Even as [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza turned to go [homeward]1300-homeward again , [[his]216-mr. tregenza wife]843-his wife stood in the midst of [[Joan]183-joan 's small sanctuary]4657-joan 's small sanctuary , and cast keen , inquiring eyes about [her]183-joan . [She]183-joan rarely visited [the apartment]4658-the apartment , and had not been in [it]4658-the apartment for six months . Now [she]183-joan came to set doubt at rest if possible , or confirm it . [Her]183-joan own secret opinion was that [Joan]183-joan had come to serious trouble with [[her]183-joan superiors]4659-her superiors . In that case letters , presents or tokens had probably passed into [her]183-joan hands ; and , if such existed , in [this room]4660-this room they would be . " [God]179-god send as [I]1927-e 'm[1927-e] makin ' a mistake an '[1927-e] shaan't find nothin' ' tall , " said [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza to [herself]1927-e . And then [she]198-mrs. tregenza began [her]198-mrs. tregenza scrutiny . [Thomasin]201-thomasin saw that all things about [[Joan]183-joan 's room]4661-joan 's room were neat , spotless , and in order . For one brief moment a sense of disquiet at the action before [her]198-mrs. tregenza touched [the woman]4662-the woman 's heart and head ; but duty alike to [[her]198-mrs. tregenza husband]605-her husband and [[her]198-mrs. tregenza stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter demanded the search in [her]198-mrs. tregenza opinion . Should there be nothing to find , so much the better ; if , on the other hand , matters affecting [Joan]183-joan 's temporal and eternal welfare were [here]432-here hidden , then they could not be uncovered too quickly . [She]198-mrs. tregenza looked first through [the girl]521-the girl 's little wooden trunk , the key of which was in the lock , but nothing save a childish treasure or two rewarded [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza [here]432-here . In a broken desk , which had belonged to [[her]183-joan mother]706-her mother , [Joan]183-joan kept a few Christmas cards , and two silhouettes : one of [Uncle Thomas]199-tom , of [Drift]15-drift , one of [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary . Here were also some cooking recipes copied in [[her]183-joan mother]706-her mother 's writing , an agate marble which [Joan]183-joan had found on [Penzance beach]4670-penzance beach , lavender tied up in a bag , and an odd toy that softened [Thomasin]201-thomasin 's heart not a little as [she]198-mrs. tregenza picked it up and looked at it . The thing brought back to [her]198-mrs. tregenza memory a time four years earlier . It was [a small , grotesque figure on wires , built up of chestnuts and acorns]4671-a small , grotesque figure on wires , built up of chestnuts and acorns with a hazel - nut for its head and black pins stuck in for the eyes . [She]198-mrs. tregenza remembered [Tom]199-tom making it and giving it to [Joan]183-joan on [her]183-joan birthday . Then the memory of [Joan]183-joan 's love for [Tom]199-tom from the time [he]199-tom was born came like a glow of sunshine into [the mother]4243-the mother 's heart , and for a moment [she]198-mrs. tregenza was minded to relinquish [her]198-mrs. tregenza unpleasant task upon the spot ; but [she]198-mrs. tregenza changed [her]198-mrs. tregenza intention again and proceeded . The box held little else save a parcel of old clothes tied up with rosemary in brown paper . These [the woman]4662-the woman surveyed curiously , and knew , without being told , that they had belonged to [[Joan]183-joan 's mother]715-joan 's mother . For some reason the spectacle killed sentiment and changed [her]198-mrs. tregenza mood . [She]198-mrs. tregenza shut down the box , and then , going to the chest of drawers , pulled out each compartment in turn . Nothing but [Joan]183-joan 's apparel and [her]183-joan few brooches and trinkets appeared here . The history of each and all was familiar to [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza . But on reaching the bottom drawer of the chest , [she]198-mrs. tregenza found it locked and the key absent . To continue [her]198-mrs. tregenza search , however , was not difficult . Nothing separated the drawers , and by removing that above the last , the contents of the lowest lay at [her]198-mrs. tregenza mercy , It was full of linen for the most part , but hidden at the bottom , [Thomasin]201-thomasin made a discovery , and found certain matters which at once spoke of tremendous mystery , and , to [her]198-mrs. tregenza mind , indicated the nature of it . First [she]198-mrs. tregenza came upon the little picture of [[Joe]192-joe 's ship]3620-joe 's ship in its rough gilded frame . This might be an innocent gift from some of [the young men who had asked in the past]4676-the young men who had asked in the past to be allowed to paint [Joan]183-joan and received a curt negative from [Gray Michael]204-gray michael . But the other discovery meant more . Pushing [her]198-mrs. tregenza hand about the drawer [she]198-mrs. tregenza found a pile of paper , felt the crackle of it , and pulled it eagerly to the light . Then , and before [she]198-mrs. tregenza learned the grandeur of the sum , [she]198-mrs. tregenza was seized with a sudden palpitation and sat down on [Joan]183-joan 's bed . [Her]198-mrs. tregenza mouth grew full as [a hungry man]4677-a hungry man 's before a feast , [her]198-mrs. tregenza lips were wet , [her]198-mrs. tregenza hand shook as [she]198-mrs. tregenza opened and spread the notes . Then [she]198-mrs. tregenza counted them and sat gasping like a landed fish . [Thomasin]201-thomasin had never seen so much money before in [her]198-mrs. tregenza life . A thousand pounds ! Unlike [Joan]183-joan , to whom the sum conveyed no significance , [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza could estimate it . [Her]198-mrs. tregenza mind reached that far , and the bank - notes , for [her]198-mrs. tregenza , lay just within the estimation of avarice . Every snowy fragment meant a hundred pounds — a hundred sovereigns — two hundred ten - shilling pieces . The first shock overpast , and long before [she]198-mrs. tregenza grew sufficiently calm to associate the treasure with [its possessor]4678-its possessor , [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza began spending in [her]198-mrs. tregenza mind 's eye . The points in [house]4679-house and [garden]4680-garden , [outhouse]4681-outhouse and sty , whereon money might be advantageously expended , rose up one after the other . Then [she]198-mrs. tregenza put aside eight hundred and fifty out of the grand total and pictured [herself]198-mrs. tregenza taking it to [the bank]4682-the bank . [She]198-mrs. tregenza thought of a nest - egg that would " goody " against the time [Tom]199-tom should grow into [a man]467-a man ; [she]198-mrs. tregenza saw [herself]198-mrs. tregenza among [the neighbors]4684-the neighbors , pointed at , whispered of as [a woman with hundreds and hundreds of pounds put by]4685-a woman with hundreds and hundreds of pounds put by ; [she]198-mrs. tregenza saw the rows of men sitting basking about in [Newlyn]1-newlyn , as [their]4684-the neighbors custom is when off [the sea]463-the sea ; and [she]198-mrs. tregenza heard [them]4684-the neighbors drop words of admiration at the sight of [her]198-mrs. tregenza . Presently , however , this gilded vision vanished , and [she]198-mrs. tregenza began to connect the money with [Joan]183-joan . [She]198-mrs. tregenza solved the mystery then with a brutal directness which hit the mark in one direction ; as to the source of the money , but went wide of it in some measure upon the subject of [the girl]521-the girl . [Thomasin]201-thomasin held briefly that [[her]201-thomasin stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter had fallen , and now , knowing [her]201-thomasin condition , had informed [some man]4689-some man of it , with the result that from [him]4689-some man came this unutterable gift . That the money made an enormous difference to [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza 's mental attitude must be confessed . [She]198-mrs. tregenza found [herself]198-mrs. tregenza fashioning absolute excuses for [Joan]183-joan . [Girls]4690-girls so often came to ill through no fault of [their]4690-girls own . [The man]3494-the man must at least have been [a gentleman]4034-a gentleman to pay for [his]3494-the man pleasure in four figures . Four figures ! Here [she]198-mrs. tregenza stopped thinking in order to picture the vision of [a unit followed by three ciphers]4693-a unit followed by three ciphers . Then [she]198-mrs. tregenza marveled as to what manner of [man]3551-man [he]3494-the man was who could send [a girl like [Joan]183-joan]4695-a girl like joan a thousand pounds . [She]198-mrs. tregenza never heard of such a price for the value received . [Her]198-mrs. tregenza respect for [Joan]183-joan began to increase when [she]198-mrs. tregenza realized that the money was [hers]198-mrs. tregenza . Probably there was even more where that came from . " Anyway , " [she]198-mrs. tregenza reflected , " it ban't no use cryin '[1927-e] ower spilt milk . What 's done 's done . An ' a thousand pounds'll go long ways to softenin '[1927-e] [the road]445-the road . [She]1930-she might travel up - long to [Truro]69-truro to [[my]0-i cousin]1931-my cousin an ' bide quiet [theer]4696-theer till arter , an '[1930-she] no harm done , [poor lass]1932-poor lass . When all 's said , [us]1933-us knaws the Lard Hissel weer mighty easy wi ' the like o '[1930-she] [she]1930-she , an ' [worser wenches tu]4697-worser wenches tu . But [Michael]204-gray michael — [God A'mighty knaws]4698-god a'mighty knaws [he]204-gray michael wo n't be easy . [She'm]183-joan [a damned wummon]4699-a damned wummon , [I]1930-she s'pose , but [she]1930-she 's got to live through '[1930-she] er life here — damned or saved ; an ' [she]1930-she 's got a thousand pound to do't with . [A terrible braave dollop o '[1930-she] money]4700-a terrible braave dollop o ' money , sure ' nough . To think '[1930-she] ow ' ard [a man]467-a man 's got to work '[1934-he] fore [he]1934-he earns five of 'em ! " But [her]1930-she imagination centered upon [Gray Michael]204-gray michael now , and [she]1930-she almost forgot the banknotes for a moment . [She]1930-she thought of [his]204-gray michael agony and trembled for the result . [He]204-gray michael might strike [Joan]183-joan down and kill [her]183-joan . [The man]3494-the man 's anger against [evil - doers]4703-evil - doers was always a terrific thing ; and [he]204-gray michael had no idea of the value of money . [She]1930-she hazarded guesses at the course [he]204-gray michael would pursue , and each idea was blacker than the last . Then [Thomasin]201-thomasin fell to wondering what [Michael]204-gray michael would be likely to do with the money . [She]201-thomasin sighed at this thought , and then [she]201-thomasin grew pale at the imaginary spectacle of [[her]201-thomasin husband]605-her husband tearing the devil - sent notes to pieces and scattering them over [the cliff]4179-the cliff to [the sea]463-the sea . This horrible possibility stung [her]201-thomasin to another train of ideas . Might it be within [her]201-thomasin power to win [Joan]183-joan 's secret , share it , and keep it from [the father]3806-the father ? [Her]201-thomasin pluck , however , gave way when [she]201-thomasin looked a little deeper into the future . [She]201-thomasin would have done most things in [her]201-thomasin power for a thousand pounds , but [she]201-thomasin would not have dared any treachery to [Michael]204-gray michael . [The woman]4662-the woman put the notes together and stroked them and listened to the rustle of them and rubbed [her]4662-the woman hard cheek with them . Then , looking from the little window of [[Joan]183-joan 's garret]4709-joan 's garret , [she]4662-the woman saw [the girl]521-the girl [herself]521-the girl approaching with [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza . [They]4711-they were nearly [home]453-home again , so [Thomasin]201-thomasin returned the money and the picture to [their]4711-they places in the chest of drawers , smoothed the bed , where [she]201-thomasin had been sitting for half an hour , and went [downstairs]4713-downstairs still undetermined as to a course of action . Before dinner was eaten , however , [she]201-thomasin had decided that [[her]201-thomasin husband]605-her husband must know the truth . Even [her]201-thomasin desire toward the money cooled before the prospect of treachery to [him]605-her husband . Fear had something to do with this decision , but [the woman]4662-the woman 's own principles were strong . It is unlikely that in any case [they]4711-they would have broken down . [She]201-thomasin sent [Joan]183-joan on an errand to [the village]423-the village after the meal was ended ; and upon [her]201-thomasin departure addressed [[her]201-thomasin husband]605-her husband hurriedly . " [You]204-gray michael said [I]1930-she was '[1930-she] mazed to dinner , an ' so [I]204-gray michael was . [I]204-gray michael 've gotten bad news for '[204-gray michael] e , [Michael]204-gray michael , touchin ' [Joan]183-joan . " " No more o '[756-mother] that , [mother]756-mother , " [he]204-gray michael answered , " [I]0-i 've talked wi ' [she]183-joan an '[756-mother] said a word in season . [She'm]1936-she'm well in body an ' be gwaine to turn a new leaf , so theer 's an end o '[756-mother] the matter . " " ' [Tedn ']4718-tedn '[756-mother] so , " [she]756-mother declared , " [I]0-i 've bin in [[the gal]3893-the gal 's room]1938-the gal 's room an ' [I]756-mother 've found — but [you]204-gray michael bide here an '[756-mother] [I]0-i 'll bring 'em to '[756-mother] e. " " [She've]183-joan tawld [me]0-i the truth out a walkin ' an '[0-i] [I]0-i 've shawed [her]183-joan the narrer path . What should [you]204-gray michael find ? " " Money — no lil come - by - chance neither ; more money than ever [you]204-gray michael or [me]0-i seed in [our]1939-us born days afore or shall agin . " " [You'm]204-gray michael dreamin ' , [wummon]4719-wummon ! " [he]204-gray michael said . " [God]179-god knaws [I]1941-she wishes it weer so , " [she]1941-she answered , and went once more to [[Joan]183-joan 's room]4661-joan 's room . [Gray Michael]204-gray michael was walking up and down [the kitchen]860-the kitchen when [she]1941-she returned , and [Thomasin]201-thomasin said nothing , but put money and picture upon the table . [[Her]1941-she husband]605-her husband fought with [himself]605-her husband a moment , as it appeared , then seemed to pray a while , standing still with [his]605-her husband hand pressed over [his]605-her husband eyes , and finally sat [himself]605-her husband down beside the things which [Thomasin]201-thomasin had brought . " [I]1941-she 'd no choice but to tell '[1941-she] [e]1940-e , " [she]1941-she said . [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's eyes were on the picture and utter astonishment appeared in them . " Why ! ' tis [[Joe Noy]192-joe 's ship]4723-joe noy 's ship . [Us]4724-us seed [her]4723-joe noy 's ship off [the islands]3676-the islands , outward bound ! [He]192-joe might '[1941-she] a ' gived it [her]4723-joe noy 's ship hisself surely ? " " But t'other thing ; the money . Count them notes . [Noy]192-joe never gived [Joan]183-joan them . " [He]204-gray michael spread the parcel , counted the money , and sat back thunderstruck . " [God]179-god in [heaven]637-heaven ! A thousan '[1941-she] pound , an ' notes as never went through no dirty hands neither ! What do it mean ? " " How should [I]1942-i tell what it means ? " " What do ' [e]1943-e mean by that ? " [he]204-gray michael blazed out , rising to [his]204-gray michael feet and clinching [his]204-gray michael fists . " Ax [[your]1944-your darter]4727-your darter . Do '[1943-e] [e]1943-e think [I]0-i 'd dare to say a word onless [I]0-i was sartain sure ?
