" [He]204-gray michael raised [his]204-gray michael hand to stop [her]1945-your own wife . [He]204-gray michael was sitting back in [his]204-gray michael chair with a face that had grown gray even to the skin , with eyes that looked out at nothing . There was a moment 's silence save for the tall clock in the corner ; then [Tregenza]183-joan brushed beads of water off [his]204-gray michael forehead and dried [his]204-gray michael hand on [his]204-gray michael trousers . [He]204-gray michael raised [his]204-gray michael eyes to the roof and gripped [his]204-gray michael hands together on [his]204-gray michael chest and slowly spoke a text which [[his]204-gray michael wife]843-his wife had heard upon [his]204-gray michael lips before , but only at times of deep concern or emotion . " '[1943-e] [The Lard]1026-the lard is [king]671-king , be [the people]4040-the people never so impatient ; [He]1026-the lard sitteth between [the cherubims]1949-the cherubims , be the airth never so unquiet . ' " [Few]310-few saw any particular meaning in this quotation applied in moments of stress , as [Michael]204-gray michael usually employed it ; but to [the man]3494-the man it was a supreme utterance , the last word to be spoken in the face of all the evil and wickedness of [the world]3624-the world . Come what might , [God]179-god still reigned in [heaven]637-heaven . [He]1951-husband spoke aloud thus far , and afterward , by the movement of [his]1951-husband beard and lip , [Thomasin]201-thomasin could see [he]1951-husband was still talking or praying . " Let [the Lard]200-the lard lead '[1952-she] [e]1950-e , [husband]1951-husband , in this hard pass , " [she]1952-she said . " ' Vengeance is [Mine]4734-mine , '[1952-she] the Book sez . " [He]1951-husband turned [his]1951-husband eyes upon [her]1952-she . [His]1951-husband brows were dragged down upon them ; [he]1951-husband had brushed [his]1951-husband gray hair like bristles upright on [his]1951-husband head ; across the mighty wall of [his]1951-husband forehead jagged cross - lines were stamped , like the broken strata over a cliff - face . " Ay , [you]1952-she say it . Vengeance be [God]179-god 's awn , an ' mercy be [God]179-god 's awn . '[179-god] Tedn ' for [no man]3523-no man to meddle wi '[179-god] [them]1953-them . [Us]1954-us caan't be aught but just . [She]1952-she 'll have justice from [me]0-i — no more'n that . ' Tis all wan now . [Wanton]311-wanton or [no wanton]4736-no wanton , [she've]1952-she flummoxed [me]1955-master this day . [The giglot]4737-the giglot lied an '[1955-master] said the thing that was not . She'm not o ' [the Kingdom]4738-the kingdom — the fust [Tregenza]183-joan as ever lied — the fust . " " [God]179-god send it edn '[1955-master] as bad as it do look , [master]1955-master . ' [Er]4739-er caracter belike ban't gone . S'pose as [she'm]183-joan married ? " " Hould [your]1955-master clack , [wummon]4719-wummon . [I]1955-master be thinkin '[1955-master] . " [He]1955-master was thinking , indeed . In the face of this discovery , the ghost of an idea , which had haunted [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's mind more than once during the upbringing of [Joan]183-joan , returned a greater and more pronounced shadow than ever before . The conviction carried truth stamped upon it from the standpoint of [his]1955-master present horrid knowledge . To [an outsider]1956-an outsider [his]1955-master thought had appeared absolutely devilish , to [the man]3494-the man [himself]3494-the man it was as a buoy thrown to one drowning . The belief flooded [his]3494-the man mind , swept [him]3494-the man away , convinced [him]3494-the man . Its nature presently appeared as [he]3494-the man answered [Thomasin]201-thomasin . [She]201-thomasin was still thinking of the thousand pounds . " [Theer]1958-theer 's no word in the Book agin mercy , [Michael]204-gray michael . [Joan]183-joan 's [your]204-gray michael awn darter — froward or not froward . " " [You'm]201-thomasin wrong [theer]201-thomasin , " [he]3494-the man said . [He]3494-the man was now cool and quiet . " [I]0-i did think so wance ; [I]0-i did tell [her]183-joan so when [us]1959-us walked not two hour agone . Now [I]0-i sees [differ'nt]312-differ'nt . She'm none o ' mine . She'm no [Tregenza]183-joan . Be Nature , as made [us]1959-us [God]179-god - fearin '[3494-the man] to [a man]467-a man , to a wummon , to a cheel , [gwaine to lie after generations ' pon generations]4741-gwaine to lie after generations ' pon generations ? Look back at [them]1961-them as bred [me]3494-the man , an '[3494-the man] [them]1961-them as bred [them]1961-them — back , an ' back , an '[3494-the man] back . All [Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas was [o]1962-o ' [the Lard]200-the lard 's harvest ; an '[0-i] should [I]0-i , as feared [God]179-god more'n any o ' 'em[0-i] , an ' fought for the Lard of Hosts '[0-i] fore [I]0-i was higher'n this table — should [I]0-i — [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza , breed [a damned sawl]1963-a damned sawl ? The thot 's comed black an ' terrible '[0-i] pon [my]0-i mind ' fore to - day ; an '[0-i] [I]0-i 've put en away from [me]0-i , judgin ' '[0-i] twas the devil . Now [I]0-i knaw ' twas [God]179-god spoke ; now [I]0-i knaw that [her]1963-a damned sawl 's none o '[0-i] [my]0-i gettin ' . " " [She've]1963-a damned sawl lied to [me]0-i , " was [his]0-i answer ; " [she've]1963-a damned sawl lied oftentimes ; she'm false to whatever [I]0-i did teach [her]1963-a damned sawl ; [she've]1963-a damned sawl sawld [herself]1963-a damned sawl — [she've]1963-a damned sawl — no more on it — no more on it but awnly this : [I]0-i call '[0-i] pon God A'mighty to bear witness she'm no [Tregenza]183-joan — never — never . " " ' Tweer [[her]1968-her mother]706-her mother in the gal ; but doan't '[1967-e] [e]1967-e say more 'bout that , [Michael]204-gray michael . [Poor dear sawl]4743-poor dear sawl , she'm dead an '[1967-e] gone , an ' [she]1968-her loved '[1967-e] [e]1967-e wi ' all [her]1968-her '[1967-e] eart , as [I]0-i , what knawed [her]1968-her , can testify to . " " No more o ' that , " [he]0-i said , " [the gal]3893-the gal 's comin '[1967-e] . Thank [God]179-god [she]1968-her ban't no cheel o ' mine — thank [God]179-god , as '[1968-her] ave tawld [me]0-i ' tedn '[0-i] so . [He]0-i whispered it , an ' [I]0-i put it away an '[0-i] away . Now [I]0-i knaws . [You]1969-you bide here , [Thomasin Tregenza]201-thomasin , and [I]0-i 'll speak what 's fittin ' . " Thus in one moment this hideous conviction was stamped upon [the man]3494-the man 's soul for life . [He]0-i judged [the dead mother]4746-the dead mother by [the daughter]4747-the daughter and visited [the child]758-the child 's sin upon [the parent]4749-the parent 's memory . Any conclusion more monstrous , more directly opposed to every natural instinct , can hardly be conceived , but [the man]3494-the man had been strangling natural instincts for fifty years . Only pride of [family]4751-family remained . There were but [few Tregenzas]4752-few tregenzas left and soon there would be none unless [Tom]199-tom carried on the name . [Michael]204-gray michael was the quintessence of the Tregenza spirit , the fruit of generations , the high - water mark . [He]204-gray michael stood on that giddy pinnacle which has religious mania for its precipice . To damn [a dead woman]4753-a dead woman was easier than to accept [a wanton daughter]4754-a wanton daughter . Better [an unfaithful wife than that any soul born of Tregenza blood]4755-an unfaithful wife than that any soul born of tregenza blood should be lost . So [he]0-i washed [his]0-i hands of both , thanking [God]179-god , who had launched the truth into [his]0-i mind at last ; and then [he]0-i rose to [his]0-i feet as [Joan]183-joan entered [the room]4756-the room . [She]183-joan stood for a moment in the doorway with [her]183-joan blue eyes fixed in amazement upon the kitchen table . Then [she]183-joan grew very red to the roots of [her]183-joan hair and came forward . There was almost a joy in [her]183-joan mind that the long story of falsehood must end at last . [She]183-joan did not fear [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father now and looked up into [his]3642-her father face quite calmly as [she]183-joan approached the table . " These be [mine]183-joan , " [she]183-joan said . " Was it [you]3642-her father , [faither]579-faither , as took ['em]4759-'em[0-i] from wheer [they]1970-they was ? " " ' Twas [me]0-i , [Joan]183-joan , " answered [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza ; " an '[0-i] [I]0-i judge [the Lard]1026-the lard led [me]0-i . " [The girl]521-the girl stood erect and scornful . " [I]0-i 'm glad [you]3642-her father found [them]1970-they ; now [I]521-the girl can tell the truth . " " Truth ! " thundered [Michael]204-gray michael . " Truth — what do [you]3494-the man knaw 'bout[521-the girl] Truth , darter o ' [Baal]101-baal ? [Your]3494-the man life 's a lie , [your]3494-the man tongue 's rotten in [your]3494-the man mouth wi '[3494-the man] lyin ' . Never look in no honest faace agin ! " " [You]3494-the man 'd do best to bide still while [I]3494-the man tell '[3494-the man] [e]1973-e what this here means , " said [Joan]183-joan quietly . [The man]3494-the man 's anger alarmed [her]183-joan no more than the squeak of a caged rat . " [I]0-i ban't [no darter o ' Baal]4760-no darter o ' baal , an '[3494-the man] the money 's come by honest . [I]0-i 've lied afore , but never shall again . An ' [I]3494-the man 've let [Joe]192-joe go '[3494-the man] is ways thinkin ' [I]3494-the man loved en , which [I]3494-the man doan't . [I]3494-the man be tokened to [a furriner from [London]45-london]4761-a furriner from london , an '[3494-the man] [he]3494-the man 's took [me]0-i for [his]3494-the man awn , an ' [he]3494-the man be gwaine to come down - long mighty soon an '[3494-the man] take [me]0-i away . But [I]0-i could n't tell ' [e]1976-e nothin' of that 'cause[3494-the man] [he]3494-the man bid [me]0-i keep [my]0-i mouth shut . So [theer]1975-theer . " " ' Took '[1976-e] [e]1976-e for ' is awn '[3494-the man] ! Wheer is [he]3494-the man , then ? Why be [you]0-i here ? " " [He'm]3494-the man comin ' , [I]1976-e tell '[1976-e] [e.]1976-e [He'm]3494-the man [a true man]1977-a true man , an ' [he]3494-the man shawed [me]3494-the man what '[3494-the man] tis to love . " " Bought [you]0-i , [you damned harlot]1978-you damned harlot ! " [She]1979-she knew the word was vile , but a shred of [John Barron]176-barron 's philosophy supported [her]1979-she . " [My]0-i awnly sin is [I]0-i 've lied to [you]0-i , [faither]579-faither ; an ' [you]0-i 've no right to call [me]579-faither evil names . " " Never call [me]579-faither [faither]579-faither no more , [lewd slut]4763-lewd slut ! [I]579-faither be [no faither o '[579-faither] thine]4764-no faither o ' thine , nor never was . God A'mighty ! [a Tregenza a wanton]1981-a tregenza a wanton ! [I]0-i 'd rather cut [my]0-i hand off than b'lieve it so . It 's this — this — blood - money — the price o ' a damned sawl ! No more lyin '[0-i] . [I]0-i knaw — [I]0-i knaw — an ' the picksher — [the ship of [a true man]1977-a true man]4765-the ship of a true man . It did ought to break [your]1982-you heart to see it , if [you]1982-you had wan . [A devil - spawned painting feller]4767-a devil - spawned painting feller , in [coorse]64-coorse . An '[0-i] [his]0-i black heart happy an ' content 'cause[0-i] [he've]0-i sent this filth . [You]1982-you stare , wi ' [[your]1982-you mother]1023-your mother 's eyes — [you]1982-you stare , an '[1982-you] stare . [Hell]102-hell 's yawning for ' [e]4769-e , [wretched wummon]4770-wretched wummon , an '[1982-you] for [him]0-i as brot ' e to it ! " " [He]0-i doan't believe in [hell]700-hell , no more doan't [I]1982-you , " said [Joan]183-joan calmly ; " an '[1982-you] it ban't [a faither]1983-a faither 's plaace to damn 's awn flaish an ' blood no way . " " Never name [me]1984-i [[thy]1983-a faither faither]4772-thy faither no more ! [I]1984-i ban't [[your]1983-a faither faither]1212-your faither , [I]1984-i tell '[1984-i] [e]1984-i , an ' [I]1984-i do never mean to see [thy]1983-a faither faace agin . Go wheer [you'm]1983-a faither minded ; but get '[1984-i] [e]1984-i gone from here . Tramp [the broad road]1985-the broad road with [the crowd]1986-the crowd — [the narrer path 's closed agin ' e.]4774-the narrer path 's closed agin ' e. And this — this — let it burn same as [him]0-i what sent it will . " [He]0-i picked up the note nearest to [him]0-i , crumpled it into a ball and flung it upon the fire . " [Michael]204-gray michael , [Michael]204-gray michael ! " cried [[his]0-i wife]843-his wife , rushing forward , " for [God]179-god 's love , what be doin' of ? The money ban't damned ; the money 's honest ! " But [Joan]183-joan did more than speak . As the gift flamed quickly up , then sunk to gray ash , a tempest of passion carried [her]183-joan out of [herself]183-joan . [She]183-joan trembled in [her]183-joan limbs , grew deadly pale , and flew at [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father like a tigress . No evil word had ever crossed [her]183-joan lips till then , though they had echoed in [her]183-joan ears often enough . But now they jumped to [her]183-joan tongue , and [she]183-joan cursed [Gray Michael]204-gray michael and tore the rest of the money out of [his]0-i hand so quickly that [his]0-i intention of burning it was frustrated . " It 's mine , it 's [mine]0-i , blast [you]0-i ! " [she]183-joan screamed like a fury , " what right have [you]0-i to steal it ? It 's [mine]0-i — gived [me]1986-the crowd by wan whose shoe [you]1987-you ban't worthy to latch ! [He]0-i 's shawed [me]1986-the crowd what [you]1987-you be , an '[1986-the crowd] the likes o ' [you]1987-you , wi '[0-i] [your]1987-you hell - fire an ' prayin '[0-i] an ' sour looks . [I]1987-you ban't afeared '[1987-you] o [you]1987-you no more — none o ' [you]1987-you . [I]0-i be sick o '[0-i] the smeech o ' [[your]1987-you God]4777-your god . '[0-i] Er 's a poor thing alongside o ' [mine]4778-mine an '[241-mister jan] [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's . [I]0-i 'll gaw , [I]0-i 'll gaw so far away as ever [I]0-i can ; an ' [I]1988-i 'll never call '[1988-i] [e]1988-i [[my]0-i faither]967-my faither agin , s'elp [me]0-i [God]179-god ! " [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza had thanked [Providence]285-providence under [her]198-mrs. tregenza breath when [Joan]183-joan rescued the notes , but now , almost for the first time , [she]183-joan realized that [her]183-joan own interest in this pile of money was as nothing . Every penny belonged to [[her]183-joan stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter , and [[her]183-joan stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter evidently meant to keep it . This discovery hit [her]183-joan hard , and now the bitterness came forth in a flood of words that tumbled each over the other and stung like hornets as they settled . [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's broadside had roared harmlessly over [Joan]183-joan 's erect head ; [Thomasin]201-thomasin 's small shot did not miss the mark . [She]183-joan was furious ; [[her]183-joan husband]605-her husband stood dumb ; [her]183-joan virago tongue hissed the truth ; and [Joan]183-joan , listening , knew that it was the truth . No matter what [the elder woman]1993-the elder woman said . [She]183-joan missed no vile word of [them]1994-them all . [She]183-joan called [Joan]183-joan every name that chills the ear of [the fallen]1995-the fallen ; and [she]183-joan explained the meaning of [her]183-joan expressions ; [she]183-joan bid [the girl]521-the girl take [herself]521-the girl and [the love - child within [her]521-the girl from out the sight of [honest folks]1998-honest folks]1997-the love - child within her from out the sight of honest folks ; [she]183-joan told [her]183-joan [the man]3494-the man had turned [his]3494-the man back forever , that only the ashy road of the ruined remained for [her]183-joan to tread . And that was how the great news that [Nature]178-nature had looked upon [her]183-joan for [a mother]4639-a mother came to [Joan Tregenza]183-joan . Here was the riddle of the mysterious voice unraveled ; here was the secret of [her]183-joan physical sorrows made clear . [She]183-joan looked wildly from [one]3502-one to the other — from [the man]3494-the man to [the woman]4662-the woman ; then [she]183-joan tottered a step away , clutching [her]183-joan money and [her]183-joan little picture to [her]183-joan breast ; and then [she]183-joan rolled over , a huddled , senseless heap , upon the floor . When [Joan]183-joan recovered consciousness [she]183-joan found [her]183-joan head and neck wet where [[her]183-joan stepmother]760-her stepmother had flung cold water over [her]183-joan . [Thomasin]201-thomasin was at that moment burning a feather under [her]201-thomasin nose , but [she]201-thomasin stopped and withdrew it as [the girl]521-the girl 's eyes opened . " [Theer]521-the girl , now [you]521-the girl 'll be well by night . [He've]2006-he've gone aboard . Best to change [your]521-the girl gownd , for ' tis wetted . Then [I]2006-he've 'll tell [']521-the girl[2006-he've] [e]521-the girl what [']521-the girl er said . Can '[521-the girl] [e]521-the girl get [upstairs]2007-upstairs ? " [Joan]183-joan rose slowly and went with swimming brain to [[her]183-joan room]4592-her room . [She]183-joan still held [her]183-joan picture and [her]183-joan money . [She]183-joan took off [her]183-joan wet clothes , then sat down upon [her]183-joan bed to think ; and as [her]183-joan mind grew clear , there crept through the gloomy shadows of the past tragedy a joy . It lightened [her]183-joan heart a moment , then vanished again , like the moon blotted suddenly from the sky by a rack of storm - cloud . [Joan]183-joan was full of the stupendous news . The shock of hearing [her]183-joan most unsuspected condition had indeed stricken [her]183-joan insensible , but it was the surprise of it more than the dismay . Now [she]183-joan viewed the circumstance with uncertainty , not knowing the attitude " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " would adopt toward it . [She]183-joan argued with [herself]183-joan long hours , and peace brooded over [her]183-joan at the end ; for , as [his]241-mister jan cherished utterances passed in review before [her]183-joan memory , the sense and sum of them seemed to promise well . [He]241-mister jan would be very glad to share in the little life that was upon the way to [earth]1877-earth . [He]241-mister jan always spoke kindly of [children]1425-children ; [he]241-mister jan had called [them]1425-children the flower - buds in [Nature]178-nature 's lap . Yes , [he]241-mister jan must be glad ; and [Nature]178-nature would smile too . [Nature]178-nature knew what it was to be [a mother]4639-a mother , [Joan]183-joan told [herself]183-joan . [She]183-joan was in [Nature]178-nature 's hand henceforth . But [her]183-joan blue eyes grew cold when [she]183-joan thought of the morning . So much for [St. Madron]249-st. madron and [his]249-st. madron holy water ; so much for [the good angels who [[her]183-joan dead parent]725-her dead parent had told [her]183-joan were forever stretching loving , invisible hands to guard and shield]2012-the good angels who her dead parent had told her were forever stretching loving , invisible hands to guard and shield . " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's be [the awnly God]2014-the awnly god , " [she]183-joan thought , " an ' [He'm]241-mister jan tu far aways to mind the likes o '[2015-we] [we]2015-we ; so [us]2015-we must trust to the gert Mother o ' the flowers . " [She]183-joan accepted the position with an open heart , then turned [her]183-joan thoughts to [[her]183-joan loved one]4564-her loved one . [Having]313-having now firmly convinced [herself]183-joan that [her]183-joan condition would bring [him]241-mister jan gratification and draw [them]4780-them still nearer each to [the other]3475-the other , [Joan]183-joan yearned unutterably for [his]241-mister jan presence . [She]183-joan puzzled [her]183-joan brains to know how [she]183-joan might communicate with [him]241-mister jan , how hasten [his]241-mister jan return . [She]183-joan remembered that [he]241-mister jan had once told [her]183-joan [his]241-mister jan surname , but [she]183-joan could not recollect it now . [He]241-mister jan had always been " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " to [her]183-joan . [She]183-joan went down to [her]183-joan supper in the course of the evening , and the great matter in [her]183-joan mind was for a while put aside before a present necessity . Action , [she]183-joan found , would be immediately required of [her]183-joan . [[Her]183-joan father]3642-her father , before going from [the kitchen]860-the kitchen after [she]183-joan had fainted , directed [Thomasin]201-thomasin to bid [her]183-joan never see [his]241-mister jan face again . [She]183-joan must depart , according to [his]241-mister jan direction , on the following day ; for [the thatched cottage upon [the cliff]4179-the cliff]4784-the thatched cottage upon the cliff could be [[her]183-joan home]1297-her home no more . " [Theer]2017-you weern't no time for talkin '[183-joan] ; but [I]0-i lay ' er'll sing differ'nt when next ashore . [You]2017-you bide quiet here till '[183-joan] er 's [home]453-home agin . ' Tain't nachur to bid 's awn flaish an '[0-i] blood go its ways like that . An ' , '[2017-you] pears to [me]0-i , as ' tedn '[2017-you] the law neither . But [you]2017-you bide till he'm back . [I]0-i be sorry as [I]0-i spawk so sharp , but [you]2017-you was that bowldacious that [my]0-i dander brawk loose . [Aw Jimmery]224-jimmery ! to think as [you]2017-you dedn ' knaw [you]2017-you was cheeldin '[2017-you] ! " " ' Twas hearin '[2017-you] so suddint like as made [me]0-i come over fainty . " " Ate hearty then . An ' mind henceforrard [you'm]2017-you feedin '[2017-you] an ' drinkin '[2017-you] for two . Best get to bed so soon 's [you]2017-you can . [Us'll]2018-us'll talk 'bout this coil in the marnin '[2018-us'll] . " " [Us'll]2018-us'll talk now . [I]0-i be off by light . [I]0-i ' edn '[0-i] gwaine to stop no more . [Faither]196-mister jan. sez [I]0-i ban't no cheel o ' [his]196-mister jan. an '[196-mister jan.] [he]196-mister jan. doan't want to see [my]0-i faace agen . Then [he]196-mister jan. shaan't . [I]0-i 'll gaw to [them]2019-them as wo n't be ' shamed o '[196-mister jan.] [me]0-i : [[my]0-i mother 's [people]749-people]2020-my mother 's people . " " Doan't ' [e]4787-e be in no tearin '[198-mrs. tregenza] hurry , [Joan]183-joan , " said [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza , thinking of the money . " Let [him]196-mister jan. , [the chap]3951-the chap , knaw fust what 's come along o ' [[his]196-mister jan. carneying]4788-his carneying , an '[3951-the chap] maybe [he]196-mister jan. 'll marry [']2023-en [e]2023-en , as [you]183-joan sez , right away . Bide wi '[198-mrs. tregenza] [me]0-i till [you]183-joan tells en . Let [en]2023-en do what 's right an ' seemly . That 's [the shortest road]4789-the shortest road . " " [Iss fay]194-iss ; [he'm]194-iss [a true man]1977-a true man . But [I]2023-en ban't [gwaine]4791-gwaine to wait for [en]2023-en in this '[2023-en] ouse . To - morrow [I]0-i 'll send [my]0-i box up Drift by the fust omblibus as belongs to [Staaft]314-staaft , an ' walk [myself]199-tom , an '[199-tom] tell [Uncle Thomas]199-tom all 's there is to tell . [He've]199-tom got a heart in [his]199-tom breast , an ' [I]199-tom 'll bide '[199-tom] long wi ' [him]199-tom till [Mister Jan]241-mister jan do come back . " " Wheer 's [he]199-tom to now ? " " To [Lunnon]73-lunnon . [He've]199-tom gone to make [[his]199-tom house]4385-his house vitty for [me]199-tom . " " Well , best to get [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin to write to [en]2024-en , onless [you]2024-en 'd like [me]199-tom to do it for '[199-tom] [e.]2024-en " " No . [He]199-tom 'll do what 's right — [a proper , braave man]2025-a proper , braave man . " " An ' mazin '[199-tom] rich seemin'ly . For [the Lard]200-the lard 's love , if [you'm]2026-you'm gwaine up [Drift]15-drift , take care o ' all that blessed money . Doan't say no word 'bout[2026-you'm] it till [you'm]2026-you'm in [the farm]3904-the farm , for [theer]2028-theer 's [them]2029-them — the tinners out o ' work an '[521-the girl] sich — as ' ud knock '[2024-en] [e]2024-en on the head for half of it . To think as [Michael]204-gray michael burned a hunderd pound ! Just a flicker o ' purpley fire an '[204-gray michael] a hunderd pound gone ! ' Tis '[204-gray michael] nough to make a body rave . " [The girl]521-the girl flushed , and something of [[her]521-the girl father]3642-her father 's stern look seemed reflected in [her]521-the girl face . " [He]199-tom stawl [my]0-i money . No , [I]0-i judge [his]199-tom word be truth : [he'm]199-tom no faither o ' [mine]0-i if the blood in the veins do count for anything . " [Joan]183-joan went to bed abruptly on this remark , and lay awake thinking and wondering through a long night — thinking what [she]183-joan should say to [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , wondering when " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " was coming back to [her]183-joan , and picturing [his]251-uncle chirgwin excitement at [her]183-joan intelligence . In the morning [she]183-joan packed [her]183-joan box , ate [her]183-joan breakfast , and then went into [the village]423-the village to find [somebody who would carry [her]183-joan scanty luggage as far as [Penzance]7-penzance]4794-somebody who would carry her scanty luggage as far as penzance . From there , [an omnibus]4795-an omnibus ran through [Drift]15-drift , past [[Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin 's farmhouse door]4796-mr. chirgwin 's farmhouse door . [Joan]183-joan [herself]183-joan designed to walk , the distance by road from [Newlyn]1-newlyn being but trifling . It chanced that [the girl]521-the girl met [Billy Jago]188-billy jago , [he]188-billy jago who in early spring had cut down an elm tree while [John Barron]176-barron watched . [Him]188-billy jago [Joan]183-joan knew , for [he]188-billy jago had worked on [[[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle 's farm]4799-her uncle 's farm for many years . [Mr. Jago]315-mr. jago , who could be relied upon to do simple offices , undertook the task readily enough and presently arrived with a wheelbarrow . [He]315-mr. jago whined , as ever , about [his]315-mr. jago physical sufferings , but drank a cup of tea with evident enjoyment , then fetched [Joan]183-joan 's box from [[her]183-joan room]4592-her room and set off with [it]4801-it to meet [the public vehicle]4802-the public vehicle . [Her]183-joan goods were to be left at [Drift]15-drift , and [Joan]183-joan [herself]183-joan started at an early hour , wishing to be at [the farm]3904-the farm before [[her]183-joan property]4804-her property . [She]183-joan walked in [the garden]3656-the garden for the last time , marked the magic progress of spring , then took an unemotional leave of [[her]183-joan stepmother]760-her stepmother . " There '[199-tom] edn ' no call to leave no message as [I]2033-i can see , " said [Joan]183-joan , while [she]183-joan stood at the door . " [He]315-mr. jago ban't [[my]2033-i faither]967-my faither , [he]315-mr. jago sez , so [I]2033-i 'll take it for truth . But [I]2033-i 'll ask [you]183-joan to kiss [Tom]199-tom for [me]2033-i . [Us]4808-us was [allus good brother]4809-allus good brother an '[2033-i] [sister]2032-sister , whether or no ; an ' [I]2033-i loves en dearly . " " [Iss]194-iss , [I]2033-i knaw . [He]2033-i 'll grizzle an '[2033-i] fret proper when [he]2033-i finds [you'm]2034-you'm gone . Good - by to ' [e.]2035-e. May [the Lard]1026-the lard forgive '[2035-e.] [e]2035-e. , an ' send [[your]2036-i man]4811-your man '[2035-e.] long smart ; an ' for heaven 's sake doan't lose [them]4812-them notes . " " [They]4812-them be safe stawed next to [my]2036-i skin . [Uncle Chirgwin'll]316-uncle chirgwin'll look to [them]4812-them ; an '[2036-i] [you]2036-i need n't be axin ' [God]179-god A'mighty to forgive [me]2036-i , 'cause[2036-i] [I]0-i abbun done nothin' to want it . [I]0-i be Nature 's cheel now ; an ' [I]2036-i be in kindly hands . [You]2036-i caan't understand that , but [I]2036-i knaws what [I]2036-i knaws through bein '[2036-i] taught . Good - by to ' [e.]2035-e. Maybe us'll see each other bimebye . " [Joan]183-joan held out [her]183-joan hand and [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza shook it . Then [she]183-joan stood and watched [[her]183-joan stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter walk away into [Newlyn]1-newlyn . The day was cold and unpleasant , with high winds and driving mists . [The village]423-the village looked grayer than usual ; [the boats]4815-the boats were nearly all away ; the gulls fluttered in [the harbor]458-the harbor making [their]4817-their eternal music . Seaward , white horses flecked the leaden water ; [a steamer]548-a steamer hooted hoarsely , looming large under the low , sullen sky , as it came between [the pierheads]4819-the pierheads . Presently a scat of heavy rain on a squall of wind shut out [the harbor]458-the harbor for a time . [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza waited until [Joan]183-joan had disappeared , then went back to [[her]198-mrs. tregenza kitchen]4821-her kitchen , closed the door , sat in [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's great chair by the hearth , put [her]198-mrs. tregenza apron over [her]198-mrs. tregenza head and wept . But the exact reason for [her]198-mrs. tregenza tears [she]198-mrs. tregenza could not have explained , for [she]198-mrs. tregenza did not know it . Mingled emotions possessed [her]198-mrs. tregenza . Disappointment had something to do with this present grief ; sorrow for [Joan]183-joan was also responsible for it in a measure . That [the girl]521-the girl should have asked [her]183-joan to kiss [Tom]199-tom was good , [Thomasin]201-thomasin thought , and the reflection moved [her]198-mrs. tregenza to further tears ; while that [Joan]183-joan was going to put [her]183-joan money into the keeping of [a simple old fool]4823-a simple old fool like [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin seemed a highly pathetic circumstance to [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza . Indeed , the more [she]198-mrs. tregenza speculated upon it the sadder it appeared . Meanwhile [Joan]183-joan , leaving [Newlyn]1-newlyn and turning inland along [the little lane which has [St. Peter]39-st. peter 's church]4824-the little lane which has st. peter 's church and [the Newlyn brook]4825-the newlyn brook upon [its]4824-the little lane which has st. peter 's church right , escaped the wind and found [herself]183-joan walking through an emerald woodland world all wrapped in haze and rain . Past [the smelting works]4826-the smelting works , where purple smoke made wonderful color in rising against the young green , over [the brook]1099-the brook and under [the avenue of great elms]4828-the avenue of great elms went [Joan]183-joan . [Her]183-joan heart ached this morning , and [she]183-joan thought of yesterday . It seemed as though a hundred years of experience had passed over [her]183-joan since [she]183-joan knelt by [[St. Madron]249-st. madron 's stone altar]4829-st. madron 's stone altar . [She]183-joan told [herself]183-joan bitterly how much wiser [she]183-joan was to - day , and , so thinking strange thoughts , tramped forward over [Buryas Bridge]104-buryas bridge , and faced [the winding hill beyond]4830-the winding hill beyond . Then came doubts . Perhaps after all [St. Madron]249-st. madron had answered [her]183-joan prayer . Else why the underlying joy that now fringed [her]183-joan sorrows with happiness ? [Drift]15-drift is [a place well named , when seen , as then , gray through sad - colored curtains of rain on [the bare hilltop]4832-the bare hilltop]4831-a place well named , when seen , as then , gray through sad - colored curtains of rain on the bare hilltop . But [the orchard lands of the coomb below]4833-the orchard lands of the coomb below were fair , and many primroses twinkled in the soaking green of the tall hedge - banks . [Joan]183-joan splashed along through the mud , and presently a lump rose in [her]183-joan throat , born of thoughts . It had seemed nothing to leave the nest on [the cliff]4179-the cliff , and [she]183-joan held [her]183-joan head high and thanked [God]179-god for a great deliverance . That was less than an hour ago ; yet here , on [the last hill to Drift]4835-the last hill to drift and within sight of [the stone houses clustering at the summit]4836-the stone houses clustering at the summit , [her]183-joan head sank lower and lower , and it was not the rain which dimmed [her]183-joan eyes . [She]183-joan much doubted the value of further prayers now , yet every frantic hope and aspiration found its vent in a petition to [[her]183-joan new God]4837-her new god , as [Joan]183-joan mounted [the hill]533-the hill . [She]183-joan prayed , because [she]183-joan could think of no other way to soothe [her]183-joan heart ; but [her]183-joan mind was very weary and sad — not at the spectacle of the future , for that [she]183-joan knew was going to be fair enough — but at the vision of the past , at the years ended forever , at the early pages of life closed and locked , to be opened again no more . A childhood , mostly quite happy , was over ; [she]183-joan would probably visit [the house wherein [she]183-joan was born never again]4839-the house wherein she was born never again . But even in [her]183-joan sorrow , [the girl]521-the girl wondered why [she]183-joan should be sad . [[Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin 's farm]4841-mr. chirgwin 's farm fronted [the highway]4842-the highway , and [its]4841-mr. chirgwin 's farm gray stone face was separated therefrom by a small and neat patch of [garden]4680-garden . Below [the house]592-the house a gate opened into [the farmyard]4845-the farmyard , and [[Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's land]4846-uncle chirgwin 's land chiefly sloped away into the coomb behind , though certain fields upon [the opposite side of [the highroad]4848-the highroad]4847-the opposite side of the highroad also pertained to [him]251-uncle chirgwin . [The farmhouse]4849-the farmhouse was time - stained , and the stone had taken some wealth of color where black and golden lichens fretted it . The slates of the roof shone with wet and reflected a streak of white light that now broke the clouds near the hidden sun . The drippings from the eaves had made a neat row of little regular holes among the crocuses in [the garden]3656-the garden . Tall jonquils also bent [their]4851-their heads there , heavy with water , and the white violets which stood in patches upon either side of the front door had each a raindrop glimmering within its cup . A japonica splashed one gray wall with crimson blossoms and young green leaves ; but , for the rest , [this house - front]4852-this house - front was quite bare . [Joan]183-joan saw [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary 's neat hand in the snowy short blinds which crossed the upper windows ; and [she]183-joan knew that the geraniums behind the diamond panes of [the parlor]1164-the parlor were [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle 's care . [They]4855-they dwelt indoors , winter and summer , and [their]4855-they lanky , straggling limbs shut out much light . [The visitor]3530-the visitor did not go to the front door , whither [a narrow path , flanked with handsome masses of " Cornish diamonds , " or quartz crystals]4857-a narrow path , flanked with handsome masses of " cornish diamonds , " or quartz crystals , directly led from the wicket , but entered at a larger gate which led into [the farmyard]4845-the farmyard . [Here]432-here [cattle - byres and shippons]4860-cattle - byres and shippons ranged snugly on three sides of an open space , [their]4860-cattle - byres and shippons venerable slates yellow with lichens , [their]4860-cattle - byres and shippons thatches green with moss . In the center of [the yard]1477-the yard a great manure heap made comfortable lying for pigs and poultry ; while [the farmhouse]4849-the farmhouse stretched back upon the fourth side . Another gate opened beyond [it]432-here , and led to [the land upon [the sloping hill]4864-the sloping hill]4863-the land upon the sloping hill and in [the valley below]4865-the valley below . [Joan]183-joan passed a row of cream pans , shining like frosted silver in the mist , then turned from [the bleak and dripping world]4866-the bleak and dripping world . The kitchen door was open , and revealed [a large , low chamber whose rafters were studded with orange - colored hams , whose fireplace was vast and black save for a small wood fire filling but a quarter of the hearth]4867-a large , low chamber whose rafters were studded with orange - colored hams , whose fireplace was vast and black save for a small wood fire filling but a quarter of the hearth . Grocer 's almanacs brought brave color to the walls , sharing the same with a big dresser where the china made a play of reflected light from the windows . Above the lofty mantel - piece there hung an old fowling - piece , and a row of faded Daguerreotypes , into most of which damp had eaten dull yellow patches . The mantel - shelf carried some rough stoneware ornaments , an eight - day clock , a tobacco jar , and divers small utensils of polished tin . A big table covered with American cloth filled the center of [the kitchen]860-the kitchen , a low settle crossed the alcove of the window , and a leather screen , of four folds and five feet high , surrounded [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's own roomy armchair in the chimney - corner . Strips of cocoanut fiber lay upon the ground , but between [them]4855-they appeared the bare floor . [It]432-here was paved with blue stone for the most part , though here and there a square of white broke the color ; and the white patches had worn lower than the rest under many generations of hobnailed boots . A faint odor of hams was in the air , and the slight , stuffy smell of feathers . [A woman]3541-a woman sat in the window as [Joan]183-joan entered . [She]3541-a woman had [her]3541-a woman back to the door , and not hearing the footfall , went on with [her]3541-a woman work , which was the plucking of a fowl . A cloth lay spread over the floor at [her]3541-a woman feet , and each moment the pile of feathers upon it increased as [the plucker]4870-the plucker worked with rhythmic regularity and sang to [herself]4870-the plucker the while . [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary was [a dark , good - looking girl , with a face in which strong character appeared too prominently shadowed to leave room for absolute beauty]4871-a dark , good - looking girl , with a face in which strong character appeared too prominently shadowed to leave room for absolute beauty . But [her]222-mary features were regular if swarthy ; [her]222-mary eyes were splendid , and [her]222-mary brow , from which black hair was smoothly and plainly parted away , rose broad and low . There was nothing to mark kinship between [the cousins]4872-the cousins save that [both]3485-both held [their]3485-both heads finely and possessed something of the same distinction of carriage . [Mary]222-mary was eight - and - twenty , and , whatever might be thought about [her]222-mary face , there could be but one opinion upon [her]222-mary feminine splendor of figure . [Her]222-mary broad chest produced a strange speaking and singing voice — mellow as [Joan]183-joan 's , but far deeper in the notes . [Mary]222-mary gloried in congregational melodies , and [those who had not before heard [her]222-mary efforts at [church]581-church on Sundays]4874-those who had not before heard her efforts at church on sundays would often mistake [her]222-mary voice for [a man]467-a man 's . [She]222-mary was dressed in print with a big apron overall ; and [her]222-mary sleeves , turned up to [her]222-mary elbows , showed a pair of fine arms , perfect as to shape , but brown of color as [the woman]4662-the woman 's face . [Joan]183-joan stood motionless , then [[her]183-joan cousin]4878-her cousin looked round suddenly and started almost out of [her]4878-her cousin chair at a sight so unexpected . But [she]183-joan composed [herself]183-joan again instantly , put down the semi - naked fowl and came forward . [They]4879-they had not seen [each other]512-each other since the time when [Joe Noy]192-joe flung over [Mary]222-mary for [Joan]183-joan ; and [the latter]4881-the latter , remembering this circumstance very well , had hoped [she]183-joan might escape from meeting [[her]183-joan cousin]4878-her cousin until after some talk with [Uncle Thomas]199-tom . But [Mary]222-mary hid [her]222-mary emotion from [Joan]183-joan 's sight , and [they]4879-they shook hands and looked into [one another]4213-one another 's faces , each noting marked changes there since the last occasion of [their]4879-they meeting . [The elder]4884-the elder spoke first , and went straight to the past . It was [her]4884-the elder nature to have every connection and concern of life upon a definite and clear understanding . [She]4884-the elder hated mystery , [she]4884-the elder disliked things hidden , [she]4884-the elder never allowed the relations between [herself]4884-the elder and [any living being]4885-any living being to stand otherwise than absolutely defined . " Without waiting for more words [Joan]183-joan departed , hastened through the gate on [the inner wall of [the farmyard]4845-the farmyard]4892-the inner wall of the farmyard and walked along [the steep hillside]4894-the steep hillside by [a lane which wound muddily downward to [the grasslands]4896-the grasslands]4895-a lane which wound muddily downward to the grasslands , under high hazel hedges . The new leaves dripped showers at every gust of the wind , then a gleam of wan sunlight brightened distant vistas of the way , while [Joan]183-joan heard the patter of a hundred hoofs in the mud , the bleat of lambs , the deeper answer of ewes , the barking of [a shepherd]4897-a shepherd 's dog . Soon [the cavalcade]4898-the cavalcade came into view — [a flock of sheep]4899-a flock of sheep first , a black and white dog with a black and white pup , which was learning [his]2039-i business , next , and [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin [himself]251-uncle chirgwin bringing up the rear . The first sunshine of the day seemed to have found [him]2039-i out . It shone over [his]2039-i round red face and twinkled in the dew on [his]2039-i white whiskers . [He]2039-i stumped along upon short , gaitered legs , but went not fast , and stayed at [the steep shoulder of [the hill]533-the hill]4900-the steep shoulder of the hill that [his]2039-i lambs might have rest and time to suck . [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary meantime speculated on this sudden mystery of [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin 's arrival . [She]222-mary spread the cloth for dinner , bid [[her]222-mary maid]4903-her maid lay another place for [Joan]183-joan and wondered much what manner of news [she]222-mary brought . There were changes in [Joan]183-joan 's face since [she]222-mary saw it last — not changes which might have been attributed to the possession of [Joe Noy]192-joe , but an alteration of expression betokening thought , a look of increased age , of experiences not wholly happy in their nature . And [Joan]183-joan had also marked the changes in [Mary]222-mary . These indications were clear enough and filled [her]222-mary with sorrow . A river of tears will leave its bed marked upon [a woman]3541-a woman 's face ; and [Joan]183-joan , who had never thought overmuch of [[her]183-joan cousin]4878-her cousin 's sorrows until then , began to feel [her]183-joan heart fill and run over with sudden sympathy . [She]183-joan asked [herself]183-joan what life would look like for [her]183-joan if " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " ; changed [his]241-mister jan mind now and never came back again . That was how [Mary]222-mary felt doubtless when [Joe Noy]192-joe left [her]222-mary . [Already Joan]183-joan grew zealous in thought for [Mary]222-mary . [She]183-joan would teach [her]222-mary something of that sweet wisdom which was to support [her]222-mary own burden in the future ; [she]183-joan would tell [her]222-mary about [Nature]178-nature — the " All - Mother " as " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " called [her]222-mary once . And , concerning [Joe Noy]192-joe — might it be within the bounds of possibility , within the power of time to bring [these two]4906-these two together again ? The thought was good to [Joan]183-joan , and wholly occupied [her]183-joan mind until the sight of [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin with [his]251-uncle chirgwin sheep brought [her]183-joan back to the present moment and [her]183-joan own affairs . When [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin caught sight of [Joan]183-joan [his]189-mr. chirgwin astonishment knew no bounds , and [his]189-mr. chirgwin first thought was that something must certainly be amiss . " [He]0-i tried hard to put a hopeful face upon the position and , [himself]0-i as simple as [a child]4285-a child , presently found [Joan]183-joan 's story not hopeless at all . To love [Nature]178-nature was no sin ; [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin [himself]189-mr. chirgwin did so ; and as for the money , instead of reading the truth of it , [he]189-mr. chirgwin told [himself]189-mr. chirgwin very wisely that [the giver of a sum so tremendous]4935-the giver of a sum so tremendous must at least be in earnest . The amount astounded [him]189-mr. chirgwin . [Fired]320-fired by [Joan]183-joan 's words , for as [he]0-i played the ready listener [her]183-joan eloquence increased , [he]0-i fell to thinking as [she]183-joan thought , and even speaking hopefully . [The old farmer]4936-the old farmer 's reflections merely echoed [his]0-i own simple trust in [men]3512-men and had best not been uttered , for [they]3512-men raised [Joan]183-joan 's spirits to a futile height . But [he]0-i caught the contagion from [her]183-joan and spoke with sanguine words of the future , and even prayed [Joan]183-joan that , if wealth and a noble position awaited [her]183-joan , [she]183-joan would endeavor to brighten the lives of [the poor]4938-the poor as became [a good Cornish woman]4939-a good cornish woman . This [she]183-joan solemnly promised , and [they]4940-they built castles in the air : [two children]4941-two children together . [His]0-i sheep driven to [[their]4940-they new pasture]4942-their new pasture , [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin led the way [home]453-home and listened as [he]251-uncle chirgwin walked to [Joan]183-joan 's story . [She]183-joan quite convinced [him]251-uncle chirgwin before [he]251-uncle chirgwin reached [[his]251-uncle chirgwin kitchen]4944-his kitchen door — partly because [he]251-uncle chirgwin was very well content to be convinced , partly because [he]251-uncle chirgwin could honestly imagine [no man]3523-no man base enough to betray [this particular blue - eyed child]4946-this particular blue - eyed child . [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin 's extremely unworldly review of the position was balm to [Joan]183-joan . [Her]183-joan heart grew warm again , and [the old man]3536-the old man 's philosophy brightened [her]183-joan face , as the sun , now making a great clearness after rain , brightened the face of [the land]3578-the land . But the recollection of [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary sobered [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle not a little . How [she]183-joan would take this tremendous intelligence [he]251-uncle chirgwin failed to guess remotely . Opportunity to impart it occurred sooner than [he]251-uncle chirgwin expected , for [Joan]183-joan 's box had just arrived . During dinner [the old man]3536-the old man explained that [[his]3536-the old man niece]3958-his niece was to be [a visitor at [Drift]15-drift]4952-a visitor at drift for a term of uncertain duration ; and after the meal , when [Joan]183-joan disappeared to unpack [her]183-joan box and make tidy [a little apple - room , which was now empty and at [her]183-joan service]4953-a little apple - room , which was now empty and at her service , [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin had speech with [Mary]222-mary . [He]251-uncle chirgwin braced [himself]251-uncle chirgwin to the trying task , waited until [the kitchen]860-the kitchen was empty of [those among [[his]251-uncle chirgwin servants who ate at [his]251-uncle chirgwin table]4956-his servants who ate at his table]4955-those among his servants who ate at his table , and then replied to the question which [[his]3536-the old man niece]3958-his niece promptly put . " What do this mean , [Uncle Thomas]199-tom ? ' Twas a match o '[2075-you] [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza 's makin ' , [I]2075-you reckon , an '[2075-you] , so like 's not , [Joe]192-joe weern't any more heart - struck than [Joan]183-joan . " But [the woman]4662-the woman 's mind had not followed these last facts . [Her]4662-the woman face was white to the lips ; [her]4662-the woman hands were shaking . [She]4662-the woman spoke , and regretted [her]4662-the woman words a moment later . " [The old man]3536-the old man prattled on , setting out the position in the most favorable light to [Joan]183-joan that seemed possible to [him]3536-the old man . But [[his]3536-the old man listener]4969-his listener was [one]3502-one no longer . [She]222-mary had forgotten [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin and the present circumstances , for [her]222-mary thoughts were with [a sailor]4972-a sailor at [sea]540-sea . One tremendous moment of savage joy gripped [her]222-mary heart , but the primitive passion perished in its birth - pang and left [her]222-mary cold and faint and ashamed . [She]222-mary wondered from what unknown , unsecured corner of [her]222-mary soul the vile thing came . It died on the instant , but the corpse fouled [her]222-mary thoughts and tainted them and made [her]222-mary feel faint again . The irony of chance burst like a storm on [the woman]4662-the woman , and mazes of tangled thoughts made [her]222-mary brain whirl in a chaos of bewilderment . [She]222-mary sat motionless , [her]222-mary face dark , and much mystery in [her]222-mary wonderful eyes , while [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin , with shaking head and scriptural quotation and tears , babbled on , pleading for [Joan]183-joan with all [his]189-mr. chirgwin strength . [Mary]222-mary heard little of what [he]189-mr. chirgwin said . [She]222-mary was occupied with facts and asking [herself]222-mary [her]222-mary duty . From the storm in [her]222-mary mind arose a clear question at last , and [she]222-mary could not answer it . The point had appeared unimportant to [anybody]943-anybody but [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary , but no question of conduct ever looked trivial to [her]222-mary . At least the doubt was definite and afforded mental occupation . [She]222-mary wondered now whether it was well or possible that [she]222-mary and [Joan]183-joan could live together under the same roof . Why such a problem had arisen [she]222-mary knew not ; but it stood in the path , a fact to be dealt with . [Her]222-mary heart told [her]222-mary that [Joan]183-joan and [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle alike erred in the supposition that [[the girl]521-the girl 's seducer]4978-the girl 's seducer would ever return . [She]222-mary read the great gift of money as [Thomasin]201-thomasin had read it — rightly ; and the thought of living with [Joan]183-joan was at first horrible to [her]222-mary . [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin talked and [Mary]222-mary reflected . Then [she]222-mary rose to leave [the room]4756-the room . " '[0-i] Tis tu gert a thing for [me]0-i to say — [no wummon]2086-no wummon was ever plaaced like what [I]0-i be now . [I]0-i do mean to see passon at [Sancreed]107-sancreed , [uncle]1153-uncle . " [She]183-joan was silent a full minute , then answered slowly . " [I]2092-i see what [you]2093-you mean , [uncle]1153-uncle . [I]2092-i hadn '[2092-i] thot o ' [she]183-joan just then . " [She]183-joan hesitated , and [the old man]3536-the old man spoke again . " [I]2093-you s'pose that a bit o '[2093-you] prayer wouldn ' shaw light on it — eh , [Polly]222-mary ? '[2093-you] Pears to [me]0-i , axin ' [your]2093-you pardon , for [you'm]2093-you clever'n what [I]2093-you am , that '[2093-you] tedn ' a tale what [you]2093-you can put out '[2093-you] fore any other body ' sactly — even [a holy man like [him]3536-the old man]4987-a holy man like him . " [She]183-joan saw at once that it was not . [Her]183-joan custom had been to get [the kind - hearted old clergyman of [[her]183-joan parish church]4989-her parish church]4988-the kind - hearted old clergyman of her parish church to soothe the doubts and perplexities which not seldom rose within [her]183-joan strenuous mind . And before this great , crushing problem , with the pretext of the one difficulty which had tumbled uppermost from the chaos and so been grasped as a reality , [she]183-joan had naturally turned to [[her]183-joan guide]4990-her guide and [friend]1343-friend . But , as [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle spoke , [she]183-joan saw that in truth this matter could not be laid naked before [any man]1176-any man . Another 's hidden life was involved ; another 's secret must come out if all was told , and [Mary]222-mary 's sense of justice warned [her]183-joan that this could not be . [She]183-joan had taken [her]183-joan own mighty grief to [the little parsonage at [Sancreed]107-sancreed]4994-the little parsonage at sancreed , and [a kindly counselor , who knew sorrow at first hand]4995-a kindly counselor , who knew sorrow at first hand , helped [her]183-joan upon [the road that henceforth looked so lonely and so long]4996-the road that henceforth looked so lonely and so long ; but this present trial , though it tore the old wounds open , must be borne alone . [She]183-joan saw as much , and turned and went [upstairs]2007-upstairs again to [[her]183-joan chamber]4998-her chamber . " Think of [her]222-mary kindly , " said [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin as [Mary]222-mary left [him]251-uncle chirgwin without more words . " [She'm]222-mary so young an '[2095-she] [ignorant o ' the gert world]4999-ignorant o ' the gert world , [Polly]222-mary .
