" " [Us]2094-we have all got to suffer an '[2095-she] suffer this side [our]2094-we graaves , " [she]2095-she said , mounting wearily . " So young an ' purty as [she]222-mary be — the moral o '[2095-she] [[her]2096-her mother]706-her mother . [I]0-i doan't knaw—'tis sich [a wonnerful world]2098-a wonnerful world — but [them]2099-them blue eyes — [them]2099-them round blue eyes could n't do a thing as was wrong afore [God]179-god as wan might fancy , " [he]0-i said aloud , not knowing [she]2095-she was out of earshot . Then [he]0-i heaved a sigh , returned to [the kitchen]860-the kitchen , and presently departed to [the fields]3478-the fields . With searching of heart , [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary spent time during that afternoon . In [one room]2102-one room [Joan]183-joan , happier than [she]183-joan had been for many days , set out [her]183-joan few possessions , boldly hung the picture of [[Joe Noy]192-joe 's ship]4723-joe noy 's ship upon the wall and gazed at it with affection , for it spoke of [the painter]2104-the painter , not [the sailor]784-the sailor , to [her]183-joan ; while , in a chamber hard by , [Mary]222-mary solved the problem of the day , coming at [her]222-mary conclusion with great struggle of mind and clashing of arguments . [She]222-mary resolved at last to abide at Drift with [[her]222-mary uncle]783-her uncle and with [Joan]183-joan . The reason for those events now crowding upon [her]222-mary life was hidden from [her]222-mary ; and why [Providence]285-providence saw fit to awaken or mightily intensify the sorrows which time was lulling to sleep , [she]222-mary could not divine . [She]222-mary accepted [her]222-mary position , none the less , doubted nothing but that the secret hidden in these matters would some day be explained , and , according to [her]222-mary custom before the approach of all mundane events and circumstances affecting [herself]222-mary , viewed the present trial as heaven - sent to purify and strengthen . So [[your]2107-your religious egotists]2108-your religious egotists are ever wo nt to read into the great waves of chance , as here and there a ripple from [them]2108-your religious egotists sets [their]2108-your religious egotists own little vessels shaking , as here and there some splash of foam , a puff of wind , strikes the nutshell which floats [their]2108-your religious egotists lives , a personal , deliberate intervention , an event designed by the Everlasting to test [their]2108-your religious egotists powers , ripen [their]2108-your religious egotists characters , equip [their]2108-your religious egotists souls for an eternity of satisfaction . At tea time [the cousins]4872-the cousins met again , and [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , returning from [his]251-uncle chirgwin affairs , was rejoiced to learn [Mary]222-mary 's decision . No outward sign marked [her]222-mary struggle . [She]222-mary was calm , even stately , with a natural distinction which physically appeared in [her]222-mary bearing and carriage . [She]222-mary chilled [Joan]183-joan a little , but not with intention . Yet [Joan]183-joan was bold for [her]183-joan love and spoke no less than the truth when [she]183-joan asserted that [she]183-joan viewed [her]183-joan position without shame and without remorse . [She]183-joan spoke of it openly , fearlessly , and kept [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin on thorns between the cold silence of [[his]251-uncle chirgwin elder niece]2110-his elder niece and the garrulous chatter of [the younger]2111-the younger . [The saint]1123-the saint was so stern , [the sinner]2113-the sinner so happy and so perfectly impressed with [her]222-mary own innocence , which latter fact [Mary]222-mary too saw clearly ; and it instantly solved half the problem in [her]222-mary mind . [Joan]183-joan had obviously been sent to [Drift]15-drift that the truth might reach [her]183-joan heart . [She]183-joan came [a heathen from the outer darkness of sin]2114-a heathen from the outer darkness of sin , with vain babbling on [her]183-joan lips and a mind empty . [She]183-joan called [herself]183-joan " [[Nature]178-nature 's child]2115-nature 's child " and the theatric thunders of [Luke Gospeldom]242-luke gospeldom had never taught [her]183-joan that [she]183-joan was [God]179-god 's . [Here]432-here , then , was [one to be brought into the fold with all possible dispatch]2117-one to be brought into the fold with all possible dispatch , and [Mary]222-mary , who loved religious battle , braced [herself]222-mary to the task while silently listening to [Joan]183-joan , that [she]222-mary might the better learn what manner of spiritual attack would best meet this sorry case . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin took charge of [[his]251-uncle chirgwin niece]3958-his niece 's bank - notes , and , after some persuasion , consented to accept the weekly sum of three shillings and sixpence from [Joan]183-joan . [He]251-uncle chirgwin made many objections to any such arrangement , but [the girl]521-the girl overruled them , declaring absolutely that [she]521-the girl would not stop at [Drift]15-drift , even until [[her]521-the girl future husband]2120-her future husband 's return , unless the payment of money was accepted from [her]521-the girl . It bred a secret joy in [Joan]183-joan to feel that " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's " wealth now enabled [her]183-joan to enjoy an independence which even [Mary]222-mary could not share . [She]183-joan much desired to give more money , but [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin reduced the sum to three shillings and sixpence weekly and would take no more . This wealth was viewed with very considerable loathing by [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary , and [she]183-joan criticised [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle 's decision unfavorably ; but [he]251-uncle chirgwin accepted [the owner]2122-the owner 's view , arguing that it was only justice to [all parties]2123-all parties so to do , until facts proved whether [Joan]183-joan was mistaken . The notes did not cause [him]251-uncle chirgwin uneasiness — at any rate during this stage of affairs — and [he]251-uncle chirgwin took them to [Penzance]7-penzance upon the occasion of [his]251-uncle chirgwin next visit . [[Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin 's lawyer]2124-mr. chirgwin 's lawyer saw to the safe bestowal of the money ; and when [she]2124-mr. chirgwin 's lawyer heard that [her]183-joan nine hundred pounds would produce about five - and - twenty every year and yet not decrease the while , [Joan]183-joan was much astonished . [Meantime John Barren]177-barren neither came to fetch [her]183-joan , nor sent any writing to tell of the causes for [his]251-uncle chirgwin delay . [The girl]521-the girl was fruitful of new reasons for [his]251-uncle chirgwin silence , and then grew a black fear which answered all doubts and , by its reasonableness , terrified [her]521-the girl . Perhaps " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " was ill — too ill even to write . [He]251-uncle chirgwin had but little strength — that [she]521-the girl knew , and [few friends]2126-few friends — of that [Joan]183-joan was also aware , for [he]251-uncle chirgwin had told [her]183-joan so . Yet , surely , there were those , if only [[his]251-uncle chirgwin servants]2127-his servants , who might have written to bid [her]183-joan hasten . A line — a single word — and [she]183-joan would get into [the train]4378-the train and stop in it until [she]183-joan saw " [London]45-london " written on a board at [a station]2129-a station . Then [she]183-joan would leap out and find [him]251-uncle chirgwin and get to [his]251-uncle chirgwin heart and warm it and kiss life back to [his]251-uncle chirgwin body , light to [his]251-uncle chirgwin loved gray eyes . So thinking , time dragged , and as the novelty of the new life abated , and wore thin , [Joan]183-joan 's spirits wavered until long and longer intervals of gloomy sadness marked the duration of each day for [her]183-joan . But [she]183-joan was young , and hope yet held revels in [her]183-joan heart when the mood favored , when the wind was soft , the sun bright , and [Mother Nature]178-nature seemed close and kind , as often happened . [Joan]183-joan worked too , helping [Mary]222-mary and [the maids]2130-the maids , but after a wayward manner of [her]183-joan own . There was no counting upon [her]183-joan and [she]183-joan loved better to be with [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle , abroad upon [the land]3578-the land , or by [herself]183-joan , hidden in [the orchard]1208-the orchard , in [the fruit garden]2134-the fruit garden , or in [the secret places of [the coomb]2136-the coomb]2135-the secret places of the coomb . [She]183-joan had [her]183-joan favorite spots , for as yet that great , overwhelming regard for the old stone crosses , which came to [her]183-joan afterward , had not grown into a live passion . [Her]183-joan present pilgrimages were short , [her]183-joan shrines those of [[Nature]178-nature 's building]2137-nature 's building . Much [she]183-joan loved the arm of an ancient apple - tree hid in the very heart of [the orchard]1208-the orchard . A great gnarled limb bent abruptly out , grew long and low , and was propped at a distance of three yards from the parent tree . Midway between the stem and support , a crooked elbow of the bough made a pleasant seat for [Joan]183-joan ; and here , when life at [the farm]3904-the farm looked more gray than common , [she]183-joan came and sometimes sat long hours . [Her]183-joan perch raised [her]183-joan above a velvet scented sea of wall - flowers which ran in regular waves beneath the apple - trees , under murmuring of many bees . The blossom above [Joan]183-joan 's head was all a lacework of sunny rose and cream ; and the sun painted glorious russet harmonies below , glinted magically in the green and white above , turned the gray lichens , which clustered on the weather side of the trunks and boughs , to silver . The glory of life here always heartened [Joan]183-joan . [She]183-joan felt the immortality of [Nature]178-nature , who , from naked earth and barren boughs , thus at the sun 's smile splendidly awakened , and teemed and overflowed with bewildering , inexhaustible luxuriance . Nor seldom this aspect of [[her]183-joan Mother]706-her mother 's infinite wealth touched [her]183-joan blood , and a strange sensation as of very lust of life made [her]183-joan wild . At such times [she]183-joan would pick the green things and tear them and watch the colorless life ooze from their wounds ; [she]183-joan would gather blossoms and scatter them against the wind , break buds open and pluck their hearts out , fill [her]183-joan mouth with sorrel and young grass - shoots , and feel the cool saps of them upon [her]183-joan palate . And sometimes [[her]183-joan Mother]706-her mother frightened [her]183-joan , for the dim clouds hid beneath the horizon of maternity were moving now and their color was dark . [Nature]178-nature had as many moods as [Joan]183-joan and often looked distant and terrible . Poor little blue - eyed " [sister of the sun and moon]2142-sister of the sun and moon ! " [She]183-joan likened [herself]183-joan so bravely to [the other children of [[her]183-joan Mother]706-her mother]2143-the other children of her mother — to the stars , to the fair birch - trees , where emerald showers now twinkled down over the silver stems , to the uncurling fronds of the fern , to the little trout in [the coomb - stream]2145-the coomb - stream ; and yet [she]183-joan was not content as they were . " [Her]183-joan 's good , so good , but oh ! if [her]183-joan was a bit nigher — if [I]0-i could sit in [her]183-joan lap an ' feel [her]183-joan arms around [me]2147-a grawed wummon an '[2147-a grawed wummon] thread the daisies into chains like when [I]0-i was [a lil maid]2146-a lil maid ! But [I]0-i be [a grawed wummon]2147-a grawed wummon now — an ' yet caan't feel it so — not yet . [Her'll]183-joan hold [my]2147-a grawed wummon hand , maybe , an '[2147-a grawed wummon] lead [me]0-i ' pon the road past pain an '[2147-a grawed wummon] sorrow . [I]0-i can trust [her]183-joan , 'cause [Mister Jan]241-mister jan did say as Nature never lies — never . " So [the child]758-the child 's thoughts wandered on a day when [she]183-joan sat upon the bough and brought a shower of pale petals down with every movement . But as yet only the shadows of shadows clouded [her]183-joan thoughts when [she]183-joan thought about [herself]183-joan . It was the loneliness brought real care — the loneliness and the waiting . [She]183-joan spent time , too , in [[Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's old walled garden]5001-uncle chirgwin 's old walled garden . [This place]544-this place and [its]544-this place products went for little in the traffic of [the farm]3904-the farm , though every year [its owner]5004-its owner was wo nt to count upon certain few baskets of choice fruit as an addition to [his]5004-its owner income , and every year [his]5004-its owner hopes were blighted . For the walls whereon [his]251-uncle chirgwin peaches and nectarines grew had stood through generations , [their]2149-the necter'ns red brick work was much fretted by time , and the interstices between the bricks made snug homes for a variety of insects . [Joan]183-joan once listened to [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle upon this subject , and henceforth chose to make [his]2148-his scanty fruit [her]183-joan special care . " '[2148-his] Tis like this , " [he]2148-his explained , " an ' specially wi '[2148-his] [the necter'ns]2149-the necter'ns . The moment [they]2149-the necter'ns graws a shade , an ' long afore [they]2149-the necter'ns stone , [them]2149-the necter'ns dratted lil auld sow - pigs [ Footnote : Sow - pigs — Woodlice . ] falls '[2149-the necter'ns] pon 'em cruel . Then [they]2149-the necter'ns waits [theer]5006-theer time till the ripenin '[2149-the necter'ns] , an ' , blame [me]2148-his , but [the varmints]5007-the varmints do allus knaw just a day '[2148-his] fore [I]0-i does , when things be ready , an ' [they]2149-the necter'ns eats the peaches an '[2148-his] necter'ns by night , gouging ['em]5008-'em shameful , same as if [you]2150-your 'd done it wi '[2148-his] [your]2150-your nails . ' Tis a terrible coorious wall for [sow - pigs]5009-sow - pigs , likewise for [snails]5010-snails ; an '[0-i] [I]0-i be allus a gwaine to have en repaired an ' pinted , but yet somehow '[0-i] tedn ' done . But [your]2150-your sharp eyes'll be a sight o '[0-i] use wi ' creepin '[0-i] things . ' Tis a reg'lar Noah 's Ark o '[2148-his] a wall , to be sure ; not but what [I]0-i lay [theer]2151-theer 's five pound worth o ' stone fruit '[2148-his] pon it most years if ' twas let bide . " [Joan]183-joan enjoyed watching the peaches grow . First [they]2149-the necter'ns peeped like pearls from the dried frills of [their]2149-the necter'ns blossoms ; then [they]2149-the necter'ns expanded and cast off the encumbrance of dead petals and nestled against the red bricks that sucked up sunshine and held it for [them]2149-the necter'ns when the sun had gone . [She]183-joan found the garden wall was [a whole busy world]5011-a whole busy world , and , taught by [[her]183-joan vanished master]5012-her vanished master , [she]183-joan took interest in all that dwelt thereon . But the snails and woodlice [she]183-joan slew ruthlessly that [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle might presently come by [his]176-barron five pounds '[2148-his] value of fruit . [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary speedily discovered the task of reforming [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin was like to be lengthy and arduous . There appeared no foundations upon which to work , and while the certainty of [Barron]176-barron 's return still remained with [Joan]183-joan as a vital guide to conduct , no other gospel than that which [he]176-barron had taught found [her]183-joan [a listener]2153-a listener . [She]183-joan refused to go to [church]581-church , to [Mary]222-mary 's chagrin and [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's sorrow ; but [he]176-barron explained the matter correctly and indeed found a clew to most of [Joan]183-joan 's actions at this season . [Mary]222-mary saw [the old man]3536-the old man 's growing love for [the new arrival]2156-the new arrival , and a smaller mind might have sunk to jealousy quickly enough under such circumstances , but [she]222-mary , deeply concerned with [Joan]183-joan 's eternal welfare , rose above temporary details , At the same time [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle 's mild and tolerant attitude caused [her]183-joan pain . " As to [church - gwaine]2158-church - gwaine , " [he]176-barron said , on a Sunday morning when [he]176-barron and [[his]176-barron elder niece]2110-his elder niece had driven off to [Sancreed]107-sancreed as usual , leaving [Joan]183-joan in [the orchard]1208-the orchard ; " she've larned to look ' pon it from [a Luke Gosp'ler]5014-a luke gosp'ler 's pint o '[176-barron] view . Doan't [you]183-joan fret , [Polly]222-mary . Let [her]183-joan bide . ' Twill come o '[183-joan] itself bimebye wan o ' these Sundays . [Poor tiby lamb]5015-poor tiby lamb ! Christ 's a watchin '[222-mary] of [her]183-joan , [Polly]222-mary . An ' if [this here gen'leman]5016-this here gen'leman , by the name o '[241-mister jan] [Mister Jan]241-mister jan , doan't come — " " [You]176-barron make [me]0-i daft ! " [she]183-joan interrupted , with impatience . " [D'you]176-barron mean as [you]176-barron ever thot [he]176-barron would ? " " [I]0-i hopes . [Theer]2161-theer 's sich a ' mazin '[183-joan] deal o ' good in human nature . Mayhap [he'm]176-barron wraslin '[183-joan] wi ' [his]176-barron sawl to this hour . An '[183-joan] [the Lard]1026-the lard do allus fight ' pon the side o '[183-joan] conscience . [Iss fay]194-iss ! Some ' ow [I]183-joan do think as [he]176-barron 'll come . " [Mary]222-mary said no more . [She]222-mary was quite positive that [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin and [[her]222-mary uncle]783-her uncle were alike mistaken ; but [she]222-mary saw that , until the hard truth forced itself upon [Joan]183-joan , [the girl]521-the girl would go [her]521-the girl present way . It was not that [Joan]183-joan lacked goodness and sweetness , but , in [Mary]222-mary 's opinion , [she]222-mary took an obstinate and wrong - headed course upon the one vital subject of [her]222-mary own salvation . [Mary]222-mary fought with [herself]222-mary to love [Joan]183-joan , and the battle now was only hard when [Joe Noy]192-joe came within the scope of [her]222-mary thoughts . [She]222-mary banished [him]192-joe as much as [she]222-mary could , but it never grew easy , and the complex problems bred of reflections on this theme maddened [her]222-mary . For [she]222-mary had always loved [him]192-joe , and that affection , thrust away as deadly - sin , when [he]192-joe left [her]222-mary for another , could not be wholly strangled now . Time hung heavily and more heavily with [Joan]183-joan at [Drift]15-drift . A fortnight passed ; but the hope of [the ignorant and trustful]5020-the ignorant and trustful dies very hard and the faith which is bred of absolute love has a hundred lives . [The girl]521-the girl walked into [Penzance]7-penzance every second day , and hope blazed brightly on [the road]445-the road to [the post - office]4454-the post - office , then sank a little deeper into the hidden places of [her]521-the girl heart as [she]521-the girl plodded empty - handed back to [Drift]15-drift . Slowly , and so gradually that [she]521-the girl [herself]521-the girl knew it not , [her]521-the girl thoughts grew something less occupied with [John Barren]177-barren , something more concerned about [herself]521-the girl . For [the world]3624-the world was full of [happy mothers]5025-happy mothers now . One " [Brindle"—a knot - cow of repute]5026-brindle"—a knot - cow of repute — dropped a fine bull - calf in a croft hard by [the orchard]1208-the orchard , and [Joan]183-joan looked into " [Brindle]321-brindle 's " solemn eyes after the event , and learned . [She]183-joan marveled to see the little brown calf stand on [his]321-brindle shaking legs within an hour of [his]321-brindle birth ; then [[his]321-brindle mother]752-his mother licked [him]321-brindle lovingly , while [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin [himself]251-uncle chirgwin drew off [her]752-his mother " buzzy milk . " There was [another mother in [a disused pigsty]5030-a disused pigsty]5029-another mother in a disused pigsty . There [Joan]183-joan found a red and white tortoise - shell cat with four blind , squeaking atoms beside [her]183-joan , and as the cat rolled over and the atoms sucked life , [Joan]183-joan saw [her]183-joan shining eyes , afore - time so bright and hard , full of a new strange light , like the cloud that glimmers over the fires of an opal . The cat 's green orbs were full of mystery : of pain past , of joy present . So again [Joan]183-joan learned . But a black tragedy blotted out [that little happy family in [the pigsty]5032-the pigsty]5031-that little happy family in the pigsty , and [Death]322-death , in the shape of [Amos Bartlett]323-amos bartlett , [[Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin 's head man]5033-mr. chirgwin 's head man , fell upon [them]5031-that little happy family in the pigsty . Then [the farmer]3745-the farmer learned that [[his]3745-the farmer niece]3958-his niece could be angry . One morning [Joan]183-joan found the mother cat running wildly here and there , with a world of misery in its cry ; while a moment afterward [she]183-joan came upon the kittens in [a duck pond]5036-a duck pond . [Mr. Bartlett]324-mr. bartlett was present and explained . " [Them]2163-them chets had to gaw , [missy]5037-missy . '[183-joan] Tis a auld word an ' it ban't wise to take no count of sayings like that . '[2167-her] May chets bad luck begets . ' [You]2165-you 've heard tell o '[2167-her] that ? Never let live no kittens born in May. [They]2163-them [theer]2164-theer dead chets comed May Day . " " [You'm]2165-you [a cruel devil]2166-a cruel devil ! " [she]2167-her said hotly ; " how 'd [you]2165-you like for [[your]2165-you two lil children]2168-your two lil children to be thrawed in the water , May or no May ? Look at thicky cat , breakin ' [her]3958-his niece heart , [poor twoad]5038-poor twoad ! " [Mr. Bartlett]324-mr. bartlett was justly angry that [Joan]183-joan could dare to thus class [[his]324-mr. bartlett priceless red - headed twins]5039-his priceless red - headed twins with a litter of dead kittens , and [he]324-mr. bartlett said more than was wise , ramming home a truth , and that coarsely . " [Theer]2168-your two lil children 's plenty more wheer [them]5039-his priceless red - headed twins comed from , [I]2167-her lay . [Nachur]325-nachur 's so free , [you]2167-her see — tu free like sometimes . Ban't no dearth o '[2167-her] chets or [childern]1104-childern as [I]0-i 've heard on . [They]2168-your two lil children comes unaxed , an ' unwanted tu . [You]2167-her might a heard tell o '[2168-your two lil children] some sich p'raps ? " [She]2167-her blushed and shook with passion at this sudden new aspect of affairs . Here was a standpoint from which [nobody]3503-nobody had viewed [her]2167-her before . Worse — far worse than [[her]2167-her father]3642-her father 's rage or [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's tears was this . [Amos Bartlett]323-amos bartlett represented [the world]3624-the world 's attitude . [The world]3624-the world would not be angry with [her]2167-her , or cry for [her]2167-her ; it would merely laugh and pass on , like [Mr. Bartlett]324-mr. bartlett . So [Joan]183-joan learned yet again ; and the new knowledge cowed [her]183-joan for full eight - and - forty hours . But the eyes of [the mothers]1119-the mothers had taught [Joan]183-joan something of the secret of pain , and a thread of gravity ran henceforth through all thoughts concerning the future . [She]183-joan much marveled that " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " had never touched upon this leaf in the book . [Beauty]326-beauty was what [he]241-mister jan invariably talked about , and [he]241-mister jan found beauty hidden in many a strange matter too ; but not in pain . That was because [he]241-mister jan suffered [himself]241-mister jan sometimes , [Joan]183-joan suspected . And yet , to [her]183-joan , pain , though [she]183-joan had never felt it , seemed not wholly hideous . [She]183-joan surprised [herself]183-joan mightily by the depth of [her]183-joan own thoughts now . [She]183-joan seemed to stand upon the brink of deep matters guessing dimly at things hidden . Then [her]183-joan moods would break again from the clouds to brightness . Hot sunshine on [her]183-joan cheek always raised [her]183-joan young spirits , and [her]183-joan health , now excellent , threw joy into life despite the ever - present anxiety . Then came a meeting which roused interest and brought very genuine delight with it . It happened upon a fine Sunday afternoon , when [Joan]183-joan was walking through [the fields on [the farm]3904-the farm]2175-the fields on the farm — those which extended southward — that [she]183-joan reached [a stile where granite blocks lay lengthwise , like the rungs of a ladder]2177-a stile where granite blocks lay lengthwise , like the rungs of a ladder , between two uprights . Here [she]183-joan stopped a while , and sat [her]183-joan down , and looked out over the promise of fine hay . The undulating green expanse was studded with the black knobs of ribwort plantain and gemmed with buttercups , which here were dotted like sparks of fire , here massed in broad bunches and splashes of color . The wind swept over [the field]1557-the field , and [its]2179-its course was marked by sudden flecks and ripples of transient sheeny light , paler and brighter than the mass of the herbage . Then a figure appeared afar off , following the course of the footpath where it wound through the gold of the flowers and the silver of the bending grasses . [It]2180-it approached , resolved itself into [a fisher - boy]2181-a fisher - boy and presently proved to be [Tom Tregenza]327-tom . [Joan]183-joan ran forward to meet [him]327-tom as soon as [the short figure]2182-the short figure , with its exaggerated nautical roll , became known to [her]183-joan . [She]183-joan kissed [[her]183-joan half - brother]759-her half - brother warmly , and [he]327-tom hugged [her]183-joan and showed great delight at the meeting , for [he]327-tom loved [Joan]183-joan well . " [I]0-i 've stealed away , 'cause [I]0-i was just burstin '[0-i] to get sight of ' [e]183-joan again , [Joan]183-joan . [Faither]196-mister jan. 's [home]453-home an '[0-i] [I]0-i comed off for a walk , creepin ' round here an '[0-i] hopin ' as [we]2186-we 'd meet . [I]0-i doan't care a grain o ' wheat what faither sez . " " [I]2204-much more humans wish [I]2204-much more humans was [a Nachur]5059-a nachur 's cheel then . " [Joan]183-joan flung down a little bouquet of starry stitchworts [she]183-joan had gathered upon the way and turned very earnestly to [Tom]327-tom . " [You]327-tom be , [you]327-tom be a Nature 's cheel . [Us]5060-us all be , but awnly a few knaws it . " [Tom]327-tom laughed at this idea mightily . " Well , [I]2204-much more humans 'll slip back long , [Joan]183-joan ; an '[2204-much more humans] if [I]0-i be a Nachur 's cheel , [I]0-i be ; but [I]0-i guess [I]0-i 'll keep it a secret . If [I]0-i tawld [faither]579-faither as [I]0-i dedn ' b'lieve in no auld devil , [I]0-i guess [he]579-faither 'd hurry [me]0-i into [next world]5061-next world so 's [I]0-i might see for [myself]0-i [theer]579-faither was wan . " [They]5060-us walked a little way together . Then [Tom]327-tom grew frightened and stopped [[his]327-tom companion]516-his companion . " Guess [you]516-his companion 'd best to be turnin '[0-i] . " " D'you like [the sea]463-the sea still , [Tom]327-tom ? " " Doan't [I]0-i just ! " So [Tom]327-tom marched off , speculating as to what particular lie would best meet the case if cross - questioning awaited [him]327-tom on [his]327-tom return , and [Joan]183-joan watched [the thickset little figure]5068-the thickset little figure very lovingly until it was out of sight . [June]330-june came . The wall - flowers were long plucked or dead , the last snows of apple - blossom had vanished away , and the fruit was setting well . [The woodlice]5069-the woodlice were already ruining the young nectarines . " [They]2210-they spiles 'em[183-joan] in the growth an ' scores 'em[183-joan] wi ' [their]2210-they wicked lil teeth , then , come August an '[183-joan] [they]2210-they ripens , [they]2210-they 'll begin again . But the peaches [they]2210-they wo n't touch now , 'cause of the fur '[2210-they] pon 'em . Awnly [they]2210-they 'll make up for't when the things is ready for eatin '[2210-they] . " So Uncle [Thomas]327-tom explained the position to [Joan]183-joan . [He]327-tom , [good man]2211-good man , had fulfilled [his]327-tom promise to see [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza . It happened that a load of oar - weed was wanted on [the farm]3904-the farm , and [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin , instead of sending one of the hands with horse and cart to [Newlyn]1-newlyn according to [his]189-mr. chirgwin custom when seaweed was needed , went [himself]189-mr. chirgwin . [[His]189-mr. chirgwin elder niece]2110-his elder niece expostulated with [him]189-mr. chirgwin and explained that such a trip would be interpreted to mean straitened circumstances on [the farm]3904-the farm ; but [[her]2110-his elder niece uncle]783-her uncle was not proud , and when [he]783-her uncle explained that [his]783-her uncle real object was an opportunity to speak with [[Joan]183-joan 's father]2216-joan 's father [Mary]222-mary said no more . [Screwing]331-screwing courage to the sticking - point , therefore , [the old man]3536-the old man went down to [Newlyn]1-newlyn on a morning when [Joan]183-joan was not by to question [his]3536-the old man movements . [Fortune]332-fortune favored [him]3536-the old man . [Michael]203-michael tregenza had landed at daylight and was not sailing again till dusk . [The fisherman]797-the fisherman listened patiently , but [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin 's inconsequent and sentimental conversation sounded as tinkling brass upon [his]3536-the old man ear . [Both]3485-both argued the question upon religious grounds , but from an entirely different standpoint . [Michael]203-michael tregenza was not at the trouble to talk much , for [[his]3536-the old man visitor]2220-his visitor seemed scarce worthy of powder and shot . [He]3536-the old man explained that [he]3536-the old man deemed it damnation to hold unnecessary converse with [sinners]616-sinners ; that , by [her]183-joan act , [Joan]183-joan had raised eternal barriers between [herself]183-joan and those of [[her]183-joan own home]2222-her own home , and , indeed , [all chosen people]2223-all chosen people ; that [he]3536-the old man had walked in the light from the dawn of [his]3536-the old man days until the present time , and could not imperil the souls of [[his]3536-the old man wife]843-his wife , [[his]3536-the old man son]869-his son and [himself]3536-the old man by any further communion with [one]3502-one , in [his]3536-the old man judgment , lost beyond faintest possibility of redemption . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin listened with open mouth to these sentiments . [He]251-uncle chirgwin longed to relate how [Joan]183-joan had repented of [her]183-joan offense , how [she]183-joan had thrown [herself]183-joan upon [the Lord]702-the lord , and found peace and forgiveness . No such thing could be recorded , however , and [he]251-uncle chirgwin felt [himself]251-uncle chirgwin at a disadvantage . [He]251-uncle chirgwin prayed for mercy on [her]183-joan behalf , but mercy was a luxury [Gray Michael]204-gray michael deemed beyond the reach of [man]3551-man . [He]251-uncle chirgwin showed absolutely no emotion upon the subject , and [his]251-uncle chirgwin chill unconcern quenched [the farmer]3745-the farmer 's ardor . [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin mourned mightily that [he]251-uncle chirgwin held not a stronger case . [Joan]183-joan had tied [his]251-uncle chirgwin hands , at any rate , for the present . If [she]183-joan would only come round , accept the truth and abandon [her]183-joan present attitude — then [he]251-uncle chirgwin knew that [he]251-uncle chirgwin would fight like [a giant]656-a giant for [her]183-joan , and that , with right upon [his]251-uncle chirgwin side , [he]251-uncle chirgwin would surely prevail . [His]251-uncle chirgwin last words upon the subject shadowed this conviction . " A month before [Joan]183-joan would have flashed into anger at such a speech as this , but now [she]183-joan did not answer . Young love is fertile in imagination . [She]183-joan had found a thousand glories in [John Barren]177-barren , and , when [he]177-barren left [her]183-joan , had woven a thousand explanations for [his]177-barren delayed return . [I]0-i knaws so much , but caan't speak it out . [Us]2279-us done no sin , an ' [I]338-adam ban't shamed to look the sun in the faace , nor [you]183-joan . If ' [e]2282-e doan't , then [I]2282-e 'll say that [faither]579-faither 's [God]179-god 's [the right wan]5112-the right wan . " " Doan't '[2282-e] [e]2282-e put on a bold front , [Joan gal]183-joan . [Theer]338-adam 's things tu deep for the likes o ' [us]5113-us . [You]2283-you ban't prayin '[0-i] right , [I]0-i reckon . [Theer]338-adam 's a voice hid in [you]2283-you . Listen to that . [Nature]178-nature 's spawk to ' [e]2282-e an '[178-nature] now er 's dumb . Listen to t'other , [lassie]2284-lassie . [Nature]178-nature do [guide beasts]2285-guide beasts an ' birds an '[178-nature] the poor herbs o ' [the field]1557-the field ; but [you]2283-you — [you]2283-you listen to t'other . [You]2283-you 'll never be happy no more till [you]2283-you awns '[178-nature] twas a sad mistake an ' do ax in the right plaace for pardon . " " [I]2286-i want no pardon , " [she]2286-i said . " [I]2286-i have done no wrong , [I]2286-i tell [']2286-i[2286-i] [e.]2286-i [Wheer]340-wheer 's justice to ? [I]0-i be sinless in the matter of it , an ' [Nature]178-nature do knaw it , an '[0-i] [God]179-god do knaw it . " But [her]2287-her breast heaved and [her]2287-her eyes were wet with unshed tears . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , [her]2287-her solitary trust and stand - by , had drifted away too . [His]251-uncle chirgwin hope was dead and [she]2287-her could not revive it . [He]251-uncle chirgwin had never spoken so strongly before , but now [he]251-uncle chirgwin was taking up [Mary]222-mary 's line of action and had ranged [himself]251-uncle chirgwin against [her]222-mary . It almost seemed to [Joan]183-joan that [he]251-uncle chirgwin reflected in a meek , diluted fashion , as the moon turns the sun 's golden fire to silver , something of what [he]251-uncle chirgwin must have heard that afternoon from [[her]2287-her father]3642-her father . This defection acted definitely on [the girl]521-the girl 's temperament . [She]2287-her fought fear , hardened [her]2287-her heart against doubt , cast suspicion far away as treason to " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " and gave to hope a new lease of life . [She]2287-her would be patient for [his]251-uncle chirgwin sake , [she]2287-her would trust in [him]251-uncle chirgwin still . There was something grand in the loneliness , [she]2287-her told [herself]2287-her . [He]251-uncle chirgwin would know perhaps one day of [her]2287-her great patient faith and love . And the trial would make [her]2287-her brain and heart bigger and better fit [her]2287-her for the position of wife to [him]251-uncle chirgwin . The struggle was fought by [her]2287-her with that courage which lies beyond [man]3551-man 's comprehension . [She]2287-her looked at [the world]3624-the world with bright eyes when there was necessity for facing it ; [she]2287-her exhausted [her]2287-her ingenuity in schemes for communicating with [John Barron]176-barron . If [he]251-uncle chirgwin only knew ! [She]2287-her felt that even had change darkened [his]251-uncle chirgwin affection for [her]2287-her , yet , most surely , the thought of [the baby]2292-the baby must tempt [him]251-uncle chirgwin back again . Thus , with sustained bravery and ignorance , [she]2287-her left [her]2287-her hand in [Nature]178-nature 's , and [her]2287-her faith , rising gloriously above the doubt of the time , trusted [that majestic heathen goddess as [a little child]4198-a little child trusts [[its]4198-a little child mother]4199-its mother]2293-that majestic heathen goddess as a little child trusts its mother . [Fate]181-fate played another prank upon [her]2287-her not long afterward and thrust into [her]2287-her hands a possible means of access to [John Barron]176-barron . [A favorite resort of [Joan]183-joan 's]2296-a favorite resort of joan 's was [the brook which ran down [the valley beneath Drift and Sancreed]2298-the valley beneath drift and sancreed]2297-the brook which ran down the valley beneath drift and sancreed . [The little stream]2299-the little stream wound through [a fair coomb between orchards]2300-a fair coomb between orchards , [meadows , wastes of fern and heather]2301-meadows , wastes of fern and heather . At this season of the year [the valley]2302-the valley was very lonely , and [a certain spot beside [the stream]4565-the stream]2303-a certain spot beside the stream often tempted [Joan]183-joan by reason of [its]4565-the stream comfort and its peace . From here , sitting on a granite bowlder clothed in soft green mosses and having a shape into which human limbs might fit easily , [the girl]521-the girl could see much that was fair . [The meadows]2306-the meadows were all sprinkled with the silver - mauve of cuckoo - flowers — [Shakespeare]341-shakespeare 's " [lady]2307-lady 's smock " ; [the hills]1859-the hills sloped upward under oaken saplings as yet too young for the stripping ; [the valley]2302-the valley stretched winding landward beneath [Sancreed]107-sancreed . Above and far away stretched [the Cornish moors dotted with [[man]3551-man 's mining enterprises]2312-man 's mining enterprises]2310-the cornish moors dotted with man 's mining enterprises , chiefly deserted . [Ding - Dong]115-ding - dong raised [its]115-ding - dong gaunt engine stack and , distant though it was , [Joan]183-joan 's sharp eyes could see the rusty arm of iron stretching forth from the brickwork , motionless , not worth the removing . Close at hand , where [the stream]4565-the stream wandered babbling at [her]183-joan feet , the whole glory of spring shone on blossoms and grasses where the world of [the stream - side]2314-the stream - side sent forth a warm , living smell . The wildness of [the upland moors]2315-the upland moors stretched down into [[the valley]2302-the valley below [them]2315-the upland moors]2317-the valley below them . There glimmered blue - green patches of bracken , speckled with the red and white hides of calves which fed and scampered dew - lap deep ; and the fern was all sheened with light where the sunshine brightened its polished leaves . [The stream]4565-the stream wound through the midst , bedecked and adorned with purple bugle flowers , bridged with dog - roses and honeysuckles , in festoons , in bunches and in sprays , crowned with scented gorse , fringed with yellow irises which splashed flaming reflections where [the brook]1099-the brook widened and slowed into shallow little backwaters . Flags and cresses framed the margins ; meadowsweets made the air fragrant above , and granite bowlders fretted the waters silver , [their]2320-their foundations hidden in dark water - weed . Sunshine danced on every tiny cascade and threw stars and twinkling flashes of light upward from the brown pools upon [the banks]2321-the banks . Everything was upon a miniature scale , even to the trout which lived in [the stream]4565-the stream , flashed their dim shadows under its waters , leaped into the air after the flies , set little clouds of sand shimmering as they darted up and down or , when surprised , wriggled away into favorite holes and hiding places beneath the banks and trailing weeds . [Ling]342-ling and wortleberry too were moorland visitors in [the valley]2302-the valley , and the bog heather already budded . Here was [one of the many favorite resting - places of [Joan]183-joan]2324-one of the many favorite resting - places of joan , and hither [she]183-joan came on a rare morning in mid June at the wish of [another person]2325-another person . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin had set [[his]251-uncle chirgwin niece]3958-his niece a task , and the object of [her]183-joan present visit was no mere dawdling and thinking while perched upon the granite throne above the meadowsweets . This fact a basket and a three - pronged fork indicated . [[Her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle deemed [himself]251-uncle chirgwin an authority on simples and possessed much information , mostly erroneous , concerning the properties of wild herbs and flowers . A decoction of hemp agrimony [he]251-uncle chirgwin at all times considered a most valuable bitter tonic ; and of this plant the curious flesh - colored flowers on their long green stems grew pretty freely by [the stream]4565-the stream - side in [the valley]2302-the valley . The time of flowering was not yet come , but [Joan]183-joan knew the dull leaf of the herb well enough and , that found , [she]183-joan could easily dig up the root , wherein its virtue dwelt . But before starting on [her]183-joan search , [the girl]521-the girl rested a while where the serrated foliage and creamy blossom of [the meadowsweets]2331-the meadowsweets laced and fringed the granite of [[her]183-joan couch]2332-her couch ; and , as [she]183-joan sat there , [her]183-joan eye taking in [the happy valley]2333-the happy valley , [her]183-joan brain reading into the luxuriant life of nature , some strange new thoughts hidden until lately , [she]183-joan became suddenly conscious of a phenomenon beyond [her]183-joan power to immediately explain or understand It drove the hemp agrimony quite out of [her]183-joan head , and , when the mystery came to be explained , filled [Joan]183-joan 's mind with the memory of [her]183-joan own sad affairs . First and repeatedly there glimmered a gossamer over [the stream]4565-the stream , falling into the water and as often rising again ; then above the film of light flashed another , rising abruptly golden into the sunshine . Not for a moment or two did [she]183-joan discover the flashing thing was a fly - rod , but presently the man who held it appeared below [her]183-joan at a bend of [the streamlet]2335-the streamlet . [He]2336-he was clad much like [the artists]620-the artists , and it made the blood flush hot to [her]183-joan cheek as [she]183-joan thought [he]2336-he might be one . [Young men]2338-young men sometimes fished [the brook]1099-the brook for the fingerling trout it contained . [They]2338-young men were small but sweet , and the catching [them]2338-young men with a fly was difficult work in a stream so overhung with tangles of vine and brier , so densely planted in the wider reaches with water hemlock and lesser weeds . [This fisherman]2340-this fisherman , at any rate , found successful sport beyond [his]2340-this fisherman power to achieve . [He]2340-this fisherman flogged away , but hung [his]2340-this fisherman fly clear of [the stream]4565-the stream at every second cast and deceived not the smallest troutlet of [them]2342-them all . [The young man]2343-the young man , after the manner of [those anglers classified as " chuck and chance it]2344-those anglers classified as " chuck and chance it , " worked [his]2343-the young man clumsy way toward [Joan]183-joan 's chair on the granite bowlder . Motionless [she]183-joan sat , and [her]183-joan drab attire and faded sun - bonnet harmonized so well with the tones around it — the gray of the stones , the lights of [the river]2345-the river , the masses of [the meadowsweet]2346-the meadowsweet — that while noting a broad and sparkling stickle winding away beneath [her]183-joan , [the angler]2347-the angler missed [the girl]521-the girl [herself]183-joan . This stickle spread , with an oily tremor and white undercurrent full of air pearls , from [a waterfall where the foot of [Joan]183-joan 's throne]2349-a waterfall where the foot of joan 's throne fretted [the stream]4565-the stream . Below [it]2349-a waterfall where the foot of joan 's throne the waters slowed and ran smoothly into dark brown shadows , being here marked by the wrinkled lines of their currents and splashed with the sky 's reflected blue . An ideal spot for a trout it doubtless was , and [the approaching sportsman]2351-the approaching sportsman exercised unusual care in [his]2351-the approaching sportsman approach , crouching along [the bank]4682-the bank and finally creeping bent double within casting distance . Then , as [he]2351-the approaching sportsman freed [his]2351-the approaching sportsman fly , [he]2351-the approaching sportsman saw [Joan]183-joan , like [a queen of the pool reigning motionless and silent]2353-a queen of the pool reigning motionless and silent . [She]183-joan moved and no fish was likely to rise after within the visual radius of [her]183-joan sudden action . Thereupon [the angler in the man]2354-the angler in the man cursed ; [the artist in [him]2351-the approaching sportsman]2355-the artist in him drew a short , sharp breath . [He]2351-the approaching sportsman scrambled to [his]2351-the approaching sportsman feet and looked again upon a beautiful picture . The plump , baby freshness of [Joan]183-joan 's face had vanished indeed , and there was that in the slightly anxious expression and questioning look of [her]183-joan blue eyes that had told [any medical man [he]2351-the approaching sportsman stood before [a future mother]2357-a future mother]2356-any medical man he stood before a future mother ; but , in [her]183-joan seated position , no tangible suggestion of a hidden life was thrust upon [the spectator]4409-the spectator 's view . [Both man]2368-both man and [woman]1347-woman were profoundly anxious each to hear [the other]3475-the other 's voice , but [neither]2371-neither felt brave enough to speak first . Then [the artist]3491-the artist 's ingenuity found a means , and [Joan]183-joan presently saw [his]2351-the approaching sportsman fly stick fast upon the side of the stream where [she]183-joan sat . The thing was caught at the seed - head of a rush within reach of [Joan]183-joan 's hand , and while this incident appeared absolutely accidental , yet it was not so , for [the artist]3491-the artist had long been endeavoring to get fast somewhere hard by [Joan]183-joan . " So [he]176-barron passed slowly forward , and [she]5117-she sat a full hour after [he]176-barron had left [her]5117-she building [new castles on [the old crumbling foundations]5119-the old crumbling foundations]5118-new castles on the old crumbling foundations . It was even in [her]5117-she mind to pray , to pray with [her]5117-she whole heart and soul ; but chaos had settled like a storm upon [her]5117-she beliefs . [She]5117-she was almost happy and whistled gently to [herself]5117-she as [she]5117-she filled [her]5117-she little basket .
