" Four days elapsed , and then [Edmund Murdoch]175-murdoch received an answer to [his]175-murdoch letter . [He]175-murdoch had written at length upon various affairs and [[his]175-murdoch friend]494-his friend did no less . " No . 6 [Melbury Gardens]116-melbury gardens , S.W. " June 8 , 189—. " [Dear Murdoch]345-dear murdoch — [Your]345-dear murdoch long screed gave [me]0-i some pleasure and killed an hour . [You]345-dear murdoch relate the even course of [your]345-dear murdoch days since [my]0-i departure from [Cornwall]13-cornwall , and [I]0-i envy the good health and happy contentment of mind which [your]345-dear murdoch note indicates . [I]0-i gained no slight benefit from [my]0-i visit to [the West Country]2395-the west country , and it had doubtless carried [me]0-i bravely through this summer but for an unfortunate event . A sharp cold , which settled on [my]0-i chest , has laid [me]0-i low for some length of time , though [I]0-i am now as well again as [I]0-i shall ever be . So much for facing the night air in evening dress . [Nature]178-nature has no patience with [our]2396-our idiotic conventions , and hates alike [man]3551-man 's shirt - front and [woman]1347-woman 's bare bosom when displayed , as is [our]2396-our imbecile custom , at the most dangerous hours in the twenty - four . [[My]0-i doctors]2399-my doctors are for sending [me]0-i away , and [I]0-i shall probably follow [their]2399-my doctors advice presently . But the end is not very far off . " [I]0-i rejoice that [you]345-dear murdoch have sucked in something of [my]0-i spirit and are trying to get at the heart of rocks and [sea]540-sea before [you]345-dear murdoch paint them . [Men]3512-men waste so much time poking about in [art galleries]2402-art galleries , like the blind moles [they]3512-men mostly are , and forget that [[Nature]178-nature 's art gallery]2403-nature 's art gallery is open every day at sunrise . Dwell much in the air , glean the secrets of dawns , listen when the white rain whispers over woodland , translate the tinkle of summer seas where they kiss [your]345-dear murdoch rocky shores ; get behind the sunset ; think not of what colors [you]345-dear murdoch will mix when [you]345-dear murdoch try to paint it , but let the pageant sink into [your]345-dear murdoch soul like a song . Do not drag [your]345-dear murdoch art everywhere . Forget it sometimes and develop [your]345-dear murdoch individuality . [You]345-dear murdoch have learned to draw tolerably ; now learn to think . Believe [me]0-i , [the painting people]2404-the painting people do not think enough . " Truly [I]0-i am content to die in the face of the folly [I]0-i read and see around [me]0-i . Know [you]345-dear murdoch what [certain obscure writers]2405-certain obscure writers are now about in magazines ? [They]2405-certain obscure writers are vindicating the cosmic forces , whitewashing [Mother Nature]178-nature after [Huxley]346-huxley 's Romanes lecture ! [He]346-huxley told the truth , and [Nature]178-nature loved [him]346-huxley for it ; but now come hysterical religious ciphers who squeak boldly forth in print that [Nature]178-nature is [the mother of altruism]2406-the mother of altruism , that self - sacrifice is [her]178-nature first law ! [One genius]2407-one genius observes that ' tis [their]2405-certain obscure writers cruelty and selfishness have arrested the progress of the tiger and the ape ! [Poor Nature]178-nature ! Never a word of shotguns in all this drivel , of course . Cruelty and selfishness ! Qualities purely and solely human — qualities resulting from conscious intelligence alone . [You]345-dear murdoch and [I]2407-one genius are selfish , not the ape ; [you]345-dear murdoch and [I]2407-one genius are cruel , not the tiger . [He]346-huxley at least learns [Nature]178-nature 's lessons and obeys [her]178-nature dictates ; [we]5121-we never do and never shall . A plague upon [these fools]5122-these fools with [their]5122-these fools theologic rubbish heaps . [They]5122-these fools would prostitute the very fonts of reason and make [Nature]178-nature 's eternal circle fit the little squares of [their]5122-these fools own faiths . Man ! [I]2407-one genius tell [you]345-dear murdoch that the root of human misery might be pulled out and destroyed to - morrow like the fang of a decayed tooth if only reason could kill these weeds of falsehood which choke [civilization and strangle religion]5123-civilization and strangle religion . But [the world]3624-the world 's '[2407-one genius] doers ' have all got '[2407-one genius] faith ' ( or pretend to it ) ; [the world]3624-the world 's thinkers are [mere shadows moving about in the background of active affairs]5126-mere shadows moving about in the background of active affairs . [They]5122-these fools only write and talk . Action is the sole way of chaining [a nation]5127-a nation 's mind . " [[Your]345-dear murdoch churchman]5128-your churchman is active enough , hence the spread of that poison which keeps human reason stunted , impotent , anaemic . Take Liberty — the cursed ignis fatuus [[our]5121-we dear poets]5129-our dear poets have shrieked for , [[our]5121-we preachers]5130-our preachers have prayed for , [[our]5121-we patriots]5131-our patriots have perished for through all time . In pursuit of this rainbow - gold more blood and brains have been wasted than would have sufficed to make [a nation]5127-a nation . And yet a breath from Reason blows the thing to tatters , as an uprising wind annihilates a fog . Freedom is an attribute of [the Eternal]5133-the eternal , and creation can not share it with [him]5133-the eternal , any more than it can share [his]5133-the eternal throne with [him]5133-the eternal . '[2407-one genius] The liberty of the subject ' ! A contradiction in terms . Banish this unutterable folly of freedom , and control the breeding of human flesh as [we]5121-we control the output of beef and of mutton . Then the face of [the world]3624-the world will alter . Millions of money is annually spent in order that [mindless humanity]5135-mindless humanity , [congenital lunatics]5136-congenital lunatics and [madmen]5137-madmen , may be fed and housed and kept alive . [Their]5122-these fools existences are to [themselves]5122-these fools less pleasurable than that of the beasts , they are a source of agony to those who have borne [them]5122-these fools ; but [they]5122-these fools live to old age and devour tons of good food , while [wholesome intellects]5138-wholesome intellects starve in the gutters of [every big city]5139-every big city . Banish this ca nt of freedom then , [I]2407-one genius tell [you]5140-you . The lightning in [heaven]637-heaven is not free ; the stars are not free ; [Nature]178-nature [herself]178-nature is [the created slave of the Great Will]5142-the created slave of the great will — and [we]5121-we prattle about liberty . Let [the State]5143-the state look to it and practice these lessons [Nature]178-nature has taught and still preaches patiently to deaf ears . Let it be as penal to bring life into [the world]3624-the world without permission from authority as it is to put life out of [the world]3624-the world . Let the begetting of [paupers]5146-paupers be a crime ; let the health and happiness of [the community]5147-the community rise higher than the satisfaction of [individuals]5148-individuals ; let the self - denial practiced by [the reasonable few]5149-the reasonable few be made a legal necessity to [the unreasonable many]5150-the unreasonable many . Let [the blighted]5151-the blighted , [the malformed]5152-the malformed , [the brainless]5153-the brainless go back to [the earth from which]5154-the earth from which [they]5150-the unreasonable many came . Let [the world of humanity]5155-the world of humanity be cleansed and sweetened and purified as [Nature]178-nature cleanses and sweetens and purifies [[her]178-nature own kingdom]5156-her own kingdom . [She]178-nature removes [her]178-nature failures ; [we]5157-we put [ours]5157-we under glass and treat them like hothouse flowers . That is called humanity ; it is the mad leading the mad … . But why waste [your]5158-your time ? Nature will have the last word ; Reason must win in the end ; [a genius , at once thinker and doer]5159-a genius , at once thinker and doer , will come along some day and put [the world]3624-the world right , at a happy moment when the din of [theologists]5161-theologists is out of [its]3624-the world ears . [We]5157-we want a new practical religion ; for Christianity , distorted and twisted through the centuries into its present outworn , effete , ignoble shape , is a mere political force or a money - making machine , according to [the genius of [the country which professes it]5163-the country which professes it]5162-the genius of the country which professes it . The golden key of [the founder , which is lost]5164-the founder , which is lost , may be found again , but [I]2407-one genius think it never will be . " [ Here [the man]3494-the man elaborated [his]3494-the man opinions . They were like [himself]3494-the man : a medley — a farrago — wherein ascerbity , acuteness , and a mind naturally philosophic were stranded in the arid deserts of a pessimism bred partly from [his]3494-the man own decaying physical circumstances and partly from recognition of [his]3494-the man own wasted time . ] " [I]2407-one genius do not suppose that [I]2407-one genius shall paint any more . [I]2407-one genius had [my]2407-one genius Cornish picture brought from its packing - case and framed , and supported on a great easel at the foot of [my]2407-one genius bed while [I]2407-one genius was stricken down last month . [Mistress Joan]183-joan eyed [me]2407-one genius curiously from under [her]183-joan hand , and through the night - watches , while [[my]2407-one genius man]5166-my man snored in [the next chamber]5167-the next chamber and [I]2407-one genius tossed with great unrest , [the girl]521-the girl seemed to live and move and smile at [me]2407-one genius under the flicker of the night lamp . [Everybody]3758-everybody is pleased to say that '[2407-one genius] [Joe]192-joe 's Ship ' seems good to [them]3758-everybody . [I]176-barron have it now in [the studio]5170-the studio , and contrasted it yesterday with [my]176-barron bathing negresses from [Tobago]11-tobago . [I]176-barron think [I]176-barron like it better . It is difficult to read the soul in black faces , especially when [the models]5171-the models are freezing to death as [mine]176-barron were . But there is something near to soul in this painted [Joan]183-joan — more [I]176-barron doubt than the living reality would be found to possess to - day . [She]183-joan was [a good girl]5172-a good girl all the same , and [I]176-barron am gratified to hear [she]183-joan did not quite forget [me]176-barron . [I]176-barron have written to [her]183-joan at the address [you]5173-you mention . [They]3758-everybody pester [me]176-barron to send the picture somewhere , and to stop [their]3758-everybody importunities — especially [the women]3669-the women — [I]176-barron have promised to let the thing go to [the Institute]5175-the institute in the autumn . [I]176-barron shall doubtless change [my]176-barron mind before the time comes . " [My]176-barron life slowly but surely dwindles to that mere battle with Death which [your]5173-you consumptive wages at the finish . [I]176-barron fancy [Biskra]348-biskra will see [my]176-barron bones later in the year . [The R.A.]349-the r.a. took not less than six months off [my]176-barron waning days this spring . Thank [God]179-god [they]349-the r.a. hung [Brady]180-brady as [he]180-brady deserved . Twenty good works [I]176-barron saw—'the rest is silence . '[176-barron] " [Yours]2408-yours , while [I]0-i remain , " [JOHN BARRON]176-barron . " It was true that [the artist]3491-the artist had written another letter addressed to [Joan Tregenza]183-joan at [Drift]15-drift . [He]3491-the artist had written it first — written it hurriedly , wildly , on the spur of the moment . But , after the completion of [his]3491-the artist communication to [Murdoch]175-murdoch , the mood of [the man]3494-the man changed . [He]3491-the artist had coldly read again the former epistle , and altered [his]3491-the artist mind concerning it . [Barron]176-barron wanted [Joan]183-joan back again sometimes , if life dragged more than usual ; but pens and paper generally modified [his]176-barron desire when [he]176-barron got that far toward calling [her]183-joan to [him]176-barron . [Her]183-joan memory tickled [him]176-barron pleasantly and whiled away time . [He]176-barron framed the various sketches [he]176-barron had made of [her]183-joan and suffered thought to occupy itself with [her]183-joan as with [no other woman who had entered [his]176-barron life]2411-no other woman who had entered his life . But the day on which [he]176-barron wrote to [Murdoch]175-murdoch was a good one with [him]176-barron . [He]176-barron felt stronger and better able to suck pleasure out of living than [he]176-barron had for a month . " When [I]0-i whistle [she]183-joan will come , " [he]0-i thought to [himself]0-i . " Perhaps there would be some pleasure in taking [her]183-joan to [Biskra]348-biskra presently . [I]0-i will wait , at any rate , until nearer the last scene . [She]183-joan would be pretty to look at when [I]0-i 'm dying . Yes , [she]183-joan shall close [my]0-i eyes some day , if [she]183-joan likes . That 's a pleasant thought — for [me]0-i . " So the letter to [Murdoch]175-murdoch was sent forth , but the letter to [Joan]183-joan , containing some poetic thoughts on Nature , a pathetic description of [Barron]176-barron 's enfeebled state , and an appeal to [her]183-joan to join [him]0-i that [they]5176-they might part no more on this side the grave , was torn up . [He]0-i laughed at the trouble [he]0-i had taken to print it all , and pondered pleasantly on the picture which [Murdoch]175-murdoch had drawn of [Joan]183-joan ruling [the kingdom of [the meadowsweets]118-the meadowsweets]5177-the kingdom of the meadowsweets , of [her]183-joan eager question concerning " [Mister Jan.]196-mister jan. " " Strange , " [he]0-i reflected , " that [her]183-joan mediocre intelligence should have clung to [a man so outwardly mean as [myself]0-i]5178-a man so outwardly mean as myself . If [I]0-i thought that [she]183-joan had remembered half [I]0-i said when [I]0-i was with [her]183-joan , or had made a single attempt to practice the gospel [I]0-i preached so finely — damned if [I]0-i would n't have [her]183-joan back again to - morrow and be proud of [her]183-joan too . But it ca n't be . [She]183-joan was such [an absolute fool]5179-an absolute fool . No , [I]0-i much fear [she]183-joan only desires to find out what has become of the goose who laid the big golden egg . Or if [she]183-joan does n't , perhaps [[her]183-joan God - fearing father]5180-her god - fearing father and [mother]756-mother do . " Which opinion is not uninteresting , for it illustrates the usual failure of materialism to discover or gauge those mental possibilities which lie hidden within the humblest and worst equipped intelligences . [John Barron]176-barron was [an able man]5182-an able man in some respects , but [his]176-barron knowledge of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan had taught [him]176-barron nothing concerning [her]183-joan character and its latent powers of development . With summer , [Nature]178-nature , proceeding on [her]178-nature busy way , approached again the annual phenomena of seed - time and harvest . To [Joan]183-joan , as spring had brought with it a world of [mothers]5183-mothers , so the subsequent season filled [Nature]178-nature with [babies]5184-babies ; and , in the light of all this newborn life , [the mothers]1119-the mothers suffered a change . Now , sorrow - guided , did [Joan]183-joan begin to read under the face of things , " to get behind the sunset , " as [Barren]177-barren had said in [his]177-barren letter to [Murdoch]175-murdoch , to realize a little of the mystery hidden in green leaves and swelling fruits and ripening grain , to observe at least the presence of mystery though [she]183-joan could not translate more than an occasional manifestation thereof . [She]183-joan found much matter for wonder and for fear . Visible Nature had grown to be a smiling curtain behind which raged eternal struggles for life . Every leaf sheltered a tragedy , every bough was [a battlefield]5186-a battlefield . The awful frailty of all existence began to dawn upon [Joan Tregenza]183-joan , and the discovery left [her]183-joan helpless , lonely , longing for new gods . [She]183-joan knew not where to turn . Any brightness from any source had been welcome then . Disenchantment came with the second visit of [the artist]3491-the artist to [the stream]4565-the stream . There ; [young Murdoch]175-murdoch had met [her]183-joan and told [her]183-joan that " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " was going to write [her]183-joan a letter . Upon which [she]183-joan had sung glad songs in [a sunlit world]5189-a sunlit world and amazed [Mary]222-mary and [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin alike by the exhibition of a sudden and profound happiness . But that longed - for letter never came ; weeks passed by ; the truth rolled up over [her]183-joan life at last ; and , as [a world seen in a blaze of sunshine]5190-a world seen in a blaze of sunshine only dazzles [us]5191-us and conceals its facts under too much light , but reveals the same clear cut and distinct at dawn or early twilight , so now [Joan]183-joan 's eyes , obscured no more by the blinding promise of great joy , began to see [[her]183-joan world]1339-her world as it was , [her]183-joan future as it would be . Strange thoughts came to [her]183-joan on an evening when [she]183-joan stood by the door of [the kitchen]860-the kitchen at [Drift]15-drift , waiting for [the cart]5194-the cart to return from [market]1222-market . [It]5196-it was a cool , gray gloaming , wreathed in diaphanous mists born of past ram . These rendered every outline of tree and building vague and immense . Where [Joan]183-joan stood , the peace of the time was broken only by a gentle dripping from the leaves of a great laurel by the gate which led from [the farmyard]4845-the farmyard to [the fields]3478-the fields . Below [it]5196-it , moist ground was stamped with the trident impress of many fowls '[0-i] feet ; and , now and then , a feather sidled down from the heart of the evergreen , where poultry , black and white and spangled , were settling to roost . A subdued clucking and fluttering marked [their]2412-their hidden perches ; then came showers of rain - drops from the shining leaves as a bird mounted to a higher branch ; after which silence fell again . And [Joan]183-joan found all hope fairly dead at last . There and then , in the misty eveningtide , the fact fell on the ear of [her]183-joan heart as though [one]3502-one had spoken it ; and henceforth [she]183-joan dated disenchantment from that hour . The whole pageant of [her]183-joan romance , with the knightly figure of [the painter that filled its foreground , shriveled to a scroll no bigger than a curled , dead leaf — sere , wasted , ghostly , and light enough to be washed away on a tear , borne away upon a sigh]2414-the painter that filled its foreground , shriveled to a scroll no bigger than a curled , dead leaf — sere , wasted , ghostly , and light enough to be washed away on a tear , borne away upon a sigh . Then there followed for [her]183-joan prodigious transformations in the panorama of Nature . Seen from the standpoint of [his]2415-his great , overwhelming lie to [her]183-joan , the philosophy which [this man]3526-this man had professed changed in its appearance , and that mightily . [He]2415-his had used [his]2415-his cleverness like a net to trap [her]183-joan , and now , though [she]183-joan could not prove [his]2415-his words untrue save in one particular , yet that crowning act of faithlessness much tended to vitiate all the beauties of imagination which had gone before it . They were lilies grown from a dung - heap . Looking back in the new cold sidelight , [her]183-joan life came out clearly with all the color gone from it and the remorseless details distinct . And in this survey Nature dwindled to [a minor Deity]2417-a minor deity , [a goddess with moods as many and whims as wild as a woman]2418-a goddess with moods as many and whims as wild as a woman 's . [She]183-joan was unstable , it seemed to [Joan]183-joan then ; the immemorial solidity and splendor of [her]183-joan had departed ; [her]183-joan eyes were not fixed on [Heaven]339-heaven any more , nor did peace any longer rest within them ; [they]2419-they were frightened , terrified , and [their]2419-they wild and furtive glances followed one Shadow , reflected one Shape . [It]2420-it stood waiting at the end of all [[her]183-joan avenues]2421-her avenues ; It peered from the heart of [[her]183-joan forests]2422-her forests ; it wandered on [her]183-joan heaths and moors ; it lay under the stones in [[her]183-joan rivers]2423-her rivers ; it stalked [[her]183-joan sea - shores]2424-her sea - shores , floated on [her]183-joan waves , rode upon [her]183-joan lightning , hid in [her]183-joan four winds ; and the Shadow 's name was Death . [Joan]183-joan stood face to face with [it]2420-it at last and gazed round - eyed at a revelation . [She]183-joan was saddened to find [her]183-joan own story told by [Nature]178-nature in many allegories , painted upon [the garden]3656-the garden , set forth in waste places , fashioned by humble weeds , reflected in the small , brief lives of unconsidered creatures . Now [she]183-joan imagined [herself]183-joan an ill - shaped apple in the orchard which [the mother of all]1589-the mother of all had neglected . It was crumpled up on one side , twisted out of its fair full beauty , ruined by some wicked influence — a failure . Now [she]183-joan was a fly caught by the gold spider who set [his]2427-his web shaking to deceive . Now [she]183-joan was a little bird singing one moment , the next crawling dazed and shaking under the paw of a cat . Why should [Nature]178-nature make the strong [her]178-nature favorites and be so cruel to [the weak]2428-the weak ? That seemed an ungodly thing to [Joan]183-joan . [She]183-joan had only reached this point . [She]183-joan had no inkling of the great cleansing process which removes the dross , the eternal competition from which only the cleanest and sweetest and best come forth first . [She]183-joan saw the battle indeed , but did not understand the meaning of it any more than the rest of [the world]3624-the world which , in the words of [the weakling Barren]2430-the weakling barren , beneath the emblems of a false humanity , keeps its weeds under hot - house glasses and , out of mercy to [futile individuals]2431-futile individuals , does terribly wrong [its communities]2432-its communities . [Our]2433-our cleansing processes are only valuable so far as they go hand in hand with Nature , and where the folly of [many fools]2434-many fools rejects the wisdom of [the wise]2435-the wise , there [Nature]178-nature has [her]178-nature certain revenge sooner or later . The sins of [the State]5143-the state are visited on [the children of [the State]5143-the state]2437-the children of the state , and [those who repeal laws which Science , walking hand in hand with Nature]2439-those who repeal laws which science , walking hand in hand with nature , has proposed , those who refuse laws which Science , Nature - taught , urges upon Power , do not indeed suffer [themselves]2440-their , but commit thousands of [others]3522-others to suffering . So [their]2440-their false sentiment in effect poisons the blood - springs of [a nation]5127-a nation . Religion leads to these disasters , and any religion answerable for gigantic human follies is either false or most falsely comprehended . [[Her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle still tarried , and [Joan]183-joan , weary of waiting , betook [herself]183-joan and [her]183-joan sorrows to [the old garden]2444-the old garden , there to view a spectacle which [she]183-joan never tired of . [She]183-joan watched the evening primroses , saw [their]2440-their green bud - cases spring open and the soft yellow leaves tremble out like butterflies new come from the chrysalis . [She]183-joan loved these little lemon - colored lamps that twinkled anew at every sundown in the green twilight of [the garden]3656-the garden . [She]183-joan knew [their]2440-their eyes would watch through the night and that [their]2440-their reward would be death . Many shriveled fragments marked the old blossoms on the long stems , but the crowns of each still put out new buds , and every dusk saw the wakening of fresh blossoms heedless of [[their]2440-their dead sisters]2446-their dead sisters below . " [They]2440-their was killed 'cause [they]2440-their looked at the sun , " thought [Joan]183-joan . " [I]183-joan suppose the moon be [theer mistress]5199-theer mistress and [they]2440-their should not chaange [[their]2440-their god]5200-their god . Yet it do seem hard like to be scorched to death for lookin '[183-joan] upward . " What [she]183-joan saw now typified in a dead flower was [her]183-joan own case under a new symbol ; but [the girl]521-the girl wasted no anger on [the man who had played with [her]521-the girl to make a holiday pleasant , on that mock sun whose light now turned to darkness]2448-the man who had played with her to make a holiday pleasant , on that mock sun whose light now turned to darkness . [Her]183-joan mind was occupied entirely with pity for [herself]183-joan . And that fact probably promised to be a sure first step to peace . The lonely void of [her]183-joan life must be filled , else [Joan]183-joan was like to go mad ; and the filling , left to [Faith]350-faith , might yet be happily accomplished . For [Faith]350-faith , if no more than [a " worm with diamond eyes]2449-a " worm with diamond eyes " yet has eyes of diamonds , and rainbows are the arches of [her]350-faith shape . [Faith]350-faith is fair and a very heart - companion to [those who know [her]350-faith and love [her]350-faith courts]2450-those who know her and love her courts ; and [Joan]183-joan , of all others , was best endowed by disposition and instinct for the possession of [her]350-faith . [Faith]350-faith had slept in [the girl]521-the girl 's heart since [[her]521-the girl mother]706-her mother died ; but , sleeping , had grown , and now waited in all strength to be called to a great task . [The void]2453-the void was at [its]2453-the void deepest just now ; the lowest note of [Joan]183-joan 's soul had sounded ; the facts of [her]183-joan ruin and desertion were fully accepted at last ; and such knowledge served even to turn [the growing mother]2454-the growing mother in [her]2454-the growing mother sour for a time . Maternal instinct stood still just a little while at this point in [the girl]521-the girl 's inner life ; then , when all things whirled away to chaos ; on this night , when nothing remained sure for [her]183-joan but death ; in [her]183-joan hour of ultimate , unutterable weakness and at the dawn of a blank despair , came one last plea from [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin . [Mary]222-mary had given up talking , fairly wearied out and convinced that to waste more words on [Joan]183-joan would be a culpable disposal of time ; but [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin blundered doggedly on with the humility of a worm and the obstinacy of a friendly dog . [He]189-mr. chirgwin hammered at the portals of [Joan]183-joan 's spiritual being with admirable pertinacity ; and at length [he]189-mr. chirgwin had [his]189-mr. chirgwin reward . Faith in something being an absolute and vital essential to the welfare of [every woman]2456-every woman , [Joan Tregenza]183-joan was no exception to the rule . It fell out on the night of [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle 's weekly visit to [market]1222-market , that [Joan]183-joan had just returned from [the garden]3656-the garden , when [she]183-joan heard the clatter of [the spring - cart]2460-the spring - cart . It drew up at the [kitchen]3657-kitchen door and [Mary]222-mary alighted with [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin . The baskets that had started laden with eggs , butter and other produce came back empty save for a few brown paper parcels . Exceptional prices had ruled in [the market - place]2462-the market - place that day , so [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin and [[his]189-mr. chirgwin niece]3958-his niece returned [home]453-home in excellent temper . [They]2465-they all met at supper , together with [those farm - servants who took [their]2466-those farm - servants who took their meals at the farmer 's table meals at [the farmer]3745-the farmer 's table]2466-those farm - servants who took their meals at the farmer 's table . Then [the laborers]2468-the laborers and [the women workers]2469-the women workers withdrew ; [Mary]222-mary sat down to a little sewing before bedtime ; and [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin smoked [his]189-mr. chirgwin pipe and looked at [Joan]183-joan . [He]189-mr. chirgwin noticed that the weather reflected much upon [her]183-joan moods . [She]183-joan was more than usually silent tonight despite the bright news from [market]1222-market . [Presently Mary]351-presently mary put on the kettle and brought out a bottle of rum . [[Her]222-mary uncle]783-her uncle had taken [his]783-her uncle nightcap of spirit and water from [her]183-joan hand for nearly ten years , and the little duty of preparing it was dear to [her]183-joan . [She]183-joan also made cups of tea for [Joan]183-joan and [herself]183-joan . [Mary]222-mary often blamed [herself]222-mary for this luxury and only allowed it on the night that ended those arduous duties proper to market - day . " While thus employed , both [she]183-joan and [Uncle Thomas]199-tom tried to draw [Joan]183-joan out of [her]183-joan gloomy silence . " [Theer]2472-theer 's to be a braave sight o ' singin '[183-joan] down to [Penzance]7-penzance come next week , [Joan]183-joan . [Lunnon folks]2473-lunnon folks , [they]2473-lunnon folks tell [me]0-i , wi ' names a foot tall stuck '[2473-lunnon folks] pon the hoardings . [Us]2474-us thot ' twould be a pleasin '[2473-lunnon folks] kind o ' junketin '[2473-lunnon folks] to go an ' listen . Not but entertainments o '[2473-lunnon folks] singin ' by night be mighty exciting to the blood . Awnly just for wance , [Polly]222-mary reckoned it might do [us]2474-us all good . An '[222-mary] [Polly]222-mary knaws what 's singin ' an '[222-mary] what edn ' so well as [any lass]5201-any lass . [The riders]5202-the riders [ Footnote : [The riders]5202-the riders — [A circus]5204-a circus . ] be comin '[222-mary] likewise , though maybe that 's tu wild an ' savage amoosment for [quiet folks]5205-quiet folks . " " [You]222-mary an '[222-mary] [Polly]222-mary go to the singin ' then . '[222-mary] Tedn ' for the likes o '[222-mary] [me]0-i . " Then [Joan]183-joan turned to [[her]183-joan cousin]4878-her cousin , who was pouring tea out of a little pot which held two cups and no more . " Let [me]0-i have the last nine drops , [Polly]222-mary ; they'm good for the heartache , an ' mine 's more'n common sore to - night . " [Mary]222-mary sighed , opened [her]222-mary mouth to preach a sermon , but shut it without a word . [She]222-mary drained the teapot into [Joan]183-joan 's cup , and then , from a bright mood for [her]222-mary , relapsed into cold silence . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , however , prattled on about the concert until [[his]251-uncle chirgwin elder niece]2110-his elder niece finished [her]2110-his elder niece tea and went to bed . Then [he]251-uncle chirgwin put down [his]251-uncle chirgwin pipe , took a long pull at [his]251-uncle chirgwin drink , and began to talk hurriedly to [Joan]183-joan . " [I]222-mary bin an '[222-mary] got a wonnerful fine notion this day , drivin ' [home]453-home - long , [Joan]183-joan ; an '[179-god] it 's comed back an ' back that importuneous that [I]179-god lay it 's truth , an '[179-god] sent for [me]0-i to remember . D'you knaw that since [you]2476-you comed to [Drift]15-drift [us]2477-us have prospered uncommon ? [Iss]194-iss , [us]2477-us have . The winter dedn ' give no mighty promise , nor yet the spring , till [you]2476-you comed . Then [the Lard]200-the lard smiled '[179-god] pon Drift . Look at the hay what 's gwaine to be cut , [God]179-god willin ' , next week . [I]179-god never seed nothin' more butivul thick underneath in all [my]179-god days . A rare aftermath tu , [I]179-god 'll warrant . '[179-god] Tis so all round . The wheat 's kernin ' somethin' cruel fine — [I]179-god awnly wish [theer]5208-theer was more of it — an '[179-god] the sheep an ' cattle 's in braave kelter likewise . Then [the orchard]1208-the orchard do promise no worse . [I]179-god never seed [such a shaw of russets]5210-such a shaw of russets an '[179-god] of quarantines ' pon they old trees afore . " " '[179-god] Tis a fine , fair season . " " Why , so [I]0-i say — a ' mazin '[0-i] summer thus far — but what 's the reason o't ? That 's [the poser]2478-the poser as an answer comed to in [the cart a drivin ' [home]453-home]5211-the cart a drivin ' home . [You'm]2476-you the reason ! [You]2476-you mind when [good Saint Levan]352-good saint levan walked through [the fields]3478-the fields that the grass grawed the greener for [his]2479-he tread , an '[0-i] many days arter , when [he]2479-he 'd gone dead years an ' years , the corn allus comed richest '[0-i] long the path what [he]2479-he trod . An ' '[0-i] tis the same here , 'cause [God]179-god 's eye be on [you]2480-you , [Joan Tregenza]183-joan , an '[0-i] [His]2479-he eye caan't be fixed ' pon no spot wi'out brightening all around . [You]2476-you mind [me]2480-you , that 's solemn truth . [The Lard]200-the lard 's watchin '[2480-you] over [you]2480-you — watchin ' double tides , as [the sailors]5214-the sailors say — and so this bit o '[2480-you] airth 's smilin ' from the herb o '[2480-you] [the field]1557-the field to the biggest tree as graws . He'm watchin ' over [Drift]15-drift for [your]2480-you sake , [[my]2480-you girl]5215-my girl , an '[2480-you] [the farm]3904-the farm prospers along o ' the gert goodness o '[2480-you] the watchin ' [Lard]200-the lard . Iss fay , [He]2479-he fills all things livin '[2480-you] with plenshousness , an ' fats the root an '[2480-you] swells the corn 'cause [He'm]2479-he breathin '[2480-you] sweet over [the land—'cause]119-the land—'cause [He'm]2479-he wakin ' an '[2479-he] watchin ' for [you]2480-you , [Joan]183-joan . " " [He'm]2479-he watchin '[2480-you] [all of [us]2483-all of us]2483-all of us , [I]0-i s'pose — just to catch the trippin ' footstep , like what faither sez . [He]2479-he abbun no call to worry no more 'bout[2480-you] [me]0-i , [I]0-i reckon . [I]0-i be [Nature]178-nature 's cheel , [I]0-i be ; an ' [[my]2480-you mother]968-my mother 's turnin '[2480-you] hard too — like a cat , as purrs to ' [e]5217-e wan moment an '[0-i] sclows ' e the next . [My]0-i day 's done . [I]0-i 've chose wrong an '[0-i] must abide by it . But ' tis along o '[0-i] bein ' sich [a lil fool]5218-a lil fool . [Nature]178-nature pushes [the weak]2428-the weak to the wall . [I]0-i 've seed that much '[0-i] o late days . [I]0-i was born to have [my]0-i heart broke , [I]0-i s'pose . ' Tedn '[0-i] nothin' very straange . " " [I]0-i judge [[your]2484-you angel]2485-your angel do cry gert tears when [you]2484-you lets on like that , [[my]0-i [Joan]183-joan]1680-my joan . Oh , [gal]3968-gal , why wo n't ' [e]5220-e give ear to [me]3968-gal , as have lived fifty an '[3968-gal] more winters in [the world]3624-the world than what [you]2484-you have ? Why caan't ' [e]5220-e taste an '[3968-gal] try what [the Lard]200-the lard is ? Drabbit this nonsense 'bout [Nature]178-nature ! As if [you]2484-you was [a fitcher]5221-a fitcher , or an '[3968-gal] awk , or an owl ! Caan't ' [e]5220-e see what a draggle tail , low - minded pass all this be bringin '[3968-gal] ' [e]5220-e to ? Yet you'm a thinkin '[3968-gal] creature an ' abbun done no worse than scores o '[3968-gal] folks who be tanklin ' '[3968-gal] pon harps afore the throne o ' God this blessed minute . [You]2484-you chose wrong ; [you]2484-you said so , an '[0-i] [I]0-i was glad to hear ' [e]5220-e , for [you]2484-you never '[3968-gal] lowed even that much till this night . What then ? [Everybody]3758-everybody chooses wrong wan time or another . Some allus goes for it , like the bud - pickers to [the red - currant bushes]2490-the red - currant bushes , some slips here an ' [theer]2491-theer , an '[2493-you] do straightway right ' emselves — right '[2493-you] emselves again an ' again . [You]2493-you 've slipped young an '[2493-you] maybe [theer]2491-theer 's half a cent'ry o ' years waitin '[2493-you] for ' [e]5220-e to get '[2493-you] pon [the right road]3816-the right road ; yet [you]2493-you sez [you]2493-you must abide by what [you]2493-you 've done . [I]2493-you lay the [Luke Gosp'lers]265-luke gosp'lers never told '[2493-you] [e]2493-you that braave fact , 'cause [they]5223-they doan't knaw it theerselves . '[2493-you] Tis like this : [[your]2493-you man]4811-your man did take plain [Nature]178-nature for [God]179-god , an ' [he]4811-your man did talk fulishness 'bout[4811-your man] finding [Him]4811-your man in the scent o ' flowers , the hum o '[4811-your man] bees an ' sichlike . Mayhap Nature 's a gude working [God]179-god for [a selfish man]5224-a selfish man , but [she]178-nature edn '[4811-your man] wan for [a maid]1430-a maid , as [you]2493-you knaws by now . Then [[your]2493-you faither]1212-your faither — [[his]1212-your faither God]4218-his god do sit everlastingly alongside hell - mouth , an ' laugh an '[1212-your faither] girn to see all [the world]3624-the world a walkin ' in , same as the beasts walked in [the Ark.]120-the ark. [Theer]5225-theer 's another picksher of a God for '[2493-you] [e]2493-you ; but mark this , [gal]3968-gal , [they]2500-they be lying [prophets]2501-prophets — lying [prophets both]2502-prophets both ! " [The old man]3536-the old man put out [his]3536-the old man hand to [Joan]183-joan as [he]3536-the old man spoke and [she]183-joan took it between [her]183-joan own and kissed it . " [You'm]3536-the old man very good , " [she]183-joan said , " an '[1212-your faither] [you'm]2503-you'm wise 'cause [you'm]3536-the old man auld an '[1212-your faither] have seen many years . [I]0-i prayed to [Saint Madern]245-saint madern to hear [me]0-i not long since , an ' [I]245-saint madern bathed in [his]245-saint madern waters , an '[245-saint madern] went [home]453-home happy . An '[579-faither] next day [faither]579-faither turned [me]0-i out o ' [[his]245-saint madern house]4385-his house an '[579-faither] counted [me]0-i numbered for hell . " " [Saints]2506-saints be very well , but ' tedn '[2506-saints] in ' cordance with what [we'm]5231-we'm tawld nowadays to pray to any but the Lard direct . " [He]3536-the old man pleaded long and patiently , humbly praying for the religion which had lightened [[his]3536-the old man own road]5232-his own road . The thought of [his]3536-the old man vast experience and the spectacle of [his]3536-the old man own blameless and simple life , as [she]2507-she reviewed it , made [Joan]183-joan relent at last . The great loneliness of [her]183-joan heart yearned for something to fill it . [Man]353-man had failed [her]183-joan , [saints]4507-saints had failed [her]183-joan ; [Nature]178-nature had turned cold ; and [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin held out a great promise . " Ban't no sort o '[2507-she] use , [I]0-i 'm thinkin '[2507-she] , " [she]2507-she said at last , " but if [you'm]2508-you that set ' pon it [I]2507-she 'll do [your]3536-the old man wish . [I]2507-she owe [you]3536-the old man that an '[2507-she] more'n that . Iss , [I]0-i 'll come along wi ' [you]3536-the old man an '[2507-she] [Mary]222-mary to [Sancreed church]2509-sancreed church next Sunday . ' Tis lil enough to do for wan as have done so much for [me]222-mary . " " Thank [God]179-god ! " [he]3536-the old man said earnestly . " That 's good news , to be sure , bless [your]2508-you purty eyes ! An '[222-mary] doan't ' [e]5234-e go a tremblin '[2508-you] an ' fearin '[222-mary] , [you]2508-you mind , like to meetin ' . '[2508-you] Tedn ' no ways like that . Just love o '[2508-you] [the Lard]200-the lard an ' moosic an '[2508-you] holy thots from passon , an ' not more hell - fire than keeps a body healthy - minded an '[2508-you] awake . [[My]0-i ivers]3961-my ivers ! " [Joan]183-joan smiled at [his]3536-the old man enthusiasm on [her]183-joan behalf , then kissed [him]3536-the old man and went to bed ; while [he]3536-the old man , mixing up [his]3536-the old man prayers , [his]3536-the old man last pipe , and [his]3536-the old man final glass of spirits according to [his]3536-the old man custom , sat the fire out while [he]3536-the old man drank deeper and prayed harder than usual in the light of [his]3536-the old man triumph . " [Polly]222-mary couldn '[2508-you] do it , not for all [her]2511-her brains an ' godliness , " [he]3536-the old man murmured to [himself]3536-the old man , " yet '[2508-you] twas given to [an auld simple sawl like [me]0-i]2512-an auld simple sawl like me ! An ' [I]200-the lard have . [I]200-the lard 've led [her]2511-her slap - bang into the hand o '[200-the lard] [the Lard]200-the lard , an ' the rest be [His]3536-the old man business . [No man]3523-no man 's done a better day 's work inside [Cornwall]13-cornwall to - day than what [I]200-the lard have — that 's sure ! " Since [her]222-mary visit to [the church at [Newlyn]1-newlyn]5237-the church at newlyn , [Joan]183-joan had been in no place of worship save [the chapel of [the Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers]5238-the chapel of the luke gospelers . What might be the nature of the service before [her]183-joan [she]183-joan did not know , nor did [she]183-joan care . But [the girl]521-the girl kept [her]521-the girl promise and drove in [the market - cart]5240-the market - cart to Sancreed with [[her]521-the girl uncle]783-her uncle and [cousin]5242-cousin when Sunday came . [The little church]5243-the little church lay bowered in [its]5243-the little church grove of sycamores , and , around [it]5243-the little church , a golden - green concourse of quivering shadows cooled [those who had walked or driven from [Drift]15-drift — [an outlying portion of [the parish]5246-the parish]5245-an outlying portion of the parish]5244-those who had walked or driven from drift — an outlying portion of the parish — approached through [lanes innocent of all shade]5247-lanes innocent of all shade . [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin put up [the horse]5248-the horse and presently joined [[his]189-mr. chirgwin nieces]5249-his nieces in [church]581-church . Then [Joan]183-joan saw [him]189-mr. chirgwin under interesting and novel conditions . [He]189-mr. chirgwin wore glasses with gold rims ; [he]189-mr. chirgwin covered [his]189-mr. chirgwin bald head with a little velvet cap ; at the appointed time [he]189-mr. chirgwin took a wooden plate and carried it round for money . [Mary]222-mary found [the old man]3536-the old man 's places for [him]189-mr. chirgwin and sang in a way that fairly astounded [Joan]183-joan . The enormous satisfaction brought to [herself]183-joan by these vocal efforts was apparent . [Her]183-joan soul appeared mightily lifted up . [She]183-joan amused chance visitors to [the church]688-the church , but [the regular congregation]5253-the regular congregation liked to hear [Mary]222-mary ; and [Joan]183-joan , seeing the comfort [[her]183-joan cousin]4878-her cousin sucked from singing , wished [she]183-joan had heart to join . That , however , [she]183-joan wholly lacked . Moreover , the words were strange to [her]183-joan . The quiet service , brightened by music , dragged its slow length murmuringly along . The sermon , delivered by [a visitor]5255-a visitor , was not of a sort to hold [Joan]183-joan , and , indeed , could hardly be expected to attract [many in such a congregation]5256-many in such a congregation . [The preacher]1903-the preacher had lately been reading old Cornish history , and , overcome by the startling fact that [the far west of [England]37-england — [Cornwall]13-cornwall and [Devon]122-devon]5258-the far west of england — cornwall and devon — were Christian long before [Augustine]299-augustine saw [Kent]123-kent , dwelt upon the matter after a very instructive fashion in ears unlikely to benefit from such knowledge . That [the Cornu - British bishops]5259-the cornu - british bishops preached [Christ]5260-christ while yet [Sussex]124-sussex , [Wessex]125-wessex , [Hampshire]126-hampshire , [Berks]127-berks and [other districts]5261-other districts worshiped [Woden]128-woden , [Freya]354-freya , [the Queen of Heaven]5262-the queen of heaven , [the Thunder God]5263-the thunder god , and [other deities whose altars were set up after the Conquest]5264-other deities whose altars were set up after the conquest , did not interest [Joan]183-joan for one or [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin for another . But [the girl]521-the girl woke up at the mention of [Irish and Welsh and Breton saints]5266-irish and welsh and breton saints . Pleasant to hear was the utterance of names which [she]521-the girl had loved once but of late almost forgotten . [They]5266-irish and welsh and breton saints came back now , and , the service having turned [her]521-the girl heart to softness , [she]521-the girl welcomed [them]5266-irish and welsh and breton saints gladly as [friends]1078-friends returned from afar . For the rest , the Litany it was which roused [Joan]183-joan to deepest interest and opened [her]183-joan mind to new impressions . Here was a prayer , gigantic in length , universal , all - embracing , catholic beyond the compass of anything [her]183-joan thoughts had heretofore conceived . From the Queen upon [her]183-joan throne to [Joan]183-joan [herself]183-joan , from [the bishops]5268-the bishops , [the princes]5269-the princes and [the Lords of the Council]5270-the lords of the council to [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin and [[his]251-uncle chirgwin fruits of [the earth]3591-the earth]5271-his fruits of the earth , that astounding petition ranged with equal vigor and earnestness . Nothing was too high , nothing was too low for it ; all [the world]3624-the world was named , and [the people]4040-the people cried for a hearing or for mercy between each supplication and each prayer . The overwhelming majesty of such praying impressed [Joan]183-joan much ; as , indeed , it impresses all who come adult thereto and do not associate it with [their]5266-irish and welsh and breton saints childhood , with weary hours dragging interminably out , with sleepy buzz of voices , with sore knees or a breaking back , with yearnings stifled , with devices for passing time , with the longed - for sunshine stealing inch by inch eastward on [the church]688-the church walls . " A power o '[200-the lard] larnin ' in a small headpiece , " commented [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin as [he]251-uncle chirgwin drove [home]453-home with [the girls]5277-the girls sitting side by side on [his]251-uncle chirgwin left . " A braave ch'ice o '[200-the lard] words an ' a easy knowledge o '[722-the saints] [the saints]722-the saints as weern't picked up in a day . Tis well to hear [a furriner]3700-a furriner now an ' again . [They]3700-a furriner do widen the grasp of [a man]467-a man 's mind , looking '[3700-a furriner] pon things from a changed point o ' view . Not as [us]5279-us could be '[3700-a furriner] spected to be [Latiners]2515-latiners , yet [I]0-i seem ' tis very well to listen to it as chance offers . '[3700-a furriner] Tis something to knaw ' twas Latin , an '[2516-she] that did [I]0-i , though [I]0-i doubt [some o ' [the good neighbors]5281-the good neighbors]5280-some o ' the good neighbors couldn '[2516-she] tell it for what ' twas , by no means . " [Joan]183-joan said little about the service , but [she]183-joan praised the Litany from [her]183-joan own peculiar attitude toward it . " That be fine prayin '[2516-she] , " [she]2516-she said , " with [nobody]3503-nobody forgot , an ' all in black print so 's wance said '[2516-she] tedn ' lost . " After dinner , when [Mary]222-mary had gone to see [a friend]691-a friend and [the farm people]5283-the farm people were dawdling abroad till evening milking - time , [Joan]183-joan made [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle read the service through again . This [he]783-her uncle did comfortably between the whiffs of [his]783-her uncle pipe , and [Joan]183-joan answered the responses , cooing them in [her]183-joan sweet voice as softly as the red and blue pigeons crooned on the roof outside . [Drift]15-drift was asleep under a hot blaze of afternoon sunshine . Sometimes [a child]4285-a child 's keen voice in [the road]445-the road cut the drowsy silence and came to [Joan]183-joan 's ears where [she]183-joan sat , in [the best parlor with [Uncle Thomas]199-tom]5287-the best parlor with uncle thomas ; sometimes slow wheels rumbled up [the hill]533-the hill toward [Buryan]255-buryan . Other sounds there were none . [The old people]5289-the old people slept within [[their]5289-the old people cottages]5290-their cottages after the extra baked meats of Sunday 's dinner ; many of [the young]5291-the young paired and walked where pathways ran over [meadows]5292-meadows and through yellowing wheat ; while [others]3522-others , more gregarious and unattached , had tramped away to [Penzance]7-penzance to join the parade by [the sea]463-the sea and meet [[their]3522-others friends from [the shops]5296-the shops]5295-their friends from the shops . [Anon nailed boots]355-anon nailed boots stamped up [the little pathway]5297-the little pathway to [Drift farmhouse]5298-drift farmhouse , and [Tom Tregenza]327-tom appeared . To - day [he]327-tom entered fearlessly , for [he]327-tom came upon an errand from [[his]327-tom father]3681-his father . [He]327-tom kissed [Joan]183-joan and shook hands with [Uncle Thomas]199-tom . Then [he]327-tom said : " '[2516-she] Tis a letter as [I]0-i 've brought for [Joan]183-joan — a furriner . " [The girl]521-the girl 's heart beat hard , and the blood rushing from [her]521-the girl cheeks left [them]2519-them white . But the letter only came from [Joe Noy]192-joe , and it is certain that [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza would have forwarded no other . [Excitement]356-excitement died , and was painfully renewed , in a fresh direction , when [Joan]183-joan realized from whom the missive came and thought about [its writer]2520-its writer . [He]192-joe had long been [a stranger to [her]183-joan mind]2521-a stranger to her mind , and now [he]192-joe seemed suddenly to re - enter it — like [a stranger]571-a stranger . " [I]0-i can stay for a bit of tea so long as [I]0-i be back by chapel - time , " explained [Tom]199-tom . " An ' so [you]521-the girl shall , [[my]199-tom son]3811-my son . Run '[199-tom] e out o ' doors an '[199-tom] amoose [yourself]521-the girl where [you]521-the girl mind to ; awnly do n't ope the lil linhay in [the Brook Croft]129-the brook croft , 'cause auld bull 's fastened up [theer]5301-theer an '[192-joe] [his]192-joe temper 's gettin ' more'n more out o '[251-uncle chirgwin] hand . " So [Tom]199-tom departed , and [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin read [Joan]183-joan 's letter aloud to [her]183-joan . It came from [Santa Rosalia]130-santa rosalia , and contained not much news but plenty of love and some religious sentiments bred from [the writer]2523-the writer 's foreign environment . [Joe Noy]192-joe would be back in [England]37-england again before the end of the year . [Joan]183-joan was reduced to tears by this communication . [She]183-joan refused to be comforted , and , indeed , the position was beyond [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's power to brighten . The letter had come at a bad moment , and that calm and repose which almost appeared to be softening [Joan]183-joan 's sorrows now spread speedy wings and departed , leaving [her]183-joan wholly forlorn . Curtains were falling behind [her]183-joan , but curtains were also rising in front . [She]183-joan had looked forward vaguely , and now the position was suddenly defined by the arrival of [Joe]192-joe 's letter , with all its future phases clear - cut , cold and terrible . " [[My]0-i baaby]2524-my baaby 's comin ' just then . An '[2525-he] that 's what 'll fall ' pon [his]192-joe ear fust thing . Oh , if [us]5302-us could awnly tell [en]192-joe afore [he]192-joe comes so [he]192-joe might knaw '[2525-he] tis all chaanged ! ' Twould be easier for [en]192-joe , lovin' [me]2525-he that keen . [He]192-joe 'd grawed to be [a shadder of [a man]467-a man in [my]2525-he mind]5303-a shadder of a man in my mind ; but now [I]2525-he sees [en]192-joe real flaish'n blood ; an '[2525-he] maybe — maybe [he]2525-he 'll seek [me]0-i out an ' kill [me]2526-me for what 's done . " " [I]2526-me do creem to hear '[2526-me] [e]2526-me , [gal]3968-gal ! No , no , [Joe Noy]192-joe 's [a God]3553-a god fearin ' sawl . " " If [he]2525-he 'd forgive [me]3553-a god fust , [I]3553-a god 'd so soon [he]2525-he killed [me]3553-a god as not . " [Mary]193-anna and [Tom]199-tom came in from different directions about this time . [The latter]4881-the latter had regaled [himself]4881-the latter with a peep at " auld bull , " heard the terrific snorting of [his]4881-the latter nostrils and observed how [he]4881-the latter bellowed mightily at durance on such an afternoon . Tea being finished , [the boy]3680-the boy started homeward with a basket of fresh eggs and butter , a pound of cream and some early apples of a sort used for cider , but yet equal to the making of a pie . " As for the butter , '[183-joan] tis [Joan]183-joan 's churnin ' , " said [Mary]193-anna , " but [you]0-i 'd best not to tell [[your]0-i faither]1212-your faither that , else , so like 's not , [he]2531-he 'll pitch it into [the sea]463-the sea . If [us]5312-us could send [en]5313-en a pound o '[199-tom] charity , [I]0-i doubt [he]2531-he 'd be better for't . " " [Faither]579-faither 's [a holy man]2533-a holy man , whatever else [he]579-faither be , " said [Tom]199-tom stoutly . " [He]579-faither doan't want for no good qualities like , 'cause what [he]579-faither doan't knaw 'bout[179-god] [God]179-god edn ' worth knawin '[179-god] . " [Mary]193-anna laughed . It was a feat [she]193-anna seldom performed , and the sound of [her]193-anna amusement lacked joy . " Well , [us]2534-us wo n't argue 'bout en . [You'm]0-i right to say that . " So [Tom]199-tom marched off , and [Mary]222-mary , returning to [the house]592-the house , heard of [Joan]183-joan 's letter . The old gusts of misery , sorrow , indignation , rose in [her]222-mary heart again then , but faintly , like the dying flutter of winds that have blown themselves out . [She]222-mary tried to find a way of bringing comfort to [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin , but failed . [Joan]183-joan had retired and refused consolation . The glory of splendid summer hours passed away ; the long twilight sank to darkness ; the opal lights in [the west]5317-the west at last died under the silver of the moon . And then , like [a child weary with crying]5318-a child weary with crying , [Joan]183-joan slept , while [Mary]222-mary , creeping a third time to see and speak with [her]183-joan , departed silently . But [she]183-joan did not sleep ; and [her]183-joan wakefulness was fortunate , for long after eleven o'clock came a noisy summons at the outer door . Looking from [[her]222-mary room]4592-her room which faced the front of [the house]592-the house , [the woman]4662-the woman saw [Tom]199-tom with [his]199-tom full basket standing clearly defined below . [The world of [the weald and woods]5323-the weald and woods]5322-the world of the weald and woods shimmered silvery in dew and moonlight . Infinite silence reigned . Then [the boy]3680-the boy 's small , indignant voice broke it . " [You]4662-the woman 'll have to let [me]193-anna in , [I]193-anna reckon . [He]199-tom had the satisfaction of eating apples in the moonlight and of posing as [a bitterly wronged boy]2552-a bitterly wronged boy at [Drift]15-drift when [Mary]222-mary came down , lighted a candle , and let [him]199-tom into [the house]592-the house . " [Tom]199-tom departed , the lighter for [his]199-tom basket . [He]199-tom flung a stone at a hare , listened to the jarring of a night - hawk , and finally returned [home]453-home about one o'clock . Both [[his]199-tom parents]5340-his parents were awaiting [him]199-tom , and [the boy]3680-the boy saw that [[his]199-tom mother]752-his mother had been enduring some trouble on [his]199-tom behalf .
