" Then [Tom]199-tom vanished , [[his]199-tom parents]5340-his parents went to [their]5340-his parents rest , and [the cottage on [the cliff]4179-the cliff]5348-the cottage on the cliff slept within the music of [the sea]463-the sea , [its]5348-the cottage on the cliff thatch all silver - bright under a summer moon . To the superficial eye dead hopes leave ugly traces ; viewed more inquiringly the cryptic significance of them appears ; and that is often beautiful . [Joan]183-joan 's soul looked out of [her]183-joan blue eyes now . Seen thoughtfully [her]183-joan beauty was refined and exalted to an exquisite perfection ; but [the unintelligent observer]5351-the unintelligent observer had simply pronounced [her]183-joan pale and thin . The event which first promised to destroy [the new - spun gossamers of a religious faith]5352-the new - spun gossamers of a religious faith and break [them]5352-the new - spun gossamers of a religious faith even on the day of [their]5352-the new - spun gossamers of a religious faith creation , in reality acted otherwise . For [Joan]183-joan , [Joe]192-joe 's letter was like a window opening upon a hopeless dawn ; and [her]183-joan helplessness before this spectacle of the future threw [the girl]521-the girl upon religion — not as a sure rock in the storm of [her]183-joan life , but as a straw to the hand of the drowning . [The world]3624-the world had nothing else left in it for [her]183-joan . [She]183-joan , to whom sunshine and happiness were the breath of life , [she]183-joan who had envied butterflies [their]5352-the new - spun gossamers of a religious faith joyous being , now stood before a future all uphill and gray , lonely and loveless . As yet but the dawn of affection for [the unborn child]5355-the unborn child lightened [her]183-joan mind . Thought upon that subject went hand in hand with fear of pain . And now , in [her]183-joan dark hours , [Joan]183-joan happily did not turn to feed upon [her]183-joan own heart , but fled from it . For distraction [she]183-joan read the four Gospels feverishly day by day , and [she]183-joan prayed long to [the Lord of [them]5352-the new - spun gossamers of a religious faith]5356-the lord of them by night . [Mary]222-mary helped [her]183-joan in an earnest , cheerless fashion , and before [[her]183-joan cousin]4878-her cousin 's solicitude , [Joan]183-joan 's eyes opened to another thought : the old friendship between [Mary]222-mary and [Joe Noy]192-joe . [It]5358-it had wakened once , on [her]183-joan first arrival at [Drift]15-drift , then slept again till now . [She]183-joan was troubled to see [the other woman]5359-the other woman 's indifference , and [she]183-joan formed plans to bring [these two]4906-these two together again . The act of getting away from [herself]183-joan and thinking for others brought some comfort to [her]183-joan heart and seemed to rise indirectly out of [her]183-joan reading . The Christianity of [Drift]15-drift was old - fashioned , and reflected [the Founder]5361-the founder . No distractions rose between [Joan]183-joan and the story . [She]183-joan took it at first hand , escaping thus from those petty follies and fooleries which blight and fog the real issues today . [She]183-joan sucked [her]183-joan new faith pure . A noble rule of conduct lay before [her]183-joan ; [she]183-joan dimly discerned something of its force ; and unselfishness appeared in [her]183-joan , proving that [she]183-joan had read aright . As for the dogma , [she]183-joan opened [her]183-joan arms to that very readily because it was beautiful and promised so much . [[Faith]350-faith 's votaries]5362-faith 's votaries never turn critical eyes upon the foundations of [her]183-joan gorgeous fabric ; [their]5362-faith 's votaries sight is fixed aloft on the rainbow towers and pinnacles , upon the golden fanes . And yet [this man - born structure of theology]5363-this man - born structure of theology , with aisles and pillars fretting and crumbling under the hand of reason , needs such eternal propping , restoring and repairing , that [priestly tinkers]5364-priestly tinkers , [masons]5365-masons , [hod - carriers]5366-hod - carriers are solely occupied with it . [They]5362-faith 's votaries grapple and fight for the poor shadows of dogma by which [they]5362-faith 's votaries live , and , so engaged , the spirit and substance of religion is by [them]5362-faith 's votaries altogether lost . [None of [the Christian churches]5368-the christian churches]5367-none of the christian churches will ever be overcrowded with [men who possess brain - power worthy the name]5369-men who possess brain - power worthy the name . Mediocrity and ignorance may starve , but talent and any new nostrum to strangle reason and keep the rot from the fabric will always open [their]5362-faith 's votaries coffers . [Joan]183-joan truly found the dogma more grateful and comforting than anything else within [her]183-joan experience , and the apparition of [a flesh and blood God]5370-a flesh and blood god , who had saved [her]183-joan with [His]5370-a flesh and blood god own life 's blood before [she]183-joan was born , appeared too beautiful and sufficing to be less than true . [Her]183-joan eyes , shut so long , seemed opening at last . With errors that really signify nothing , [she]183-joan drew to [herself]183-joan great truths that matter much and are vital to all elevated conduct . [She]183-joan thought of [other people]3998-other people and looked at [them]3998-other people as [one wakened from sleep]5372-one wakened from sleep . And , similarly , [she]183-joan looked at [Nature]178-nature . Even [[her]183-joan vanished lover]5373-her vanished lover had not taught [her]183-joan all . There were truths below the formulae of [his]5373-her vanished lover worship ; there were secrets deeper than [his]5373-her vanished lover intellectual plummet had ever sounded . Without understanding it , [Joan]183-joan yet knew that a change had come to pass in material things . Sunshine on [the deep sea]1399-the deep sea hid more matters for wonder than [John Barron]176-barron had taught or known . Once only as yet had [she]183-joan caught a glimpse of [Nature]178-nature 's beating heart ; and that was upon the occasion of [her]183-joan visit to [[St. Madron]249-st. madron 's chapel]5375-st. madron 's chapel . [She]183-joan was lifted up then for a magic hour ; but the lurid end of that day looked clearer afterward than ever the dewy dawn of it . [Nature]178-nature had smiled mutely and dumbly at [her]183-joan sufferings for long months since then . But now added knowledge certainly grew , and from a matrix mightier than the love of Nature or of [man]3551-man , was [Joan]183-joan 's new life born . It embraced a new sight , new senses , ambitions , fears and hopes . [Joan]183-joan went to [church]581-church at every opportunity . Faith seemed so easy , and soon so necessary . Secret prayer became a real thing to be approached with joy . To own to sins was as satisfactory as casting down a heavy burden at a journey 's end ; to confess [them]5378-them to [God]179-god was to know that [they]5378-them were forgiven . There were not many clouds in [her]183-joan religious sky . As [Mary]222-mary 's religion was bounded by [her]222-mary own capabilities and set forth against a background of gloom , which never absolutely vanished save in moments of rare exaltation , so [Joan]183-joan 's newfound faith took upon itself an aspect of sunshine . [Her]183-joan clouds were made beautiful by the new light ; they did not darken it . [Mary]222-mary 's gray Cornish mind kept sentiment out of sight . [She]222-mary lived with clear eyes always focusing reality as it appeared to [her]222-mary . [Heaven]637-heaven was indeed a pleasanter eternal fact than [hell]700-hell ; yet [the place of torment]5381-the place of torment existed on Bible authority ; and it was idle to suppose [it]5381-the place of torment existed for nothing . Grasping eternity as a truth , [she]183-joan occupied [herself]183-joan in strenuous preparation ; which preparation took the form of good works and personal self - denial . [Joan]183-joan belonged to an order of emotional creatures widely different . [She]183-joan loved the beautiful for its own sake , kept [her]183-joan face to the sun when it shone , shivered and shut up like a scarlet pimpernel if bad weather was abroad . And now a chastened sunshine , daily growing stronger , shot through the present clouds , painted beauty on their fringes , and lighted the darkness of their recesses so that even the secrets of suffering were fitfully revealed . [Joan]183-joan grasped at new thoughts , the outcome of [her]183-joan new road . Nature presently seemed of a nobler face , and certain immemorial achievements of [man]3551-man also flashed out in the side - light of the new convictions ; as objects , themselves inconsiderable , will suddenly develop unsuspected splendors from change of standpoint in [the beholder]528-the beholder . The magic of that Christianity , which [Joan]183-joan now received directly from [her]183-joan Bible , wrought and embroidered a new significance into many things . And it worked upon none as upon the old crosses , some perfect still , some ruined as to arm or shaft , some quite worn out and gnawed by time from their original semblance . These dotted [[her]183-joan native land]5384-her native land . Them [she]183-joan had always loved , but now they appeared marvelously transfigured , and the soul hid in [their]5385-their granite beamed through it . Supposing the true menhirs to be but ruined crosses also , [Joan]183-joan shed on [them]5385-their no scantier affection than upon the less venerable Brito - Celtic records of Christianity . Bid so to do , and prompted also by [her]183-joan inclination , [the girl]521-the girl was wo nt to take walks of some length for [her]183-joan health 's sake ; and these had an object now . As [[her]183-joan dead mother]1231-her dead mother 's legends came back to [her]183-joan memory and knit [Nature]178-nature to [[her]183-joan new Saviour]5388-her new saviour , so the weather - beaten stones brought [Him]5388-her new saviour likewise nearer , marked the goal of precious daily pilgrimages , and filled a sad young life with [friends]1078-friends . Returning from a visit to [Tremathick cross]132-tremathick cross , where [it]132-tremathick cross stands upon [a little mound on [the St. Just road]5391-the st. just road]5390-a little mound on the st. just road , [Joan]183-joan heard a thin and well - known voice before [she]183-joan saw [the speaker]1365-the speaker . It was [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza , who had walked over to drink tea and satisfy [herself]198-mrs. tregenza on sundry points respecting [[her]198-mrs. tregenza stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter . " Oh , [[my]3680-the boy Guy]5394-my guy Faux , [Polly]222-mary ! " [she]3680-the boy said upon arriving , " [I]3680-the boy 'm[3680-the boy] in a reg'lar take to be [here]432-here , though [I]0-i knaws [Michael]204-gray michael 's t'other side [the islands]3676-the islands an ' wo n't fetch [home]453-home [']5396-'[0-i] fore marnin ' . [I]0-i 've comed 'cause[0-i] [I]0-i could n't keep from it no more . How 's [her]2561-her doin' , poor tibby lamb , wi ' all them piles o '[0-i] money tu . Not that money did ought to make a differ'nce , but it do , an ' that 's the truth , an '[0-i] it edn ' no good makin '[0-i] as though it doan't . What [a world]2562-a world , to be sure ! An ' that letter from [Noy]192-joe ? [I]0-i knaw [you]222-mary was fond of en likewise in [your]222-mary time . The sadness of it ! Just think o '[0-i] that mariner comin ' [home]453-home '[0-i] pon top o ' this mishap . " [Mary]222-mary winced and answered coldly that [the world]3624-the world was full of mishaps and of sadness . " [The man]3494-the man must face sorrer same as what [us]5400-us all have got to , [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza . Some gets more , some gets less , as the sparks fly up'ard . [Joe Noy]192-joe 's got religion tu . " [Mary]222-mary spoke the last words with some bitterness , which [she]222-mary noted too late and set against [herself]222-mary for a sin . " Oh , [[my]0-i dear]4088-my dear sawl , " said [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza , looking round nervously , as though [she]198-mrs. tregenza feared the shadow of [[her]198-mrs. tregenza husband]605-her husband might be listening . " [Luke]361-luke gosp'ler Gosp'ling 's a mighty uncomfortable business , though [I]0-i lay [Tregenza'd]362-tregenza'd most kill [me]0-i if [he]605-her husband heard the word . '[0-i] Tedn ' stomachable to all , an '[0-i] [I]0-i doubts whether ' twill be a chain strong enough to hold [Joe Noy]192-joe , when [he]605-her husband comes back to find this coil . '[0-i] Tis a kicklish business an ' [I]0-i wish '[0-i] twas awver . [Joe]192-joe 's [a fiery feller]2563-a fiery feller when [he]192-joe reckons [he]192-joe 's wronged ; an ' there ban't no balm to this hurt in [Gosp'ling]133-gosp'ling , take it as [you]5403-you will . [I]192-joe tell [you]5403-you , in [your]5403-you ear awnly , that [Luke Gosp'lers]265-luke gosp'lers graw ferocious like along o '[192-joe] the wickedness o ' the airth . Take [Michael]204-gray michael , as walks wi '[192-joe] [the Lard]200-the lard , same as [Moses]363-moses done ; an ' the more [he]204-gray michael do , the ferociouser [he]204-gray michael do get . Religion ! [He]364-luke gosp'ling stinks o '[192-joe] religion worse than ever [Newlyn]1-newlyn stinks o ' feesh ; [he]364-luke gosp'ling goes in fear o '[179-god] [God]179-god to [his]192-joe marrow ; an ' yet '[222-mary] tis uncomfortable , now an ' then , to live wi '[222-mary] [such a righteous member]2564-such a righteous member . [Theer]2565-theer 's a sourness along of it . [Luke Gosp'ling]364-luke gosp'ling doan't soften the heart of en . " " It should , " said [Mary]222-mary . " An 's so it should , but [he]364-luke gosp'ling says [the world]3624-the world 's no plaace for softness . [He'm]364-luke gosp'ling a terror to [the evildoer]2567-the evildoer ; an ' he'm a terror to [the righteous - doer]5404-the righteous - doer ; an '[364-luke gosp'ling] to hisself no less , [I]0-i reckon ; an ' to [God]179-god A'mighty tu , so like 's not . [The friends of en]5405-the friends of en be as feared of en as [his]364-luke gosp'ling foes be . An '[364-luke gosp'ling] that 's awful wisht , 'cause [he]364-luke gosp'ling goes an '[364-luke gosp'ling] comes purty nigh alone . [The Gosp'lers]265-luke gosp'lers be like fry flyin ' this way an '[364-luke gosp'ling] that ' fore [a school o '[364-luke gosp'ling] mackerl]5406-a school o ' mackerl when [Michael]204-gray michael 's among ['em]5407-'em . Even [minister]5408-minister , [he]2569-he do shrivel a inch or two '[364-luke gosp'ling] longside o ' [Michael]204-gray michael . [I]364-luke gosp'ling 've seen en wras'lin '[364-luke gosp'ling] wi ' the Word same as [Jacob]365-jacob wras'led wi '[364-luke gosp'ling] [the angel]1193-the angel . An ' yet , why ? [Theer]2569-he 's [a man chosen for glory this five - an'-forty years]5409-a man chosen for glory this five - an'-forty years , an '[2569-he] [he]2569-he knaws it so well as [I]0-i do , or any wan . " " [He]2569-he knaws nothin' o ' the sort . The best abbun no right to say it , " declared [Mary]222-mary . Then [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza fired up , for [she]198-mrs. tregenza resented any criticism on this subject other than [her]198-mrs. tregenza own . " An '[2569-he] why not , [Polly Chirgwin]222-mary ? Who 's a right to doubt it ? Not [you]222-mary , [I]0-i reckon , Ban't [your]222-mary plaace to judge [a man]467-a man as walks wi ' [God]179-god , like [Moses]363-moses done . If [Michael]204-gray michael edn '[222-mary] saved , then [theer]2571-theer 's [no sawl]2572-no sawl saved ' pon land or [sea]540-sea . [You]222-mary talk — [a young maiden]5411-a young maiden ! [[His]204-gray michael sawl]5412-his sawl was bleedin '[0-i] an ' [his]204-gray michael hands raw a batterin '[222-mary] the gate o ' heaven '[0-i] fore [you]222-mary was born , [Polly]222-mary — ay , an ' [he]204-gray michael 'd got [the bettermost o '[222-mary] the devil]5413-the bettermost o ' the devil wance for all ' fore [you]222-mary was conceived in the womb ; [you]222-mary mind that . " " [Us]2573-us caan't get the bettermost o '[222-mary] the devil wance for all , " said [Mary]222-mary , changing the issue , " no — not no more'n [us]2573-us can wash [our]2573-us skin clean wance for all . But [you]222-mary an ' [me]222-mary thinks differ'nt an '[222-mary] allus shall , [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza . " " [Iss]2574-iss , though [I]0-i s'pose ' tis [the same devil as [takes backslidin '[198-mrs. tregenza] [church]581-church or [chapel folks]2576-chapel folks]5415-takes backslidin ' church or chapel folks]5414-the same devil as takes backslidin ' church or chapel folks . Let that bide now . Wheer 's [Joan]183-joan to ? [I]0-i 've got to thank ' [e]222-mary kindly for lookin '[0-i] arter Tom t'other Sunday night . Tis things like that makes religion uncomfortable . But [you]222-mary gived [the bwoy]366-the bwoy some tidy belly - timber in the small hours o ' day , an '[366-the bwoy] [he]366-the bwoy comed [home]453-home dog - tired , but none the worse . An ' thank '[222-mary] [e]222-mary for [they]2578-they apples an ' cream an '[222-mary] eggs , which [I]0-i 'm sorry [they]2578-they had sich poor speed . A butivul basket as hurt [me]0-i to the heart to paart with . But [I]0-i was n't asked . No offense , [I]0-i hope , 'bout[0-i] it ? Maybe [uncle]1153-uncle forgot ' twas [the Lard]200-the lard 's day ? " " He'm the last ever to do that . " [Joan]183-joan entered at this point in the conversation and betrayed some slight emotion as [[her]183-joan stepmother]760-her stepmother kissed [her]183-joan . It was nearly five months since [they]2578-they had met , and [Mary]222-mary now departed , leaving [them]2578-they to discuss [Joan]183-joan 's physical condition . " [I]1153-uncle be doin' clever , " said [Joan]183-joan , " never felt righter in body . " [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza poured forth good advice , and after a lengthy conversation came to a secret ambition and broached it with caution . " [I]1153-uncle called to mind some baaby 's things — shoes , clouts , frocks an '[1153-uncle] sich - like as [I]0-i 've got snug in lavender to [home]453-home . [They]2581-they was all flam - new for [Tom]199-tom , an ' [I]2581-they judged [I]2581-they 'd have further use for 'em[2581-they] , but never did . [Theer]2582-theer [they]2581-they be , even to a furry - cloth , as [none]2202-none doan't ever use nowadays , though [[my]0-i mother]968-my mother did , and thot well on't . So [I]0-i did tu . ' Tis just a bit o '[0-i] crimson red tailor 's cloth to cover the soft plaace ' pon a lil baaby 's head '[2581-they] fore the bones of en graw together . An ' [I]0-i reckon '[0-i] tis better to have it then not . [I]0-i seem [you]2585-you 'd do wise to take the whole kit ; an ' you'm that well - to - do that '[2585-you] twouldn ' be worth thinkin '[2585-you] 'bout . '[2585-you] Twould be cheaper'n [a shop]2586-a shop ; an ' theer 's everything [a royal duke]5417-a royal duke 's cheel could want ; an '[2585-you] a butivul robe wi ' lacework cut '[2585-you] pon it , an ' lil bits o '[2585-you] ribbon to tie in the armholes Sundays . They'm vitty clothes . " [Joan]183-joan 's eyes softened to a misty dreaminess before this aspect of the time to come . [She]183-joan had thought so little about [the baby]2292-the baby and all matters pertaining thereto , that every day now brought with it mental novelty and a fresh view of that experience stored for [her]183-joan in the future . " [Iss]194-iss , [I]0-i do mind [they]2581-they things when [Tom]199-tom was in 'em . What be the value in money ? " [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza answered shyly and almost respectfully . " Well , '[194-iss] tis so difficult to say , not bein ' [a reg'lar seller o '[194-iss] things]5418-a reg'lar seller o ' things . [They]2581-they cost wi'out the robe , as was a gift from [Mrs. Blight]367-mrs. blight , more'n five pound . " " Take ten pound , then . [I]0-i 'll tell [uncle]1153-uncle . " [Thomasin]201-thomasin 's red tongue - tip crept along [her]201-thomasin lips and [her]201-thomasin bright eyes blinked , but conscience was too strong . " No , no — a sight too much — too much by half . [I]0-i 'll let [']201-thomasin [e]201-thomasin have the lot for a fi'-pun '[1153-uncle] note . An ' [I]251-uncle chirgwin 'd like it to be a new wan , if '[251-uncle chirgwin] tis the same to [you]201-thomasin . " [Joan]183-joan agreed to this , and ten minutes afterward [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin was opening [his]251-uncle chirgwin cash - box and handing [Thomasin]201-thomasin the snowy , crackling fragment [she]201-thomasin desired . " ' Tis the fust bit o '[201-thomasin] money ever [I]0-i kept unbeknawnst to [Michael]204-gray michael , " [she]201-thomasin said , " an ' , '[201-thomasin] pon [me]0-i life , [Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , [I]0-i be a'most ' feared on't . " " [You]201-thomasin 'll soon get awver that , " declared [Uncle Thomas]199-tom . " [I]201-thomasin 'll send the trap [home]453-home with '[201-thomasin] [e]201-thomasin , an ' [you]201-thomasin can look out the frippery ; an '[201-thomasin] [you]201-thomasin might send a nice split bake back - along with it , if [you]201-thomasin 've got the likes of sich a thing gwaine beggin ' to be ate . " [Presently Mrs. Tregenza]368-mrs. tregenza drove away and [Joan]183-joan went to [[her]183-joan room]4592-her room to think . Magic effects had risen from the spectacle of the well - remembered face , from the sound of the sharp , high voice . A new sensation grew out of them for [Joan]183-joan . [Home]453-home rose like a vision , with the sighing of [the sea]463-the sea , the crying of [the gulls]1611-the gulls , the musical rattle of blocks in [the bay]526-the bay , the clink , clink of picks in [the quarry]5425-the quarry , the occasional thunder of a blast . Many odors were with [her]183-joan : the smell of tar and twine and stores , the scent of drying fish . [She]183-joan saw [the low cliffs]485-the low cliffs all gemmed at this season with moon - flowers — the great white convolvulus which twinkled there . A red and purple fuchsia in [the garden]3656-the garden , had blossomed also . [She]183-joan could see the bees climbing into its drooping bells . [She]183-joan remembered [their]5428-their music , as it murmured drowsily from dead and gone summers , and sounded sweeter than the song of the bees at [Drift]15-drift . [She]183-joan heard the tinkle of a stream outside [the cottage]599-the cottage , where it ran under the hedge through a shute and emptied itself into a great half - barrel ; and then , turning [her]183-joan thoughts to [the house]592-the house , [[her]183-joan own attic]5431-her own attic , with the view of [St. Michael]191-michael 's Mount and [the bay]526-the bay , rose in thought , with every detail distinct , even to the glass scent - bottle on the mantel - piece , and the colored print of [John Wesley]210-john wesley being rescued in [his]210-john wesley childhood from [a burning house]5433-a burning house . These and kindred memories made a live picture to [Joan]183-joan 's eyes . For the first time since [she]183-joan had left [[her]183-joan [home]453-home]1297-her home [the girl]521-the girl found in [her]183-joan heart a desire to return to it . [She]183-joan awoke next morning with the old recollections increased and multiplied ; and the sensation bred from continued contemplation was the sensation of a loss . The significance of the ancient crosses in [Joan Tregenza]183-joan 's latest phase of mental growth becomes much finer after learning somewhat more concerning them than [she]183-joan could ever know . The ephemeral life of [one unhappy woman]5437-one unhappy woman viewed from these granite records of Brito - Celtic pagan and Christian faith , examined in its relation to these hoary splinters of stone , grows an object of some pathetic interest . Such memorials of the past as are here indicated , vary mightily in age . The Christian monuments are not older than the fifth century , but many have been proved palimpsests and rise on pagan foundations dating from a time far more ancient than [their]5438-their own . The relics are divided into two classes by [antiquarians]5439-antiquarians : Pillar Stones and Sculptured Crosses . The former occur throughout [the Celtic divisions of [Great Britain]134-great britain]5440-the celtic divisions of great britain , and are sometimes marked with the Chi Rho monogram , or early rude cross form . In most cases these earlier erections indicated [a grave]5441-a grave , while the sculptured crosses either denoted boundaries of sanctuary , or were raised promiscuously where [men]3512-men and [women]1371-women passed or congregated , [their]5444-their object being to encourage devotion and lead human thoughts heavenward . The designs on [these monuments]5445-these monuments are usually a bad imitation of Irish key patterns and spirals ; but many , in addition , show crucifixes in [their]5438-their midst , with pre - Norman figures depicting [the Christ]5446-the christ in a loose tunic or shirt , [his]5446-the christ head erect and [his]5446-the christ body alive , after the Byzantine fashion . The mediaeval mode of carving a corpse on the cross is of much later date and may not be observed before the twelfth century . More than three hundred of these sculptured crosses have been discovered within [the confines of [Cornwall]13-cornwall]5447-the confines of cornwall . In [churchyards]5448-churchyards and [churchyard]5449-churchyard walls they stand ; they have even been discovered wrought into the fabric of [the churches themselves]5450-the churches themselves ; [the brown moor]5451-the brown moor likewise knows them , for [they]5451-the brown moor stud [[its]5451-the brown moor wildernesses]5452-its wildernesses and rise at the crossways of [many lonely roads]5453-many lonely roads ; while elsewhere , [villages]5454-villages hold them in [their]5454-villages hearts , and the emblem rises daily before the sight of generation upon generation . In [hedges]5455-hedges [they]5451-the brown moor are also to be seen , and in [fields]5456-fields ; many have been rescued from base uses ; and all have stood through the centuries as the sign and testimony of primitive Cornish faith , even as [St. Piran]254-st. piran 's white cross on a black ground , [the first banner of [Cornwall]13-cornwall]5457-the first banner of cornwall , bore aloft the same symbol in days when the present emblem , with [its]5458-its fifteen bezants and its motto , " One and All , " was not dimly dreamed of . These ancient crosses now rose like gray sentinels on the gray life of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan . At [Drift]15-drift [she]183-joan was happily placed among them , and many , not necessary to separately name , lay within the limit of [her]183-joan daily wanderings , and [her]183-joan superstitious nature , working with the new - born faith , wove precious mystery into them . Much [she]183-joan loved the more remote and lonely stones , for beside them , hidden from [the world]3624-the world 's eye , [she]183-joan could pray . Those others about which circled human lives attracted [her]183-joan less frequently . To [her]183-joan the crosses were sentient creatures above the fret of Time , eternally watching human affairs . The dawn of art as shown in early religious sculpture generally amuses an ignorant mind , but , to [Joan]183-joan , the little shirted figures of [[her]183-joan new Saviour]5388-her new saviour , which opened blind eyes on the stones [she]183-joan loved , were matter for sorrow rather than amusement . [They]5451-the brown moor did by no means repel [her]183-joan , despite the superficial hideousness of them ; indeed , with a sort of intuition , [Joan]183-joan told [herself]183-joan that human hands had fashioned them somewhere in the dawn of [the world]3624-the world when yet [her]183-joan Lord 's blood was newly shed , at a time before [men]3512-men had learned skill to make beautiful things . Once , beside the foot of the cross which stood in Sancreed [ Footnote : This fine sculptured cross has since these events been placed within [the said churchyard]5463-the said churchyard , at the desire of [Mr. A. G. Langdon]369-mr. a. g. langdon , [the greatest living authority on the subject of Cornish remains]5464-the greatest living authority on the subject of cornish remains . ] [churchyard]5449-churchyard wall , between two tree - trunks under a dome of leaves , [the girl]521-the girl found growing a spotted persicaria , and the force of the discovery at such a spot was great to [her]183-joan . Familiar with the legend of the purple mark on every leaf of the plant , nothing doubting that it had aforetime grown at the foot of the true cross and there been splashed with the blood of [[her]183-joan Master]5467-her master , [Joan]183-joan accepted the old story that henceforth the weed was granted this proud livery and badge of blood . And now , finding it here , the fable revived with added truth and conviction , the legend of the persicaria was as true to [her]183-joan as that other of [the Lord]702-the lord 's resurrection from death . Thus [her]183-joan views of Nature suffered some approach to debasement in a new direction , but this degradation , so to call it , brought mighty comfort to [her]183-joan soul , daily rounded the ragged edges of life , woke merciful trust and belief in a promised life of bliss beyond the grave , and embroidered thereupon a patchwork , not unbeautiful , built of fairy folk - lore , saintly legend and venerable myth . [Her]183-joan credulous nature accepted right and left ; anything that harbored a promise or was lovely or wonderful in itself found acceptance ; and [Joan]183-joan read into the very pulses of [the summer world]5469-the summer world the truth as [she]183-joan now understood it . [Cornwall]13-cornwall suddenly became [a new Holy Land]5470-a new holy land to [the girl]521-the girl . Here the circumstances of life chimed with those recorded in the New Testament , and it was an easy mental achievement to transplant [[her]183-joan Saviour]5472-her saviour from a historical environment into [her]183-joan own . [She]183-joan pictured [Him]5472-her saviour as walking amid [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's ripening corn ; [she]183-joan saw [Him]5472-her saviour place [His]5472-her saviour hands on the heads of [the little children]1436-the little children at cottage doors ; [she]183-joan imagined [Him]5472-her saviour standing upon one of [the stranded luggers in [Newlyn]1-newlyn harbor]5474-the stranded luggers in newlyn harbor with the gulls floating round [His]5472-her saviour head and [the fishermen]558-the fishermen listening to [his]5472-her saviour utterance . The growing mother instincts in [Joan]183-joan also developed about this season . [They]5476-they leaped from comparative quiescence into activity ; [they]5476-they may indeed be recorded as having arisen within [her]183-joan after a manner not less sudden than had the new faith itself , which was exhibited to [you]5477-you as blossoming with an abruptness almost violent , because it thus occurred . Now most channels of thought led [Joan]183-joan to [[her]183-joan unborn infant]5478-her unborn infant , and there came at length an occasion upon which [she]183-joan prayed for the first time that [[her]183-joan child]741-her child might be justified in its existence . The petition was raised where , in the past , [she]183-joan had uttered one widely different : at the altar - stone in [the ruined baptistery of Saint Madron]5480-the ruined baptistery of saint madron . Thither on a day in early August , [Joan]183-joan traveled by short cuts over fields which brought [the chapel]1120-the chapel within reach of [Drift]15-drift . The scene had changed from that of [her]183-joan former visit , and summer was keeping the promises of spring . Yellow stars of biting stone - crop covered the walls of [the ruin]1861-the ruin ; the fruit of the blackthorn was growing purple , of the hawthorn , red ; [the lesser dodder]5483-the lesser dodder crept , like pink lacework , over furze and heather ; bright - eyed euphrasy and sweet wild thyme were murmured over by many bees ; at the altar 's foot grew brake fern and towering foxgloves ; while upon the sacred stone itself brambles laid [their]5476-they fruit , a few ripe blackberries shining from clusters of red and green . Seeding grasses and docks likewise nourished within [the little chapel]1866-the little chapel , and ragged robins and dandelions brought the best beauty [they]5476-they had . Among which matters , hid in loneliness , to the sound of that hymn of life which rises in a whisper from [all earth]5485-all earth at summer noon , [Joan]183-joan prayed for [[her]183-joan baby]5486-her baby that it might not be born in vain . Among the varied ambitions now manifested by [Joan]183-joan was one already hinted at — one which increased to the displacement of smaller interests : [she]183-joan much desired to see again [[her]183-joan home]1297-her home , if but for the space of an hour . The days and weeks of an unusually smiling summer brought autumn , and with it the cutting of golden grain ; but the bustle and custom of harvest failed to draw [Joan]183-joan among [her]183-joan kind . Human life faded somewhat , even to the verge of unreality with [her]183-joan . Silence fell upon [her]183-joan , and a gravity of demeanor which was new to [the beholders]5488-the beholders . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin and [Mary]222-mary were alike puzzled at this sign , and , misunderstanding the nature of the change , feared that [the girl]521-the girl 's spiritual development must be meeting unseen opposition . Whims and moods were proper to [her]183-joan condition , so [the farmer]3745-the farmer maintained ; but the fancy of eternally sequestering [herself]183-joan , the conceit of regarding as friends those ancient stones of [the moor]5491-the moor and crossroads , was beyond [his]3745-the farmer power to appreciate . To [Mary]222-mary such conduct presented even greater elements of mystery . Yet the fact faced [them]5492-them , and the crosses came in time to be one of the few subjects which [Joan]183-joan cared to talk upon . Even then it was to [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle alone [she]183-joan opened [her]183-joan heart concerning [them]2589-they : [Mary]222-mary never unlocked the inner nature of [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin . " [I]201-thomasin got names o '[201-thomasin] [my]0-i awn for each of 'em , " [Joan]183-joan confessed , " an '[201-thomasin] [I]0-i seem [they]2589-they do knaw [my]0-i comin ' an '[2589-they] [my]0-i secrets an ' [my]2589-they troubles . [They]2589-they teach [me]2589-they the force o '[2589-they] keepin ' [my]2589-they mouth shut ; an '[2589-they] much mixin ' wi '[1526-other folks] [other folks]1526-other folks arter the silence o ' the stones '[1526-other folks] mazes [me]0-i — [men]3512-men an ' wummen do chatter so . " " An '[1526-other folks] so did [you]0-i , [lassie]2284-lassie , an ' weern't none the worse . [Us]5495-us doan't hear [your]0-i purty voice enough now . " " '[0-i] [Tis]2593-tis better thinkin ' than talkin '[199-tom] , [Uncle Thomas]199-tom . [I]0-i abbun nort to talk 'bout , [you]199-tom see , but a power o '[0-i] things to think of . The auld stones speaks to [me]0-i solemn , though [they]2589-they ca n't talk . [They'm]2589-they wise , voiceless things an ' brings [God]179-god closer . An '[0-i] [me]0-i , an ' [all the world]3556-all the world o '[0-i] grass an ' flowers , an '[2594-the lil chirruping griggans] [the lil chirruping griggans]2594-the lil chirruping griggans [ Footnote : Grasshoppers . ] do seem so young beside ['em]5497-'em ; but they'm big an '[2594-the lil chirruping griggans] kind . They warm [my]0-i heart somethin' braave ; an ' [they]2589-they let the gray mosses cling to 'em[2594-the lil chirruping griggans] an ' the dinky blue butterflies open an '[2589-they] shut [their]2589-they wings ' pon 'em[2589-they] , an ' the bramble climb around [theer]0-i arms . [They]2589-they 've tawld [me]2589-they a many good things ; an '[2589-they] fust as [I]0-i must be humbler in [my]0-i bearin ' . Wance [I]2594-the lil chirruping griggans said [I]2594-the lil chirruping griggans 'd forgive [faither]579-faither , an '[2594-the lil chirruping griggans] [I]0-i thot ' twas a fair thing to say ; now [I]2589-they awnly wants en to forgive [me]2589-they an '[2589-they] let [me]0-i come to [my]0-i time wi ' [no man]3523-no man 's anger hot agin [me]2589-they . If [I]2589-they could win just a peep o '[2589-they] [home]453-home . [I]0-i may never see it no more arter , 'cause things might fall out bad wi '[2589-they] [me]0-i . " " ' Tis nachrul as [you]2596-you harp on it ; an '[0-i] , blame [me]0-i , if [I]0-i sees why [you]2596-you shouldn ' go down - long . [Us]5500-us might ride in [the cart]5194-the cart an '[0-i] no harm done . " " Ay , do ' [e]5502-e come , [theer]1212-your faither 's [a dear sawl]3926-a dear sawl . Just to look upon the plaace — " " As for that , if [us]5500-us goes , [us]5500-us must see the matter through an '[0-i] give [[your]2596-you faither]1212-your faither the chance to do what 's right by ' e. " " [He]1212-your faither 'll not change ; but still [I]0-i 'd have en hear [me]0-i tell [I]0-i 'm[0-i] in sorrer for the ill [I]0-i brot ' pon [his]1212-your faither name . " " Ay , facks ! '[0-i] Tis a wise word an ' a right . Us'll go this very arternoon . [You]2596-you get a odd pound or so o '[0-i] scald cream , an ' [I]0-i 'll see to a basket o '[0-i] fruit wi ' some o '[0-i] [they]2598-they scoured necterns , as ban't no good for sellin ' , but eats so well as t'others . Iss , [we]5500-us 'll go so soon as dinner be swallowed . [Wishes]370-wishes doan't run in [a body]5504-a body 's head for nothin' . " [[Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's old market - cart]5505-uncle chirgwin 's old market - cart , with the gray horse and the squeaking wheel , rattled off to [Newlyn]1-newlyn some two hours later , and the ordeal , longed for at a distance , towered tremendous and less beautiful at nearer approach . When [they]5500-us started , [Joan]183-joan had hoped that [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father might be at [home]453-home ; as [they]5500-us neared [Newlyn]1-newlyn [she]183-joan felt a growing relief in the reflection that [his]3642-her father presence ashore was exceedingly improbable . [Her]183-joan anxieties were forgotten for a few moments at sight of the well - known outlines of [the hills above [the village]423-the village]5508-the hills above the village . Now arrish - mows — little thatched stacks some eight feet high — glimmered in the pale gilded stubbles of [the fields]3478-the fields ; [the orchards]5511-the orchards gleamed with promise ; the foliage of the elms was at its darkest before the golden dawn of autumn . Well - remembered sights rose on [Joan]183-joan 's misty eyes with the music proper to [them]5512-them ; then came the smell of [the sea]463-the sea and the jolting of [the cart]5194-the cart , going slowly over rough stones . [Narrow , steep streets]5515-narrow , steep streets and sharp corners had to be traversed not only with caution but at a speed which easily placed [Joan]183-joan within the focus of many glances . Troubles and humiliation of a sort wholly unexpected burst suddenly upon [her]183-joan , bringing [the girl]521-the girl 's mind rudely back from dreams born of the familiar scene . [Newlyn women]5517-newlyn women bobbed about [their]5517-newlyn women cottage doors with hum and stir , and [every gossip]5518-every gossip 's mouth was full of news at this entry . Doors and windows filled with curious heads and bright eyes ; there was some laughter in the air ; [fishermen]1130-fishermen got up with sidelong looks from the old masts or low walls whereon , during hours of leisure , [they]1130-fishermen sat in rows and smoked . [Joan]183-joan , all aflame , prayed [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin to hasten , which [he]251-uncle chirgwin did to the best of [his]251-uncle chirgwin power ; but [their]5520-their progress was of necessity slow , and local curiosity enjoyed full scope and play . Tears came to [the girl]521-the girl 's eyes long before [the village]423-the village was traversed ; then , through a mist of them , [she]183-joan saw a hand stretched to meet [her]183-joan own and heard a voice which rang kindly on [her]183-joan ears . It was [Sally Trevennick]272-sally , who faced the spiteful laughter without flinching and said a few loud , friendly words , though indeed [her]272-sally well - meant support brought scant comfort with it for [the victim]5523-the victim . " Lard sakes ! [Joan]183-joan , doan't '[0-i] [e]2599-e take on so at [them]2600-them buzzin ' [fools]5524-fools ! '[189-mr. chirgwin] Tedn ' the trouble , '[189-mr. chirgwin] tis the money make ['em]5525-'em clatter ! Bah ! Wheer 's the wan of [[them]2600-them black - browed gals]5526-them black - browed gals as '[189-mr. chirgwin] alf the money wouldn ' buy ? [You]183-joan keep a bold faace , an '[189-mr. chirgwin] doan't let ['em]2599-e see as [their]2600-them sniggerin 's aught more to '[189-mr. chirgwin] [e]2599-e than dog - barking . " " [Us'll]2601-us'll be [theer]2602-theer in a minute , " added [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin , " an ' [I]189-mr. chirgwin 'll drive back agin by [Mouzle]16-mouzle ; then [you]2603-you 'll '[189-mr. chirgwin] scape [they]2600-them she - cats . [I]0-i never thot as [you]2603-you 'd a got to stand that dressin ' down in a plaace what 's knawed [you]2603-you an '[189-mr. chirgwin] yours these many years . " [Joan]183-joan asked [Sally Trevennick]272-sally whether [she]272-sally could say if [Gray Michael]204-gray michael was on [the water]3501-the water , and [she]272-sally felt very genuine thankfulness on learning that [Sally]272-sally believed so . Two minutes later [the spring - cart]2460-the spring - cart reached [level ground]2606-level ground above [the sea]463-the sea , then , whipping up [his]189-mr. chirgwin horse , [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin increased the pace , and very quickly [Joan]183-joan found [herself]183-joan at the door of [home]453-home . [Thomasin]201-thomasin was within , and , hearing the sound of wheels cease before [the cottage]599-the cottage , came forth to learn who had arrived . [Her]183-joan surprise was only equaled by [her]183-joan alarm at sight of [Joan]183-joan and [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin . So frightened indeed did [she]183-joan appear that both [the newcomers]2610-the newcomers supposed [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza must be within . Such , however , was not the case , and [[Joan]183-joan 's stepmother]2611-joan 's stepmother explained the nature of [her]2611-joan 's stepmother fears . " He'm to [sea]540-sea , but [the whole world]2613-the whole world do knaw [you]183-joan be come , [I]0-i 'll lay ; an ' [he]216-mr. tregenza 'll knaw tu . " " ' Tedn '[183-joan] [your]183-joan fault anyways , " declared [Uncle Thomas]199-tom . " [Joan]183-joan 's wisht an ' sad to see [home]453-home agin , as was right an '[199-tom] proper ; an ' in [her]183-joan present way [she've]183-joan got to be humored . So [I]183-joan 've brot [her]183-joan , an '[183-joan] what blame comes o't [my]0-i shoulders is more'n broad enough to carry . " [He]0-i drove away immediately , and for a while [Joan]183-joan was left with [Mrs. Tregenza]368-mrs. tregenza . [The latter]4881-the latter 's curiosity presently soothed [her]183-joan fears , and almost the first thing [she]183-joan began to talk about was that " will and testament " which [she]183-joan had long since urged upon [[her]183-joan stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter . But [the girl]521-the girl , moving about in [the well - known orchard]2621-the well - known orchard , had no attention for anything but the sights , sounds and scents around [her]521-the girl . Silently and not unhappily [she]521-the girl basked in old sensations renewed ; and they filled [her]521-the girl heart . Meanwhile [Thomasin]201-thomasin kept up a buzz of conversation concerning [Joan]183-joan 's money and [Joan]183-joan 's future . " Touchin ' that bit o '[2622-e] writin ' ! Do '[2622-e] [e]2622-e see to it , soas ; ' tis awnly wisdom . [Theer]2623-you 's allus a fear wi '[2622-e] the fust , specially in the case o ' a pin - tail built lass like [you]2623-you be . An ' [he]204-gray michael 'd burn it — every note — [I]179-god mean [Michael]204-gray michael . Now if [you]2623-you was to name [Tom]199-tom — just in case o '[179-god] accidents — ? Love [childern]1104-childern do come as sweet an ' innercent on to the airth as [them]1104-childern born o '[2625-he'm] wedlock — purty sawls . " " Quite right , " declared [Thomasin]201-thomasin . " [Iss fay]194-iss ! [He]2631-he be [a plain dealer]2632-a plain dealer an ' [a good righteous man]5534-a good righteous man . " [Joan]183-joan 's thoughts meanwhile were mainly concerned with [her]183-joan surroundings , and when [she]183-joan had walked thrice about [the garden]3656-the garden , visited the pigs , peeped into [the tool - house]5536-the tool - house to smell the paint and twine , noted the ripening plums and a promising little crop of beets coming on in [the field beyond]5537-the field beyond , [she]183-joan went indoors . There a pair of [Michael]204-gray michael 's tall sea - boots stood in the chimney corner , with a small pair of [Tom]199-tom 's beside [them]5538-them ; the old , well - remembered crockery shone from the dresser ; geraniums and begonias filled the window ; on a basket at the right of the fireside stood a small blue plate with gold lettering upon it and a picture of [Saltash Bridge]135-saltash bridge in the middle . The legend ran — A present for [a good girl]5172-a good girl . It was a gift from [[her]5172-a good girl father]3642-her father to [Joan]183-joan , on [her]183-joan tenth birthday . [She]183-joan picked it up , polished it , and asked for a piece of paper to wrap it in , designing to carry the trifle away with [her]183-joan . [Every old nook and corner]5541-every old nook and corner had been visited by the time that [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin returned . Then [all]1841-all sat down to eat and drink , and the taste of the tea went still further to quicken [Joan]183-joan 's memory . [Mrs. Tregenza]368-mrs. tregenza gave [them]1841-all such information as suggested itself to [her]368-mrs. tregenza during the progress of the meal . [She]368-mrs. tregenza was chiefly concerned about [[her]368-mrs. tregenza son]836-her son . " Cruel '[2633-his] ard worked [he]2633-his be , sure ' nough , " [she]368-mrs. tregenza murmured . " [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin went to smoke a pipe and water [his]251-uncle chirgwin horse at this juncture ; but [he]251-uncle chirgwin returned within less than ten minutes . " " Ban't no odds if [us]5548-us do . [Joan]183-joan had a mind to see [en]204-gray michael , " answered [the farmer]3745-the farmer ; but [Joan]183-joan spoke for [herself]183-joan . [She]183-joan explained that [she]183-joan now wished to depart without seeing [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father if possible . It was , however , too late to escape the meeting . Even as [the twain]5552-the twain bade [Mrs. Tregenza]368-mrs. tregenza a hasty farewell , heavy feet sounded on the cobbles at [the cottage]599-the cottage door and a moment later [Tregenza]368-mrs. tregenza entered . [His]3642-her father oilskins were wet and shiny ; half a dozen herrings , threaded through the gills on a string , hung from [his]3642-her father right hand . [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza instantly observed [Joan]183-joan where [she]183-joan sat by the window , and , seeing [her]183-joan , stood still . The fish fell from [his]3642-her father hand and dropped slithering in a heap on the stone floor . There was a silence so great that [all]1841-all could hear a patter of drops from [the fisherman]797-the fisherman 's oilskins as the water rolled to the ground . At the same moment gusts of rising wind shook the casement and bleared the glass in it with rain . [Joan]183-joan , as [she]183-joan rose and stood near [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin , heard [her]183-joan heart thump and felt the blood leap . Then [she]183-joan nerved [herself]183-joan , came a little forward , and spoke before [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father had time to do so . [He]3642-her father had now turned [his]3642-her father gaze from [her]183-joan and was looking at [the farmer]3745-the farmer . " [She]2647-she stood without moving , as did [he]371-uncle thomas'll . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin watched silently . [Mrs. Tregenza]368-mrs. tregenza made some stir at the fire to conceal [her]368-mrs. tregenza anxiety . No relenting glimmer softened either the steel of [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's eyes or one line in [his]371-uncle thomas'll great face . The furrows knotted between [his]371-uncle thomas'll eyebrows and at the corners of [his]371-uncle thomas'll eyes . [His]371-uncle thomas'll sou'wester still covered [his]371-uncle thomas'll head . At [his]371-uncle thomas'll mouth was a down - drawing , as of disgust before some offensive sight or smell , and the hand which had held the fish was clinched . [He]371-uncle thomas'll swallowed and found speech hard . Then [Joan]183-joan spoke again . " [Uncle]2648-uncle 's forgived [me]0-i , an ' [Mary]222-mary , an '[199-tom] [Tom]199-tom , an ' mother here . Caan't '[199-tom] e , caan't ' [e]2645-e , [faither]579-faither ? [The man]3494-the man twisted Scripture to [his]0-i narrow purposes according to Luke Gospel usage . " '[199-tom] Forgive ' ? [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's self - control was less than usual ; [his]204-gray michael face had grown very red and surcharged veins showed black on the unwrinkled sides of [his]204-gray michael forehead . " No more , not a word . Get [you]3551-man gone an ' never agin set foot '[179-god] pon this here draxel .
