" Hereupon [Joan]183-joan , not judging correctly of the black storm signs on [[her]183-joan father]3642-her father 's face or the force of the voice , now grating into a shriek as passion tumbled to flood , prayed yet again for that pardon which [[her]183-joan parent]4608-her parent was powerless to grant . The boon denied grew precious in [her]183-joan eyes . [She]183-joan wept and importuned , falling on [her]183-joan knees to [him]3642-her father . " [God]179-god can do it , [God]179-god can do it , [faither]579-faither . Please — please , for the sake o '[2658-the god] [the God]2658-the god as leads [you]3551-man , forgive . Oh , [God]179-god in [heaven]637-heaven , make en forgive [me—'tis]2660-me—'tis all [I]0-i wants . " But a religious delirium gripped [Tregenza]183-joan and poisoned the blood in [him]0-i . [His]0-i breast rose , [his]0-i fists clinched , [his]0-i mouth was dragged sidewise and [his]0-i underlip shook . [A damned soul , looking up with wild eyes]2661-a damned soul , looking up with wild eyes into [his]0-i , was all [he]0-i saw — the very off scouring and filth of human nature — hell tinder , to touch which in kindness was to risk [his]0-i own salvation . " Gaw , gaw ! Else [the Lard'll]373-the lard'll make [me]0-i [His]373-the lard'll weapon . [He]373-the lard'll 's whisperin'—He 's whisperin ' ! " There was something horribly akin to genuine madness in the frenzy of this utterance . [Mrs. Tregenza]368-mrs. tregenza screamed ; [Joan]183-joan struggled to [her]183-joan feet in some terror and [her]183-joan head swam . [She]183-joan turned to get [her]183-joan hat from the dresser - ledge , and , as [she]183-joan did so , the little blue plate , tied up in paper beside it , fell and broke , like the last link of a snapping chain . [Gray Michael]204-gray michael was making a snorting in [his]204-gray michael nostrils and [his]204-gray michael head seemed to grow lower on [his]204-gray michael shoulders . Then [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin found [his]189-mr. chirgwin opportunity and spoke . " [I]373-the lard'll 've heard [you]2663-you , an '[373-the lard'll] it ban't [human nachur]2662-human nachur to knuckle down dumb , so [I]0-i be gwaine to speak , an ' [you]2663-you can mind or not as [you]2663-you please . " [He]0-i flung [his]0-i old hat upon the ground and walked without fear close beside [the fisherman who towered above [him]0-i]5576-the fisherman who towered above him . " [God]179-god be with '[2663-you] [e]2663-you , [I]0-i sez , for [you]2663-you need En fine an ' bad for sartain — worse'n that poor '[2663-you] mazed lamb shakin ' [theer]5577-theer . [You]2663-you talk o '[2663-you] the ways o ' [God]179-god to [men]3512-men an '[2663-you] knaw no more 'bout 'em[2663-you] than the feesh what [you]2663-you draw from [the sea]463-the sea ! [You'm]2663-you choustin ' [yourself]2663-you cruel wi '[2663-you] [your]2663-you self - righteousness — take it from [me]0-i . [You'm]2663-you saved , be [you]2663-you ? [You]2663-you be gwaine to [heaven]637-heaven , are ' [e]2663-you ? Who tawld '[2663-you] [e]2663-you so , [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza ? Did [God A'mighty]179-god send [a flyin ' angel]5579-a flyin ' angel to tell '[2663-you] [e]2663-you a purpose ? Look in [your]2663-you heart , [man]3551-man , an ' see how much o '[2667-christ] [Christ]2667-christ be in it . [Christ]2668-christ , [I]0-i tell ' [e]2663-you , [Christ]5580-christ — [Christ]5581-christ — [Jesus Christ]5582-jesus christ . It 's [Him]5580-christ as'll smuggle [us]5583-us all into [heaven]637-heaven , not [your]2663-you psalm - smitin '[0-i] , knock - [me]0-i - down , ten - commandment , cussin ' [God]179-god . [I]0-i 'm[0-i] grawin ' very auld an '[0-i] [I]0-i knaw what [I]0-i knaw . [[Your]2663-you God]4777-your god 's [a devil]2670-a devil , [fisherman]2671-fisherman — [a graspin ' , cruel devil]5585-a graspin ' , cruel devil ; an '[2670-a devil] [them]2672-them [the devil]3557-the devil saves is damned . ' Tis [Christ]5586-christ as [you]2663-you 've turned [your]2663-you stiff back '[2674-christ] pon — [Christ]2674-christ as'll let [this poor lass]2675-this poor lass into [heaven]637-heaven afore ever [you]2663-you gets [theer]2677-theer ! [You]2663-you ban't in sight o ' the gates o '[2674-christ] pearl , not [you]2663-you , for all [your]2663-you cold prayers . [You'm]2663-you young in well - doin' ; an ' '[2674-christ] tis [a ' ard road [you]2663-you 'll fetch [home]453-home by]5587-a ' ard road you 'll fetch home by , [I]2674-christ 'll swear ; an '[2674-christ] ' tis more'n granite the Lard'll use to make [your]2663-you heart bleed . [He]2674-christ 'll break [you]2663-you , [Tregenza]203-michael tregenza — [you]2663-you , so bold , as looks dry - eyed '[2674-christ] pon the sun an ' reckons [your]2663-you throne'll wan day be as bright . [He]2674-christ 'll break [you]2663-you , an '[2674-christ] bring [you]2663-you to [your]2663-you knees , an ' that '[2674-christ] fore [your]2663-you gray hairs be turned , as [mine]2678-mine , to white . Oh , [Christ Jesus]2679-christ jesus , look [you]2663-you at this blind sawl an ' give [en]5589-en somethin' better to lay hold '[2674-christ] pon than [his]2679-christ jesus poor bally - muck o ' religion what 's nort but a gert livin '[223-tom] lie ! " [Thomas Chirgwin]223-tom seemed mightily transfigured as [he]223-tom spoke . The words came without an effort , but [he]223-tom uttered them with pauses and in a loud voice not lacking solemnity . [His]223-tom head shook , yet [he]223-tom stood firm and motionless upon [his]223-tom feet ; and [he]223-tom made [his]223-tom points with a gesture , often repeated , of [his]223-tom open right hand . As for [Tregenza]203-michael tregenza , [the man]3494-the man listened through all , though [he]3494-the man heard but little . [His]223-tom head was full of blood ; there was a weight on [his]223-tom tongue striking it silent and forcing [his]223-tom mouth open at the same moment . [The world]3624-the world looked red as [he]3494-the man saw it ; [his]223-tom limbs were not bearing [him]223-tom stiffly . [Thomasin]201-thomasin had [her]201-thomasin eye upon [him]3494-the man , for [she]201-thomasin was quite prepared to throw over [her]201-thomasin previous statements and support [[her]201-thomasin husband]605-her husband against an attack so astounding and unexpected . And the more so that [he]3494-the man had not [himself]3494-the man hurled an immediate and crushing answer . [Meantime]198-mrs. tregenza [the old farmer]4936-the old farmer 's sudden fires died within [him]3494-the man ; [he]3494-the man shrank to [his]3494-the man true self , and the voice in which [he]3494-the man now spoke seemed that of [another man]1494-another man . " Give heed to what [I]0-i 've said to ' [e]3494-the man , [Michael]203-michael tregenza , an '[0-i] be humble afore the Lard same as [[your]3494-the man darter]4727-your darter be . Go in fear , as [you]3494-the man be forever biddin ' all flaish to go . Never say no sawl 's lost while [you]3494-the man give all power to [the Maker o '[251-uncle chirgwin] sawls]5590-the maker o ' sawls . Go in fear , [I]0-i sez , else theer'll come a whirlwind o ' God - sent sorrer to strike wheer [your]3494-the man heart 's desire be rooted . '[251-uncle chirgwin] Tis allus so — allus — " [Tom]223-tom entered upon these words , and [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's eyes dropping upon [him]223-tom as [he]3494-the man spoke , [his]3494-the man utterance sounded like a prophecy . So [[the boy]3680-the boy 's mother]2687-the boy 's mother read it , and with a half sob , half shriek , [she]2687-the boy 's mother turned in all the frenzy of sudden maternal wrath . [Her]2687-the boy 's mother sharp tongue dropped mere vituperation , but did so with boundless vigor , and [the woman]4662-the woman 's torrent of unbridled curses and threats swept that scene of storm to its close . [Joan]183-joan went first from the door , while [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin , picking up [his]189-mr. chirgwin hat and buttoning [his]189-mr. chirgwin coat , retreated after [her]2687-the boy 's mother before the volume of [Thomasin]201-thomasin 's virago attack . [Tom]223-tom stood open - mouthed and silent , dumfounded at the tremendous spectacle of [[his]223-tom mother]752-his mother 's rage and [[his]223-tom father]3681-his father 's stricken silence . Then , as [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza slammed the door and wept , [[her]198-mrs. tregenza husband]605-her husband sunk slowly down with something strangely like terror in [his]605-her husband eyes . [The man in truth]2692-the man in truth had just passed through a physical crisis of alarming nature . [He]605-her husband sat in [his]605-her husband easy - chair now , removed [his]605-her husband hat , and wiped the perspiration from [his]605-her husband forehead with hands that shook . It was not what [he]605-her husband had heard or beheld that woke alarm in a spirit which had never known it till then , but what [he]605-her husband had felt : a horror which crowded down upon every sense , gripped [his]605-her husband volition with unseen hands , blinded [him]605-her husband , stopped [his]605-her husband ears , held [his]605-her husband limbs , stirred [his]605-her husband brains into a whirling waste . [He]605-her husband knew now that in [his]605-her husband moment of passion [he]605-her husband had stood upon the very brink of some terrific , shattering evil , possibly of death itself . Body or brain or both had passed through a great , unknown danger ; and now , dazed and for the time much aged , [he]605-her husband looked about [him]605-her husband with slow eyes — mastered the situation , and realized the incident was ended . " [The Lard—'the Lard]200-the lard is [King]671-king , ' " [he]605-her husband said , and stopped a moment . Then [he]605-her husband slowly rose to [his]605-her husband feet and with the old voice , though it shook and slurred somewhat upon [his]605-her husband tongue , spoke that text which served [him]605-her husband in all occasions of unusual stress and significance . " '[200-the lard] [The Lard]200-the lard is [King]671-king , be [the people]4040-the people never so impatient ; [He]200-the lard sitteth between [the cherubims]1949-the cherubims , be the airth never so unquiet ' ! " Then [he]605-her husband sat again and long remained motionless with [his]605-her husband face buried in [his]605-her husband hands . Meantime the old horse dragged [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin and [[his]251-uncle chirgwin niece]3958-his niece away along [the level road]5592-the level road to [Mousehole]9-mousehole . [Joan]183-joan was wrapped in a tarpaulin and [they]5593-they proceeded silently a while under cold rains , which swept up from a leaden south over [the sea]463-the sea . The wind blew strong , tore green leaves from the hedges , and chimed with the thoughts of [the man]3494-the man and [[his]251-uncle chirgwin niece]3958-his niece . " How did [you]199-tom come to speak so big an '[200-the lard] braave , [Uncle Thomas]199-tom ? [I]0-i couldn ' say no more to en , for the lights rose up in [my]199-tom throat an '[199-tom] choked [me]0-i ; but [you]199-tom swelled out somethin' grand to see , an ' spawk as [no man]3523-no man ever yet spawk to faither afore . " " '[199-tom] Twas put in [me]0-i to say ; [I]0-i doan't knaw how ever [I]0-i done it , but [my]0-i tongue weern't [my]0-i awn for the time . Pull that thing tighter about ' e. This rain would go through a barn door . " At [the steep hill rising from [Mousehole]9-mousehole to [Paul]182-tarrant]5598-the steep hill rising from mousehole to paul , [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin got out and walked , while the horse , with [his]3494-the man shoulders to the collar , plodded forward . Then , down [the road]445-the road came [the laboring man]5600-the laboring man , [Billy Jago]188-billy jago , mentioned aforetime as one who had worked for [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin in the past . [He]5600-the laboring man touched [his]5600-the laboring man hat to [[his]5600-the laboring man old master]5601-his old master and greeted [him]5601-his old master with respect and regard . For a moment [the farmer]3745-the farmer also stopped . No false sentiment tied [Billy]188-billy jago 's tongue and [he]188-billy jago spoke of matters personal to those before [him]188-billy jago , having first mournfully described [his]188-billy jago own state of health . " But [theer]5603-theer , [us]5604-us gaws down to [the tomb]5605-the tomb to make way for [the new born]5606-the new born . [I]2700-maaster do say , an '[2700-maaster] swear tu , that the butivulest things in [all wild nachur]2697-all wild nachur be [a ship]2698-a ship in full sail an ' a wummon in the fam'ly way . Ban't nothin' to beat 'em[2700-maaster] . An ' [I]2700-maaster 'll say it here , '[2700-maaster] pon [this spot]2699-this spot , though the rain 's bitin ' into [my]2700-maaster bones like teeth . So long to '[2700-maaster] e , [maaster]2700-maaster , an ' good cheeldin '[2700-maaster] to ' e , [miss]5607-miss ! " [The man]3494-the man rolled with loutish gait down [the hill]533-the hill ; the darkness gathered ; the wind whistled through high hedges on the left ; farmer [Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin made sounds of encouragement to [his]251-uncle chirgwin horse , which moved onward ; and [Joan]183-joan thought with curious interest of those things that [Billy Jago]188-billy jago had said . " '[2700-maaster] Tis straange [us]2701-us met [that poor , croony antic]2702-that poor , croony antic at sich a moment , " mused [Uncle Thomas]199-tom ; " the words of en jag sore ' pon a body 's mind , comin '[199-tom] arter what 's in [our]2701-us thots like . " " Maybe ' tis paart o '[183-joan] the queerness o ' things as [us]2701-us should fall '[199-tom] pon en now , " answered [Joan]183-joan . Then , through a stormy gloaming , [they]2701-us returned in sadness to [the high lands of [Drift]15-drift]2703-the high lands of drift . " A new broom sweeps clean , but ' tis the auld wan as is good for corners , " said [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , when with [[his]251-uncle chirgwin nieces]5249-his nieces [he]251-uncle chirgwin sat beside the kitchen fire that night and discussed the events of the day . " By which [I]183-joan means , " [he]251-uncle chirgwin added , " that these new - fangled ways of approaching the A'mighty may go to branch and trunk an '[183-joan] make a clean sweep o ' evil , but they leaves the root o '[183-joan] pride stickin ' in [a man]467-a man 's sawl . '[0-i] Tis the auld broom as [Christ]2704-christ brought in [the world]3624-the world as routs into the dark corners like nothin' else . " " [I]0-i be glad [you]2706-you spawk to en , " said [Mary]222-mary . " [Seed sawed]374-seed sawed do bring forth fruit in a ' mazin ''[222-mary] way . " " [I]0-i reckoned [he]374-seed sawed 'd a smote [me]0-i , but [he]374-seed sawed dedn ' . [He]374-seed sawed just turned rosy red an '[374-seed sawed] stood glazin ' at [me]374-seed sawed as if [I]374-seed sawed was a ghost . " " [I]374-seed sawed never see [en]5612-en look like that afore , " declared [Joan]183-joan ; " [he]374-seed sawed '[374-seed sawed] peared to be afeared . But the door 's shut ' gainst [me]374-seed sawed now . [I]374-seed sawed caan't do no more'n [I]374-seed sawed have done . [He]374-seed sawed 'll never forgive . " " As to that , [Joan]183-joan , [I]374-seed sawed wo n't say . [You]183-joan bide quiet till the seed sprouts . [I]374-seed sawed lay now as [you]183-joan 'll hear tell about [[your]183-joan faither]1212-your faither an '[374-seed sawed] maybe get a message from en ' fore the year 's a month older . " With which hopeful prediction [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin ended the discussion . That night the circular storm , which had died away at dark , turned upon itself and the wind moaned at window latches and down chimneys , prophesying autumn . Dawn broke on a drenched , gray world , but the storm had clean passed , and at noon the gray brightened to silver and burned to gold when the sun came out . The wind wore to the west , and on to northwest ; the weather settled down and days of a rare late summer pursued [their]5614-their even way . A fortnight passed , and [the farmer]3745-the farmer 's belief that [Gray Michael]204-gray michael would communicate with [[his]204-gray michael daughter]695-his daughter began to waver . " [Pharaoh]375-pharaoh 's a soft-'earted twoad to [this wan]5617-this wan , " [he]204-gray michael declared gloomily . " It do beat [me]2707-me to [picksher]5618-picksher sich [a man]467-a man . [I]2707-me 've piped to en hot an '[2707-me] strong , as [Joan knaws]183-joan , but [he]2707-me ban't gwaine to dance ' tall seemin'ly . [Poor sawl]1687-poor sawl ! When the hand o '[2707-me] [the Lard]1026-the lard do fall , [God]179-god send ' twon't crush en all in all . '[2707-me] [Saved'—him]2709-saved'—him — dear , [dear]957-dear ! " " The likes of [Tregenza]183-joan be saved ' pon [St. Tibbs Eve]337-eve , [ Footnote : [St. Tibbs Eve]337-eve — Equivalent to the " Greek Calends . " ] [I]222-mary reckon , an '[222-mary] no sooner , " answered [Mary]222-mary scornfully . Then [she]222-mary modified [her]222-mary fiery statement according to [her]222-mary custom , for [the woman]4662-the woman 's zeal always had first call upon [her]222-mary tongue , and [her]222-mary judgment usually took off the edge of every harsh statement immediately upon its utterance . " Leastways ' tis hard to see how [sich]5621-sich bowldashious standin '[222-mary] up in the eye o ' [God]179-god should prosper . But [us]5622-us can be saved even from [[our]5622-us awnselves]5623-our awnselves , [I]222-mary s'pose . So [Tregenza]183-joan have got [his]4608-her parent chance along o '[222-mary] the best . " [Joan]183-joan never resented the outspoken criticisms on [[her]183-joan parent]4608-her parent . [She]183-joan listened , but rarely joined the discussion . The whole matter speedily sank to a position of insignificance . [Her]183-joan own mind was clear , and the deadlock only cut off one more outer interest and reduced [Life]376-life 's existing influences to a smaller field . [She]183-joan drew more and more into [herself]183-joan , slipped more and more from out the routine life of Drift . [She]183-joan became self - centered , and when [her]183-joan body was not absent , as happened upon most fine days , [her]183-joan mind abstracted itself to extreme limits . [She]183-joan grew shy of [fellow - creatures]2713-fellow - creatures , found no day happy of which a part had not been spent beside a cross , showed a gradual indifference to the services of [the church]688-the church which not long since had attracted [her]183-joan so strongly and braced the foundations of [her]183-joan soul . There came at last a black Sunday when [Joan]183-joan refused to accompany [Mary]222-mary and [the farmer]3745-the farmer to morning worship at [Sancreed]107-sancreed . [She]183-joan made no excuse , but designed a pilgrimage of more than usual length , and , having driven as far as [the church]688-the church with [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle and [cousin]5242-cousin , left [them]2719-them there and walked on [her]183-joan way . Even the fascinations of a harvest festival failed to charm [her]183-joan ; and the spectacle of fat roots , mighty marrows , yellow corn and red apples on the window - ledges , of grapes and tomatoes , flowers and loaves upon the altar , pulpit and font , did not appeal overmuch to [Joana]377-joana — a fact perhaps surprising . With a plump pasty of meat and flour in [her]183-joan pocket and one of [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's walking - sticks to help [her]183-joan footsteps , [Joan]183-joan went on [her]183-joan way , passed [the Wesleyan Chapel of Sancreed]2720-the wesleyan chapel of sancreed , and then maintained a reasonably direct line to [her]183-joan destination by short cuts and [field paths]2721-field paths . [She]183-joan intended to visit [Mên Scryfa]136-mên scryfa , [that famous " long stone " which stands away in [a moor croft]2723-a moor croft beyond [Lanyon]137-lanyon]2722-that famous " long stone " which stands away in a moor croft beyond lanyon . [She]183-joan knew that it was no right cross , but [she]183-joan remembered it well , having visited [the monument]2724-the monument frequently in the past . It was holy with infinite age , and the writing upon it fascinated [her]183-joan as a mystery fascinates most of [us]2725-us . The words , " Rialobrani Cunovali Fili , " which probably mark the fact that [Rialobran]378-rialobran , [son of Cunoval]2726-son of cunoval , [some Brito - Celtic chieftain of eld]2727-some brito - celtic chieftain of eld , lies buried not far distant , meant nothing to [Joan]183-joan , but the old gray - headed stone , perhaps the loneliest in all [Cornwall]13-cornwall , was pleasant to [her]183-joan thoughts , and [she]183-joan trudged forward gladly with [her]183-joan eyes open for all the beauties of a smiling world . Summer clouds , sunny - hearted and towering against the blue , dropped immense shadows on the glimmering gold of much stubble and on [the wastes of [the moor]5491-the moor rising above them]2728-the wastes of the moor rising above them . In [the cornfields]2730-the cornfields , visible now that the crops were cut and gathered into mows , stood little gray - green islands — a mark distinctive of Cornish husbandry . Here grew cow - cabbages in rank luxuriance , on mounds of manure which would be presently scattered over [the exhausted land]2731-the exhausted land . [The little oases in the deserts of [the fields]3478-the fields]2732-the little oases in the deserts of the fields were too familiar to arrest [Joan]183-joan 's eye . [She]183-joan merely glanced at the garnered wheat and thought what a brief time the arrish geese , stuffing [themselves]2734-themselves in the stubble , had yet to live . A solemn , splendid peace held [the country]1536-the country - side , and [hardly a soul]2736-hardly a soul was abroad where [the road]445-the road led upward to [wild moor]2738-wild moor and waste . Sometimes [a group of calves crowding under the shady side of hedges]2739-a group of calves crowding under the shady side of hedges regarded [Joan]183-joan with youthful interest ; sometimes , in [a distant coomb - bottom , where blackberries grew , little sunbonnets]2740-a distant coomb - bottom , where blackberries grew , little sunbonnets bobbed above the fern and [a child]4285-a child 's shrill voice came clear to [her]183-joan upon the wind . But the loneliness grew , and , anon , turning from [her]183-joan way a while , [the traveler]2742-the traveler sat on the gray crown of [Trengwainton Carn]138-trengwainton carn to rest and look at [the wide world]948-the wide world . From [the little tor]2744-the little tor , over undulations of broad light and blue shadow , [Joan]183-joan could see afar to [[Buryan]255-buryan 's lofty tower]2745-buryan 's lofty tower , to [Paul]182-tarrant above [the sea]463-the sea , to Sancreed 's sycamores and to [Drift]15-drift beyond them . Wild sweeps of fell and field faded on the sight to those dim and remote hues of distance only visible upon days of exceeding aerial brilliancy . Immediately beneath the eminence subtended ragged expanses of rainbow - colored heath and fern and furze spotted with small fir trees which showed blue against the tones of [the moor]5491-the moor . The heather 's pink clearly contrasted with the paler shades of the ling , and an additional silvery twinkle of light inhabited the latter plant , its cause last year 's dead white branches and twigs still scattered through the living foliage and flower . Out of a myriad bells that [wild world]2748-wild world spoke , and the murmur of [the heath]1113-the heath came as the murmur of a wise voice to the ear on which it fell . There was a soul in the day ; it lived , and [Joan]183-joan looked into the eyes of [a glorious , conscious entity]2750-a glorious , conscious entity , [herself]183-joan a little part of the space - filling whole . Presently , refreshed by brief rest , [the pilgrim]1885-the pilgrim journeyed on over [a road]2752-a road which climbs [the moor]5491-the moor above [deep fox - covers of rhododendron]2754-deep fox - covers of rhododendron , already mentioned as visible from [Madron chapel]249-st. madron . The way dipped presently , crossed [a rivulet]2755-a rivulet and mounted again past [the famous cromlech of [Lanyon]137-lanyon]2756-the famous cromlech of lanyon . But [Joan]183-joan passed [the quoit]2757-the quoit unheeding , and kept upon [flint roads]2758-flint roads through [Lanyon farm]137-lanyon , where [[its]137-lanyon irregular buildings stretch across [the hill - crest]2760-the hill - crest]2759-its irregular buildings stretch across the hill - crest . [She]183-joan saw the stacks roped strangely in nets with heavy stones to secure them against winter gales ; [she]183-joan observed the various familiar objects of Drift repeated on a greater scale ; then , going down hill yet again , [Joan]183-joan struck up the course of [another stream]2761-another stream and passed steadily over broad , granite - dotted tangles of whin , heather and rank grasses to [her]183-joan destination . Here [the heath]1113-the heath was blasted and scarred with summer fires . Great patches of the waste had been eaten naked by past flames , and [Mên -]95-mên - an an - tol — the " crick - stone"—past which [she]183-joan progressed , stood with [its]95-mên - an lesser granite pillars in a dark bed of scorched earth and blackened furze - stems stripped bare by the fire . [She]183-joan stood in [a wide , desolate cup of [the Cornish moor]2764-the cornish moor]2763-a wide , desolate cup of the cornish moor . To [the south Ding - Dong Mine]2765-the south ding - dong mine reared [its]2766-its shattered chimney - stack , toward the northwest [Carn Galvas]379-carn galvas — that rock - piled fastness of dead giants — reared a gray head against the blue . A curlew piped ; a lizard rustled into a tussock of grass where pink bog - heather and seeding cotton grasses splashed the sodden ground ; a dragon - fly from [the marsh]2767-the marsh stayed a moment upon [Mên - an - tol]95-mên - an , and the jewel of [his]2768-his eyes was a little world holding all the colors of the larger . [Joan]183-joan , keeping [her]183-joan way to where [Carn Galvas]379-carn galvas rose over [the next ridge]2769-the next ridge , walked another few hundred yards , crossed [a disused road]2770-a disused road , climbed a stony bank , and then stood in [the little croft sacred to [Mên Scryfa]136-mên scryfa]2771-the little croft sacred to mên scryfa . At the center , above [a land almost barren save for stunted heath and [wind - beaten fern]2773-wind - beaten fern [it]2772-a land almost barren save for stunted heath and wind - beaten fern it rose rose]2772-a land almost barren save for stunted heath and wind - beaten fern it rose — a tall stone of rough and irregular shape . [The bare black earth , in which shone quartz crystals]2774-the bare black earth , in which shone quartz crystals , stretched at hand in squares . From [these raw spaces]2775-these raw spaces , peat had been cut , to be subsequently burned for manure ; and it stood hard by stacked in a row of beat - burrows or little piles of overlapping pieces , the cut side out . Near [the famous old stone itself]2776-the famous old stone itself , surmounting a barrow - like tumulus , grew stunted bracken ; and here [Joan]183-joan presently sat down full of happiness in that [her]183-joan pilgrimage had been achieved . The granite pillar of [Mên Scryfa]136-mên scryfa was crested with that fine yellow - gray lichen which finds life on exposed stones ; upon the windward side clung a few atoms of golden growth ; and its rude carved inscription straggled down the northern face . [The monument]2724-the monument rose sheer above black corpses of crooked furze , for fire had swept [this region]2778-this region also , adding not a little to the prevailing sobriety of it , and only the elemental splendor of weather and the canopy of blue and gold beneath which spread this desolation rendered [it]2772-a land almost barren save for stunted heath and wind - beaten fern it rose less than mournful . Even under these circumstances imagination , as though rebelling against the conditions of sunshine and summer then maintaining , leaped to picture [Mên Scryfa]136-mên scryfa under the black screaming of winter storm or rising darkly upon deep snows ; casting a transitory shadow over a waste ghastly blue under flashes of lightning , or throbbing to its deep roots when thunder roared over [the moor]5491-the moor and the levin brand hissed unseen into [quag and fen]2780-quag and fen . The double crown of [Carn Galvas]379-carn galvas fronted [Joan]183-joan as [she]183-joan presently sat with [her]183-joan back resting against the stone ; and a medley of the old thoughts rose not unwelcome in [her]183-joan mind . Giant mythology seemed a true thing in sight of these vast regular piles of granite ; and the thought of [the kind simple monsters who had raised that earn]2781-the kind simple monsters who had raised that earn led to musings on [the " little people]2782-the " little people . " [Her]183-joan mind brooded over the fairies and [their]2783-their strange ways with [young human mothers]2784-young human mothers . [She]183-joan remembered the stories of [changelings]2785-changelings , and vowed to [herself]183-joan that [[her]183-joan own babe]2786-her own babe should never be out of sight . These reflections found no adverse criticism in faith . The Bible was full of giants ; and if [no fairies]2787-no fairies were mentioned therein , [she]183-joan had read nothing aimed against [them]2783-their . Presently [she]183-joan prayed for [the coming child]2788-the coming child . [Her]183-joan soul went with the words ; and they were addressed with vagueness as became [her]183-joan vague thoughts , half to [Mên Scryfa]136-mên scryfa , half to [God]179-god , all in the name of [Christ]2789-christ . Going [home]453-home again , after noon , [Joan]183-joan found a glen - ader , [ Footnote : Glen - ader — The cast skin of [an adder]2791-an adder . Once accounted a powerful amulet , and still sometimes secretly preserved by [the ignorant]2792-the ignorant , as [sailors treasure a caul]2793-sailors treasure a caul . ] which circumstance is here mentioned to illustrate the conflicting nature of those many forces still active in [her]183-joan mind . That [they]2794-they should have coexisted and not destroyed [each other]512-each other is the point of most peculiarity . But it seemed for a moment as though [the girl]521-the girl had intellectually passed at least that form of superstition embraced by coveted possession of a glen - ader ; for , upon finding the thing lying extended like a snake 's ghost , [she]183-joan hesitated before picking it up . The old tradition , however , sucked in from [a credulous parent with much similar folly]2797-a credulous parent with much similar folly at a time when the mind accepts impressions most readily , was too strong for [Joan]183-joan . Qualms [she]183-joan had , and some whisper at the bottom of [her]183-joan mind was heard with a clearness sufficient to make [her]183-joan uncomfortable , but reason held a feeble citadel at best in [Joan]183-joan 's mind . The whisper died , memory spoke of the notable value which [wise men]2798-wise men through long past years had placed upon this charm , and in the face of the future it seemed wicked to reject a thing of such proven efficacy . So [she]183-joan picked up [the adder]2799-the adder 's slough , designing to sew it upon a piece of flannel and henceforth wear it against [her]183-joan skin until [[her]183-joan baby]5486-her baby should be born . But [she]183-joan determined to tell neither [Mary]222-mary nor [[her]222-mary uncle]783-her uncle , though [she]183-joan did not stop to ask why secrecy thus commended itself to [her]183-joan . That evening [Mary]222-mary came primed from [church]581-church - going with grave admonition , [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin was tearful , and hinted at [his]189-mr. chirgwin own sorrow arising from [Joan]183-joan 's backsliding , but [Mary]222-mary did not mince language and spoke what [she]222-mary thought . " [You'm]2803-you'm wrong , an ' [you]2803-you'm knaw you'm wrong , " [she]222-mary said . " The crosses be very well , an '[2803-you'm] coorious , butivul things to see ' pon [the land]3578-the land tu , but they'm poor food to a body 's sawl . [They]2805-they caan't shaw wheer you'm out ; [they]2805-they caan't lead '[189-mr. chirgwin] [e]2804-e right . " " Iss [they]2805-they can , then , an ' [they]2805-they do , " declared [Joan]183-joan . " The more [I]2805-they bide along wi '[2805-they] ['em]5625-'em the better [I]2805-they feel an '[2805-they] the nearer to [God]179-god A'mighty , so [theer]2806-theer ! They'm allus the same , an ' [they]2805-they puts thots in [my]0-i head that 's good to think ; an '[0-i] [I]0-i must go [my]0-i ways , [Polly]222-mary , same as [you]222-mary go [yours]222-mary . " When night came [Joan]183-joan slept within [the mystic circumference of [the glen - ader]2808-the glen - ader]2807-the mystic circumference of the glen - ader ; and that [she]183-joan derived a growing measure of mental satisfaction from its embrace is unquestionable . A space of time six weeks in duration may be hastily dismissed as producing no alteration in [Joan]183-joan 's method of thought and life . It swept [her]183-joan swiftly through shortening days and the last of the summer weather to the climax of [her]183-joan fortunes . As the season waned [she]183-joan kept nearer [home]453-home , going not much further than [Tremathick Cross]132-tremathick cross on [the St. Just road]5391-the st. just road or to that relic already mentioned as lying outside [Sancreed churchyard]107-sancreed . These , in time , [she]183-joan associated as much with [[her]183-joan child]741-her child as with [herself]183-joan . [The baby]2292-the baby had now taken its natural place in [her]183-joan mind , and [she]183-joan prayed every day that it might presently forgive [her]183-joan for bringing it into [the world]3624-the world at all . Misty - eyed , not unhappy , with [her]183-joan beauty still a startling fact , [Joan]183-joan mused away long hours at the feet of [[her]183-joan granite friends]2814-her granite friends through the waning splendors of many an autumn noon . Then , within the brief space of two weeks , a period of weather almost unexampled in the memory of [the oldest agriculturists]2815-the oldest agriculturists drew to its close . That mighty rains must surely come all knew , but [none]2202-none foretold [their]2817-their tremendous volume or foresaw the havoc , ruin and destruction to follow upon [their]2817-their outpouring . Meantime , with late September , the leaves began to hustle early to earth under great winds . Rain fell at times , but not heavily at first , and a thirsty world drank open - mouthed through deep sun - cracks in field and [moor and dried - up marsh]2818-moor and dried - up marsh . But bedraggled autumn 's robes were soon washed colorless ; [the heath]1113-the heath turned pallid before it faded to sere brown ; rotten banks of decaying leaves rose high under the hedges . There was no dry , crisp whirl of gold on the wind , but a sodden condition gradually overspread [the land]3578-the land . [The earth]3591-the earth grew drunken with the later rains and could hold no more . October saw the last of the purple and crimson , the tawny browns and royal yellows . Only beeches , their wet leaves by many shades a darker auburn than is customary , still retained lower foliage . The trees put on their winter shapes unduly early . [The world]3624-the world was dark and sweated fungus . [Uncouth children of the earth , whose hour is that which sees the leaf fall]2823-uncouth children of the earth , whose hour is that which sees the leaf fall , sprang into short - lived being . [Black goblins and gray , white goblins]2824-black goblins and gray , white goblins and brown , spread weird life abroad . With fleshy gills , squat and lean , fat and thin , bursting through the grass in companies and circles , lurking livid , gigantic and alone on the trunks of forest trees , gemming the rotten bough with crimson , twinkling like topaz on the crooked stems of the furze , battening upon death , rising into transitory vigor from the rack and rot of a festering earth , they flourished . Heavy mists now stretched their draperies over [the high lands]2825-the high lands ; and exhalations from the corpse of the summer hung bluish under the rain in [the valleys]1678-the valleys . One night a full moon shone clearly , and through the ambient light ominous sheets and splashes of silver glimmered in [the low fields]2827-the low fields . [Here]432-here [they]2817-their had slowly and silently spread into existence , [their]2817-their birth hidden under the mists , [their]2817-their significance marked by none but [anxious farmers]2829-anxious farmers . [All men]740-all men hoped that the full moon would bring cessation of this rainfall ; but another gray dawn faced [them]740-all men on the morrow and a thousand busy rills murmured and babbled down [the lanes round Drift]2831-the lanes round drift . Here and there [unsuspected springs]2832-unsuspected springs burst [[their]2832-unsuspected springs hidden chambers]2833-their hidden chambers and swept by steep courses over the green grass to join these main waters which now raced through [the valley]2302-the valley . The light of day was heavy and pressed upon the sight . It acted like a telescope in the intervals of no rain and brought distant objects into strange distinctness . The weather was much too warm even for " [Western Cornwall]145-western cornwall . A few leaves still hung on the crown of the apple trees , and such scanty peach and nectarine foliage as yet remained was green . The red currants flaunted a gold leaf or two and the remaining leaves of the black currant were purple after [his]2835-his fashion . [Joan]183-joan marveled to see sundry of [[her]183-joan favorites]2836-her favorites thrusting forth tokens of spring almost before autumn was ended . Lilac buds swelled to bursting ; a peony pushed many pink points upward through the brown ruins of the past ; bulbs were growing rapidly ; [Nature]178-nature had forgotten winter for once , thought [Joan]183-joan . Thus the sodden , sunless , steaming days followed each on the last until [farming folk]2837-farming folk began to grow grave before a steady increase of water on [the land]3578-the land . Much hay stood in danger and some ricks had been already ruined . Many theories were rife , [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's being , upon the whole , the most fatuous . " Tis a thunder - planet , " [he]251-uncle chirgwin told [[his]251-uncle chirgwin nieces]5249-his nieces , " an ' till [us]2840-us get a rousin '[251-uncle chirgwin] storm o ' crooked forks an '[251-uncle chirgwin] heavy thunder this rain'll go on fallin ' . But not so much as a flap o '[251-uncle chirgwin] the collybran [ Footnote : [Collybran]146-collybran — Sheet lightning . ] do [us]2840-us get for all the heat o ' the air . [I]251-uncle chirgwin should knaw , if any , for [I]251-uncle chirgwin be out turnin '[251-uncle chirgwin] night into day an ' markin '[251-uncle chirgwin] the water in [the valley]2302-the valley every evenin ' long after dark now . [I]251-uncle chirgwin 'm[251-uncle chirgwin] fearin ' graave for the big stack ; an '[251-uncle chirgwin] theer 's three paarts o ' last year 's hay beside , an '[251-uncle chirgwin] two tidy lil mows of the aftermath . So sure 's the waters do rise another foot and a half , ' tis '[251-uncle chirgwin] good - by ' to the whole boilin '[251-uncle chirgwin] . Not but ' twill be a miracle for [the stream]4565-the stream to get much higher . [The moor]5491-the moor 's burstin '[251-uncle chirgwin] wi ' rain , but the coffins [ Footnote : Coffins — Ancient mining excavations . ] do hold it up , [I]251-uncle chirgwin s'pose , an '[251-uncle chirgwin] keep it aloft . A penn'orth o ' frost now would save a pound of produce from [wan end o '[251-uncle chirgwin] Carnwall]5628-wan end o ' carnwall to t'other . " [Joan]183-joan spent many long days in [the house]592-the house at this time and practiced an unskillful needle , while [her]183-joan thoughts wandered far and near through the sullen weather to this old cross and that . Then came a night of rainless darkness through which past augmentations of water still thundered . [Nature]178-nature rested for some hours before [her]183-joan final , shattering deluge , but the brief peace was more tremendous than rain or wind , for a mighty foreboding permeated it , and [all men]740-all men felt the end was not yet , though [none]2202-none could say why [they]740-all men feared the silence more than storm . It happened upon this black night that [Joan]183-joan was alone in [the kitchen]860-the kitchen . Supper had been but a scrambling meal and [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle with [Amos Bartlett]323-amos bartlett and [all the men on [the farm]3904-the farm]2847-all the men on the farm were now somewhere in [the valley under the darkness]2849-the valley under the darkness fighting for the hay with rising water . Where [Mary]222-mary was just then , [Joan]183-joan did not know . [Her]183-joan thoughts were occupied with [her]183-joan own affairs , and in the oppressive silence [she]183-joan sat watching some little moving threadlike concerns which hung in a row through a crack below the mantelpiece above the open fire . [They]2850-you were the tails of mice which often here congregated nigh the warmth and sat in a row , [themselves]2850-you invisible . The tails moved , and [Joan]183-joan noted some shorter tails beside long ones , telling of infant vermin at [[their]2850-you mothers]3653-their mothers ' sides . In the silence [she]183-joan could hear the squeaking of them , and now and then [she]183-joan talked to [them]2850-you very softly . " Thank [God]179-god , [[you]2850-you lil mice]5629-you lil mice , as [you]2850-you abbun got no brains in [your]2850-you heads an '[183-joan] no call to look far in the future . [I]0-i lay you'm happier than [us]2852-us , wi ' nort to fear 'bout[0-i] ' cept crumbs an '[0-i] a lew snug spot to live in . " Thus [she]183-joan stumbled on the lowest note of pessimism : that conscious intelligence is a supreme mistake . But the significance of [her]183-joan idea [she]183-joan knew not . Then [Joan]183-joan rose up , shivered with a sudden sense of chill , stamped [her]183-joan feet , and caused the row of tails below the mantel to vanish . " Goose - flaish down the spine do mean as [theer]2853-theer 's feet walkin ' '[183-joan] pon [my]0-i graave , [I]0-i s'pose , " [she]183-joan thought , as a heavy knock at the front door interrupted [her]183-joan reflections . Hastening to open it , [Joan]183-joan found [the postman]2854-the postman — [a rare visitor at [Drift]15-drift]2855-a rare visitor at drift . [He]2854-the postman handed [her]183-joan a letter and prepared to depart immediately . " [I]0-i 'm grievous afeared o '[0-i] [Buryas Bridge]104-buryas bridge tonight , " [he]0-i said ; " when [I]0-i comed over , two hour back , the water was above the arches , an ' , so like 's not , [I]0-i wo n't get '[0-i] cross ' tall if it 's riz higher . An '[0-i] somethin' cruel 's comin ' , [I]0-i 'll lay [my]0-i life , '[0-i] fore marnin ' . This pitch - black silence be worse than the noise o '[0-i] the rain . " [He]0-i vanished down [the hill]533-the hill , and , returning to [the kitchen]860-the kitchen , [Joan]183-joan lighted a candle and examined the letter . A fit of trembling shook [the girl]521-the girl to the hidden seat of [her]183-joan soul as [she]183-joan did so , for [her]183-joan own name greeted [her]183-joan , in neat printed letters akin to those on the superscription of another letter [she]183-joan had received in the past . From [John Barron]176-barron it was that this communication came , and the reception of it begot a wild chaos of mind which now carried [Joan]183-joan headlong backward . Images swept through [her]183-joan brain with the bewildering rapidity and brilliance of lightning flashes ; [she]183-joan was whirled and tossed on a flood of thoughts ; [a single sad - eyed figure]2859-a single sad - eyed figure retained permanency and rose clear and separated itself from the phantasmagorial procession of personages and events wending through [her]183-joan mind , dissolving each into the other , stretching the circumstances of eight short months into an eternity , crowding the solemn aisles of time past with shadows of those emotions which had reigned over the dead spring time of the year and were [themselves]2860-themselves long dead . Thus [she]183-joan stood for a space of vast apparent duration , but in reality most brief . That trifling standpoint in time needed for a dream or for the brain - picture of [his]0-i past which dominates the mind of [the drowning]2861-the drowning was all that had sped with [Joan]183-joan . Then , shaking [herself]183-joan clear of thought , [she]183-joan found [her]183-joan candle , which burned dim when first lighted , was only now melting the wax and rising to its full flame . A mist of damp had long hung on the inner walls of [the kitchen]860-the kitchen at [Drift]15-drift , begotten not of [faulty building]2863-faulty building but by the peculiar condition of the atmosphere ; and as the candle flickered up in a chamber dark save for its light and the subdued glow of a low fire , [Joan]183-joan noticed how the gathering moisture on the walls had coalesced , run into drops and fallen , streaking the misty gray with bright bars and networks , silvery ' as the slime of snails . With shaking hand , [she]183-joan set the candle upon a table , dropped into a chair beside it and opened [her]183-joan letter . For a moment the page with its large printed characters danced before [her]183-joan eyes , then they steadied and [she]183-joan was able to read . Like a message from [one long dead]5630-one long dead came the words ; and in truth , though [the writer]2523-the writer lived , [he]2523-the writer wrote upon the threshold of the grave . [John Barren]177-barren had put into force [his]177-barren project , which was , as may be remembered , to write to [Joan]183-joan when the end of [his]177-barren journey came in sight . The words were carefully chosen , for [he]177-barren remembered [her]183-joan sympathy with suffering and [her]183-joan extensive ignorance . [He]177-barren wrote in simple language , therefore , and dwelt on [his]177-barren own helpless condition , exaggerating it to some extent . " No . 6 [Melbury Gardens]116-melbury gardens , [London]45-london . " [[My]179-god own dear love]5632-my own dear love — What can [I]179-god say to make [you]5632-my own dear love know what has kept [me]179-god away from [you]5632-my own dear love ? There is but one word and that is [my]179-god poor sick and suffering body . [I]179-god wrote to [you]5632-my own dear love and tore up what [I]179-god wrote , for [I]179-god loved [you]5632-my own dear love too much to ask [you]5632-my own dear love to come and share [my]179-god sad life . It was very , very awful to be away and know [you]5632-my own dear love were waiting and waiting for [Jan]241-mister jan ; yet [I]179-god could not come , because [Mother Nature]178-nature was so hard . Then [I]179-god went far away and hoped [you]5632-my own dear love had forgotten [me]179-god . [Doctors]5633-doctors made [me]179-god go to [a place over [the sea where tall palm trees grew up out of a dry yellow desert]5635-the sea where tall palm trees grew up out of a dry yellow desert]5634-a place over the sea where tall palm trees grew up out of a dry yellow desert ; but [my]179-god poor lungs were too sick to get well again and [I]179-god came [home]453-home to die . Yes , [sweetheart]4281-sweetheart , [you]5632-my own dear love will forgive [me]179-god for all when [you]5632-my own dear love know poor lonely [Jan]241-mister jan will soon be gone . [He]241-mister jan can not live much longer , and [he]241-mister jan is so weak now that [he]241-mister jan has no more power to fight against the love of [Joan]183-joan . " For [your]5632-my own dear love own good , [dear one]5638-dear one , [I]179-god made [myself]179-god keep away and hid [myself]179-god from [you]5632-my own dear love . Now the little life left to [me]179-god cries out by night and by day for [you]5632-my own dear love . [Joan]183-joan , [[my]179-god own true love]5639-my own true love , [I]179-god can not die until [I]179-god have seen [you]5632-my own dear love again . Come to [me]179-god , [Joan]183-joan , love , if [you]5632-my own dear love do not hate [me]179-god . Come to [me]179-god ; come ; and close [my]179-god eyes and let [poor Jan]241-mister jan have the one face that [he]241-mister jan loves quite near [him]241-mister jan at the end . Even [your]5632-my own dear love picture has gone , for [they]5640-they came when [I]179-god was away and took it and put it in a place with many others for [people]749-people to see . And [all men]740-all men and [women]1371-women say it is the best picture . [I]179-god shall be dead before [they]5640-they send it back to [me]179-god . So now [I]179-god have nothing but the thoughts of [[my]179-god [Joan]183-joan]1680-my joan . Oh , come to [me]179-god , [[my]179-god love]5645-my love , if [you]5632-my own dear love can . It will not be for long , and when [Jan]241-mister jan lies under the ground all that [he]241-mister jan has is [yours]5632-my own dear love . [I]179-god have fought so hard to keep from [you]5632-my own dear love and from praying [you]5632-my own dear love to come to [me]179-god , but [I]179-god can fight no more . [[My]179-god home]5646-my home is named at the top of this letter . [You]5632-my own dear love have but to enter [the train]4378-the train for [London]45-london and stop in [it]4378-the train until it gets to the end of [its]4378-the train journey . [[My]179-god servant]5648-my servant shall wait each day for [your]5632-my own dear love coming . [I]179-god can write no more , [I]179-god can only pray to [the God [we]5650-we both]5649-the god we both love to bring [you]5632-my own dear love to [me]179-god . And if [you]5632-my own dear love come or do not [I]179-god shall have the same great true love for [you]5632-my own dear love . [I]179-god will die alone rather than trouble [you]5632-my own dear love to come if [you]5632-my own dear love have forgotten [me]179-god and not forgiven [me]179-god for keeping silence . God bless [you]5632-my own dear love , [my]179-god only love . [JAN]241-mister jan . " This feeble stuff rang like a clarion on the ear of [the reader]5651-the reader , for [he]179-god who had written it knew how best to strike , how best to appeal with overwhelming force to [Joan Tregenza]183-joan . [Her]183-joan mind plunged straight into the struggle and the billows of the storm , sweeping aside lesser obstructions , were soon beating against the new - built ramparts of faith . The rush of thought which had coursed through [her]183-joan brains before reading the letter now made the task of deciding upon it easier . Indeed it can hardly be said that any real doubt from first to last assailed [Joan]183-joan 's decision . Faith did not crumble , but , at a second glance , appeared to [her]183-joan wholly compatible with obedience to this demand . There was an electric force in every word of the letter . It proved [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's wondrous nobility of character , [his]241-mister jan unselfishness , [his]241-mister jan love . [He]241-mister jan had suffered , too , had longed eternally for [her]183-joan , had denied [himself]241-mister jan out of consideration for [her]183-joan future happiness , had struggled with [his]241-mister jan love , and only broken down and given way to it in the shadow of death . Grief shook [Joan]183-joan upon this thought , but joy was uppermost . The long months of weary suffering faded from [her]183-joan recollection as nocturnal mists vanish at the touch of the sun 's first fire . [She]183-joan had no power to analyze the position or reflect upon the various courses of action [the man]3494-the man might have taken to spare [her]183-joan so much agony . [She]183-joan accepted [his]241-mister jan bald utterance word for word , as [he]241-mister jan knew [she]183-joan would . Every inclination and desire swept [her]183-joan toward [him]241-mister jan now . [His]241-mister jan cry of suffering , [his]241-mister jan love , [his]241-mister jan loneliness , [her]183-joan duty , as it stood blazoned upon [her]183-joan mind ten minutes after reading [his]241-mister jan letter ; [the child]758-the child to be born within two months — all these considerations united to establish [Joan]183-joan 's mind at this juncture . " Come to [me]179-god ! " Those were the words echoing within [her]183-joan heart , and [her]183-joan soul cried upon [Christ]5654-christ to shorten time that [she]183-joan might reach [him]241-mister jan the sooner . Before [the world]3624-the world was next awake , [she]183-joan would be upon [her]183-joan way ; before another night fell , [Mister Jan]241-mister jan 's arms would be round [her]183-joan . The long , dreary nightmare had ended for [her]183-joan at last . Then came tears of bitter remorse , for [she]183-joan saw how [his]241-mister jan love had never left [her]183-joan , how [he]241-mister jan had been true as steel , while [she]183-joan , misled by appearances , had lost faith and lapsed into forgetfulness . A wild , unreasoning yearning superior to time and space and the service of railways got hold upon [her]183-joan . " Come to [me]179-god , " " Come to [me]179-god , " sounded in [Joan]183-joan 's ears in the live voice [she]183-joan had loved and lost and found again . An hour 's delay , a minute 's , a moment 's seemed a crime . Yet delay there must be , but the tension and terrific excitement of [her]183-joan whole being at this period demanded some immediate outlet in action . [She]183-joan wanted to talk to [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , and [she]183-joan desired instant information upon the subject of [her]183-joan journey . First [she]183-joan thought of seeking [the farmer]3745-the farmer in [the valley]2302-the valley ; then it struck [her]183-joan , the hour being not later than eight o'clock , that by going into [Penzance]7-penzance [she]183-joan might learn at what time [the morning train]5658-the morning train departed to [London]45-london . Out of doors it was inky black , very silent , very oppressive . [Joan]183-joan called [Mary]222-mary twice before departing , but received no answer . Indeed [the house]592-the house was empty , though [she]183-joan did not know [it]592-the house . Finally , thrusting the letter into [her]183-joan bosom , taking [her]183-joan hat and cloak from a nail in [the kitchen]860-the kitchen and putting on a pair of walking shoes , [the girl]521-the girl went abroad . [Her]183-joan present medley of thoughts begot a state of exceeding nervous excitation . For the letter touched the two poles of extreme happiness and utmost possible sorrow . " [Mister Jan]241-mister jan " was calling [her]183-joan to [him]241-mister jan indeed , but only calling [her]183-joan that [she]183-joan might see [him]241-mister jan die . Careless of [her]183-joan steps , soothed unconsciously by rapid motion , [she]183-joan walked from [the farm]3904-the farm , [her]183-joan mind full of joy and grief ; and the night , silent no longer for [her]183-joan , was full of a voice crying " Come to [me]179-god , [Joan]183-joan , love , come ! " In the coomb beneath Drift , flashing as though red - hot from a theater of Cimmerian blackness , [certain figures]5663-certain figures , flame - lighted , flickered hurriedly this way and that about a dark and monstrous pile which rose in [their]5663-certain figures midst . From [the adjacent hill]5664-the adjacent hill , [superstitious watchers]5665-superstitious watchers might have supposed that [they]5665-superstitious watchers beheld [some demoniac throng newly burst oat of the bowels of earth and to be presently re - engulfed]5666-some demoniac throng newly burst oat of the bowels of earth and to be presently re - engulfed ; but seen nearer , the toiling creatures , fighting with all [their]5663-certain figures hearts and souls to save a haystack from flood , had merely excited human interest and commiseration . [Farmer Chirgwin]380-farmer chirgwin and [[his]380-farmer chirgwin men]5667-his men were girt as to the legs in old - fashioned hay - bands ; [some]3868-some held torches while [others]3522-others toiled with ropes to anchor the giant rick against the gathering waters . There was no immediate fear , for the pile still stood a clear foot above [the stream]4565-the stream on a gentle undulation distant nearly two yards from [the present boundary of [the swollen river]5672-the swollen river]5671-the present boundary of the swollen river . But , on [the landward side]5673-the landward side , another danger threatened , because in that quarter [the meadow]5674-the meadow sank in [a slight hollow which had now changed to [a lake fed by a brisk rivulet from the main river]5676-a lake fed by a brisk rivulet from the main river]5675-a slight hollow which had now changed to a lake fed by a brisk rivulet from the main river . The great rick thus stood almost insulated , and much further uprising of the flood would place it in a position not to be approached by [man without danger]5677-man without danger . Above [the stack , distant about five - and - twenty yards]5678-the stack , distant about five - and - twenty yards , stood a couple of stout pollarded willows , and by these [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin had decided to moor [his]380-farmer chirgwin hay , trusting that [they]5665-superstitious watchers might hold the great mass of it secure even though the threatened flood swept away [its]5678-the stack , distant about five - and - twenty yards foundations . [Nine figures]5679-nine figures worked amain , and to [them]5679-nine figures approached a tenth , appearing from the darkness , skirting [the lake]5680-the lake and splashing through [the streamlet]2335-the streamlet which fed [it]5680-the lake . [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary it was who now arrived — a grotesque figure with [her]222-mary gown and petticoats fastened high and wearing on [her]222-mary legs a pair of [[her]222-mary uncle]783-her uncle 's leather gaiters . [Mary]222-mary had been up to [the farm]3904-the farm for more rope , but the clothesline was all that [she]222-mary could find , and this [she]222-mary now returned with . Already three ropes had been passed round the rick and made fast to the willows , but none among [them]5679-nine figures was of great stoutness , nor had they been tied at an elevation best calculated to resist a possible strain . [Amos Bartlett]323-amos bartlett took the line from [Mary]222-mary and set to work with [many assistants]5684-many assistants ; while [the farmer]3745-the farmer [himself]3745-the farmer , waving a torch and stumping hither and thither , now directed [Bartlett]323-amos bartlett , now encouraged [two men who worked with all [their]5686-two men who worked with all their might at the cutting of a trench from the lake might at the cutting of a trench from [the lake]5680-the lake]5686-two men who worked with all their might at the cutting of a trench from the lake in order that this dangerous body of water might be drained back to [the main stream]5688-the main stream . The flame - light danced in many a flash and splash over the smooth surface of [the face of [the inland pond]5690-the inland pond]5689-the face of the inland pond . Indeed it reflected like a glass at present , for no wind fretted it , neither did a drop of rain fall . Intense , watchful silence held that hour . The squash of [men]3512-men 's feet in the mud , the soft swirl of the water , the cry of voices alone disturbed the night . " [God]179-god be praised ! [I]179-god do think '[179-god] tis ' bating , " cried [the farmer]3745-the farmer presently . [He]179-god ran every few minutes to [the water]3501-the water and examined a stake hammered into it a foot from the edge . It seemed , as far as might be judged by such fitful light and rough measurement , that [the river]2345-the river had sunk an inch or two , but it was running in undulations , and what [its]2345-the river muddy mass had lost in volume was gained in speed . The water chattered and hissed ; and [Amos Bartlett]323-amos bartlett [, who next made a survey , declared that the flood had by no means waned , but rather risen]5695-, who next made a survey , declared that the flood had by no means waned , but rather risen . Then , [the last ropes being disposed to the best advantage]5696-the last ropes being disposed to the best advantage , all joined [the laborers who were digging]5697-the laborers who were digging . Twenty minutes later , however , and before the trench was more than three parts finished , there came a tremendous change . Turning hastily to [the river]2345-the river , [Bartlett]323-amos bartlett uttered a shout of alarm and called for light . [He]323-amos bartlett had approached the telltale stake , and suddenly , before [he]323-amos bartlett reached it , found [his]323-amos bartlett feet in the water . [The river]2345-the river was rising with fierce rapidity at last , and five minutes later began to lick at the edge of [the hay - rick]5700-the hay - rick , and churn along with a strange hidden force and devil in it . The pace increased with the volume , and told of some prodigious outburst on [the moor]5491-the moor . The uncanny silence of the swelling water as it slipped downward was a curious feature of it in this phase . [Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin and [[his]251-uncle chirgwin men]5667-his men huddled together at the side of [the rick]5703-the rick ; then [Bartlett]323-amos bartlett held up [his]323-amos bartlett hand and spoke . " Hark '[2864-e] [e]2864-e all ! ' Tis comin '[2864-e] now , by [God]179-god ! " [They]2865-they kept silence and listened with straining ears and frightened eyes , fire - rimmed by the flickering torchlight . A sound came from afar — a sound not unmelodious but singular beyond power of language to express — a whisper of sinister significance to [him]2866-him who knew its meaning , of sheer mystery to all others . A murmur filled the air , a murmur of undefined noises still far distant . [They]2867-they might have been human , [they]2867-they might have arisen from the flight and terror of beasts , from the movement of vast bodies , from the reverberations of remote music ; [Earth]1877-earth or [Heaven]339-heaven might have bred them , or [the upper chambers of [the air midway between]2870-the air midway between]2869-the upper chambers of the air midway between . [They]2867-they spoke of terrific energies , of outpourings of force , of elemental chaos come again , of a crown of unimagined horror set upon the night . [All]1841-all listened fearfully while the solemn cadences crept on [their]2865-they ears , fascinated [them]2865-they like a siren song , wakened wild dread of tribulations and terrors unknown till now . It was indeed a sound but seldom heard and wholly unfamiliar to those beside the stack save one . " ' Tis [the callin '[179-god] o ' the cleeves]5704-the callin ' o ' the cleeves , " said [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin . " Nay , [man]3551-man , '[179-god] tis a live , ragin ' storm comed off [the sea]463-the sea an '[179-god] tearin ' ower the airth like a legion out o '[179-god] hell ! ' Tis the floodgates o '[179-god] [God]179-god opened [you'm]2872-you'm hearin ' ! Ay , an '[179-god] the four winds at each other 's throats , an ' a outburst o '[179-god] [all the springs ' pon [the hills]1859-the hills]5707-all the springs ' pon the hills ! '[179-god] Tis death and ruin for [the whole country - side]2873-the whole country - side as be yelling up - long now . An ' '[179-god] tis comin ' faster'n thot . " As [Bartlett]323-amos bartlett spoke , the voice of the tempest grew rapidly nearer , all mystery faded out of it and its murmuring changed to a hoarse rattle . [Thunder]381-thunder growled a bass to the shriek of coming winds and a flash of distant lightning bridged the head of the coomb with a crooked snake of fire . " Us'd best to get '[179-god] pon [high land]2874-high land out o ' this , " shouted [Bartlett]323-amos bartlett . " All as [men]3512-men can do [us]5710-them have done . The hay 's in the hand o '[179-god] [Providence]285-providence , but [I]0-i would n't be perched on top o ' that stack not for diamonds all the same . " A cry cut [him]323-amos bartlett short . [Mary]222-mary had turned and found the way to higher ground already cut off . [The lake]5680-the lake was rising under [their]5710-them eyes , and that in spite of the fact that the waters had already reached the trench cut for [them]5710-them , and now tumbled in a torrent back to [the parent stream]5712-the parent stream . Escape in this direction was clearly impossible . It only remained to wade through [the head of [the lake]5680-the lake]5713-the head of the lake , and that without a moment 's delay . [Mary]222-mary [herself]222-mary , holding a torch , went first through water above [her]222-mary knees and [the men]3467-the men hastily followed , [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin coming last and being nearly carried off [his]251-uncle chirgwin short legs as [he]251-uncle chirgwin turned to view [the rick]5703-the rick . Once through the water , [all]1841-all were in safety , for [the meadow]5674-the meadow sloped steeply upward . An increasing play of lightning made the torches useless , and they were dropped , while [the party]1434-the party pressed close beneath an overhanging hedge which ran along [the upper boundary of [the meadow]5674-the meadow]5720-the upper boundary of the meadow . From this vantage - ground [they]5710-them beheld a spectacle unexampled in the memory of [any among [them]5710-them]5722-any among them . Screaming like [some incarnate and mad manifestation of all the elements massed in one]5723-some incarnate and mad manifestation of all the elements massed in one , the hurricane launched itself upon [that valley]5724-that valley . As a wall the wind heralded [the water]3501-the water , while forked lightnings , flaming above both , tore the black darkness into jagged rags and lighted a chaos of yellow foaming torrent which battled with livid front straight down [the heart of the coomb]5726-the heart of the coomb . [The swollen river]5672-the swollen river was lost in the torrent of [it]5672-the swollen river ; and the hiss of the rain was drowned by its sound . So [Nature]178-nature 's full , hollowed hand ran over lightning - lighted to the organ music of the thunder ; but for [these horror - stricken watchers]5728-these horror - stricken watchers the majestic phenomena sweeping before [them]5728-these horror - stricken watchers held no splendor and prompted no admiration . [They]5728-these horror - stricken watchers only saw ruin tearing at [the roots of [the land]3578-the land]5729-the roots of the land ; [they]5728-these horror - stricken watchers only imagined drowned beasts floating before [them]5728-these horror - stricken watchers belly upward , scattered hay hurried to [the sea]463-the sea , wasted crops , a million tons of precious soil torn off [the fields]3478-the fields , [orchards]5733-orchards desolated , [bridges]5734-bridges and [roads]5735-roads destroyed . For [them]5728-these horror - stricken watchers misery stared out of the lightning and starvation rode upon the flood . The roar of water answering the thunder above it was to [their]5728-these horror - stricken watchers ears Earth groaning against the rod , and right well [they]5728-these horror - stricken watchers knew that the pale torrent was drowning those summer labors which represented money and food for the on - coming of the long winter months . [They]5728-these horror - stricken watchers stared , silent and dumb , under the ram ; [they]5728-these horror - stricken watchers knew that the kernel of near a year 's toil was riding away upon the livid torrent ; that [the higher meadows]5736-the higher meadows , held absolutely safe , were half under water now ; that the flood tumbling under the blue fire most surely held sheep and cattle in [its]5672-the swollen river depths ; that tons of upland hay swam upon [it]5672-the swollen river ; that , like enough , [dead men]5737-dead men also turned and twisted there in a last mad journey to [the sea]463-the sea . A passing belief that [their]5728-these horror - stricken watchers labors might save the stack sprung up in the breast of [one alone]5739-one alone . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin trusted [Providence]285-providence and [his]251-uncle chirgwin hempen ropes and clothesline ; but it was a childish hope , and , gazing open - mouthed upon that swelling , hurtling cataract of roaring water , [none]2202-none shared it . An almost continuous mist of livid light crossed and recrossed , festooned and cut by its own crinkled sources , revealed the progress of the flood , and , heedless of [themselves]5728-these horror - stricken watchers , [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin and [[his]251-uncle chirgwin men]5667-his men watched the fate of the stack , now rising very pale of hue above the water , seen through shining curtains of rain . First the torrent tumbled and rose about it , and then a sudden tremor and turning of the mass told that the rick floated . As it twisted the weak ropes , receiving the strain in turn , snapped one after another ; then the great stack moved solemnly forward , stuck fast , moved again , lost its center of gravity and foundered like [a ship]2698-a ship . Under the lightning [they]5728-these horror - stricken watchers saw [it]5739-one alone heave upward upon one side , plunge forward against the torrent which had swept its base from beneath it , and vanish . [The farmer]3745-the farmer heaved a bitter groan . " [Dear God]382-dear god , that sich things can be in [a Christian land]5744-a christian land , " [he]0-i cried . " All gone , this year , an '[0-i] last , an ' the aftermath ; an '[2875-he] Lard [He]2875-he knaws what be doin' in [the valley bottom]2876-the valley bottom . [I]0-i wish the light may strike [me]0-i dead wheer [I]0-i stand , for [I]0-i be a blot afore [Him]2875-he , else [I]0-i 'd never be made to suffer like this here . " " ' Tis [the land]3578-the land as have sinned , not [you]2877-you , " said [Mary]222-mary . " This reaches more'n [us]5747-us o '[0-i] Drift .
