" [Theer]2880-theer ban't no more for [us]5747-us to do till marnin '[2879-the man bartlett] light . " " If ever it do come , " groaned [the man Bartlett]2879-the man bartlett . " So like 's not the end o ' [the world]3624-the world be here ; an '[0-i] [I]0-i 'd be fust to hollo it , awnly [theer]2880-theer 's more water than fire here when all 's said , an ' the airth 's to be burned , not drowned . " " Let a come when a will now , " gasped [an aged man]5751-an aged man as [the drenched party]5752-the drenched party moved slowly away upward to [the farm]3904-the farm ; " [our]5747-us ears be tuned to the trump o '[2879-the man bartlett] God , for nort — no , not the screech o ' horns blawed by [all the angels in [heaven]637-heaven]5754-all the angels in heaven — could sound awfuler than the tantarra o '[2879-the man bartlett] this gert tempest . [I]0-i , [Gaffer Polglaze]383-gaffer polglaze , be the auldest piece up [Drift]15-drift , but [I]0-i never heard tell o ' no sich noise , let alone havin' [my]2879-the man bartlett awn ears flattened wi '[2879-the man bartlett] it . " [They]2881-their climbed [the steep lane]2882-the steep lane to [the farm]3904-the farm , and the wind began to drown the more distant roar of the water . Rain fell more heavily than before , and the full heart of the storm crashed and flamed over [their]2881-their heads as Drift was reached . Dawn trembled out upon a tremendous chapter of disasters , still fresh in the memory of [many who witnessed it]2884-many who witnessed it . A gray , sullen morning , with sky - glimpses of blue , hastily shown and greedily hidden , broke over [Western Cornwall]145-western cornwall and uncovered the handiwork of a flood more savage in its fury and far - reaching in its effects than [man]3551-man 's memory could parallel — a flood which already shrunk fast backward from its own havoc . To describe [a single one of [those valleys through which small rivers]2887-those valleys through which small rivers usually ran to [the sea]463-the sea]2886-a single one of those valleys through which small rivers usually ran to the sea is to describe them all . Thus the torrent which raved down [the coomb beneath Drift]2889-the coomb beneath drift , and carried [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's massive hayrick with it like [a child]4285-a child 's [toy - boat]2891-toy - boat , had also uprooted acres of gooseberry bushes and raspberry canes , torn apple trees from the ground , laid waste extensive tracts of ripe produce and carried ripening roots by thousands into [the sea]463-the sea . Beneath [the orchards]5511-the orchards , as the flood subsided , there appeared great tracts of nakedness where banks of stone had been torn out of [the land]3578-the land and scattered upon [it]3578-the land ; dead beasts stuck jammed in the low forks of trees ; swine , sheep and calves appeared , cast up in fantastic places , strangled by the water ; sandy wastes , stripped of every living leaf and blade , ran like banks where no banks formerly existed , and here and there from [their]2881-their midst stuck out naked boughs of upturned trees , fragments of [man]3551-man 's contrivances , or the legs of dead beasts . Looking up the coomb , desolation was writ large and the utmost margins of the flood clearly recorded on branch and bough , where rubbish which had floated to the fringe of the flood was caught and hung aloft . Below , as the waters gained volume and force , [Buryas Bridge]104-buryas bridge , [an ancient structure of three arches beneath which [the trout - stream peacefully babbled under ordinary conditions]2897-the trout - stream peacefully babbled under ordinary conditions]2896-an ancient structure of three arches beneath which the trout - stream peacefully babbled under ordinary conditions , was swept headlong away and [the houses]2898-the houses hard by flooded ; while the greatest desolation had fallen on [those orchards lying lowest in [the valley]2302-the valley]2899-those orchards lying lowest in the valley . Indeed the nearer the flood approached [Newlyn]1-newlyn the more tremendous had been the ravage wrought by it . [The orchards of [Talcarne valley]2902-talcarne valley]2901-the orchards of talcarne valley were ruined as though artillery had swept [them]2901-the orchards of talcarne valley , and of the lesser crops scarce any at all remained . Then , bursting down [Street - an]148-street - an [- nowan]149-- nowan , as [that lane]2903-that lane is called , the waters running high where [their]2904-their courses narrowed , swamped [sundry cottages]2905-sundry cottages and leaped like a wolf on [the low - lying portion of [Newlyn]1-newlyn]2906-the low - lying portion of newlyn . Here it burst through the alleys and [narrow passages]2907-narrow passages , drowned [the basements of [many tenements]2909-many tenements]2908-the basements of many tenements , [isolated cottages]2910-isolated cottages , [stores]2911-stores and [granaries]2912-granaries , threatened nearly a hundred lives startled from sleep by its sudden assault . Then , under the raging weather and in [that babel of angry waters]2913-that babel of angry waters , brave deeds were done by [the fisher folk , who chanced to be ashore]2914-the fisher folk , who chanced to be ashore . Grave personal risks were hazarded by [many a man]2915-many a man in that turbid flood , and [not a few women]2916-not a few women and [children]1425-children were rescued with utmost danger to [[their]2916-not a few women saviors]2918-their saviors ' lives . Yet the petty rivalry of [split and riven creeds]5756-split and riven creeds actuated not a few even at that time of peril , and while life was allowed sacred and [no man]3523-no man turned a deaf ear to the cry of [woman]1347-woman or [child]1348-child , with property the case was altered and [sects]5760-sects lifted not a finger each to help [the other]3475-the other in the saving of furniture and effects . [Newlyn]1-newlyn furnished but one theater of a desolation which covered [wide regions]5762-wide regions . At [Penzance]7-penzance , [the Laregan River]150-the laregan river flooded all [the lowlands]5763-the lowlands as it swept with prodigious cataracts to [the sea]463-the sea ; [mighty lakes]5765-mighty lakes stretched between [Penzance]7-penzance and [Gulval]151-gulval ; [the brooklets of [Ponsandine]152-ponsandine and [Coombe]153-coombe]5766-the brooklets of ponsandine and coombe , swollen to torrents , bore crushing destruction upon [the valleys through which [they]5766-the brooklets of ponsandine and coombe fell]5767-the valleys through which they fell . [Bleu Bridge]154-bleu bridge with [its]154-bleu bridge ancient inscribed " long stone " was swept into [the bed of [the Ponsandine]152-ponsandine]5768-the bed of the ponsandine , and here , as in [other low - lying lands]5769-other low - lying lands , many tons of hay were torn from [their]5766-the brooklets of ponsandine and coombe foundations and set adrift . At [Churchtown]156-churchtown the rainfall precipitated off [the slopes of [Castle - an - dinas]157-castle - an - dinas]5770-the slopes of castle - an - dinas begot vast torrents which , upon [their]5766-the brooklets of ponsandine and coombe roaring way , tore the very heart out of [steep and stony lanes]5771-steep and stony lanes , flooded [farmyards]5772-farmyards , plowed up miles of hillside , leaped the wall of [the cemetery]5773-the cemetery below and spread twining yellow fingers among the graves . Three hundred tons of rain fell to the acre in the immediate tract of that terrific storm , and the world of misery , loss and suffering poured forth on [the humble dwellers of [the land]3578-the land]5774-the humble dwellers of the land only came to be estimated in its bitter magnitude during the course of the winter which followed . Ashore it was not immediately known whether any loss of human life had added crowning horror to the catastrophe , but evil news came quickly off [the sea]463-the sea . Mourning fell upon [Mousehole]9-mousehole for [the crews of two among [[its]9-mousehole fisher fleet who were lost that night upon the way toward [Plymouth]82-plymouth waters]5778-its fisher fleet who were lost that night upon the way toward plymouth waters to join the herring fishery]5777-the crews of two among its fisher fleet who were lost that night upon the way toward plymouth waters to join the herring fishery ; and [Newlyn]1-newlyn heard the wail of [a robbed mother]5779-a robbed mother . At [Drift]15-drift [the farmhouse]4849-the farmhouse was found to hold a mystery soon after the day had broken . [Joan Tregenza]183-joan , whose condition rendered it impossible for [her]183-joan to actively assist at the struggle in [the coomb]2136-the coomb , did not retire early on the previous night , as [[her]183-joan family]5782-her family supposed , and [Mary]222-mary , entering [[her]222-mary room]4592-her room at breakfast - time , found [it]4592-her room empty . There was no sign of [the girl]521-the girl and no indication of anything which could explain [her]521-the girl absence . At the dawn of the day which followed upon the great storm , while yet [the sea]463-the sea ran high and the gale died hard , [many tumbling luggers]5786-many tumbling luggers , [some maimed]5787-some maimed , began to dot [the wind - torn waters of [Mounts Bay]158-mounts bay]5788-the wind - torn waters of mounts bay . The tide was out , but within the shelter of [the shore which rose between [Newlyn]1-newlyn and the course of the wind]5789-the shore which rose between newlyn and the course of the wind , [the returning boats]5790-the returning boats found safety at [[their]5790-the returning boats accustomed anchorage]5791-their accustomed anchorage ; and as one by one [they]5790-the returning boats made [the little roads]5792-the little roads , as [boat]913-boat after [boat]913-boat came ashore from the fleet , tears , hysteric screams and deep - voiced thanks to [the Almighty]179-god arose from [the crowd of [men]3512-men and women massed at the extremity of [Newlyn pier beneath [the lighthouse]886-the lighthouse]5797-newlyn pier beneath the lighthouse]5795-the crowd of men and women massed at the extremity of newlyn pier beneath the lighthouse . Cheers and many a shake of hand greeted [every party]5799-every party as , weary - eyed and worn , it landed and climbed the slippery steps . From such moments even [those still in the shadow of terrible fear]5800-those still in the shadow of terrible fear plucked a little courage and brightened hopes . Then [each of [the returned fishermen]5802-the returned fishermen]5801-each of the returned fishermen , with [his]5801-each of the returned fishermen own clinging to [him]5801-each of the returned fishermen , set face homeward — a rejoicing stream of little separate processions , every one heralding a saved life . There crept thus inland wives smiling through the mist of dead tears , [old mothers]5803-old mothers hobbling beside [[their]5803-old mothers bearded sons]5804-their bearded sons , [young mothers]5805-young mothers pouring blessing on [proud sailor boys]5806-proud sailor boys , [sweethearts]5807-sweethearts , [withered ancients]5808-withered ancients , [daughters]5809-daughters , [sons]5810-sons , [little children]439-little children . Sad beyond power of thought were the hearts of all as [they]5802-the returned fishermen had hastened to the pierhead at early morning light ; now the sorrowful still remained there , but [those who came away]5812-those who came away rejoiced , for [none]2202-none returned without [their]5812-those who came away treasures . [Thomasin]201-thomasin stood with [many another care - stricken soul]5814-many another care - stricken soul , but [her]201-thomasin fears grew greater as the delay increased ; for [the Tregenza lugger]5815-the tregenza lugger was big and fast , yet many boats of less fame had already come [home]453-home . [All the fishermen]5817-all the fishermen told the same story . Bursting out of an ominous peace the storm had fallen suddenly upon [them]5817-all the fishermen when [westward of [the Scilly Islands]40-the scilly islands]5818-westward of the scilly islands . [One or two]5819-one or two were believed to have made [neighboring ports in [the isles]5821-the isles]5820-neighboring ports in the isles , but [the fleet]889-the fleet was driven before the gale and had experienced those grave hazards reserved for [small vessels]5823-small vessels in [a heavy sea]5824-a heavy sea . That all had weathered the night seemed a circumstance too happy to hope for , but [Newlyn hearts]1-newlyn rose high as [boat after boat]5825-boat after boat came back in safety . Then [a dozen men]5826-a dozen men hastened to [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza with the good news that [[her]198-mrs. tregenza husband]605-her husband 's vessel was in sight . " [She've]2919-her lost [her]2919-her mizzen by the looks on it , " said [a fisherman]506-a fisherman , " an '[222-mary] that 's more'n good reason for [her]2919-her bein ' '[222-mary] mong the last to make [home]453-home . " But [Thomasin]201-thomasin 's hysterical joy was cut short by the most unexpected appearance of [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary on [the pier]2921-the pier . [She]222-mary had visited [the white cottage]841-the white cottage to find [it]841-the white cottage locked up and empty ; [she]222-mary had then joined [the concourse]2923-the concourse at [the pierhead]4120-the pierhead , feeling certain that [the Tregenza boat]2925-the tregenza boat must still be at [sea]540-sea ; and [she]222-mary now added [her]222-mary congratulations to the rest , then told [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza [her]222-mary news . " [I]0-i be comed to knaw if [you]198-mrs. tregenza 've heard or seen anything o ' [Joan]183-joan . '[2919-her] Tis ' mazin '[222-mary] straange , but [her've]2919-her gone , like a dream , an ' [us]2929-us caan't find a sign of [her]2919-her . What wi '[2919-her] [she]2919-her an ' terrible doin 's '[1153-uncle] pon [the land]3578-the land last night , [uncle]1153-uncle 's 'bout beside hisself . [Us]2929-us left [her]2919-her in [the kitchen]860-the kitchen , an '[1153-uncle] when [we]2929-us comed back from tryin ' to save the hay [she]2919-her was nowheer . But [she]2919-her weern't , an '[1153-uncle] this mornin ' [we]2929-us doan't see a atom of [her]2919-her , but finds a envelope empty '[1153-uncle] pon the kitchen floor . ' Twas addressed to [Joan]183-joan an '[1153-uncle] comed from [Lunnon]73-lunnon . " " Aw jimmery ! [She've]2919-her gone to en arter all , then — an ' in [her]2919-her state . " " The floods was out , [you]5830-you see . [Her]2919-her might have marched off to [Penzance]7-penzance to larn 'bout[2919-her] the manner o ' gwaine to [Lunnon]73-lunnon an '[2919-her] bin stopped in [home]453-home - comin ' ; or [her]2919-her might have slept in [Penzance]7-penzance to catch [a early train]5831-a early train away . " " [Iss]194-iss , or [her]2919-her might a got in the water , [poor lamb]5832-poor lamb , " said [Thomasin]201-thomasin , who never left the dark side of a position unconsidered . [Mary]222-mary 's face showed that the same idea had struck [her]222-mary . " [God]179-god grant '[2919-her] tedn ' nothin' like that , though maybe '[2919-her] twould be better than t'other . [Us]2931-us caan't say [she've]2919-her run away , but [I]0-i thot [I]0-i 'd tell ' [e]2932-e how things is so 's [you]2933-you could spread it abroad that she'm lost . " But [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza did not answer . [Her]198-mrs. tregenza eyes were fixed on [the lugger]2935-the lugger which had now got to its anchorage and looked strange and unnatural shorn of its lesser mast . [She]198-mrs. tregenza saw the moorings dragged up ; and a few minutes later [the boat]917-the boat , which had rolled and tumbled at [them]2937-they all night , was baled . [Thereupon men]2938-thereupon men took [their]2938-thereupon men seats in [her]198-mrs. tregenza and began to row toward [the harbor]458-the harbor . It seemed that [Gray Michael]204-gray michael was steering , and [[his]204-gray michael crew]2940-his crew clearly pulled very weak and short , for [their]2937-they strength was spent . Then , as [they]2937-they came between the arms of [the harbor]458-the harbor , as [they]2937-they shipped oars and glided to the steps , [Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza 's hybrid yellow dog , who accompanied [the fisherman]797-the fisherman in all [his]797-the fisherman goings , jumped [ashore]1414-ashore barking and galloped up the slippery steps with joy ; while , at the same moment , [a woman]3541-a woman 's sharp cry cut the air like a knife and two wild eyes looked down into [the boat]917-the boat . " Wheer'm the bwoy , [Michael]204-gray michael ? Oh , [[my]0-i good God]2946-my good god , wheer'm [Tom]199-tom ? " [Everybody]266-everybody strained silently to hear the answer , but though [the fisherman]797-the fisherman looked up , [he]797-the fisherman made no reply . [The boat]917-the boat steadied and one after another [the men in [her]3541-a woman]2949-the men in her went [ashore]1414-ashore , [Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza mounting the steps last . [[His]797-the fisherman wife]843-his wife broke the silence . Only a murmur of thankfulness had greeted [the other men]2952-the other men , for [their]2952-the other men faces showed a tragedy . [They]2952-the other men regarded [[their]2952-the other men leader]2953-their leader fearfully , and there was something more than death in [their]2952-the other men eyes . " [Wheer'm the bwoy]366-the bwoy — [Tom]199-tom ? For the love of [God]179-god , speak , caan't ' [e]199-tom ? Why be [you]797-the fisherman all dumb an '[366-the bwoy] glazin ' that awful ! " cried [the woman]4662-the woman , knowing the truth before [she]4662-the woman heard it . Then [she]4662-the woman listened to [the elder Pritchard , who whispered [[his]5834-the elder pritchard , who whispered his wife wife]843-his wife]5834-the elder pritchard , who whispered his wife , and so fell into a great convulsion of raving , dry - eyed sorrow . " Oh , [[my]366-the bwoy bwoy]5836-my bwoy ! Drownded — [my]366-the bwoy awn lil precious [Tom]199-tom ! God a mercy ! Dead ! Then let [me]366-the bwoy die tu ! " [She]4662-the woman gave vent to extravagant and savage grief after the manner of [[her]4662-the woman kind]5837-her kind . [She]4662-the woman would have torn [her]4662-the woman hair and thrown [herself]4662-the woman off [the quay]2614-the quay but for kindly hands which restrained . " [God]179-god rot [you]2954-you , an '[366-the bwoy] blast [you]2954-you , an ' burn [you]2954-you up ! " [she]4662-the woman screamed , shaking [her]4662-the woman fists at [the sea]463-the sea . " [I]366-the bwoy knawed this would be the end . [I]366-the bwoy dreamed it '[366-the bwoy] fore ' [e]2955-e was born . [[My]0-i [Tom]199-tom]2957-my tom , [[my]0-i [Tom]199-tom]2957-my tom ! [I]0-i awnly had but wan — awnly wan , an ' now — " [She]756-mother wailed and wrung [her]756-mother hands , while rough voices filled [her]756-mother ears with such comfort as words could bring to [her]756-mother . " Rest easy , bide at peace , [dear sawl]5840-dear sawl . " " '[0-i] Tis [the Lard]1026-the lard 's doin' , [mother]756-mother ; an ' [the lil bwoy]5841-the lil bwoy 's better off now . " " Take it calm , [[my]0-i poor good creature]5842-my poor good creature . " " Try an '[0-i] bring tears to [your]199-tom eyes , [theer]199-tom 's [a dear wummon]2961-a dear wummon . " Tears finally came to [her]756-mother relief , and [she]756-mother wept and moaned while [friends]1078-friends supported [her]756-mother , looking with wonder upon [Michael]204-gray michael , [[her]756-mother husband]605-her husband . [He]204-gray michael stood aloof with [the men]3467-the men about [him]204-gray michael . But never a word [he]204-gray michael spoke to [[his]204-gray michael wife]843-his wife or any other . [His]204-gray michael eyes dilated and had lost [their]2966-their steady forward glance , though a mad misery lighted [them]2966-their with flashes that came and went ; [his]204-gray michael face was a very burrow of time , seared and trenched with pits and wrinkles . [His]204-gray michael hat was gone , [his]204-gray michael hair blew wild , the strong set of [his]204-gray michael mouth had vanished ; [his]204-gray michael head , usually held so high , hung forward on a shrunken neck . [The brothers Pritchard]384-the brothers pritchard told [their]384-the brothers pritchard story as [a party]2967-a party conducted [Thomasin]201-thomasin back to [[her]201-thomasin home]1297-her home . For the moment [Gray Michael]204-gray michael stood irresolute and alone , save for [his]204-gray michael dog , which ran round [him]204-gray michael . " [Us]384-the brothers pritchard was tackin ' when it fust began to blaw , an '[2969-the mainsail] all bustlin ' 'bout[2969-the mainsail] in the dark , when [the mainsail]2969-the mainsail went lerrickin ' '[2969-the mainsail] cross an ' knocked [the poor dam bwoy owerboard]5843-the poor dam bwoy owerboard into as ugly a rage o '[2969-the mainsail] water as ever [I]0-i seed . [Tom]199-tom had [his]199-tom sea - boots on , an ' every sawl '[199-tom] pon the bwoat knawed ' twas all up as soon as [we]384-the brothers pritchard lost en . [We]384-the brothers pritchard shawed a light an '[199-tom] tumbled 'bout for quarter o '[199-tom] an hour wi ' the weather gettin '[199-tom] wicked . Then comed a scat as mighty near thrawed [us]384-the brothers pritchard ' pon [our]384-the brothers pritchard beam - ends , an '[199-tom] took the mizzen ' long wi '[2971-e.] it . ' Tis terrible bad luck , sure '[199-tom] nough , for never [a tidier bwoy]2970-a tidier bwoy went feeshin ' ; but [theer]5844-theer 's worse to tell '[2971-e.] [e.]2971-e. " [The man]3494-the man stopped and [[his]3494-the man brother]2975-his brother took up the story . " ' Twas arterwards , when [us]384-the brothers pritchard had weathered the worst an '[3494-the man] was tryin ' to fetch [home]453-home , [Michael]204-gray michael failed forward on 's faace arter the bwoy was drownded ; an '[3494-the man] [us]384-the brothers pritchard had to do all for the bwoat wi'out en . But [he]3494-the man comed to bimebye an ' did n't take on much , awnly kept so dumb as [a adder]5846-a adder . [You]2976-you knaw that yaller dog as sails wi ' [us]384-the brothers pritchard most times ? [He]3494-the man turned '[2976-you] pon en sudden an ' sez : '[3494-the man] Praise [God]179-god , praise [the Lard o ' Hosts]5847-the lard o ' hosts , [[my]3494-the man sons]5848-my sons , here 's [Tom]199-tom , here 's [[my]3494-the man lad]1249-my lad as [us]384-the brothers pritchard thot weer drownded ! '[3494-the man] Then [he]3494-the man kissed that beast , an ' it licked [his]3494-the man faace , an '[3494-the man] [he]3494-the man cried — that iron sawl cried like a wummon ! Then [he]3494-the man thundered out as [the crew]2977-the crew was to give [God]179-god the praise , an ' said [the man as weern't on 's knees in a twinklin ']5850-the man as weern't on 's knees in a twinklin '[3494-the man] should be thrawed out the bwoat to [Jonah]385-jonah 's whale . [God]179-god 's truth ! [I]0-i never seed nothin' so awful as [skipper]2978-skipper 's eyes ' pon airth ! Then [er]5851-er calmed down , an '[2978-skipper] the back of en grawed humpetty an ' [his]3494-the man head failed a bit forrard an '[3494-the man] [he]3494-the man sat strokin ' of the dog . Arter that , when [us]5852-us seed Newlyn , it '[2978-skipper] peared to bring [en]2979-his to [his]2979-his senses a bit , an ' [he]2979-his knawed [Tom]199-tom was drownded . [He]2979-his rambled in [his]2979-his speech a while ; then went mute again , wi '[2979-his] a new look in [his]2979-his eyes as though [he]2979-his 'd grawed so auld as history in a single night . [Theer]2980-theer [he]2979-his do stand bedoled wi ' all manner o '[2979-his] airthly sufferin ' , poor creature . [Him]2979-his wi '[2979-his] all [his]2979-his righteousness behind en tu ! But the thinkin ' paarts of en be drownded wheer [his]2979-his bwoy was , an '[0-i] [I]0-i lay [theer]2980-theer ban't [no druggister]2981-no druggister , nor [doctor]2982-doctor neither , as'll bring ['em]2980-theer back to en . " " Look at that now ! " exclaimed [another man]1494-another man . " See who 's a talkin '[0-i] to [Tregenza]183-joan ! If that ban't terrible coorious ! ' Tis [Billy Jago]188-billy jago , [the softy]5854-the softy ! " [Billy]188-billy jago was indeed addressing [Gray Michael]204-gray michael and getting an answer to [his]204-gray michael remarks . [The laborer]5855-the laborer 's brains might be addled , but they still contained sane patches . [He]188-billy jago had heard of [the fisherman]797-the fisherman 's loss and now touched [his]188-billy jago hat and expressed regret . " Ay , [the young be snatched]5857-the young be snatched , same as [a build - in '[0-i] craw]5858-a build - in ' craw will pick sprigs o ' green wood for [her]5857-the young be snatched nest an '[2984-i] leave the dead twig to rot . Here [I]0-i be , rotten an ' coffin - ripe any time this two year , yet [I]2984-i 'm[2984-i] passed awver for [that braave young youth]2983-that braave young youth . An ' how is it wi '[2984-i] [you]2984-i , [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza ? [I]0-i s'pose [the Lard]1026-the lard do look to [His]2983-that braave young youth awn in such a pass ? " [Gray Michael]204-gray michael regarded [the speaker]1365-the speaker a moment and then made answer . " [I]0-i be that sleepy , [[my]0-i son]3811-my son , an ' hungry wi '[0-i] it . [Iss fay]194-iss , [I]0-i could eat a bloody raw dog - fish an ' think it no sin . See to this , but doan't say nothin' 'bout[0-i] it . The bwoat went down wi ' all hands , but [us]5859-us flinged a bottle to [Bucca]160-bucca for en to wash ashore wi '[204-gray michael] the news . But it never comed , for why ? 'Cause [that damnation devil]5860-that damnation devil bringed the bottle '[0-i] gainst granite rocks , an ' the message was washed away for [mermaids]5861-mermaids to read an '[0-i] laugh at ; an ' the grass - green splinters o '[0-i] glass as held the last cry o ' drownin '[3512-men] [men]3512-men — why , [lil childern]386-lil childern plays wi ' 'em[386-lil childern] now ' pon the sand . '[2984-i] Sing to [the Lard]200-the lard , [ye]2984-i that gaw down to [the sea]463-the sea . ' An '[2984-i] [I]0-i 'll sing — trust [me]0-i for that , but [I]0-i must eat fust . [I]0-i speaks to [you]3811-my son , [Billy]188-billy jago , 'cause [you]3811-my son be wan o '[0-i] [God 's chosen fools]2990-god 's chosen fools . " [He]0-i stopped abruptly , pressed [his]0-i hand over [his]0-i forehead , said something about breaking the news to [[his]0-i wife]843-his wife , and then walked slowly down [the quay]2614-the quay . The manner of [his]0-i locomotion had wholly changed , and [he]0-i moved like one whose life was a failure . [Meantime Jago , full of the great discovery]2993-meantime jago , full of the great discovery , hastened to [the Pritchards]228-pritchards and [other men who were now following [Gray Michael]204-gray michael]2994-other men who were now following gray michael at a distance . [Them]2995-them [he]0-i told that [the fisherman]797-the fisherman had taken leave of [his]0-i senses , that [he]0-i had actually called [Billy]188-billy jago [himself]188-billy jago one of [[God]179-god 's chosen fools]2990-god 's chosen fools . [Several more boats]2998-several more boats had come in , and as it was certainly known that some had taken refuge at [Scilly]161-scilly , those vitally interested in [the few remaining vessels]2999-the few remaining vessels withdrew from [the quay]2614-the quay comforting each other and putting a hopeful face on the position . [Gray Michael]204-gray michael followed [[his]204-gray michael wife]843-his wife [home]453-home . As yet [she]843-his wife had not learned of [his]204-gray michael state ; but , although [his]204-gray michael conduct on returning was somewhat singular , no word which fell now from [him]204-gray michael spoke clearly of a disordered mind . [He]204-gray michael clamored first for food , and , while [he]204-gray michael ate , gave a clear if callous account of [[his]204-gray michael son]869-his son 's death and [the lugger]2935-the lugger 's danger . Having eaten , [he]204-gray michael went to [[his]204-gray michael bedroom]3005-his bedroom , dragged off [his]204-gray michael boots , flung [himself]204-gray michael down and was soon sleeping heavily ; while [Thomasin]201-thomasin , marveling at [his]204-gray michael stolidity and resenting it not a little , gave way to utter grief . During an interval between storms of tears [the woman]4662-the woman put on a black gown , then went to [her]4662-the woman work . The day had now advanced . On seeing [her]4662-the woman again [downstairs]4713-downstairs , [two or three friends]3008-two or three friends , including [the Pritchards]228-pritchards , entered [the house]592-the house and asked anxiously after [Michael]204-gray michael , without , however , stating the nature of [their]3008-two or three friends fears . [She]4662-the woman answered querulously that [the man]3494-the man was asleep and showed no more sorrow than a brute beast . [She]4662-the woman was very red - eyed and bedraggled . Every utterance was an excuse for a fresh outburst of weeping , [her]4662-the woman breast heaved , [her]4662-the woman hands moved spasmodically , [her]4662-the woman nerves were at extreme tension and [she]4662-the woman could not stay long in one place . Seeing that [she]4662-the woman was nearly lightheaded with much grief , and hoping that [[her]4662-the woman husband]605-her husband 's disorder would vanish after [his]605-her husband slumber was ended , [[her]4662-the woman friends]3012-her friends forbore to hint at what had happened to [him]605-her husband . [They]3012-her friends comforted [her]4662-the woman to the best of [their]3012-her friends power ; then , knowing that long hours of bitter sorrow must surely pass over [the mother]4243-the mother 's head before such grief could grow less , departed one by one , leaving [her]4662-the woman at last alone . [She]4662-the woman moved restlessly about from [room]3014-room to [room]3014-room , carrying in one hand a photograph of [Tom]199-tom , in the other a handkerchief . Now and then [she]4662-the woman sat down , looked at the picture and wept anew . [She]4662-the woman tried to eat some supper presently but could not . It is seldom a sudden loss strikes [home]453-home so speedily as had [her]4662-the woman tribulation sunk into [Thomasin Tregenza]201-thomasin 's soul . [She]4662-the woman drank some brandy and water which [a friend]691-a friend had poured out for [her]4662-the woman and left standing on the mantel — shelf . Then [she]4662-the woman went up to bed — a stricken ruin of [the woman who had risen from it in the morning]3018-the woman who had risen from it in the morning . [[Her]4662-the woman husband]605-her husband still slept , and [Thomasin]201-thomasin , [her]201-thomasin grief being of a nature which required spectators for its fullest and most soothing expression , felt irritated alike with [him]605-her husband and with [those friends who had all departed]3020-those friends who had all departed , and , from the best motives , left [her]201-thomasin thus . [She]4662-the woman flung [herself]4662-the woman into bed and anger obscured [her]4662-the woman misery — anger with [[her]4662-the woman husband]605-her husband . [His]605-her husband heavy breathing worked [her]4662-the woman to a frenzy at last , and [she]4662-the woman sat up , took [him]605-her husband by the shoulder and tried to shake [him]605-her husband . " Wake up , for [God]179-god 's sake , an ' speak to [me]3022-me , caan't '[3022-me] [e]3022-me ? [You]3022-me eat an ' drink an '[3022-me] sleep like a gert hog — [you]3022-me new — come from [[your]3022-me awnly son]3023-your awnly son 's drownin ' ! Oh , Christ , caan't '[3022-me] [e]3022-me think o ' [me]3022-me , as have lived a hunderd cruel years since [you]605-her husband went to sleep ? Ai n't [you]605-her husband got a word for [me]3022-me ? An '[3022-me] [you]605-her husband , as had [your]605-her husband sawl centered ' pon en — how comes it [you]605-her husband can — " [She]4662-the woman stopped abruptly , for [he]605-her husband lay motionless and made no sort of response to [her]4662-the woman shrill complaining . [She]4662-the woman had yet to learn the cause ; [she]4662-the woman had yet to know that [Michael]204-gray michael had drifted beyond the reach of all further mental suffering whatsoever . No religious anxieties , no mundane trials , none of the million lesser carking troubles that fret the sane brain and stamp care on the face of conscious intelligence would plague [him]605-her husband more . Henceforth [he]605-her husband was dead to the changes and chances of human life . At midnight there came the awful waking . [Thomasin]201-thomasin slept at last and slumbered dream - tossed in a shadow - world of fantastic troubles . Then a sound roused [her]4662-the woman — the sound of a voice speaking loudly , breaking off to laugh , and speaking again . The voice [she]4662-the woman knew , but the laugh [she]4662-the woman had never heard . [She]4662-the woman started up and listened . It was [[her]4662-the woman husband]605-her husband who had wakened [her]4662-the woman . " How do it go then ? [Lard]200-the lard ! [my]605-her husband memory be like a fishin '[605-her husband] net , as holds the gert things an ' lets [the little '[605-her husband] uns]5863-the little ' uns creep through . ' Twas a braave song as [faither]579-faither singed , though maybe for [God]179-god fearers it ban't a likely song . " Then the bed trembled and [the man]3494-the man reared up violently and roared out an order in such words as [he]3494-the man had never used till then . " Port ! Port [[your]3494-the man God - damned helm]5866-your god - damned helm if [you]3494-the man do n't want 'em[605-her husband] to sink [us]3024-us . " [Thomasin]201-thomasin , of whose presence [[her]201-thomasin husband]605-her husband appeared unconscious , crept trembling from the bed . Then [his]605-her husband voice changed and [he]605-her husband whispered : " [Port]387-port , [[my]0-i son]3811-my son , 'cause of that '[605-her husband] pon the waters . Caan't ' [e]5867-e see — [they]5868-they bubbles a glimmerin '[605-her husband] on the foam ? That 's the last life of [my]0-i lil [Tom]199-tom ; an ' the foam - wreath 's put [theer]5869-theer by [God]179-god 's awn right hand . [He'm]199-tom saved , if '[605-her husband] twasn't that down at [the bottom o ' [the sea]463-the sea]5870-the bottom o ' the sea [a man]467-a man be twenty fathom nearer hell than [them]5868-they as lies in graaves ashore . But let [en]5867-e wait for the last trump as'll rip [the deep oceans]5873-the deep oceans . An '[605-her husband] the feesh — damn 'em — if [I]605-her husband thot [they]5868-they 'd nose [Tom]199-tom , by God [I]605-her husband 'd catch every feesh as ever swum . But shall feesh be '[605-her husband] lowed to eat what 's had a everlasting sawl in it ? God forbid . [He'm]3027-he [theer]3028-theer , [I]0-i doubt , wi ' seaweed round en an '[3029-sea - maids] [sea - maids]3029-sea - maids a cryin ' awver [his]3027-he lil white faace an '[3027-he] keepin ' the crabs away . Hell take crabs — they'd a ate Christ '[3027-he] isself if so be [He]3027-he 'd falled in [the water]3501-the water . Pearls — pearls — pearls is on [Tom]199-tom , an ' the sea creatures gives what [they]3029-sea - maids can , 'cause[3029-sea - maids] [they]3029-sea - maids knaw as [he]199-tom 'd a grawed to be [a man]467-a man an ' [theer master]5874-theer master . '[3800-the awnly son o ' his mother] [The awnly son o ' [[his]3027-he mother]752-his mother]3800-the awnly son o ' his mother . '[3800-the awnly son o ' his mother] Well , well , sleep 's better'n medicine ; but no sleepin ' this weather if [us]5876-us wants to make [home]453-home again . Steady ! '[3800-the awnly son o ' his mother] Tis freshenin ' fast ! " [He]3027-he was busy about some matter and [she]752-his mother heard [him]3027-he breathing in the darkness and stirring [himself]3027-he . [Thomasin]201-thomasin , [her]752-his mother heart near standing still before this awful discovery , hesitated between stopping and flying from [the room]4756-the room before [he]3027-he should discover [her]752-his mother . But [she]752-his mother felt no fear of [the man]3494-the man [himself]3027-he , and bracing [her]752-his mother nerves , struck a light . It showed [Gray Michael]204-gray michael sitting up and evidently under the impression [he]3027-he was at [sea]540-sea . [He]3032-he grasped the bed - head as a tiller and peered anxiously ahead . " [Theer]5884-theer 's light shawin '[3032-he] forrard ! " [he]3032-he cried . Then [he]3032-he laughed , and [Thomasin]201-thomasin saw [his]3032-he face was but the caricature of what it had been , with all the iron lines blotted out and a strange , feeble expression about eyes and mouth . [He]3032-he nodded [his]3032-he head , looked up at the ceiling from time to time , and presently began to sing . It was the old rhyme [he]3032-he had been trying to recollect , and it now came , tossed uppermost in the mind - quake which had shattered [his]3032-he intellect , buried matters of moment , and flung to the surface long hidden events and words of [his]3032-he youth . " ' [Bucca]160-bucca 's a churnin '[3032-he] the waves of [the sea]463-the sea , Bucca 's a darkenin ' the sky wi '[3032-he] [his]3032-he frown , [His]3032-he voice is the roll o ' the thunder . '[3032-he] " Ha , ha , ha , [missis]3037-missis ! So you'm aboard , eh ? Well , ' tis a funny picksher [you]5885-you makes , an '[3032-he] if tweern't murder an ' hell - fire to do it , blamed if [I]3038-i would n't thraw '[3038-i] [e]3038-i out [the ship]3604-the ship . ' [Thou]3038-i mad'st [him]3032-he lower than the angels , '[3038-i] but not much lower , [I]0-i 'm thinkin '[3032-he] . ' Tis all play an '[0-i] no work wi ' [them]5886-they . [They]5886-they ought to take a back seat '[3038-i] fore the likes o ' [us]3034-us . [They]5886-they abbun [no devil]5887-no devil at [theer]3038-i tails all times . " '[3038-i] But [I]0-i 'll tame the wild devil afore very long . If [I]0-i caan't wi ' [my]3038-i feests , [I]3038-i will wi '[3038-i] [my]0-i tongue ! ' " [Thomasin Tregenza]201-thomasin scuffled into [her]201-thomasin clothes while [he]3032-he babbled , and now , bidding [him]3032-he sleep in a shaking voice , putting out the candle and taking the matches with [her]201-thomasin , [she]201-thomasin fled into the night to rouse [[her]201-thomasin neighbors]5888-her neighbors and summon [a doctor]5889-a doctor . [She]201-thomasin forgot all [her]201-thomasin other troubles before this overwhelming tragedy . And [the man]3494-the man driveled on in the dark , concerning [himself]3494-the man for the most part with those interests which had occupied [his]3494-the man life when [he]3494-the man was [a boy]619-a boy . [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary did not return to [Newlyn]1-newlyn after making inquiries at [Penzance]7-penzance . There indeed [she]222-mary learned one fact which might prove important , but the possibilities to be read from it were various . [Joan]183-joan had been at [the Penzance railway station]5892-the penzance railway station , and chance made [Mary]222-mary question [the identical porter who had studied the timetable for [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin]5893-the identical porter who had studied the timetable for her cousin . " [She]3042-she was anxious 'bout[3494-the man] the Lunnon trains an ' tawld [me]3494-the man [she]3042-she was travelin '[3494-the man] up to [town]1223-town to - morrow , " explained [the man]3494-the man . " [I]0-i weer ' pon the lookout this marnin '[0-i] , but [she]3042-she dedn ' come again . " " What time did [you]3494-the man see [her]3042-she last night ? " " '[3042-she] Bout nine or earlier . [I]0-i mind the time 'cause the storm burst not so very long arter , an '[0-i] [I]0-i wondered if [the gal]3893-the gal had got to [her]3042-she [home]453-home . " " No , [she]3042-she did n't . Might [she]3042-she have gone by [any other train]3045-any other train ? " " [She]3042-she might , but [I]0-i 'm everywheers , an '[3042-she] ' tedn '[0-i] likely as [I]0-i should n't have seed [her]3042-she . " This much [Mary]222-mary heard , and then went [home]453-home . [Her]3042-she news made [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin very anxious , for supposing that [Joan]183-joan had returned from [Penzance]7-penzance on the previous evening , or attempted to do so , it was probable that [she]183-joan had been in [the lowest part of [the valley]2302-the valley]3047-the lowest part of the valley , at or near [Buryas Bridge]104-buryas bridge , about the time of the flood . The waters still ran high , but [Uncle Thomas]199-tom sent out [search parties]3049-search parties through the afternoon of that day , and [himself]199-tom plodded not a few miles in [the lower part of [the coomb]2136-the coomb]3050-the lower part of the coomb . Meantime the truth must be stated . On the night of the storm [Joan]183-joan had gone to [Penzance]7-penzance , ascertained [the first train]3052-the first train which [she]183-joan could catch next day , and then returned as quickly as [she]183-joan could toward [Drift]15-drift . But at [Buryas Bridge]3053-buryas bridge [she]183-joan remembered that [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle was in [the coomb]2136-the coomb with the farm hands , and might be there all night . It was necessary that [he]783-her uncle should know [her]183-joan intentions and direct [her]183-joan in several particulars . [A farm vehicle]3056-a farm vehicle must also be ordered , for [Joan]183-joan would have to leave [the farm]3904-the farm at a very early hour . Strung to a tension of nerves above all power of fatigue , in a whirl of excitement and wholly heedless of the mysterious nocturnal conditions around [her]183-joan , [Joan]183-joan determined to seek [Uncle Thomas]199-tom directly , and with that intention , instead of climbing [the hill to Drift]3058-the hill to drift and so placing [herself]183-joan in a position of safety , passed the smithy and cots which lie by [Buryas Bridge]104-buryas bridge and prepared to ascend [the coomb]2136-the coomb in this fashion and so reach [[her]183-joan friends]3012-her friends the quicker . [She]183-joan knew [[her]183-joan road]3061-her road blindfold , but was quite ignorant of the altered character of [the stream]4565-the stream . [Joan]183-joan had not , however , traveled above a quarter of a mile through [the orchard lands]3063-the orchard lands when [she]183-joan began to realize the difficulties . Once well out of [the orchards]5511-the orchards , [she]183-joan believed that [the meadows]2306-the meadows would offer an easier path , and thus , buried in [her]183-joan own thoughts , proceeded with many stumblings and splashings over the wet grasses and earth , under a darkness that made progress very slow despite [her]183-joan familiarity with the way . Then it was that , deep hidden in the night and all alone , where [the stream]4565-the stream ran into [a pool above big bowlders which banked]3067-a pool above big bowlders which banked [it]4565-the stream — at the spot , indeed , where [she]183-joan had reigned over the milky meadowsweets seated on a granite throne — the vibrating thread of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan 's little life was sharply severed and [she]183-joan died with none to see or hear , in that tumult of rising waters which splashed and gurgled and rose on the skirts of the coming storm . [A pathway]3068-a pathway ran here at the edge of [the river]2345-the river , and [the girl]521-the girl stepped upon it to find the swollen current suddenly up to [her]183-joan knees . Bewildered [she]521-the girl turned , slipped , turned again , and then , under the impression that [she]521-the girl faced toward [the meadow - bank]3071-the meadow - bank , put up [her]521-the girl hands to grapple safety , set [her]521-the girl foot forward and , in a moment , was drowning . Distant not half a mile , laboring like giants to save a thing far less precious than this life , toiled [Uncle Thomas]199-tom and [[his]199-tom men]5667-his men . Had silence prevailed among [them]3073-them the single cry which echoed up [the valley]2302-the valley might well have reached [their]3073-them ears ; but [all]1841-all were laboring amain , and [Joan]183-joan was at that moment the last thought in the minds of [any among [them]3073-them]5722-any among them . So [she]183-joan died ; for the gathering waters soon beat out [her]183-joan life and silenced [her]183-joan feeble struggle to save it . A short agony ended the nine months of experience through which [Joan]183-joan 's life has been followed ; [her]183-joan fires were quenched , and that most roughly ; [her]183-joan fears , hopes , sorrows , joys were all swept away ; and [Nature]178-nature stood defeated by [herself]178-nature , to see [a young life strangled on the threshold of motherhood]3077-a young life strangled on the threshold of motherhood , and [an infant being drowned so near to birth]3078-an infant being drowned so near to birth that [its]3078-an infant being drowned so near to birth small heart had already begun to beat . [Two men]482-two men , tramping through the desolation of [the ruined valley]3080-the ruined valley at [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's command , discovered [Joan]183-joan 's body . [The elder]4884-the elder was [Amos Bartlett]323-amos bartlett , and [he]4884-the elder fell back a step at the spectacle with a sorrowful oath on [his]4884-the elder lip ; [the younger searcher]3082-the younger searcher turned white and showed fear . [The dead girl]3083-the dead girl lay on [her]3083-the dead girl back , so left by [the water]3501-the water . [Her]3083-the dead girl dress had been caught between two great bowlders near [the pool of [her]3083-the dead girl drowning]3085-the pool of her drowning and the flood had thus caused [her]3083-the dead girl no injury . " [God]179-god 's goodness ! how comed [she]3083-the dead girl here ! " cried out [Bartlett]323-amos bartlett . " Oh , but this 'll be black news — black news ; an ' [[her]3083-the dead girl brother]5895-her brother drowned at [sea]540-sea likewise ! [Theer]5897-theer 's a hidden meanin '[323-amos bartlett] in it , [I]0-i lay , if [us]3086-their awnly knawed . " [The lad who accompanied [Bartlett]323-amos bartlett]3087-the lad who accompanied bartlett was shaking , and did not dare to look at the still figure which lay so stiff and straight at [their]3086-their feet . [The old , silent man called [Gaffer Polglaze]383-gaffer polglaze]5899-the old , silent man called gaffer polglaze found sufficient excitement in the tragedy to loosen a tongue which seldom wagged . " Two minutes later [Mr. Bartlett]324-mr. bartlett followed [[his]324-mr. bartlett master]676-his master , but [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin had taken a considerable start of [him]676-his master . [The old man]3536-the old man was terribly shocked to hear the news , for [he]3536-the old man had clung to a theory that [Joan]183-joan was long since in [London]45-london . Dread and fear came over [him]3536-the old man . The thought of facing this particular corpse was more than [he]3536-the old man could contemplate with self - control . A great nervous terror mingled with [his]3536-the old man grief . [He]3536-the old man wished to avoid the return from [the valley]2302-the valley , and the first excuse for so doing which came to [his]3536-the old man mind [he]3536-the old man hurriedly acted upon . [He]3536-the old man declared it essential that [the Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas should be told instantly , and hastened away before [Mary]222-mary could argue with [him]3536-the old man . Only that morning [they]5913-they had heard of [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's condition , but [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin forgot it when the blasting news of [[his]3536-the old man niece]3958-his niece 's death fell upon [him]3536-the old man . [He]3536-the old man hurried snuffling and weeping along as fast as [his]3536-the old man legs would bear [him]3536-the old man , and not until [he]3536-the old man stood at [[their]5913-they cottage]5915-their cottage door did [he]3536-the old man recollect the calamities which had overtaken [the fisherman]797-the fisherman and [those of [[his]3536-the old man household]5918-his household]5917-those of his household . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin began to speak hastily the moment [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza opened the door . [He]251-uncle chirgwin choked and gurgled over [his]251-uncle chirgwin news . " [She'm]3958-his niece dead — [Joan]183-joan . [They]5913-they 've found [her]183-joan in [the brook]1099-the brook as the waters went down . " [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin approached [Gray Michael]204-gray michael and [the fisherman]797-the fisherman held out [his]797-the fisherman hand and smiled . " '[199-tom] Tis [farmer Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , to be sure . An ' how is it with '[3118-e] [e]3118-e , [uncle]1153-uncle ? " " Bad , bad , [Tregenza]183-joan . " " [You'm]3125-you'm wrong , [[my]0-i son]3811-my son . [Joan]183-joan 's bin dead these years ' pon years . " [The other]3475-the other laughed loudly , and burst into mindless profanity and obscenity . [So the purest liver and most cleanly thinker]5933-so the purest liver and most cleanly thinker has often cursed and uttered horrible imprecations and profanations under the knife , being chloroformed and unconscious the while . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin gazed and listened open mouthed . This spectacle of a shattered intellect came upon [him]204-gray michael as an absolutely new manifestation . Any novel experience is rare when [a man]467-a man has passed the age of seventy , and [the farmer]3745-the farmer was profoundly agitated . Then a solemn fit fell upon [Gray Michael]204-gray michael , and as [[his]204-gray michael visitor]2220-his visitor rose to depart [he]204-gray michael quoted from words long familiar to [the speaker]1365-the speaker — weird utterances , and doubly weird from [a madman]5938-a madman 's mouth in [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's opinion . ' " [He]0-i relapsed into absolute silence and sat with [his]0-i eyes on the fire . Sometimes [he]0-i shook , sometimes [he]0-i nodded [his]0-i head ; now [he]0-i frowned , then grinned vacuously at the current of [his]0-i thoughts . [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin took [his]189-mr. chirgwin leave of [Thomasin]201-thomasin , prayed that [she]201-thomasin might be supported in [her]201-thomasin tribulation , and so departing met [Amos Bartlett]323-amos bartlett who was standing outside [the cottage]599-the cottage awaiting [him]189-mr. chirgwin . [The man]3494-the man gave a forcible and blunt description of [his]3494-the man morning 's work which brought many tears to [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin 's eyes ; then , together , [they]5945-they walked to [Penzance]7-penzance , there to chronicle the sudden death of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan and arrange for those necessary formalities which must precede [her]183-joan burial . The spectacle of [Tregenza]183-joan 's insanity , which to [an educated observer had perhaps presented features of some scientific interest and appeared grotesque rather than tremendous]5946-an educated observer had perhaps presented features of some scientific interest and appeared grotesque rather than tremendous , fell upon the ignorant soul of [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin in a manner far different . The mystery of madness , the sublimity and horror of it , rise only to tragic heights in the untutored minds of [such beholders as [the farmer]3745-the farmer]5947-such beholders as the farmer , for no mere scientific manifestation of mental disease is presented to [their]5947-such beholders as the farmer intelligence . Instead [they]5947-such beholders as the farmer stand face to face with the infinitely more terrific apparition of [God]179-god speaking direct through the mouth of one among [[His]179-god chosen insane]5949-his chosen insane . In [their]5947-such beholders as the farmer estimation [a madman]5938-a madman 's utterance is pregnant , oracular , a subject worthy of most grave consideration and appraisement . And after [Gray Michael]204-gray michael 's mental downfall [many humble folks]5951-many humble folks , incited by the remarkable religious fame of [his]204-gray michael past life , begged permission to approach within sound of [his]204-gray michael voice at those moments when the desire for utterance was upon [him]204-gray michael . This , indeed , came to be a privilege not a little sought after . [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary would allow none but [herself]222-mary to perform the last offices of kindness for [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin . In poor [Joan]183-joan 's pocket [she]222-mary found a wet , crumpled mass of paper which might have been dried and read without difficulty , but [Mary]222-mary lacked curiosity to approach the matter . [She]222-mary debated with [herself]222-mary as to how [her]222-mary duty stood in connection with the communication from [John Barron]176-barron , then took it in [her]222-mary hand , not without a sensation of much loathing , and burned it to ashes . The act produced considerable and unforeseen consequences . [Her]222-mary own mundane happiness was wholly dependent on the burning of the letter , and [a man]467-a man 's life likewise hung upon the incident ; but these results of [her]222-mary conduct were only brought to [the woman]4662-the woman 's understanding in the light of subsequent events . Then , and with just if superficial cause , [she]222-mary directly read [God]179-god 's hand in the circumstance . Another discovery saddened [Mary]222-mary far more than that of the letter , which had caused [her]222-mary little surprise . Around [Joan]183-joan 's white body was a strange amulet — the glen - ader . [She]222-mary had sewed it upon flannel , then fastened the ends about [herself]222-mary , and so worn the snake skin at all seasons since the finding of it . The fact was nothing , the condition of mind which it indicated brought great grief to [the discoverer]5955-the discoverer . [She]222-mary judged that [Joan]183-joan was little better than heathen after all ; [she]222-mary greatly feared that [the girl]521-the girl had perished but half - believing . [Any soul which could thus cherish the slough of a serpent]5957-any soul which could thus cherish the slough of a serpent must most surely have been wandering afar out of [the road of faith]5958-the road of faith . The all - embracing credulity of [Joan]183-joan was , in fact , a phenomenon beyond [Mary]222-mary 's power to estimate or translate ; and [her]222-mary present discovery , therefore , caused [her]222-mary both pain and consternation . But as [she]222-mary had burned the letter , so [she]222-mary likewise destroyed all evidence of [[her]222-mary cousin]4878-her cousin 's superstitious weakness ; and of neither one nor [the other]3475-the other did [she]222-mary speak when [the farmer]3745-the farmer returned to [[his]3745-the farmer home]5962-his home . [He]3745-the farmer was sadly crushed and broken ; and the spectacle of [[his]3745-the farmer loved one]5963-his loved one , lying silent and peaceful , brought with it deep grief for [him]3745-the farmer . Not until [he]3745-the farmer had seen [her]222-mary and held [her]222-mary dead hand did [he]3745-the farmer begin slowly to realize the truth . " [The coroner]5977-the coroner 's inquest found that [Joan Tregenza]183-joan had come by [her]183-joan death from drowning upon the night of the flood ; the tragedy filled an obscure paragraph or two in local journals ; [Joan]183-joan 's funeral was fixed for two days later , and [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza decided that [she]198-mrs. tregenza would attend it . At a spot where fell the shadow of [the church]688-the church when the sun sank far westerly on summer days , [they]5977-the coroner dug the grave in [Sancreed churchyard]5979-sancreed churchyard . Round about [it]5979-sancreed churchyard on slate slabs and upright stones appeared the names of [Chirgwins]215-the chirgwins not a few . [[Her]183-joan maternal grandparents]5980-her maternal grandparents lay there , [[her]183-joan uncle]783-her uncle , [[Mary]222-mary 's father]5982-mary 's father , and many others . Some of the graves dated back for a hundred and more years . On the morning of the funeral , [Uncle Thomas]199-tom [himself]199-tom tied scraps of crape around the stems of [his]199-tom tall geraniums , according to an ancient custom ; and [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza arrived at [Drift]15-drift in good time to join [the few who mourned]5983-the few who mourned . [A few of [the Drift folk]5988-the drift folk]5987-a few of the drift folk and [half a dozen young children]5989-half a dozen young children came in the wake of the procession proper ; and that was all . [The mourners]5990-the mourners and [[their]5990-the mourners dead]5991-their dead proceeded along [the high lanes]5992-the high lanes to [Sancreed]107-sancreed , and conversation was general . [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin tugged at [his]251-uncle chirgwin black gloves and snuffled , then snuffled and tugged again ; [Mary]222-mary walked on one side of [him]251-uncle chirgwin ; and [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza , in new and heavy black bought for another , found the opportunity convenient for the display of varied grief , as [she]198-mrs. tregenza marched along on [the farmer]3745-the farmer 's right hand . [Her]198-mrs. tregenza condition indeed became hysterical , and [Mary]222-mary only soothed [her]198-mrs. tregenza with difficulty . So [the party]1434-the party crawled within sound of the minute bell and presently reached [the church]688-the church . [The undertaker]5970-the undertaker buzzed here and there issuing directions , [an old clergyman]5997-an old clergyman met [the dead]2243-the dead at the lych - gate and walked before [her]198-mrs. tregenza up [the aisle]5999-the aisle ; while [those who had a right to attend the service]6000-those who had a right to attend the service , clustered in the pews to right and left of the trestles . Upon [them]6000-those who had a right to attend the service lay [Joan]183-joan . The words of the service sounded with mournful reverberations through the chill echoes of [an unwarmed and almost empty church]6001-an unwarmed and almost empty church ; and then [the little sister]6002-the little sister , sleeping peacefully enough after [her]6002-the little sister one short year of storm , was carried to [the last abode of silence]6003-the last abode of silence . Then followed [an old man]5966-an old man 's voice , sounding strangely thin in the open air , the straining of cords , the sweating and hard breathing and shuffling of [men]3512-men , the grating of oak on a grave - bottom , the updrawing of the ropes that had lowered the coffin . Genuine grief accompanied the obsequies of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan , and [[her]198-mrs. tregenza uncle]783-her uncle 's sorrow touched even [men]3512-men to visible grief and sympathy ; but there was no heart to break for the heart which had itself come so near to breaking , there was no mighty wellspring of love to be choked with tears for [one who had [herself]183-joan loved so much]6008-one who had herself loved so much . A feeling , hidden in some minds , expressed by [others , latent in all , pervaded that throng]6009-others , latent in all , pervaded that throng ; and there was not one among [those present]6010-those present , save [Thomas Chirgwin]223-tom , but felt that [Providence]285-providence , harsh till now , had dealt kindly by [Joan]183-joan in dealing death to [her]183-joan . " Blamed if [I]3153-the idiot ever filled wan quicker'n that , " [he]6019-a young florid man , with pale hair , tightened his leather belt , turned up his sleeves , watched a grand pair of biceps roll up as he crooked his elbows , then , taking a spade , set to work upon the wet mound he had dug from the earth the day before to clear those few square feet of space below thought , with some satisfaction ; " [I]3153-the idiot reckoned the rain must fall afore [I]3153-the idiot 'd done , but it do hold off yet seemin'ly . " [The man]3494-the man departed , gray twilight fell , and out from the gathering darkness , like a wound on the hand of Time , that new - made grave and [its]6024-the grave fringe of muddy grass stood forth , crude of color , raw , unsightly in the deepening monochrome of the gloaming . At Drift the important meal which follows a funeral was enjoyed with sober satisfaction by about [fifteen persons]6026-fifteen persons . Cold fowls and a round of cold beef formed the main features of the repast ; [Mary]222-mary poured out tea for [the women]3669-the women at [her]222-mary end of the table , while [the men]3467-the men drank two or three bottles of grocer 's sherry among [them]3669-the women . [The undertaker]5970-the undertaker and [[his]5970-the undertaker assistants]6030-his assistants followed when [the funeral assembly]6031-the funeral assembly dispersed . [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza was about to depart in the fly specially ordered to take [[her]198-mrs. tregenza [home]453-home]1297-her home when [a lawyer , who was of the company]6034-a lawyer , who was of the company , begged [she]198-mrs. tregenza would stay a little longer . " [I]3153-the idiot learn that [you]198-mrs. tregenza are [[the deceased]6035-the deceased 's stepmother]6036-the deceased 's stepmother , [madam]6037-madam , and as [you]198-mrs. tregenza stand related to the parties both now unhappily swept away by [Providence]285-providence — [I]3153-the idiot mean [Thomas Tregenza]327-tom and [Joan]183-joan — it is sufficiently clear that [you]198-mrs. tregenza inherit directly the bequest left by [the poor girl]6038-the poor girl to [[her]6038-the poor girl brother]5895-her brother . [I]3153-the idiot framed [her]6038-the poor girl little will [myself]3153-the idiot ; failing [[her]6038-the poor girl own child]6040-her own child , [her]6038-the poor girl property went to [Thomas Tregenza]327-tom , [[his]327-tom heirs]6041-his heirs and [assigns]6042-assigns — those were the words . The paper is here ; the sum mentioned lies at interest of three per cent . Let [me]3153-the idiot know when convenient what [you]198-mrs. tregenza would wish to be done . " So the pile of money , at a cost terrible enough , had reached [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza after all . [She]198-mrs. tregenza had been drinking brown sherry as well as tea , and was in a condition of renewed tears approaching to maudlin , when the announcement reached [her]198-mrs. tregenza . It steadied [the woman]4662-the woman . Then the thought that this wealth would have been [[her]198-mrs. tregenza son]836-her son 's made [her]198-mrs. tregenza weep again , until the fact that it was now [her]198-mrs. tregenza own became grasped in [her]198-mrs. tregenza mind . There is [a sort of people who find money a reasonably good support in all human misfortune]6045-a sort of people who find money a reasonably good support in all human misfortune , and if [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza did not entirely belong to [that callous company]6046-that callous company , yet it is certain that this sudden afflux of gold was more likely to assuage [her]198-mrs. tregenza grief than most things . [She]198-mrs. tregenza presently retired , all tears and care ; but at intervals , when sorrow rested to regain its strength , [the lawyer]5082-the lawyer 's information recurred and the distractions of mind caused by the contemplation of a future brightened by this wealth soothed [Thomasin]201-thomasin 's nerves to an extent beyond the power of religion or any other force which could possibly have been brought to bear upon [them]6048-them . [She]201-thomasin felt that [her]201-thomasin own position must henceforth be exalted in [Newlyn]1-newlyn , for the effects of the combination of catastrophes led to that end . [[Her]201-thomasin husband]605-her husband was the sole care [she]201-thomasin had left , and [physicians]6050-physicians foretold no great length of days for [him]605-her husband . [The lugger]2935-the lugger would be put up to auction , with the drift nets and all pertaining thereto . [The cottage]599-the cottage was already [[Tregenza]201-thomasin property]6053-tregenza property . [Thomasin]201-thomasin therefore looked through the overwhelming misery of the time , counted [her]201-thomasin moneys and felt comforted without knowing it . As for [[her]201-thomasin insane husband]6054-her insane husband , [his]6054-her insane husband very sufferings magnified [him]6054-her insane husband into [a man of importance]6055-a man of importance , and [she]201-thomasin enjoyed the reflected glory of being [[his]6054-her insane husband keeper]6056-his keeper . [People]749-people came from [remote villages]6058-remote villages to listen to [him]6054-her insane husband , and it was held a privilege among [the humbler sort]6059-the humbler sort to view the ruin of [Michael Tregenza]203-michael tregenza and hark to the chaotic ravings of a mind overthrown . A fortnight and four days after the funeral of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan there blew a southwest wind over [Newlyn]1-newlyn , from out a gray sky , dotted with watery blots of darker gray . No added light marked the western horizon at sunset , but the short , dull day simply fell headlong into night ; and with darkness came the rain . About five o'clock in the afternoon , when the flicker and shine of many lamps in little shop windows brightened [the tortuous streets]6060-the tortuous streets , [a man clad in tarpaulins]6061-a man clad in tarpaulins , and carrying a big canvas bag on [his]6054-her insane husband back , passed rapidly through [the village]423-the village . [He]6054-her insane husband had come that day from [London]45-london upon the paying off of [[his]6054-her insane husband vessel]6063-his vessel ; and while [he]6054-her insane husband left [his]6054-her insane husband two chests at [the railway station]6064-the railway station , [he]6054-her insane husband made shift to bring [his]6054-her insane husband sea - bag along [himself]6054-her insane husband ; and that because [he]6054-her insane husband was bound for [the white cottage on [the cliff]4179-the cliff]6065-the white cottage on the cliff , and the bag held many precious foreign concerns for [Joan Tregenza]183-joan . It had been impossible to communicate with [the sailor]784-the sailor ; and [he]6054-her insane husband did not write from [London]45-london to tell any of [his]6054-her insane husband return , that [their]6068-their pleasure and surprise on [his]6054-her insane husband appearance might be the more complete . Now a greater shock than that in [his]6054-her insane husband power to give waited [the man]3494-the man [himself]3494-the man . [[The sailor]784-the sailor 's parents]6071-the sailor 's parents lived at [Mousehole]9-mousehole , but [[Michael]203-michael tregenza 's cottage]6072-michael 's cottage lay upon the way , and there [he]6054-her insane husband first designed to appear . [Joe Noy]192-joe was [a very big man , loosely but strongly set together]6073-a very big man , loosely but strongly set together , a Celt to the backbone , hard , narrow of mind , but possessing rare determination . [His]192-joe tanned , clean - shaven face was broader at the jaw than the eyes , and a lowering heaviness of aspect , almost ape - like , resulted when [his]192-joe features remained in repose . The effect , however , vanished when [he]192-joe spoke or listened to the speech of [another]6074-another . That [such a man]4280-such a man had proved fickle in love was a thing difficult to credit to the mind familiar with [his]192-joe character . Solid , sober , simple , fearing [God]179-god and lacking humor , the jilting of [a woman]3541-a woman was an offense of all others least likely to have been associated with [him]192-joe . Yet circumstances and some unsuspected secrets of disposition had brought about that event ; and now , as [he]192-joe hastened along , the vision of [the dark woman [he]192-joe once loved at [Drift]15-drift]6077-the dark woman he once loved at drift did not for an instant cross [his]192-joe thoughts , for they were full of [the fair girl [he]192-joe meant to marry at [Newlyn]1-newlyn]6078-the fair girl he meant to marry at newlyn . To [her]6077-the dark woman he once loved at drift , at least , [he]192-joe had kept faithful enough ; [she]6077-the dark woman he once loved at drift had been the guiding - star of [his]192-joe life for hard upon a year of absence ; not one morning , not one night , in fair weather or foul , had [he]192-joe omitted to pray [God]179-god 's blessing upon [her]6077-the dark woman he once loved at drift . A fatalism , which [his]192-joe Luke Gospel tenets did not modify , was strong in [the sailor]784-the sailor . [He]192-joe had seen death often enough in [his]192-joe business ; and [his]192-joe instincts told [him]192-joe , apart from all religious teaching , that [those who died ripe for salvation]6080-those who died ripe for salvation were but few . [Every man]631-every man appeared to be an instrument in [God]179-god 's hand , and human free - will represented a condition quite beyond the scope of [his]192-joe intelligence to estimate or even conceive . Had any justified in so doing asked of [him]192-joe [his]192-joe reasons for desertion of [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary , [Noy]192-joe would have explained that when inviting [her]6077-the dark woman he once loved at drift to be [[his]192-joe wife]843-his wife [he]192-joe took a wrong step in darkness ; that light had since suddenly shone upon [him]192-joe , as upon [Saul]403-saul , and that [Mary]222-mary , choosing rather to remain outside the sure fold of [Luke Gospeldom]242-luke gospeldom , by so doing made it impossible for [him]192-joe to love [her]6077-the dark woman he once loved at drift longer . [He]192-joe would have added that the match was doubtless foredoomed according to the arrangements of [the Almighty]6083-the almighty . Now [Joe]192-joe came back to [his]192-joe own ; and [his]192-joe heart beat faster by several pulses , and [his]192-joe steps quickened and lengthened , as , through darkness and rain , [he]192-joe sighted [the lamp - lighted cottage window of [the Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas]6084-the lamp - lighted cottage window of the tregenzas . Thereupon [he]192-joe stopped a moment , brought [his]192-joe bag to the ground , mopped [his]192-joe forehead , then , raising the latch , strode straight into [the kitchen]860-the kitchen without a knock of warning . For a moment [he]192-joe imagined [the room]4756-the room , lighted only by a dull glow of firelight , to be empty ; but then , amid familiar objects , [he]192-joe noted one not familiar — a tall and roomy armchair . This stood beside the fireplace , and in it sat [Gray Michael]204-gray michael . " Why , so '[3153-the idiot] tis ! [Mr. Tregenza]216-mr. tregenza sure ' nough ! " [the traveler]2742-the traveler exclaimed , setting down [his]192-joe bag and coming forward with hand outstretched . " Here [I]3153-the idiot be at last arter nine months o '[3153-the idiot] salt water ! An ' Newlyn do smell pleasant in [my]3475-the other nose as [I]3475-the other come back to it , [I]3475-the other tell '[3475-the other] e ! " [[His]204-gray michael wife]843-his wife looked to see how [Joe]192-joe viewed this statement . A great local superstition was growing up round [Gray Michael]204-gray michael , and [his]204-gray michael wild utterances ( sometimes profanely fearful beyond the possibility of setting down ) were listened to greedily as inspirations and oracles . [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza [herself]198-mrs. tregenza became presently imbued with something of this morbid and ignorant opinion . [Her]198-mrs. tregenza deep wounds time promised to heal at the first intention , and the significance now attributed to [[her]198-mrs. tregenza insane husband]6054-her insane husband grew to be a source of real satisfaction to [her]198-mrs. tregenza . [She]198-mrs. tregenza dispensed the honor of interviews with [Michael]204-gray michael as one distributes great gifts . " '[3194-us] Tis all so true as gospel , " declared [Gray Michael]204-gray michael , rolling [his]204-gray michael head round on [his]204-gray michael neck and laughing . " An ' [my]204-gray michael auld wummon 's fine an '[204-gray michael] braave , edn ' [her]3195-her ? That 's cause [I]204-gray michael cleared a thousan '[204-gray michael] pound in wan trip . [He]3196-christ do look arter [His]3196-christ awn somethin' butivul , as [I]3196-christ tawld En . An '[3196-christ] now [I]0-i be [a feesher o ' men]6133-a feesher o ' men , which is better , an '[3196-christ] high ' mong the salt o '[3196-christ] the airth , bein ' called to walk along wi '[173-james i.] [James]173-james i. an ' [John]176-barron an '[173-james i.] the rest . " " [He]3196-christ sits [theer]3197-theer chitterin ' , ding dong , ding dong , all the wisht day . [Tom]327-tom 's death drove en cracked , but '[198-mrs. tregenza] [e]3198-e ban't no trouble , ' cept at feedin '[198-mrs. tregenza] times . Besides , [I]0-i keeps [a paid servant girl]3199-a paid servant girl now , " said [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza . [Joe Noy]192-joe had heard neither [the man]3494-the man nor [the woman]4662-the woman . From the moment that [he]192-joe knew the truth concerning [Joan]183-joan [his]192-joe own thoughts barred [his]192-joe ears to all utterances . " Who weer it ? Tell [me]0-i the name . [I]0-i want no more'n that , " [he]0-i said . " ' Tis [Anne Bundle]409-anne bundle 's darter , " answered [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza , [her]198-mrs. tregenza mind on [[her]198-mrs. tregenza maid]4903-her maid . " [The man]3494-the man ! " " Then [my]0-i work 's the harder ; but [I]0-i 'll find en , s'elp [me]0-i [God]179-god , even if [us]3207-us be grawed gray afore [we]3207-us meet . " " That 's worse than [a fool]3528-a fool 's thot . Bide till [you'm]3217-you'm grawed cool anyways . [You]3222-you was wrong ; an ' [you]3222-you 'll be wrong again to break [your]3222-you heart now . Let en go—'tis best . " " Let en go ! Blast en — [I'll]0-i let heaven go fust ! [Us'll]6149-us'll see what [a wronged sawl]6150-a wronged sawl 's patience can do now . [Us'll]6149-us'll see what the end of the road'll shaw ! O God o '[3223-the righteous] [the Righteous]3223-the righteous , fester [this here man]3224-this here man 's bones in [his]3224-this here man body , an ' eat [his]3224-this here man life out of en wi '[3223-the righteous] fiery worms ! Tear [his]3224-this here man heartstrings , God o ' Hosts , rob en of all [he]3224-this here man loves , stamp [his]3224-this here man foul mind wi '[3223-the righteous] memories till [he]3224-this here man shrieks for death an ' judgment ; punish [his]3224-this here man seed forever ; turn [his]3224-this here man prayers into swearin '[3223-the righteous] ; torture en , rot en sawl an ' body till [you]3228-you brings [me]3223-the righteous to en .
