" " Oh , [[my]0-i Guy Faux]411-my guy faux ! [theer]3227-theer 's cussin ' ! An '[3227-theer] yet ' tedn '[3223-the righteous] gwaine to do a happard [ Footnote : [Happard]412-happard — Halfpennyworth . ] o ' good ; an '[3228-you] [you]3228-you wouldn ' be no happier for knawin '[204-gray michael] sich a prayer was granted , " said [Thomasin]201-thomasin ; but [Gray Michael]204-gray michael applauded the outburst , and [his]204-gray michael words ended that strange spectacle of [two men]482-two men , for the time both mad . " Hallelujah ! Hallelujah ! Braave prayin ' ! Braave savor for [the Lard]200-the lard 's nose — sweeter than the blood o '[204-gray michael] beasts . [You'm]3230-you'm a shinin ' light , cap'n — a trumpet in the battle , like the sound o '[204-gray michael] the sea - wind when it begins to sting afore heavy weather , an ' the waters roll to the top o '[204-gray michael] the bulwarks an ' awver . '[204-gray michael] The snorting of [his]204-gray michael horses was heard from [Dan'—sea]163-dan'—sea - horses [us]3231-us calls 'em nowadays . Mount an '[3231-us] ride , mount an ' ride ! '[3231-us] Cursed be [the man that trusteth in man]3232-the man that trusteth in man , ' saith [the Lard]200-the lard ; but the beasts be truer , thanks to the wickedness o '[179-god] [God]179-god , who 's spared 'em the curse o '[179-god] brain paarts , but [stricken man wi ' a mighty intelligence]6151-stricken man wi ' a mighty intelligence . '[414-god] Twas a fine an ' cruel act , for the more mind the more misery . '[414-god] Twas a damned act sure ' nough ! [Doan't]413-doan't '[3233-e] [e]3233-e let on 'bout it , [mate]6152-mate , but [theer'll]6153-theer'll be clever surprises at Judgment , an '[414-god] the fust to be damned'll be [the God o ' [the Hebrews Hisself]414-god for givin '[414-god] o ' brains to weak heads]414-god . Then the thrawn o '[414-god] heaven'll stand empty — empty — the plaace ' tween [the cherubims]1949-the cherubims empty ; an '[3234-i] [they]3234-i 'll call ' pon [me]3234-i to fill it so like 's not . [Tarraway]164-tarraway , [I]3234-i shall be named , same as the devil in [the droll]6155-the droll — a purty word enough tu . " [He]204-gray michael broke into laughter , and [Joe Noy]192-joe , saying a few hasty words to [Thomasin]201-thomasin , departed . [He]192-joe who less than an hour before had hastened hot - footed through [the Newlyn streets]6156-the newlyn streets , whose habitual stern expression had softened before the well - known sights and smells of [the gray village]6157-the gray village , whose earnest soul was full of happiness under the rain of the night , now turned back upon [his]192-joe way and skulked through the darkness with [a murderer]6158-a murderer 's heart in [him]192-joe . The clear spectacle of [his]192-joe revenge blinded [lesser presentations]6159-lesser presentations and even distracted [his]192-joe sorrow . There was no space now vacant in [Noy]192-joe 's brain to hold the full extent of [his]192-joe loss ; and the fabric of happiness which for weary months on various seas [he]192-joe had been building up in imagination , and which [a madman]5938-a madman 's word had now sent spinning to chaos , yet remained curiously with [him]192-joe , as an impression stamped by steadfast gazing remains upon the eye . It recurred as of old : a joy ; and not till the former emotion of happiness had again and again reappeared to be blunted , as a dream , at waking , by the new knowledge , did truth sink into [this man]3526-this man 's mind and become part of memory . Now [he]192-joe was dazed , as [one who has run hard and well to a goal]6162-one who has run hard and well to a goal , and who , reaching it , finds [his]192-joe prize stolen . Under these circumstances , [Joe Noy]192-joe 's natural fatalism — an instinct beyond the power of any religion to destroy — appeared instant and strong . [Chance]235-chance had now fed these characteristics , and they grew gigantic in an hour . But the religious habit made [him]192-joe turn to [[his]192-joe Maker]6163-his maker in this pass , and the merely primitive passions , which were now breaking loose within [him]192-joe , [he]192-joe regarded as the direct voices of [God]414-god . [They]6164-they proclaimed that solitary duty [the world]3624-the world still held for [him]192-joe ; [they]6164-they marked out [[his]192-joe road]6166-his road to the lurid end of it . Thus [Noy]192-joe 's own furious lust for revenge was easily and naturally elevated into a mandate from the Highest — into a message echoed and reiterated upon [his]192-joe ear by the multitudinous voices of that wild night . The rain whispered it on the roof - trees , the wind and [sea]540-sea thundered it ; out of elemental chaos the awful command came , as from primal lips which had spoken since creation to find at last the ultimate destination of [their]6164-they message within a human ear . To [Noy]192-joe , [his]192-joe purpose , not yet an hour old , seemed ancient as eternity , a fixed and deliberate impression which had been stamped upon [his]192-joe mind at a period far earlier than [his]192-joe life in time . For one end had [he]192-joe been created ; that by some sudden short cut [he]192-joe should hurry to its close a vile life , fill up [God]414-god 's bitter curse upon [this man]3526-this man , destroy [the destroyer]6169-the destroyer , and speed [a black soul]6170-a black soul into the torment awaiting it . Irresolute and deep in thought as to [his]192-joe future actions , [Joe Noy]192-joe walked unconsciously forward . [He]192-joe felt unequal to returning to [[his]192-joe home]5962-his home in [Mousehole]9-mousehole after what [he]192-joe had learned at [Newlyn]1-newlyn ; and [he]192-joe wandered back , therefore , toward [Penzance]7-penzance . A glare of gas lamps splashed the wet surface of [the parade]6172-the parade with fire ; while below [him]192-joe , against the sea wall , a high tide spouted and roared . Now and again , after a heavy muffled thud of sea against stone , columns of glimmering , gray foam shot upward , like gigantic ghosts out of the water . For a moment [they]6173-they towered in the air , then , wind - driven , swept hissing across the black and shining surfaces of [the deserted parade]6174-the deserted parade . [Noy]192-joe stood here a moment , and the cold wind cooled [him]192-joe , and the riot and agony of [the sea]463-the sea boiling against the granite face of [the breakwater]6176-the breakwater chimed with the riot and agony of [his]192-joe mind , whose hopes were now rent in tatters , riven , splintered and disannulled by chance . [He]192-joe turned a moment where the Newlyn harbor light flashed across the darkness to [him]192-joe . From [his]192-joe standpoint [he]192-joe knew that a line drawn through that light must fall upon [the cottage of [the Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas beyond [it]7-penzance on [the shore]3470-the shore]6177-the cottage of the tregenzas beyond it on the shore , and , fixing [his]192-joe eyes where [the building]6179-the building lay hidden , [he]192-joe stretched out [his]192-joe hand and spoke aloud . " May [God]414-god strike [me]3234-i blind and daft if ever [I]3234-i looks '[3234-i] pon yon light an ' yonder cot again till [the man]3494-the man be dead . " Then [he]192-joe turned , and was about to seek [the station]4377-the station , with a vague purpose to go straight to [London]45-london at the earliest opportunity , when a wiser thought arrested this determination . [He]192-joe must learn all that it was possible to learn concerning the last days of [Joan]183-joan . [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza had explained [[her]198-mrs. tregenza stepdaughter]838-her stepdaughter 's life at [Drift]15-drift . To [Drift]15-drift , therefore , [the sailor]784-the sailor determined to go ; and the stress upon [his]192-joe mind was such that even the prospect of conversation with [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary — a thing [he]192-joe had certainly shrunk from under other circumstances — caused [him]192-joe no uneasiness . Over [the last road that [Joan]183-joan had ever walked]6184-the last road that joan had ever walked , and under similar conditions of night and storm , [he]192-joe tramped up to [Drift]15-drift , entered through the side gate , and surprised [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin and [[his]189-mr. chirgwin niece]3958-his niece at [their]6186-their supper . As before with [the Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas , so now again in company of [Uncle Thomas]199-tom and [Mary]222-mary , [Joe Noy]192-joe formed the third in a trio of curious significance . Though aware that [the sailor]784-the sailor was due from [his]192-joe voyage , this sudden apparition of [him]192-joe at such a time startled [[his]192-joe former friends]6188-his former friends not a little . [Mary]222-mary indeed was unnerved in a manner foreign to [her]222-mary nature , and the candle - lighted [kitchen]3657-kitchen whirled in [her]222-mary eyes as [she]222-mary felt [her]222-mary hand in [his]192-joe . Save for an ejaculation from [the old man]3536-the old man , which conveyed nothing beyond [his]3536-the old man astonishment , [Noy]192-joe was the first to speak ; and [his]192-joe earliest words relieved the minds of [[his]192-joe listeners]6191-his listeners in one great particular ; [he]192-joe already knew the worst that had happened . " [I]3234-i be come from [Newlyn]1-newlyn , from [the Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas . [Thomasin]201-thomasin have tawld [me]3234-i of all that 's falled out ; but [I]3234-i could n't bide in [my]3234-i awful trouble wi'out comin '[3234-i] up - long . [I]0-i reckon [you]3235-you 'll let the past be forgot now . [I]0-i 'm punished ugly enough . " " Eat , [[my]414-god son]3811-my son , an '[414-god] doan't ' [e]3239-e fancy [theer]6199-theer 's any here but [them]6199-theer as be [friends]1078-friends . " " [I]192-joe lay that 's a true sayin '[192-joe] , " declared [Noy]192-joe shortly . " [I]0-i wo n't keep ' [e]6199-theer ower - long from [your]3242-you beds , " [he]0-i added . " If [you]3242-you got a drink o '[192-joe] spirits [I]0-i 'll thank [you]3242-you for it ; then [I]0-i 'll put a question or two to [she]3240-she — to [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary , if [she]3240-she 'll allow ; an ' then [I]3243-i 'll get going . " All [you]3242-you can ax that [I]3243-i knaw , [I]3243-i 'll tell '[3243-i] [e]3243-i , though [Joan]183-joan shut [her]183-joan thots purty close most times . " [You]0-i never heard the name of en ? " " [Awnly]318-awnly the christening name , as was ' [Jan.]196-mister jan. " " [I]0-i 'd think of en no more if [I]0-i was [you]3252-you , [Joe]192-joe , " said [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin . " Leave the likes of en to [the God of en]3253-the god of en . " [Noy]192-joe looked at [the old man]3536-the old man and [his]3536-the old man great jaw seemed to spread laterally with [his]3536-the old man thought . " [God]414-god have gived [the man]3494-the man to [me]251-uncle chirgwin ! that 's why [I]251-uncle chirgwin be [here]432-here : to knaw all any can teach [me]251-uncle chirgwin . [I]251-uncle chirgwin 've got to be [the undoin '[251-uncle chirgwin] o ' that devil]6211-the undoin ' o ' that devil — the undoin '[251-uncle chirgwin] an ' death of en . [I]251-uncle chirgwin 'll be upsides wi '[251-uncle chirgwin] [the man]3494-the man if it takes [me]0-i fifty year to do it . [Awnly]318-awnly ' more haste , more let . '[0-i] [I]0-i shall go slow an ' sure . That 's why [I]192-joe comed here fust thing . " [Mr. Chirgwin]189-mr. chirgwin looked extremely alarmed , and [Mary]222-mary spoke . " " [Joe]192-joe , [Joe]192-joe , stay an ' listen to [me]183-joan ! For the sake of the past , listen ! " But [Noy]192-joe rose as [Mary]222-mary cried these words , and before [she]222-mary had finished speaking [he]192-joe was gone . Thus [the sailor]784-the sailor , [Noy]192-joe , wholly imbued with one idea , absolutely convinced that to this end it had pleased [Providence]285-providence to give [him]192-joe life , went forth into [the world]3624-the world that [he]192-joe might seek and slay [the seducer of [Joan]183-joan]6227-the seducer of joan . After leaving [Drift]15-drift [he]192-joe returned to [Penzance]7-penzance , lay [there]3728-there that night , and upon the following morning began a methodical visitation of [the Newlyn studios]6229-the newlyn studios . Five [he]192-joe called at and to [five artists]6230-five artists [he]192-joe stated something of [his]192-joe case in general terms ; but [none of those who heard [him]192-joe]6231-none of those who heard him were familiar with any of the facts , and [none]2202-none could offer [him]192-joe either information or assistance . [Edmund Murdoch]175-murdoch was not in [Newlyn]1-newlyn , [Brady]180-brady had gone to [Brittany]94-brittany ; but at [the seventh studio which [he]192-joe visited]6233-the seventh studio which he visited , [Joe Noy]192-joe substantiated some of [his]192-joe facts . [Paul Tarrant]182-tarrant chanced to be at [home]453-home and at work when [he]182-tarrant called ; and [the artist]3491-the artist would have told [Joe]192-joe everything which [he]182-tarrant wished to learn , but that [Noy]192-joe was cautious and reserved , not guessing that [he]192-joe stood before [one who knew [[his]192-joe enemy]6237-his enemy and entertained no admiration for [him]192-joe]6236-one who knew his enemy and entertained no admiration for him . " Axing pardon for taking up any of [your]182-tarrant time , [sir]556-sir , " [he]182-tarrant began , " but theer'm a matter concerning a party in [your]182-tarrant business as painted [a maiden]3858-a maiden here , by name o '[183-joan] [Joan Tregenza]183-joan . [She]183-joan weern't [nobody]3503-nobody — awnly [a fisherman]506-a fisherman 's darter , but the picksher was said to be done in these paarts , an ' [I]183-joan thot , maybe , [you]182-tarrant 'd knaw who drawed it . " [Tarrant]182-tarrant had not heard of [Joan]183-joan 's death , and , indeed , possessed no information concerning [her]183-joan , save that [Barron]176-barron had prevailed upon [the girl]521-the girl to sit for a portrait . The question , therefore , struck [him]182-tarrant as curious ; and one which [he]182-tarrant put in return , merely to satisfy [his]182-tarrant own curiosity , impressed [Joe]192-joe in a similar way . [His]182-tarrant suspicious nature took fright and [Tarrant]182-tarrant 's dark , bright eyes seemed to read [his]182-tarrant secret and search [his]182-tarrant soul . " Yes , a portrait of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan was painted [here]432-here last spring , but not by [a Newlyn man]6242-a newlyn man . How does that interest [you]3273-you ? " " Awnly sideways . '[183-joan] Tedn ' nothin' to [me]183-joan . [I]183-joan knaws the parties an '[183-joan] wanted to see the picksher if [theer]3272-theer weern't no objection . " " That 's impossible , [I]0-i fear , unless [you]3273-you go to [London]45-london . [Somebody]4300-somebody told [me]0-i that much ; but which it is [I]0-i do n't know . " This was enough for [Noy]192-joe . Ignorant of [the metropolis]3278-the metropolis or the vague import of the words " [a picture gallery]3279-a picture gallery , " [he]192-joe deemed these directions amply sufficient , and , being anxious to escape further questioning , now thanked [Tarrant]182-tarrant and speedily departed . Not until half way back again to [Penzance]7-penzance did [he]192-joe realize how slight was the nature of this information and how ill - calculated to bring [him]192-joe to [his]192-joe object ; [the man [he]192-joe wanted]3280-the man he wanted lived in [London]45-london and had a painting of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan in [a picture gallery]3279-a picture gallery [there]3728-there . Yet upon these directions [Joe Noy]192-joe resolved to begin [his]192-joe search , and as [the train]4378-the train anon bore [him]192-joe away to [the field of the great quest]3284-the field of the great quest [he]192-joe weighed the chances and considered a course of action . Allowing the ample margin of [ten picture galleries]3285-ten picture galleries to [London]45-london , and assuming that the portrait of [Joan]183-joan once found would be easily recognized by [him]192-joe , [the sailor]784-the sailor considered that a fortnight of work should bring [him]192-joe face to face with the picture . That done , [he]192-joe imagined that it would not be difficult to learn the name and address of [the painter]2104-the painter . [He]192-joe had indeed asked [Tarrant]182-tarrant this question pointblank , but [the artist]3491-the artist 's accidental curiosity and [Joe]192-joe 's own caution combined to prevent any extension of the interview , or a repetition of the question . A word had at least placed [him]192-joe in possession of [John Barron]176-barron 's name , but [Chance]235-chance prevented it from being spoken , as [Chance]235-chance had burned [Barron]176-barron 's letter and prevented [his]176-barron name appearing at the inquest . Now [Noy]192-joe viewed the task before [him]192-joe with equanimity . The end was already assured , for , in [his]192-joe own opinion , [he]192-joe walked [God]179-god - guided ; but the means lay with [him]192-joe , and [he]192-joe felt that it was [his]192-joe duty to spare no pains or labors and not to hesitate from the terrible action marked for [him]192-joe when [he]192-joe should reach the end of [his]192-joe journey . [Mary]222-mary 's last words came to [his]192-joe ear like a whisper which mingled with the jolt and rattle of [the railway train]3289-the railway train ; but they held no power to upset [his]192-joe purpose or force to modify [his]192-joe rooted determination . [Her]222-mary image occupied [his]192-joe thoughts , however , for a lengthy period . Then , with some effort , [he]192-joe banished it and entered upon a calculation of ways and means , estimating the capabilities of [his]192-joe money . Entering the great hive to accomplish that assassination as [he]192-joe supposed both planned and predestined for [him]192-joe before [God]179-god made the sun , [Noy]192-joe set about [his]192-joe business in a deliberate and careful manner . [He]192-joe hired [a bedroom in [a mean street]3291-a mean street near [Paddington]166-paddington]3290-a bedroom in a mean street near paddington , and , on the day after [his]192-joe arrival in [London]45-london , purchased a large map and index of [the city]3139-the city which gave ample particulars of [public buildings]3293-public buildings and mentioned the names and positions of [the great permanent homes of art]3294-the great permanent homes of art . By the help of newspaper advertisements [he]192-joe also ascertained where to find [some of [the numerous private dealers ' galleries]6244-the numerous private dealers ' galleries]6243-some of the numerous private dealers ' galleries and likewise learned what public annual exhibitions chanced to be at that time open . Whereupon , though the circumstance failed to quicken [his]192-joe pulse , [he]192-joe discovered that the extent of [his]192-joe labors would prove far greater than [he]192-joe at first imagined . [He]192-joe made careful lists of the places where pictures were to be seen , and the number quickly ran up to fifty , sixty , seventy exhibitions . That [he]192-joe would be able to visit all these [Joe]192-joe knew was impossible , but the fact caused [him]192-joe no disquiet . The picture [he]192-joe sought and the name of [the man who painted it]6245-the man who painted it must be presented to [him]192-joe in due season . For [him]192-joe it only remained to toil systematically at the search and allow no clew to escape [him]192-joe . As for the issue , it was with [the Lord]702-the lord . [London]45-london swept and surged about [Joe Noy]192-joe unheeded . [He]192-joe cared for nothing but canvases and the places where they might be seen . Day by day [he]192-joe worked and went early to rest , weary and worn by occupation of a nature so foreign to [his]192-joe experience . Nightly [his]192-joe last act was to delete one or sometimes two of the exhibitions figured upon [his]192-joe lists . Thus a week passed by and [he]192-joe had visited [ten galleries]6247-ten galleries and seen upward of five thousand pictures . Not one painting or drawing of them all was missed or hurried over ; [he]192-joe compared each with its number in the catalogue , then studied it carefully to see if any hint or suggestion of [Joan]183-joan appeared in it . [Her]183-joan Christian name often met [his]192-joe scrutiny in titles , and those works thus designated [he]192-joe regarded with greater attention than any others ; but the week passed fruitlessly , and [Joe]192-joe , making a calculation at the termination of it , discovered that , at [his]192-joe present rate of progression , it would be possible to inspect no more than half of [the galleries]6248-the galleries set down before [his]192-joe funds were exhausted . The knowledge quickened [his]192-joe ingenuity and [he]192-joe discovered a means by which future labors might be vastly modified and much time saved . [He]192-joe already knew that [the man responsible for [Joan]183-joan 's destruction]6249-the man responsible for joan 's destruction was called [John]176-barron ; [his]192-joe mind now quickened with the recollection of this important fact , and henceforth [he]192-joe did a thing which [any man less unintelligent]6250-any man less unintelligent had done from the first : [he]192-joe scanned [his]192-joe catalogues without troubling about the pictures , and only concerned [himself]192-joe with those canvases whose [painters]6251-painters had " [John]176-barron " for [their]6251-painters Christian names . [He]192-joe thanked [God]179-god on [his]192-joe knees that the idea should have entered [his]192-joe mind , for [his]192-joe labors were thereby enormously lightened . Notwithstanding , through ignorance of [his]192-joe subject , [Joe]192-joe wasted a great deal of time and money . Thus [he]192-joe visited [the National Gallery]6252-the national gallery , the Old Masters at [the Academy]4405-the academy and [various dealers]6254-various dealers '[192-joe] exhibitions where collections of the pictures of [foreign men]3295-foreign men were at that season being displayed . [The brown sailor]3296-the brown sailor created some interest viewed in an environment so peculiar . [His]3296-the brown sailor picturesque face might well have graced a frame and looked down upon [the artistic throngs who swept among the pictures]3297-the artistic throngs who swept among the pictures , but [the living man]3298-the living man , full of almost tragic interest in what [he]3298-the living man saw , laboring along catalogue in hand , dead to everything but the art around [him]3298-the living man , seemed wholly out of place . [He]3298-the living man looked what [he]3298-the living man was : the detached thread of some story from which [the spectator]4409-the spectator only saw this chapter broken away and standing without its context . [Nine persons out of ten]3300-nine persons out of ten dismissed [him]3298-the living man with a smile ; but occasionally a thoughtful mind would view [the man]3494-the man and occupy itself with the problem of [his]3494-the man affairs . Such built up imaginary histories of [him]3298-the living man and [his]3298-the living man actions , which only resembled each other in the quality of remoteness from truth . Once it happened that at [a small gallery]3302-a small gallery , off [Bond Street]167-bond street , the sudden sight of precious things brought new emotions to [Joe Noy]192-joe — sentiments and sensations of a sort more human and more natural than those under which [he]3298-the living man was at present pursuing [his]3298-the living man purpose . Before this spectacle , suddenly presented in the quietness and loneliness of the little exhibition , that stern spirit of revenge which had actuated [him]3298-the living man since the knowledge of [his]3298-the living man loss , and which , gripping [his]3298-the living man mind like a frost from the outset , had congested the gentler emotions of sorrow for poor [Joan]183-joan and for [himself]3298-the living man — before this display of a familiar scene , hallowed beyond all others in memory , [the man]3494-the man 's relentless mood rose off [his]3494-the man mind for a brief moment like a cloud , and [he]3494-the man stood , with aching heartstrings , gazing at a great canvas . Sweet to [him]3494-the man it was as the unexpected face of one dearly loved to [the wanderer]3304-the wanderer ; and startling in a measure also , for , remembering [his]3494-the man oath , to see [Newlyn]1-newlyn no more until [[his]3494-the man enemy]6237-his enemy was dead , it seemed as though the vow was broken by some miracle and that from the heart of [the roaring city]3306-the roaring city [he]3494-the man had magically plunged through space to the threshold of [the home of [Joan]183-joan]3307-the home of joan . Before [him]3494-the man loomed a picture like a window opening upon [Newlyn]1-newlyn . [The village]423-the village lay there in all the flame and glory of sunset lights . The gray and black roofs clustered up [the great dark hill]3309-the great dark hill and the gloaming fell out of a primrose sky over [sea]540-sea and [land]664-land . [The waters]1617-the waters twinkled full of light to the very foreground of the canvas , and between the piers of [the harbor]458-the harbor [a fisher - boy]2181-a fisher - boy was sculling [[his]2181-a fisher - boy boat]3315-his boat . Between the masts of stone - schooners at [the quay]2614-the quay , [Joe]192-joe saw [the white cottage of [the Tregenzas]218-the tregenzas]3317-the white cottage of the tregenzas , and there [his]192-joe survey stopped , for at this spectacle thought broke loose . [No man]3523-no man ever paid a nobler tribute to a good picture . Very long [he]3494-the man gazed motionless , then , with a great sigh , moved slowly forward , [his]3494-the man eyes still turning back . The day and the experience which it brought [him]3494-the man marked a considerable flux of new impressions in [Joe]192-joe 's mind — impressions which , without softening the rugged aspect of [his]3494-the man determination , yet added other lines of reflection . Sorrow for what was lost fastened upon [him]3494-the man , and an indignation burned [his]3494-the man soul that such things could be in a world designed and ordered by [the Almighty]6083-the almighty . Revenge , however , grew no less desirable in the light of sorrow . [He]3494-the man looked to it more and more eagerly as the only food which could lead to peace of mind . [[His]3494-the man road]6166-his road probably embraced the circumstances of an ignominious death ; but none the less peace would follow — a peace beyond the power of future life on [earth]1877-earth to supply . Thus , at least , did [his]3494-the man project then present itself to [him]3494-the man . Thought of the meeting with [[his]3494-the man enemy]6237-his enemy grew to be a luxury which [he]3494-the man feasted upon in the night watches after fruitless days and the investigation of endless miles of pictures . Then [he]3494-the man would lie awake and imagine the inevitable climax . [He]3494-the man saw [himself]3494-the man standing before [the man who had ruined two lives]3323-the man who had ruined two lives ; [he]3494-the man felt [his]3494-the man hand close over a knife or a pistol , and wondered which it should be ; [he]3494-the man heard [his]3494-the man own voice , slow and steady , pronounce sentence of death , and [he]3494-the man saw terror light [that other man]3324-that other man 's face as the blood fled from it . [He]3494-the man rehearsed the words [he]3494-the man should utter at that great juncture and speculated as to what manner of answer would come ; then the last scene of all represented [[his]3494-the man enemy]6237-his enemy stretched dead at [his]3494-the man feet and [himself]3494-the man with [his]3494-the man hands linked in iron . There yet remained the end of the tragedy for [him]3494-the man — a spectacle horrible enough in the eyes of those still left to love [him]3494-the man , but for [himself]3494-the man empty of terror , innocent of power to alarm . [Clean - living men]3326-clean - living men would pity [him]3494-the man , [religious men]3327-religious men would see in [him]3494-the man an instrument used by [God]179-god to strike at [a sinner]3843-a sinner . [His]3494-the man death would probably bring [some wanderers]3329-some wanderers to the fold ; it must of a surety be long remembered as the greatest sermon lived and preached by [a Luke Gospeler]209-luke gospeler . Lulled by the humming woof and warp of such reflections , [his]3494-the man mind nightly passed into the unconsciousness of sleep ; and quickened by subsequent visions , the brain enacted these imaginings with an added gloom and that tremendous appearance of reality proper to the domain of dreams . Thus the days sped and grew shorter as December waned . Then , at the end of the second week of [his]3494-the man work , [Noy]192-joe chanced to read that an Exhibition at [the Institute of Painters in [Oils]170-oils]169-the institute of painters in oils was about to close ; and not yet having visited [that collection]3330-that collection [he]3494-the man set out on the morning of the following day to do so . According to [his]3494-the man custom , [Noy]192-joe worked through the exhibition catalogue for [each room]3331-each room before entering [it]3331-each room . The hour was an early one , and but [few persons]3332-few persons had as yet penetrated to the central part of [the gallery]3333-the gallery . For these , however , an experience of [a singular character]3334-a singular character was now in store . Wandering hither and thither in groups and talking in subdued voices after the manner of [persons in such a place]3335-persons in such a place , all were suddenly conscious of a loud inarticulate cry . The sudden volume of sound denoted mixed emotions , but amazement and grief were throned upon it , and the exclamation came from a man standing now stiff and spellbound before " [Joe]192-joe 's Ship , " the famous masterpiece of [John Barron]176-barron . [The beholders]5488-the beholders viewed an amazed figure which seemed petrified even to an expression on [his]3494-the man face . There are countenances which display the ordinary emotions of humanity in a fashion unusual and peculiar to [themselves]5488-the beholders . Thus , while the customary and conventional signs of sorrow are a down - drawing slant to the corners of mouth and eye , yet it sometimes happens that the lines more usually associated with gratification are donned in grief . Of [this freakish character]3337-this freakish character was the face of [Joe Noy]192-joe . [His]192-joe muscles seemed to follow the bones underneath them ; and now beholding [him]192-joe , [the surprised spectators]3338-the surprised spectators saw [a man of gigantic proportions]3339-a man of gigantic proportions gigantically moved . Yet , while sorrow was discernible in [his]192-joe voice , the corners of [his]192-joe mouth were dragged up till [his]192-joe lips resembled a half - moon on its back , and the lids and corners of [his]192-joe eyes were full of laughter wrinkles , while the eyes themselves were starting and agonized . [The man]3494-the man 's catalogue had fallen to the ground ; [his]192-joe hands were clinched ; now , as [others]3522-others watched [him]192-joe , [he]192-joe came step by step nearer to the picture . To estimate the force of the thing upon [Noy]192-joe 's hungry heart , to present the chaos of emotions which now gripped [him]192-joe at the goal of [his]192-joe pilgrimage , is impossible . Here , restored to [him]192-joe by art , was [[his]192-joe dead sweetheart]3342-his dead sweetheart , the sum and total of all the beauty [he]192-joe had worshiped and which for nearly a year of absence had been [his]192-joe guiding star . [He]192-joe knew that [she]3342-his dead sweetheart was in [[her]3342-his dead sweetheart grave]3343-her grave , yet [she]3342-his dead sweetheart stood before [him]192-joe sweet and fresh , with the moisture of life in [her]3342-his dead sweetheart eyes and on [her]3342-his dead sweetheart lips . [He]192-joe recognized everything , to [the windy spot where the gorse flourished on the crown of [the cliff]4179-the cliff]3344-the windy spot where the gorse flourished on the crown of the cliff . The clean sky told [him]192-joe from whence the wind blew ; the gray gull above was flying with it upon slanting wings . And [Joan]183-joan stood below in a blaze of sunshine and yellow blossom . A reflection from the corner of [her]183-joan sunbonnet brightened [her]183-joan face , though it was shaded from direct sunlight by [her]183-joan hand ; [her]183-joan blue eyes mirrored [the sea]463-the sea and the sky ; and [they]3347-they met [Joe]192-joe 's , like a question . [She]183-joan was looking away to [the edge of [the world]3624-the world]3348-the edge of the world ; and [he]192-joe knew from the name of the picture , which [he]192-joe had read before [he]192-joe saw it , the object regarded . [He]192-joe glared on , and [his]192-joe breath came quicker . The brown petticoat with the black patch was familiar to [him]192-joe ; but [he]192-joe had never seen the gleam of [her]183-joan white neck below the collar where it was hidden from the sun . In the picture an unfastened button showed this . The rest [he]192-joe knew : [her]183-joan hair , turning at the flapping edge of the sunbonnet ; [her]183-joan slight figure , round waist , and the shoes , whose strings [he]192-joe had been privileged to tie more than once . Then [he]192-joe remembered [her]183-joan last promise : to see [[his]192-joe ship]778-his ship go down Channel from [[their]3351-their old meeting - place upon [Gorse Point]42-gorse point]3352-their old meeting - place upon gorse point ; and the memory , thus revived by the actual spectacle of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan looking [her]183-joan last at [[his]192-joe vanishing vessel]3353-his vanishing vessel , brought the wild cry to [Noy]192-joe 's lip with the wringing of [his]192-joe heart . [He]192-joe was absolutely dead to [his]192-joe environment , and [his]192-joe long days of silence suddenly ended in a futile outpouring of words addressed to [any who might care to listen]3354-any who might care to listen . Passion surged to the top of [his]192-joe mind — rage for [his]192-joe loss , indignation that the unutterably fair thing before [them]3351-their had been blotted out of [the world]3624-the world while [he]192-joe was far away , without power to protect [her]183-joan . For a few moments only was [the man]3494-the man beyond [his]192-joe own self - control , but in that brief time [he]192-joe spoke ; and [[his]192-joe listeners]6191-his listeners enjoyed a sensation of a nature outside [their]6191-his listeners widest experiences . " Oh , [Christ Jesus]3358-christ jesus ! ' tis [Joan]183-joan — [my]183-joan awn [lil Joan]183-joan , as [I]183-joan left [her]183-joan , as [I]183-joan seed [her]183-joan alive ! " [He]192-joe had reached the rail separating the pictures from [the public]4048-the public . Here [he]192-joe stood and spoke again , now conscious that there were people round about [him]192-joe . " [She'm]183-joan dead — dead an '[183-joan] buried — [[my]0-i [Joan]183-joan]1680-my joan — killed by the devil as drawed [her]183-joan theer in that picksher . " [A man from the turnstile]6260-a man from the turnstile came up here and inquired what was the matter . [His]6260-a man from the turnstile voice and tone of authority brought [the sailor]784-the sailor back to the position [he]6260-a man from the turnstile occupied ; [he]6260-a man from the turnstile restrained [himself]6260-a man from the turnstile , therefore , and spoke no more . [Already Noy]192-joe feared that [his]6260-a man from the turnstile passion might have raised suspicions , and now , turning and picking up [his]6260-a man from the turnstile catalogue , [he]6260-a man from the turnstile made hasty departure before [those present]6010-those present had opportunity to take much further notice of [him]6260-a man from the turnstile . [The man]3494-the man hurried off into the rattle of [the busy thoroughfare]6264-the busy thoroughfare , and in a moment [he]3494-the man and [his]3494-the man sorrows and [his]3494-the man deadly purpose had vanished away . [Meantime]198-mrs. tregenza [the curator of [the gallery]3333-the gallery]6265-the curator of the gallery , [a man of intelligence]6267-a man of intelligence , improved the moment and addressed some apposite reflections to [those spectators who still clustered around [John Barron]176-barron 's picture]6268-those spectators who still clustered around john barron 's picture . " It is n't often [we]6269-we get such a sight as that . [Many people]6270-many people have wondered why this great work was called as it is . The man who has gone explains it , and [you]6271-you have had a glimpse of the picture 's history — the inner history of it . The painting has made a great sensation ever since it was first exhibited , but never such a sensation as it made to - day . " " [The beggar]2389-the beggar looked as though [he]2389-the beggar meant mischief , " said [somebody]4300-somebody . " [He]2389-the beggar knows [the model]2391-the model is dead apparently , but there 's another mystery there too , for [Mr. Barron]176-barron [himself]176-barron is n't aware of the fact . [He]2389-the beggar was [here]432-here only the day before yesterday — a little pale shadow of [a man]467-a man , like a ghost in a fur coat . [He]2389-the beggar came to see [his]2389-the beggar picture and stopped ten minutes . [Two gentlemen]6277-two gentlemen were with [him]2389-the beggar , and [I]192-joe heard [him]2389-the beggar say , in answer to one of [them]6277-two gentlemen as [he]2389-the beggar left [the gallery]3333-the gallery , that [he]2389-the beggar had quite recently endeavored to learn some particulars of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan , [[his]2389-the beggar model]3917-his model , but had failed to do so as yet . " The gratification of [his]2389-the beggar desire and the fulfillment of [his]2389-the beggar revenge , though steadfastly foreseen by [Joe Noy]192-joe from the moment when first [he]2389-the beggar set foot in [London]45-london and began [his]2389-the beggar search , now for a moment overwhelmed [him]2389-the beggar at the prospect of [their]6277-two gentlemen extreme propinquity . Had anything been needed to strengthen [his]2389-the beggar determination on the threshold of a meeting with [Joan]183-joan 's destroyer , it was the startling vision of [Joan]183-joan [herself]183-joan from which [he]2389-the beggar had just departed . No event had brought the magnitude of [his]2389-the beggar loss more cruelly to the core of [his]2389-the beggar heart than the sudden splendid representation of what [he]2389-the beggar had left behind [him]2389-the beggar in [her]183-joan innocence and beauty ; and , for the same reason , nothing could have more thoroughly fortified [his]2389-the beggar mind to the deed now lying in [his]2389-the beggar immediate future . [Noy]192-joe 's first act was to turn again to [the gallery]3333-the gallery with a purpose to inquire where [John Barron]176-barron might be found ; but [he]192-joe recollected that many picture catalogues contained the private addresses of [the exhibitors]6281-the exhibitors , and accordingly consulted the list [he]192-joe had brought with [him]192-joe . There [he]192-joe found the name and also [the house in which [the owner of [it]6284-it]6283-the owner of it dwelt]6282-the house in which the owner of it dwelt — [JOHN BARRON]176-barron , [No . 6 [Melbury Gardens]116-melbury gardens]6285-no . 6 melbury gardens , [S. W. Only hours]416-s. w. only hours now separated [him]192-joe from [his]192-joe goal , and it seemed strange to [Noy]192-joe that [he]192-joe should have thus come in sight of [it]6284-it so suddenly . But [his]192-joe wits cooled and with steady system [he]192-joe followed the path long marked out . [He]192-joe stood and looked in at [a gunsmith]6286-a gunsmith 's window for ten minutes , then moved forward to another . At [the shop - fronts of [cutlers]6288-cutlers]6287-the shop - fronts of cutlers [he]192-joe also dawdled , but finally returned to [the first establishment which had attracted [him]192-joe]6289-the first establishment which had attracted him , entered , and , for the sum of two pounds , purchased a small , five - chambered revolver with a box of cartridges . [He]192-joe then went back to [[his]192-joe lodging]6290-his lodging , and set to work to find the position of [Melbury Gardens]116-melbury gardens upon [his]192-joe map . This done [the man]3494-the man marked [[his]192-joe road]6166-his road to [that region]6293-that region , outlining with a red chalk pencil [the streets through which [he]192-joe would have to walk before reaching [it]6293-that region]6294-the streets through which he would have to walk before reaching it . Throughout the afternoon [he]192-joe continued [his]192-joe preparations , acting very methodically , and setting [[his]192-joe house]4385-his house in order with the deliberation of one who knows that [he]192-joe is going to die , but not immediately . Sometimes [he]192-joe rested from the labor of letter - writing to think and rehearse again the scene which was to close that day . A thousand times [he]192-joe had already done so ; a thousand times the imaginary interview had been the last thought in [his]192-joe waking brain ; but now the approach of reality swept away those unreal dialogues , dramatic entrances , exits and events of the great scene as [he]192-joe had pictured it . The present moment found [Noy]192-joe 's brain blank as to everything but the issue ; and [he]192-joe surprised [himself]192-joe by discovering that [his]192-joe mind now continually recurred to those events which would follow the climax , while yet the death of [John Barron]176-barron was unaccomplished . [His]192-joe active thoughts , under conditions of such excitation as the day had brought upon the top of [his]192-joe discovery , traveled with astounding speed , and it was not [John Barron]176-barron 's end but [his]192-joe own which filled the imagination of [the sailor]784-the sailor as [he]192-joe wrote . The shadow of the gallows was on the paper , though the event which was to bring this consummation still lay some hours deep in unrecorded time . But , for [Noy]192-joe , [John Barron]176-barron was as good as dead , and [himself]192-joe as good as under sentence of death . Grown quite calm , fixed in mind , and immovable as the black sea cliffs of [[his]192-joe mother - land]6297-his mother - land , [he]192-joe wrote steadily on until thought sped whirling forward to a new aspect of [his]192-joe future : the last . [He]192-joe saw [himself]192-joe in eternity , tossed to everlasting flames by [[his]192-joe Maker]6163-his maker , as [a man]467-a man tosses an empty match - box , after it has done its work , into the fire . [He]192-joe put down [his]192-joe pen and pictured it . The terrific force of that conviction can not fairly be set before the intelligence of [average cultured people]6300-average cultured people , because , whatever [they]6300-average cultured people profess to believe in [their]6300-average cultured people hearts , the truth is that , even with [forty - nine Christians]6301-forty - nine christians out of fifty , hell appears a mere vague conceit meaning nothing . [They]6300-average cultured people affirm that [they]6300-average cultured people believe in eternal torment ; [they]6300-average cultured people confess all humanity is ripe for it ; but [their]6300-average cultured people pulses are unquickened by the assertion or admission ; [they]6300-average cultured people do not believe in it . Nor can [educated man]6302-educated man so believe , for that way madness lies , and [he]6302-educated man who dwells long and closely upon this unutterable dogma , [anon]6303-anon [himself]6303-anon feels the first flickering of the undying flame . It scorches , not [his]6303-anon body , but [his]6303-anon brain , and [a lunatic asylum]713-a lunatic asylum presently shuts [him]6303-anon from [a sane world]6305-a sane world unless medical aid quickly brings healthy relief . But with primitive opinions , narrow beliefs and narrow intelligences , hell can be a live conceit enough . Among [Luke Gospelers]205-the luke gospelers and [kindred sects]6306-kindred sects there shall be found such genuine fear and such trembling as [the church called orthodox]6307-the church called orthodox never knows ; and to Noy the tremendous spectacle of [his]6303-anon everlasting punishment now made itself actively felt . A life beyond death — a life to be spent in one of two places and to endure eternally was to Joe as certain as the knowledge that [he]6303-anon lived ; and that [his]6303-anon destination must be determined by the work yet lying between [him]6303-anon and death appeared equally sure . Further , that work must be performed . There was no loophole of escape from it , and had there been such [he]6303-anon would have blocked it against [himself]6303-anon resolutely . Moreover , as the will and desire to do the deed was an action as definite in the eye of [Heaven]339-heaven as the accomplishment of the deed itself , [he]6303-anon reckoned [himself]6303-anon already damned . [He]6303-anon had long since counted the whole cost , and now it only seemed more vast and awful than upon past surveys by reason of its nearer approach . Now [he]6303-anon speculated curiously upon the meetings which must follow upon [the world]3624-the world 's dissolution ; and wondered if [those who kill]6309-those who kill do ever meet and hold converse in hell - fire with [[their]6309-those who kill victims]6310-their victims . Then again [he]6303-anon fell to writing , and presently completed letters to [[his]6303-anon father]3681-his father , [[his]6303-anon mother]752-his mother , to [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza and to [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary . These [he]6303-anon left in [[his]6303-anon apartment]6313-his apartment , and presently going out into the air , walked , with no particular aim , until darkness fell . Hunger now prompted [him]6303-anon , and [he]6303-anon ate a big meal at [a restaurant]6314-a restaurant and drank with [his]6303-anon food a pint of ale . Physically fortified , [he]6303-anon returned to [[his]6303-anon lodging]6290-his lodging , left upon the table in [[his]6303-anon solitary room]6316-his solitary room the sum [he]6303-anon would that night owe for the hire of [the chamber]1583-the chamber , and , then , taking [his]6303-anon letters , went out to return no more . A few clothes , a brush and comb and a small wooden trunk was all [he]6303-anon left behind [him]6303-anon . [Joe Noy]192-joe purchased four stamps for [his]192-joe letters and posted them . They were written as though the murder of [John Barron]176-barron had been already accomplished , and [he]192-joe thus completed and dispatched them before the event , because [he]192-joe imagined that , afterward , the power of communicating with [[his]192-joe parents]5340-his parents or [friends]1078-friends would be denied [him]192-joe . That [they]6320-them might be spared the horror of learning the news through a public source [he]192-joe wrote it thus , and knew , as [he]192-joe did so , that to [two of [[his]192-joe correspondents]6322-his correspondents]6321-two of his correspondents the intelligence would come without the full force of a novelty . [Thomasin Tregenza]201-thomasin and [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary alike were familiar with [his]192-joe intention at the time of [his]192-joe departure , and to [them]6320-them [he]192-joe therefore wrote but briefly ; [[his]192-joe parents]5340-his parents , on the other hand , for all [Joe]192-joe knew to the contrary , might still be ignorant of the fact that [he]192-joe had come off [his]192-joe cruise . [His]192-joe letters to [them]6320-them were accordingly of great length ; and [he]192-joe set forth therein with the nervous lucidity of a meager vocabulary the nature of [his]192-joe wrongs and the action which [he]192-joe had taken under [Heaven]339-heaven 's guidance to revenge [them]6320-them . [He]192-joe stated plainly in all four of [his]192-joe missives to [Newlyn]1-newlyn , [Drift]15-drift and [Mousehole]9-mousehole that [the artist]3491-the artist , [John Barron]176-barron , was shot dead by [his]176-barron hand and that [he]176-barron [himself]176-barron intended suffering the consequent punishment as became [a brave man]6325-a brave man and the weapon of [the Lord]702-the lord . These notes then [he]192-joe posted , and so went upon [his]192-joe way that [he]192-joe might fulfill to the letter [his]192-joe written words . Following [the roads [he]192-joe had studied upon [his]192-joe map and committed to memory]6327-the roads he had studied upon his map and committed to memory , [Noy]192-joe soon reached [Melbury Gardens]116-melbury gardens and presently stood opposite [No]417-no , 6 and scanned it . The hour was then ten o'clock and lights were in some of the windows , but not many . Looking over the area railings , [the sailor]784-the sailor saw [four servants]6329-four servants — [two men]482-two men and [two women]6331-two women — eating [their]6329-four servants supper . [He]192-joe noted , as a singular circumstance , that there were wineglasses upon the kitchen table and that they held red liquor and white . [Noy]192-joe 's design was simple enough . [He]192-joe meant to stand face to face with [John Barron]176-barron , to explain the nature of the events which had occurred , to tell [him]176-barron , what it was possible [he]176-barron might not know : that [Joan]183-joan was dead ; and then to inform [him]176-barron that [his]176-barron own days were numbered . Upon these words [Joe]192-joe designed to shoot [the other]3475-the other down like a dog , and to make absolutely certain of [his]176-barron death by firing the entire contents of the revolver . [He]192-joe expected that a private interview would be vouchsafed to [him]192-joe if [he]192-joe desired it ; and [his]192-joe intention , after [[his]192-joe victim]4315-his victim should fall , was to blow [the man]3494-the man 's brains out at close quarters before even [those nearest at hand]6335-those nearest at hand could prevent it . At half - past ten [Noy]192-joe felt that [his]192-joe weapon was in the left breast pocket of [his]192-joe coat ready for the drawing ; then ascended the steps which rose to the front door of [[John Barron]176-barron 's dwelling]6336-john barron 's dwelling and rang the bell . [The man - servant whom [he]192-joe had seen through the area railings in [the kitchen]860-the kitchen]6337-the man - servant whom he had seen through the area railings in the kitchen came to the door , and , much to [Noy]192-joe 's astonishment , accosted [him]192-joe before [he]192-joe had time to say that [he]192-joe wished to see [the master of [the house]592-the house]6339-the master of the house . " [You]192-joe 've come at last , then , " said [the man]3494-the man . [Joe]192-joe regarded [him]192-joe with surprise , then spoke . " [I]192-joe want to see [Mr. John Barron]176-barron , please . " [The other]3475-the other laughed , as if this was an admirable jest . " [I]192-joe suppose [you]192-joe do , though that 's a queer way to put it . [You]192-joe talk as though [you]192-joe had come to smoke a cigar along with [him]176-barron . " In growing amazement and suspicion , [Noy]192-joe listened to this most curious statement . [Fears]418-fears suddenly awoke that , by some mysterious circumstance , [Barron]176-barron had learned of [his]176-barron contemplated action and was prepared for it . [He]192-joe stopped , therefore , looked about [him]176-barron sharply to avoid any sudden surprise , and put a question to [the footman]6343-the footman . " [You]192-joe spoke as though [I]192-joe was wanted , " [he]192-joe said . " What do [you]192-joe mean by that ? " " Blessed if [you]192-joe 're[192-joe] not [a rum ' un]6344-a rum ' un ! " answered [the man]3494-the man . " Of course [you]192-joe was wanted , else [you]192-joe would n't be here , would [you]192-joe ? [You]3360-you 're[194-iss] not a party as calls promiscuous , [I]0-i should hope . Else it would be rather trying to delicate nerves . [You]3360-you 're [the gentleman]6346-the gentleman as [everybody]3758-everybody requires some time , though [nobody]3503-nobody ever sends for [himself]3503-nobody . " Failing to gather the other 's meaning , [Noy]192-joe only realized that [John Barron]176-barron expected [some visitor]6349-some visitor and felt , therefore , the more determined to hasten [his]176-barron own actions . [He]192-joe saw [the footman]6343-the footman was endeavoring to be jocose , and therefore humored [him]6343-the footman , pretending at the same time to be [the individual who was expected]6351-the individual who was expected . " [You]3360-you 're[0-i] [a funny fellow]3361-a funny fellow and must often make [[your]3360-you master]3362-your master laugh , [I]0-i should reckon , [Iss]194-iss , [I]0-i be [the chap what [you]3360-you thought [I]0-i was]3363-the chap what you thought i was . An ' [I]194-iss should like to see [him]3362-your master — [the guv'nor]6352-the guv'nor — at once if [he]3362-your master 'll see [me]194-iss . " [The footman]6343-the footman chuckled again . " [He]3362-your master 'll see [you]3360-you all right . [He]3362-your master 's been wantin '[194-iss] of [you]3360-you all day , and [he]3362-your master 'd have been that dreadful disapp'inted if [you]3360-you ' adn't come . Always awful particular about [his]3362-your master clothes , [you]3360-you know , so mind [you]3360-you 're[194-iss] jolly careful about the measuring 'cause this overcoat will have to last [him]3362-your master a long time . " Taking [his]3360-you cue from these words [Noy]192-joe , still ignorant of the truth , made answer : " [Iss]194-iss , [I]3362-your master 'll measure en all right . Wheer is [he]3362-your master to ? " " In [the studio]5170-the studio — there [you]3360-you are , right ahead . Knock at that baize door and then walk straight in , 'cause[3362-your master] [he]3362-your master 'll very likely be too much occupied to answer [you]3360-you . [He]3362-your master 's quite alone — leastways [I]0-i believe so . [I]0-i 'll come back in quarter'n hour ; and mind [you]3360-you do n't talk no secrets or tell [him]3362-your master how [I]0-i laughed at [him]3362-your master behind [his]3362-your master back , else [he]3362-your master 'd give [me]0-i the sack for certain . " [The man]3494-the man withdrew , sniggering at [his]3494-the man own humor , and [Noy]192-joe , quite unable to see rhyme or reason in [his]3494-the man remarks , stood with an expression of bewilderment upon [his]192-joe broad face and watched [the servant]3365-the servant disappear . Then [his]192-joe countenance changed , and [he]192-joe approached a door covered with red baize at which [the passage]3366-the passage terminated . [He]192-joe knocked , waited , and knocked again , straining [his]192-joe ear to hear the voice [he]192-joe had labored so long to silence . Then [he]192-joe put [his]192-joe revolver into the side pocket of [his]192-joe coat , and , afterward , following [the footman]6343-the footman 's directions , pushed open the swing door , which yielded to [his]192-joe hand . A curtain hung inside it , and , pulling this aside , [he]192-joe entered [a spacious apartment]3368-a spacious apartment with a glass roof . But scanty light illuminated [the studio]5170-the studio from one oil lamp which hung by a chain from a bracket in the wall , and the rays of which were much dimmed by a red glass shade . Some easels , mostly empty , stood about the sides of [the great chamber]3370-the great chamber ; here and there on the white walls were sketches in charcoal and daubs of paint . A German stove appeared in the middle of [the room]4756-the room , but it was not burning ; skins of beasts scattered the floor ; upon one wall hung the " Negresses Bathing at Tobago . " For the rest [the room]4756-the room appeared empty . Then , growing accustomed to the dim red light , [Noy]192-joe made a closer examination until [he]192-joe caught sight of an object which made [him]192-joe catch [his]192-joe breath violently and hurry forward . Under the lofty open windows which rose on the northern side of [the studio]5170-the studio , remote from all other objects , was a couch , and upon [it]3374-it lay a small , straight figure shrouded in white sheets save for [its]3375-its face . [John Barron]176-barron had been dead twenty - four hours , and [he]176-barron had hastened [his]176-barron own end , by a space of time impossible to determine , through leaving [[his]176-barron sick - room]3376-his sick - room two days previously , that [he]176-barron might visit [the picture gallery]3377-the picture gallery wherein hung " [[Joe]192-joe 's Ship]3620-joe 's ship . " It was a step taken in absolute defiance of [[his]176-barron medical men]3379-his medical men . The day of that excursion had chanced to be a very cold one , and during the night which followed it [John Barron]176-barron broke a blood vessel and precipitated [his]176-barron death . Now , in the hands of [hirelings]3380-hirelings , without [a friend]691-a friend to put one flower on [his]176-barron breast or close [his]176-barron dim eyes , [the man]3494-the man lay waiting for [an undertaker]3383-an undertaker ; and while [Joe Noy]192-joe glared at [him]176-barron , unconsciously gripping the weapon [he]192-joe had brought , it seemed as though [the dead]2243-the dead smiled under the red flicker of the lamp — as though [he]2243-the dead smiled and prepared to come back into life to answer [this supreme accuser]3385-this supreme accuser . As by [an educated mind]3386-an educated mind [Joe Noy]192-joe 's estimate and assurance of the eternal tortures of hell can not be adequately grasped in its full force , so now it is hard to set forth with a power sufficiently luminous and terrific the effect of this discovery upon [him]176-barron . [He]3387-he , the weapon of [the Almighty]6083-the almighty , found [his]176-barron work finished and the fruits of [his]176-barron labors snatched from [his]176-barron hand . [[His]176-barron enemy]6237-his enemy had escaped , and the fact that [he]176-barron was dead only made the case harder . Had [Barron]176-barron hastened from [him]192-joe and avoided [his]176-barron revolver , [he]176-barron could have suffered it , knowing that the end lay in the future at the determination of [God]179-god ; but now the end appeared before [him]176-barron accomplished ; and it had been attained without [his]176-barron assistance . [His]176-barron labor was lost and [his]176-barron longed - for , prayed - for achievement rendered impossible . [He]176-barron stood and scanned the small , marble - white face , then drew a box of matches from [his]176-barron pocket , lighted one and looked closer . Worn by disease to mere skin and skull , there was nothing left to suggest [the dead man]3390-the dead man 's wasted powers ; and generation of [their]3391-their own destroyers was the only task now left for [his]176-barron brains . The end of [Noy]192-joe 's match fell red - hot on [John Barron]176-barron 's face . Then [he]176-barron turned as footsteps sounded ; the curtains were moved aside and [the footman]6343-the footman reappeared , followed by [another person]2325-another person . " Why , [you]176-barron was n't [the undertaker]5970-the undertaker after all ! " [he]176-barron explained . " Did [you]5970-the undertaker think [the man]3494-the man was alive ? [Good Lord]234-good lord ! But [you]5970-the undertaker 've found [him]3494-the man anyway . " " [Iss]194-iss , [I]0-i thot [he]3494-the man was alive . [I]0-i wanted to see en livin ' an '[0-i] leave en — " [he]0-i stopped . Common sense for once had a word with [him]0-i and convinced [him]0-i of the folly of saying anything now concerning [his]0-i frustrated projects . " [He]3494-the man died night ' fore last — consumption — and [he]3494-the man 's left money enough to build a brace of ironclads , [they]6355-they say , and never no will , and not a soul on [[God]179-god 's earth]6356-god 's earth is there with any legal claim upon [him]3494-the man . To tell the truth , [we]6357-we [none of [us]6357-we]2265-none of us never liked [him]3494-the man . " " If [you]5970-the undertaker 'll shaw [me]0-i the way out into [the street]1438-the street , [I]0-i 'll thank ['[0-i] e]5970-the undertaker , " said [Noy]192-joe . [The undertaker]5970-the undertaker was already busy making measurements . Then , a minute later , [Joe]192-joe found [himself]192-joe standing under the sky again ; and the darkness was full of laughter and of voices , of gibing , jeering noises in unseen throats , of rapid utterances on invisible tongues . The supernatural things screamed into [his]192-joe ears that [he]192-joe was damned for a wish and for an intention ; then [they]3397-they shrieked and yelled [their]3397-they derision , and [he]192-joe understood well enough , for the point of view was not a new one . Given the accomplishment of [his]192-joe desire , [he]192-joe was prepared to suffer eternally ; now eternal suffering must follow on a wish barren of fruit , and hell for [him]192-joe would be hell indeed , with no accomplished revenge in memory to lessen the torment . When the voices at length died and a clock struck one , [Noy]192-joe came to [himself]192-joe , and realized that , in so far as the present affected [him]192-joe , Fate had brought [him]192-joe back to life and liberty by a short cut . Then , seeing [his]192-joe position , [he]192-joe asked [himself]192-joe whether life was long enough to make atonement and even allow of ultimate escape after death . But the fierce disappointment which beat upon [his]192-joe soul like a recurring wave , as thought drifted back and back , told [him]192-joe that [he]192-joe had fairly won hell - fire and must abide by it . So thinking , [he]192-joe returned to [[his]192-joe lodging]6290-his lodging , entered unobserved and prowled [the small chamber]3399-the small chamber till dawn . By morning light all [his]192-joe life appeared transfigured and a ghastly anti - climax faced [the man]3494-the man . Presently [he]192-joe remembered the letters [he]192-joe had posted overnight , and the recollection of them brought with it sudden resolves and a course of action . Half an hour later [he]192-joe had reached [Paddington Station]171-paddington station , and was soon on [his]192-joe way back to [Cornwall]13-cornwall . Born of the sunshine , on a morning in late December , gray ephemerae danced and dipped and fashioned vanishing patterns against the green of the great laurel at the corner of [Drift farmyard]3401-drift farmyard . The mildness of the day had wakened [them]3402-them into brief life , but even as [they]3402-them twinkled [their]3402-them wings of gauze death was abroad . A sky of unusual clearness crowned [the Cornish moorland]3403-the cornish moorland , and [Uncle Chirgwin]251-uncle chirgwin , standing at [his]251-uncle chirgwin kitchen door , already foretold frost , though the morning was still young . " The air 's like milk just now , sure ' nough , an '[251-uncle chirgwin] ' twill bide so till noon ; then , when the sun begins to slope , the cold will graw an '[251-uncle chirgwin] graw to frost . An ' no harm done , thank [God]179-god . " [He]251-uncle chirgwin spoke to [[his]251-uncle chirgwin niece , who was in [the room]4756-the room behind [him]251-uncle chirgwin]6360-his niece , who was in the room behind him ; and as [he]251-uncle chirgwin did so a circumstance of very unusual nature happened . [Two persons]6362-two persons reached the front door of [the farm]3904-the farm simultaneously , and [a maid , answering the double knock]6364-a maid , answering the double knock , returned a moment later with two communications , both for [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary . " [Postman]419-postman , [he]251-uncle chirgwin brot this here , [miss]5607-miss , an '[251-uncle chirgwin] a bwoy from Mouzle brot t'other . " The first letter came from [London]45-london , the second , directed in a similar hand , reached [Mary]222-mary from [the adjacent fishing hamlet]3404-the adjacent fishing hamlet . [She]222-mary knew the big writing well enough , but showed no emotion before [the maid]4104-the maid . In fact [her]222-mary self command was remarkable , for [she]222-mary put both letters into [her]222-mary pocket and made some show of continuing [her]222-mary labors for another five minutes before departing to [[her]222-mary room]4592-her room that [she]222-mary might read the news from [Joe Noy]192-joe . [He]192-joe , it may be said , had reached [Penzance]7-penzance by [the same train]3407-the same train which conveyed [his]192-joe various missives , all posted too late for the mail upon the previous night . Thus [he]192-joe reached [the white cottage on [the cliff]4179-the cliff]6065-the white cottage on the cliff in time to see [Mrs. Tregenza]198-mrs. tregenza and bid [her]198-mrs. tregenza destroy unread the letter [she]198-mrs. tregenza would presently receive ; and , on returning to [[his]192-joe parents]5340-his parents , [himself]192-joe took from the letter - carrier [his]192-joe own communications to [them]5340-his parents and burned both immediately . [He]192-joe had also dispatched [a boy]619-a boy to [Drift]15-drift that [Mary]222-mary might be warned as to the letter [she]222-mary would receive by the morning post , but [the lad]761-the lad , though ample time was given [him]192-joe to reach [Drift]15-drift before [the postman]2854-the postman , loitered by the way . Thus the letters had arrived simultaneously , and it was quite an open question which [the receiver of them]3414-the receiver of them would open first . [Chance]235-chance decided : [Mary]222-mary 's hand , thrust haphazard into [her]222-mary pocket , came forth with [Hoy]420-hoy 's epistle recently dispatched from [Mousehole]9-mousehole ; and that [she]222-mary read , the accident saving [her]222-mary at least some moments of bitter suffering . " Dear [Mary]222-mary , " wrote [Noy]192-joe , " [you]222-mary will get this by hand afore the coming in of the penny post . When that comes in , there will be another letter for [you]222-mary from [me]0-i , sent off from [London]45-london . It is all wrong , so burn it , and do n't [you]222-mary read it on no account . Burn it to ashes , for [theer]3415-theer 's a many reasons why [you]222-mary should . [I]0-i be coming up - long to see [you]222-mary arter dinner , and if [you]222-mary can walk out in the air with [me]0-i for a bit [I]0-i 'll thank [you]222-mary so to do . [[Your]222-mary friend]3416-your friend , [J. Noy]421-j. noy . Burn the letter to dust ' fore anything else . Do n't let [it]6366-it bide a minute and doan't tell [none]2202-none [you]222-mary had it . " Curiosity was no part of [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary 's nature . Now [she]222-mary merely thanked [Heaven]339-heaven which had led to the right letter and so enabled [her]222-mary unconsciously to obey [Joe]192-joe 's urgent command . Then [she]222-mary returned to [the kitchen]860-the kitchen , placed [his]192-joe earlier communication in the heart of the fire and watched while it blackened , curled , blazed , and finally shuddered down into a red - hot ash . [She]222-mary determined to see [him]192-joe and walk with [him]192-joe , as [he]192-joe asked , if [he]192-joe returned with clean hands . While the letter which [she]222-mary had read neither proved nor disproved such a supposition , [the woman]4662-the woman yet felt a secret and sure conviction in [her]222-mary heart that [Noy]192-joe was coming back innocent at least of any desperate action . That [he]192-joe was in [Cornwall]13-cornwall again and [a free man]6370-a free man appeared to [her]222-mary proof sufficient that [he]192-joe had not committed violence . [Mary]222-mary allowed [her]222-mary anxiety to interfere with no duty . By three o'clock [she]222-mary was ready to set out , and , looking from [her]222-mary bedroom window as [she]222-mary tied on [her]222-mary hat , [she]222-mary saw [Joe Noy]192-joe approaching up [the hill]533-the hill . A minute later [she]222-mary was at the door , and stood there waiting with [her]222-mary eyes upon [him]0-i as [he]0-i came up [the path]6372-the path . " '[0-i] Tis as it was , [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary — [my]0-i hands be white , " [he]0-i said . " " [A body]5504-a body must b'lieve in somethin' , else [he'm]192-joe [a rudderless vessel]6387-a rudderless vessel seemin'ly , but wi '[179-god] sich a flood of ' pinions 'bout[179-god] the airth , how 's [wan sailorman]3428-wan sailorman to knaw what be safe anchorage and what ban't ? " [Mary]222-mary argued with [him]192-joe in strenuous fashion and increased [her]222-mary vehemence as [he]192-joe showed signs of yielding . [She]222-mary knew well enough that religion was as necessary to [him]192-joe in some shape as to [herself]222-mary . Already a pageant of winter sunset began to unfold fantastic sheaves of splendor , and over the horizon line of [the western moors]3429-the western moors the air was wondrously clear . It faded to intense white light where [the uplands]3430-the uplands cut it , while , above , the background of the sky was a pure beryl gradually burning aloft into orange . Here waves of fire beat over [golden shores]3431-golden shores and red clouds extended as [an army in regular column upon column]3432-an army in regular column upon column . At the zenith , billows of scarlet leaped in feathery foam against a purple continent and the flaming tide extended from reef to reef among [a thousand aerial bays]3433-a thousand aerial bays and estuaries of alternating gloom and glow until shrouded and dimmed in an orange tawny haze of infinite distance . In the immediate foreground of this majestic display , like a handful of rose - leaves fallen out of heaven , small clouds floated directly downward , withering to blackness as they neared [the earth]3591-the earth and lost the dying fires . Beneath the splendor of the sky [the land]3578-the land likewise flamed , the winding roadways glimmered , and many pools and ditches reflected back the circumambient glory of the air . In a few more minutes , [Mary]222-mary and [Joe]192-joe reached [Sancreed churchyard]5979-sancreed churchyard and soon stood beside [the grave of [Joan Tregenza]183-joan]3437-the grave of joan tregenza . " The grass wo n't close proper till the spring come , " said [Mary]222-mary ; " then the turf will grow an ' make it vitty ; an '[3438-uncle 's gwaine] [uncle 's gwaine]3438-uncle 's gwaine to set up a good slate stone wi ' the name an '[222-mary] date an ' some verses . [I]0-i planted them primroses '[0-i] long the top [myself]0-i . If wan abbun gone an ' blossomed tu ! " [She]222-mary stooped to pick a primrose and an opening bud ; but [Joe]192-joe stopped [her]222-mary . " Doan't '[3439-e] [e]3439-e pluck 'em . Never take no flowers off of a graave . They'm all [the dead]2243-the dead have got . " " But [they]3440-they 'll die , [Joe]192-joe . [Theer]6389-theer 's frost bitin '[3439-e] in the air already . [They]3440-they 'll be withered come marnin ' . " " No matter for that , " [he]3494-the man said ; " let ['em]6390-'em[3494-the man] bide wheer [they]3440-they be . " [The man]3494-the man was silent a while as [he]3494-the man looked at the mound . Then [he]3494-the man spoke again . " Tell [me]0-i about [her]3442-i . Talk 'bout [her]3442-i doin 's an '[3494-the man] sayin 's . Did [she]3442-i forgive [that man]661-that man afore [she]3442-i died or dedn ' [she]3442-i ? " " [Iss]194-iss , [I]3442-i reckon so . " [Mary]222-mary mentioned those things best calculated in [her]222-mary opinion to lighten the other 's sorrow . [He]3494-the man nodded from time to time as [she]222-mary spoke , and walked up and down with [his]3494-the man hands behind , [him]3494-the man . When [she]222-mary stopped , [he]3494-the man asked [her]222-mary to tell [him]3494-the man further facts . Then the light waned under the sycamore trees and only a red fire still touched their topmost boughs . " [We]6391-we 'll go now , " [Noy]192-joe said . " An '[3442-i] [she]3442-i died believin ' just the same as what [you]192-joe do — eh , [Mary]222-mary ? " " [Uncle]6392-uncle 's sure of it — positive sartain '[3442-i] twas so . " " An ' [you]192-joe ? " " [I]3442-i pray that [he]6392-uncle was right . [Iss fay]194-iss , [I]3442-i 've grawed to b'lieve truly [[our]6391-we Joan]6393-our joan was saved , spite of all . [I]3442-i never '[3442-i] sactly understood [her]3442-i thots , nor [she]3442-i mine ; but [she'm]3442-i in [heaven]637-heaven now [I]0-i do think . " " If [bitterness]3445-bitterness an ' sorrer counts [she]3442-i should be . An '[3442-i] [you]3446-you may take it from [me]0-i [she]3442-i is . An ' [I]3442-i 'll come back , [tu]422-tu , if [I]3442-i may hope for awnly the lowest plaace . [I]3442-i 'll come back an '[3442-i] walk along to [church]581-church wance agin wi ' [you]3446-you , wance '[3442-i] fore [I]0-i goes back to [sea]540-sea . Will ' [e]6394-e let [me]3442-i do that , [Mary Chirgwin]222-mary ? " " [I]3442-i thank [God]179-god to hear [you]3446-you say so . [You'm]3442-i welcome to come along wi '[3442-i] [me]0-i next Sunday if [you]3446-you mind to . " " An ' now [us'll]3450-us'll go up the Carn an '[3442-i] look out ' pon [the land]3578-the land and see the sun sink . " [They]3450-us'll left [the churchyard]6016-the churchyard together , climbed [the neighboring eminence]3452-the neighboring eminence and stood silently at the top , [their]3450-us'll faces to [the West]26-the west . A great pervasive calm and stillness in the air heralded frost . The sky had grown strangely clear , and only the rack and ruin of the recent imposing display now huddled into the arms of night on the eastern horizon . The sun , quickly dropping , loomed mighty and fiery red . Presently it touched the horizon , and its progress , unappreciated in the sky , became accentuated by the rim of [the world]3624-the world . A semi - circle of fire , a narrowing segment , a splash , throbbing like a flame — then it had vanished , and light waned until there trembled out the radiance of a brief after - glow . Already the voices of the frost began to break [the earth]3591-the earth 's silence . In the darkness of [woods]3455-woods [it]3456-it was busy casing the damp mosses in ice , binding the dripping outlets of hidden water , whispering with infinitely delicate sound as it flung forth its needles , the mother of ice , and suffered them to spread like tiny sudden fingers on the face of freezing water . From the horizon the brightness of the zodiacal light streamed mysteriously upward into [the depth of heaven]3457-the depth of heaven , dimming the stars . But the brightness of them grew in splendor and brilliancy as increasing cold gripped [the world]3624-the world ; and while the stealthy feet of the frost raced and tinkled like a fairy tune , the starlight flashed upon its magic silver , powdered its fabrics with light and pointed its crystal triumphs with fire . Thus starlight and frost fell upon [the forest]1406-the forest and [the Cornish moor]2764-the cornish moor , beneath the long avenues of silence , and over all the unutterable blackness of [granite and dead heather]3461-granite and dead heather . [The earth]3591-the earth slept and dreamed dreams , as the chain of the cold tightened ; all [the earth]3591-the earth dreamed fair dreams , in night and nakedness ; dreams such as forest trees and lone elms , meadows and [hills]3464-hills , moors and [valleys]3465-valleys , great heaths and the waste , secret habitations of Nature , [one and all]3466-one and all do dream : of the passing of another winter and the on - coming of another spring .
